author: haka5HI
title: I really like should quality
content: I really like the sound quality, the noise-canceling ability and the comfort of the headphones but I could not connect them to my iPhone and computer by myself.  Other seniors with limited technical ability may also find they need assistance.

author: CLSmoothie
title: Love It
content:
These headphones are great.  The bluetooth works fantastic, haven't had any issues with it.  I'm usually pairing them with my iPhone XS Max and the AppleTV.  When I'm using them to watch TV the sound is great.

The battery life is outstanding for the amount of time I've used them.

I love the noice cancelling.  It was great on a plane and I can't hear my wife at all when she's talking to me.  Love the nice cancelling.

Only downside I would say is it seems like you need an app to connect these things up to other bluetooth devices and it only allows you to connect to two devices only.

Overall I love them.

author: Cameraman
title: Great Headphones
content: Worked fantastically on a trip from Austin TX to Frankfurt and also on the return trip. 12 hours on the plane and the battery was still about 40%.

author: C J Brown
title: I very happy with them so far
content: So far they are working great. I currently work on a golf course and operate large mowers and they have great sound, great noise cancellation, and very good battery life

author: David Richard Bailey
title: Never doubt!
content: It’s a BOSE!!!  What else can I say?!!

author: Mow Man
title: Bought 2 pairs for my discerning teens --Terrific
content: I have twin daughters who are very discerning about the quality of their music--both are gifted musicians with "perfect pitch"... so, they know.  After two weeks of heavy use, their verdict is the headphones are terrific.  I looked at the newest version but saw so many complaints about the new Bose App required to use them that I decided to buy these previous generation.

author: Daniel Luz
title: Surprisingly uncomfortable
content:
Two points that were immediately clear to me and were surprisingly absent from nearly every review I had read before purchasing:
- The headphones exert quite a bit of pressure around the hinge of my jaw. I tried a few different positions, but I just can't get a good fit — there's always some level of discomfort.
- Active noise canceling also puts a significant amount of constant pressure on your ears. I know this is due to the way it works, but I honestly would never expect it to be this strong, considering most people won't even mention it.

All in all, beware when purchasing these headphones, particularly if they're your first experience with ANC. If at all possible, try then out in a store or with a friend, to avoid later figuring out you can't stand wearing them for more than 15 minutes. I'll have to try other models, even if they don't score as highly in the ANC ratings.

author: Jamile
title: Awesome!!
content: Oh my god!! This is the BEST noise-cancelling headphone of the world!!! I am completely shocked and I'm in love with it!!!!!!!

author: Iyad
title: Great headphones and very comfortable
content:
Great headphones and very comfortable... Just a bit expensive specially after seeing the new Sony wh-1000-XM2 which is way more refined from the last gen reach 298$.
And this with the Google Assistant button addition only is still 350$.

But otherwise I love the comfort and quality.

author: cstove
title: Best earphones! Very comfortable
content: Best earphones! Very comfortable, great sound and excellent sound blockage. Perfect on planes or just listening to music or movies. Worth the money for the quality! I have now purchased 3 for family members.

author: VirtualWatts
title: Bose QuietComfort 35 Series II – Bose SoundLink II – Microsoft Surface, FAIL in an open office
content:
I was looking for a pair of headphones to help me with video/VOIP calls in a noisy office environment as an upgrade to my Jabra 370 – I tried Bose QuietComfort 35 Series II – Bose SoundLink II – Microsoft Surface and all three failed.

Bose QC35 best sound quality
Surface failed to work with iPhone X and iPad Pro
Soundlink isn’t noise cancelling
All three have microphones that amplify ALL VOICES IN THE ROOM – fail
Turns out the Jabra 370 really is the best for office communications, but not for taming noisy office.

Our company just moved to a new open office design. That means no walls, no offices, all open space with desks, work stations and huddle areas. I had an office until we moved and was going from speakerphone to headphones. We are a global company thus video conferencing and VOIP con calls are constant on Zoom, Skype, WebEx etc.

I already have a Bluetooth wireless headset Jabra 370, it is “on the ear” with a boom microphone, I thought an “around the ear” would help better with the new noisy office. The Jabra 370 uses a USB transmitter and is pretty much tied to desktops/laptops.

Now, about my special circumstances, I have a hearing disability and wear a hearing aid and Cochlear Implant. For this review what that means is that I hear from things that sit on my ear rather then inside my ear and because I already have the hearing aids cannot wear an ear bud arrangement. I am an IT professional.

This review is of all three subject headsets:
1) Noise Cancellation for Other Party – (FAIL) that is, when on a call what does the other side hear? And here all three failed, on calls the other parties could hear voices from all across the office because the microphone arrays would pick up every voice in the room. For the QC35 weirdly it was only when I was speaking – deathly silent when I wasn’t, but the moment I began to speak all the other voices in the room came through loud and clear, very distracting to the folks on other end of the call, at one point they could hear a conversation 35 feet away very clearly that I couldn't hear because of the headset

2) Noise Cancellation for Wearer– The Soundlink is not noise cancelling (I thought all Bose were) and therefore, it cannot work in a noisy open office environment, the Bose QC35 did the best job of noise cancellation, the Surface okay
But about noise cancellation – Bose is made for like a plane non-voice noisy environment, in an open office where the “noise” is other people talking on phones or in groups, the Bose actually makes the problem WORSE by amplifying surrounding voices

3) Call Quality – all three had good call quality on Win10 bluetooth, but the Surface had terrible quality for other party on the iPhone X and iPad, the other end and con calls could not hear me like I was in a tunnel

4) Pairing - All three headsets paired easily with my Win10 Lenovo corporate laptop, Win10 Surface Book 2 personal laptop, iPad Pro and iPhone X

5) No boom microphone – all three use a microphone array in the ear cup rather than boom microphone, my voice was clear on all three, but other side said QC35 was best sound
But note other voices are picked up as well

6) Surround the ear – all three styles are designed to fit around the ear entirely instead of on or in the ear, I was worried about discomfort based upon other reviews and the Surface has small ear cups, but all fit well over my (somewhat) oversized Obama type ears. The Bose were the most comfortable, in a warm office I can tell the Surface would have a sweat issue

7) Sound clarity – all three had very good voice sound clarity, but the Bose QC35 did so with less volume turned up, volume of 8 – 10 for others while volume of 5 on Bose QC35 to hear the same thing

8) Interoperability – all three operated fine on all manner of video, voip, UCaaS and web calls

9) Multi-device – in theory all three are supposed to connect to both phone and computer for dual inputs, I guess to hear music and then take a call or conversation, in reality that is horrible because my VOIP calls were constantly interrupted by the alerts and messages from my phone, the headset was constantly switching back and forth, and once, my iPhone randomly began playing music during a VOIP con call

10) Digital Aid/Cochlear – all three work fine with digital hearing and BTE hearing aids, and Advanced Bionics Cochlear implant

11) Sound Quality – my focus was on voice clarity not music, all three have excellent sound quality, The QC35 the best, then the Surface and then the Soundlink, the volume on the QC35 did not have to go as high to get the same results as the other two

author: S. Howard
title: I bought these solely for noise cancellation
content: I bought these Bose headphones solely for the purpose of noise cancellation.  I work at a desk in a room that has a very large overhead fan that goes on and off all day.  The noise is so bad that I found myself getting stressed and literally putting my hands over my ears.  The headphones are absolutely awesome at canceling out that noise.  I wear them virtually all day at work, and I can barely tell when the fan is on versus when it's off.  They are very comfortable, and my ears don't get hot as some other people mentioned.  The part that goes over my ears is actually big enough that my earlobes don't get crushed, which was a problem with the last headphones I tried.  I also have a big head, and these aren't too tight.  Overall extremely comfortable.  My only complaint is that they require being connected to a cell phone in order to work.  So if I forget to bring my cell phone to work -- no headphones.  If my cell phones dies -- no headphones.  I can't understand whey they couldn't make these so that the noise cancellation would work regardless of whether I had my cell phone with me.  In fact you should be able to use the wire to connect them to the computer and listen to something there without a cell phone as well.  The only feature that should require a phone is talking on the phone.  It doesn't make sense that they are useless without one.  These would be five stars -- ten stars!! -- if I could just use them without the phone.  Still very happy with these headphones though, would definitely buy again.

author: Paul Thomas
title: Good sound
content: Comfortable and have excellent sound.  I wish that they didn't instruct me to download their app in order to use them.  It's not necessary.  They should have paper set-up instructions or give a website to refer to.

author: Deecat
title: Best Headphones Ever!
content: I use the headphones mostly when I go to the gym which is very noisy.  This Bose product is perfect!  It cancels the noise and  has fantastic sound!  I am so surprised about its battery life.  It is very long lasting!  In short, I love my headphones!  I’m not quite sure how to use the built-in Alexi?

author: sundancr123
title: Worth every penny
content: Wore these on a plane and was able to sit through 3 hours of an infant screaming directly behind me. I could also still hear my movie when the flight attendant kept talking over the loud speaker

author: April
title: Awesome sound nose canceling is as advertised
content: Bought these for my boyfriend. Everything is as advertised. He can basically ignore anything I say due to the noise canceling feature. Its his favorite thing. The sound is pretty great too. He wears them while working around the house allot and on flights. It also helps when using loud tools such as table saws etc.

author: joseph jackson
title: Good quality and clear sound!
content: Very nice quality! Sounds great and travel case is really nice. Just what i wanted!

author: Al
title: Unbelievable difference
content: Great at cancelling out airplane noise.  Perfectly quiet on a noisy flight.

author: Mama Bear of four
title: Amazing headphones!
content: Amazing headphones!  Bought these for my daughter- she has autism and suffers with certain sounds. These headphones have been a game changer. They allow us to go out in public without fear of loud noises effecting our daughter. I would recommend to anyone with our situation.

author: naa134
title: Good, comfortable headphones for long wear
content: I bought these headphones for my very long flight to China. The best feature about them is comfort. They fit over my ears so they were not pressing on my ears at all. I also wear glasses and they were not pressing into the sides of my glasses. I was able to wear them for hours without any discomfort. I synced them with my tablet to watch shows and movies on the flight. The sound quality was really good and the bluetooth worked great. There is also a cord to plug in to devices if you don't want to use the bluetooth. I think the noise cancellation feature works good, but not great. It blocked out some of the loud plane engine noises and some surrounding noises, but not everything completely. There were crying children on the flight which I heard through the headphones. I guess I expected them to block out all surrounding noise completely instead of just muffling the sounds. Using a pair of earplugs in addition to these headphones would be good to block out all sounds. Overall, I really like the headphones for the comfort they provided.

author: Summers Family
title: I didnt know I needed these
content: These are expensive and worth every penny. I had no idea headphones could sound like this. There is no going back!

author: Melissa
title: worth the money
content: Great headphones!  I can wear them while on the treadmill and not have to turn up the volume on the computer or phone due to background noise.  They are really comfortable, too.

author: Gwen D
title: Great investment for students!
content: A great investment for a student when they need to concentrate! The noise cancelling really works especially when music is playing too. I also like how they can connect to multiple devices at once! I just wish they came in more colors.

author: Kevin
title: Occasional connectivity problems
content: I was expecting these headphones to be perfect for the price I bought them at, but they are still very nice to have. The comfort is great and they do a great job blocking out general sound. I occasionally have blue-tooth connectivity problems, though, even when my phone is in my pants pocket. I also found the Alexa feature absolutely useless. I haven't tried the cheaper version of these headphones, but I think I might have been satisfied with those and paid half the price.

author: Spoon
title: Nice sellers
content: I contacted the company before buying these to ask some questions and they were super quick to respond. We got a refurbished ones and they work very well. I don’t know if any headphones are truly 100% noise canceling, but these seem to help

author: MSJ
title: Noise cancelling
content: Great noise cancelling headphones

author: Salty Caramel
title: Keeps you sane on long plane rides.
content:
Wore on a 14 hour plane ride.  Keeps you protected from the engine noise.  And helps you sleep.  It really does block out the noises around you.  Plus there are 2 levels of noise canceling.  You can choose how much noise you want blocked. How much is your sanity worth on long trips?  Buy these...
Also works great for mobile phone calls. And listening to audio in noisy public spaces.

author: SherryA
title: Sound is excellent!
content: Totally blocks out surrounding noise and distractions!  Sound is excellent!

author: Sea Dog
title: Fantastic Stuff
content: Used it on a transcontinental 16 hrs flight. Enjoyed the music and then just the noise cancelling, almost all the way. Great Stuff!

author: Washington Irving
title: Great, but only indoors
content:
Generally these are fantastic, my only gripe is how bad the noise cancellation is when it's windy: it's actually worse than normal headphones.

If you plan to use them on planes or inside go for it, but if you need them outdoors look elsewhere.

author: Jennifer Oh
title: Great headphones
content: Only thing I didn’t like was how sweaty my ears got if I wore them for a while.  Everything else was great.  Would definitely recommend.

author: Lola Joyner
title: Great Product
content: I ordered these headphones for my hubby as a gift for Christmas and ever since I gifted it to him he seems to never to take them off. He loves them and I love the fact that he enjoys them! He connects them wirelessly to our tv and at night watches his favorite shows on full blast without waking me up.

author: M Zak
title: Awesome product!
content: I'm not an audiophile but appreciate these immensely. I swear these helped me to not feel jet lagged on a couple of overseas trips. To not hear the constant noise of an airplane was so nice! I'm also shocked at the battery life these have. Just love them.

author: J. Tate
title: Not good for bus/subway
content: These headphones are ok.  Certainly not worthy of $350. They have good sound quality, ok bass, and great battery life. But they lack in volume, and the noise canceling is more annoying than useful. It worked decent on an airplane canceling the steady sound of the engine, but on a bus/subway it was terrible. The noise canceling causes a little pressure on the ears, this was fine when canceling a steady noise, but with each bump, rattle and squeak of the bus and subway, there was noticeable pressure fluctuations and “drumming” that coincided with each bump/rattle. Very annoying. So much so I just turned off the canceling completely.

author: Andy V.
title: Great overall
content: Best noise canceling and comfort. Sound is a little on the flat and quiet side although ive come to like the subtle music. As someone who never pairs his old headphones to 2 devices this feature is extremely convenient. It is possible to game with these is you have a seperate cable with in line mic that is 2.5mm and 3.5mm. Button'a are easy to distinguish. Usb c in the future would be great although they do last very long.

author: Les
title: Authentic. Only thing I use when traveling.
content: Authentic. Only thing I use when traveling.

author: Star Gazer
title: Great product !
content: What I like about this product is the premium sound but better yet the ability to cancel out my coworkers!!

author: mgesellschap
title: Love them!!!
content: They are light weight, feel well constructed though!  Sound quality is outstanding!  Battery life is great for my use...

author: Caroline Powell
title: Broken
content: Unfortunately, I think mine came broken.  I bought them for work to cut down on extra noise and also to bring with me when I traveled for work.  The left side works perfectly, but there is something loose in the right side that I cannot seem to figure out and it rattles when the headphones vibrate, which is almost constant since sound is vibration.  Due to the close proximity to my ear, it hurts my ears too much to use and defeats the purpose of having noise cancelling headphones.  I'm probably going to send them back.  My coworker has the same headphones and his work perfectly, so I think it's just my specific pair.

author: samuelhusner
title: wheres the beef?
content: no directions on how to set up OR use. absolutely USELESS if you can't figure out how to use it. INSTRUCTIONS NEEDED for those of us NOT tech savvy.

author: R. Rivas
title: Not impressed and returned.
content:
I experienced discomfort with top cushion, it has 2 hard seams on the outer perimeter of the band that caused pain on my mid scalp region. Noise cancelling worked as advertised but the sound quality was mediocre Imo as there was no clear separation between the highs and lows.

I was expecting a WOW factor at this price but it never delivered.

author: Marty Frascone
title: I love these headphones
content: I absolutely love these. Sound quality is super crisp and the battery lasts quite a while.  I feel so immersed in these at cubicle at work and they are great for when I'm playing the drums and want to hear the rest of the track. Had them for a month and no hardware issues either.  They also work well with taotronics devices.

author: Chris
title: Love it! Great sound, light and seemlees to use
content: Love it! Great sound, light and seemlees to use

author: Nate Wilson
title: Make Sure to Mute ALL Notifications
content:
I used to love these headphones, but since about June of 2018, any time that my phone receives a notification I get a FULL VOLUME BLAST of static/white noise in my ears in place of an actual notification sound. I honestly think it has damaged my hearing and I simply cannot use these headphones any longer. I have researched the issue thoroughly on Bose forums and the company provides no work arounds or desire to improve the issue. Some users have worked around the issue by manually turning off the notification sounds on each app so that they don't get their eardrums blown out. However, as these are $350.00 headphones, Bose should fix this issue via firmware, not by expecting their own customer's to provide other customer's with workarounds.

I always thought Bose was the cream of the crop when it comes to Headphones, but from here on out I will just by the Tao Tronics Chinese Knockoffs just because Bose is such a shitty company when it comes to supporting their customers who pay way too much for their products.

End rant.

author: Simon
title: Predictably good noise canceling, very comfortable
content:
These replaced my corded QC15s of which I had three pairs.

Still not sure I like the idea of a proprietary battery, as it was easy to just carry AAAs around when you were going on a trip, but it works very well, sound insulation better I think and bluetooth pairing works well and sounds fine.

Still not the best music sound compared to things like B&W P7 or Sennheiser momentums (have both) but nothing comes close to the total solution when you're getting on an airplane for 8 hours and want noise canceling. Very comfortable for a trip that long - not so either of the above.

author: Thomas M Thigpen
title: Best headphones ever
content: Best sounding headphones ever

author: Wilyue
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent BOSE Noise Cancellation Headphone easy to setup & GREAT sound & Noise cancellation

author: toni_sto
title: awesome headphones. sound is great
content: awesome headphones. sound is great, noise cancelling -works great, battery life - great. I see people complaining about the bluetooth, I never had any issues, works great with about 40ft range from my phone.no problems with taking calls or using SIRI. the only thing that i don't quite like is the mobile app. i was expecting an established company like Bose to at lease put a sound equalizer on the app, not just try to sell me songs

author: Bruce B
title: Great headphones with a not so good required app to control settings
content: The headset works great. The app required to control it not so well. I have used several models of noise cancelling headphones, primarily Koss, for many years. Koss no longer makes a comparable product and a friend recommended this product. For noise cancellation and sound quality it works great, probably the best I have ever used on a flight. But the app, which is required to change any settings on the headset, is clunky and hard to navigate.

author: Martin E.
title: nice sound
content: Noise canceling feature is great.

author: B Mel
title: Amazing
content:
I was really doubting these headphones would be as good as my previous Bose.
The bluetooth is actually way better than having a cable. The quality of the noise cancelling improved a ton.
They are light, do not hurt my head.
They look good and the battery life is long. I use it many hours per week as I like quiet around me.

author: V.S.
title: Great value!
content: I love the look and feel of these headphones.  My old, corded Bose are still in perfect condition but I wanted to upgrade to wireless.  I bought these same headphones for my adult children, too.

author: Gingerbreadman
title: Works mostly as expected but with silly issues.
content: The headphones work well and replace an older set. The internal battery is a positive step and battery life is good. Noise cancellation is only marginally better than the old version. The 3 settings is useful but only functions with Bluetooth connection. A cable connection does not allow the same flexibility which makes little sense. I find the cable connection to be quite sensitive requiring care connection at the headphone socket. The biggest problem is the BT app on an iPhone at least. Connectivity to the app is easily lost forcing an on/off routine to connect but even that often does not work and a new pairing is required. It’s annoying.

author: MAHA
title: AMAZING
content:
This product is amazing. the cancellation is perfect; although if the area is too loud then you'll hear the people but overall great product. I use them to study and i am able to tune out everyone and everything. sound quality is great as well.
I like how you can connect to two product but hope they change the limit in the future.
bass quality is great as well.

I love this product.

author: BatteryKing
title: All around really good
content:
I am updating after close to a year of use as things have changed with firmware updates to warrant adding the last star to make it 5/5.  Something up front I think I should say about noise cancelling as there does seem to be a bit of a debate over it, is it does not block out all sounds and it does not muffle sounds equally, but for practical purposes it does do a very good job at noise cancelling striking a good balance of things and being most effective where it is needed the most to make an enjoyable listening experience.  At least this is my experience using this on a daily basis in many different environments.  I have noticed on airplanes I need to fine tune how the headset rests on my head for best results, but once finding the proper adjustment it is almost like I am in an isolation room.  Fantastic.

Overall I am seeing this as well worth the money, a big step up over a much older generation of this product line I had been using, and definitely a huge step up over what came with my phone.  I bought this right after upgrading my phone, so in the past week have found some issues were not the head phone's fault, but instead default sound settings I have since adjusted.  Also been getting more adjusted to the noise cancellation, which is really a great feature of this headset.

For some things I really like about this headset:
1. I have a huge head and this fits nicely on it; even covers my large ears comfortably.  Almost no over the ear headphones do this and I have looked far and wide.  My head is just too big for pretty much all except this particular line of headphones / headsets.  In the ear headsets irritate my ears after a while, causing my ear canals to swell up.  So having something tolerable let alone comfortable to the point that I almost forget they are on is a huge plus.  They also fit on my wife's normal sized head just fine, so it covers a wide range of head sizes pretty well.

2. The sound quality and frequency range is great.  While I would like frequency sliders in their app, the hard coded balance across the range is pretty darn good.  Some reviews say there is a different headset that sounds better, but especially after this latest update, I am having trouble finding room for improvement; it sounds excellent across the range, even deep bass.  The main limit I hit is a streaming service I use defaulted back to low quality when I upgraded my phone, so deep bass was crushed a bit and overall was not sounding as good as my home computer which has been the same machine for a while now (where I got the quality options set right a while back), but resetting the values and clearing the cache has fixed this issue.  Really with noise cancelling mixed in I am hearing a lot more detail that would normally get washed out from background noise and my desire to keep volume levels down in order to preserve my hearing.  Have the best of both worlds now.

3. In call sound quality is reported to be good across a number of calls now, even from the datacenter floor.  Especially considering this does not have a boom mic, that is pretty good.  I remember in the past getting a call on the datacenter floor with a lesser headset and nobody could hear anybody.  Then again they have been moving servers to the cloud and the remaining servers are running cooler with the reduced heat load on the CRACs and thus their fans have slowed a bit, bit it is still really loud in there, so both parties hearing loud and clear is pretty amazing.

4. The battery really does go the distance and I would venture to say the 20 hour rating would be for harsh use cases where my main use case is mellow office building use.  I am thinking more like 25 hours in an office.  I just love how my newer devices can just go and go on batteries, at least initially where in the past battery life started off too short an then quickly became frustratingly way too short.  Starting off with plenty of time I have some room to do some battery life extension tricks like limiting the charge window manually.  Now if this was something built into the product like what you can do with a Tesla car, that would be really nice as changing out batteries every two years or so, especially with how devices are built these days is a bit of a PITA and too often goes badly.

5.  For sound cancellation, I have to say there is something to be said for pretty much all of the ambient noise just going away and it just being dead silent.  Seems to weird some people out, but I think it is great.  Can still hear people talk and other loud sounds, but I seems to be rather muffled.  Also it seems to be good at figuring out what is white noise and clearing that out completely where some other frequencies that are more useful get through better.  Also love being able to walk down a busy street and hear my music, especially without having to sacrifice my eardrums in the process, especially as a lot of really loud noise around freeways and such are really muffled down.  Found in a noisy data center that if I were to go to the barber, they would work better, but still work quite well with the hair I have, just little bit of bleed through sound from the excess hair around my ears.  Pressing the headphones down causes things to get a lot quieter.  Plenty good for easy on the ear drum music listening while in the data center.  Have used for other things like muffling noisy power tools and having my wife watch her TV next to me and not be distracted by anything at all.  Beginning to think this could be the beginnings of a great relationship... Oh wait a sec.

My complaints so far are:
1. My #1 complaint is removed as it seems to have been fixed with the latest firmware update as I thought would be possible.  Star added back.  Thanks Bose!

2. I have noticed doors around the office that automatically slam shut while this headset muffles the higher frequencies, the lowest frequencies seem amplified and so it is like my head is getting hit with a sound pressure wave.  Been thinking about this more and I have been moving in the direction of what this does muffle, it does so well that what it does not effectively muffle seems quite loud as the ears adjust to the greatly reduced sound levels hitting them overall.

3. The radio antenna seems to be on the right side only.  Being a lefty I like putting my phone on the left side, but that just does not go well.  Have to use the right side when going for a walk.

author: Daniel Hinchcliff
title: Great headphones if you're looking for a upgrade
content: These are some of the best headphones I have ever wore. Coming from a pair of audio technica ath-m50x the bose feel lighter, sound better and the noise canceling is crazy, I had a microwave running in the background and couldnt hear it with these on.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love IT!!
content: Love the headset. Wish Bose app can allow you to tweak the sound equalizer but works great for noisy office or on the plane. Not full noise cancellation but muffles most of the sound which works well to get in the zone.

author: George L. Rivera
title: Works Great
content: The best!!

author: Joshua Burroughs
title: Perfect for travel
content: These headphones compact down to a great travel size!  The noise-canceling on these were worth every penny.  Traveling on bus, plane, train, car, you'll be able to hear your music at a low volume.

author: Jim Botsford
title: Poor Bluetooth Implementation
content:
Sound and noise canceling seemed very good. However these were a nightmare to get bluetooth connected properly. My wife wanted them for the computer when working and TV in the evening. Could not get them to seamlessly switch between devices with out having to clear the bluetooth connections and starting over.

Then once connected the bluetooth kept breaking up, dropping and stuttering if she moves even 12 feet from the TV or computer. 19 dollar cheap headphones with poor sound quality work much better than this.

For this kind of money, no thank you.  Sent them back.

author: Angela Chang
title: Use to study effectively
content: Best purchase I have ever made. Thanks to the cyber monday deals I get the $50 discount. I liked it couple years but it was so expensive that made me consider. The headphones comes to right time when I study for my up coming finals. Best noise canceling headphones

author: Mom of 2
title: Great sound; a little uncomfortable
content: Great set of headphones. Excellent sound quality. Drowns out my kids and provides peace. Only issue - the top of the headpiece seems to push on the top of my head no matter how much I adjust it. Just wish the headpiece was a little flexible to better mold to an individual’s head shape. Overall good choice.

author: Jman
title: Best thing ever!
content: I am new to the headphone game, but I'm glad I didn't go cheap.  Noise cancellation is the ticket.  Very comfortable with my larger head.

author: Klaw
title: Excellent noise cancellation
content: Picked these over all other high end over the ear headphones bc of the superior active noise cancellation.  We tried every competitor you can think of and some friends even bought some other brands that allowed longer listening opportunities but never had a single regret buying the Bose.

author: LARRY DAQUIOAG
title: Best headphones for an open office floor plan
content:
I am the Director of Operations for a 100+ employee company which utilizes an open office floorplan (i.e.: cubicles).  Of course one of the side effects of the open office is an elevated level of background sound.
We went through a lot of trial and error testing which noise canceling headphones would work the best for us.  These Bose QuietComfort35 headphones were consistently the best we have found.  They may seem pricey, but for us they work the best with very few if any problems.  I see that Bose has a new headphone in this series that I may take a look at, but as for now, when a new employee starts work they get a cubicle, laptop with keyboard and curved monitor and a pair of Bose QuietComfort35 headphones.

author: Courtney
title: I will never fly without these again
content: These headphones are my saving grace. I use them on every flight, in the office and even when I vacuum.  Babies on the plane? Who cares! Office chatter? Doesn't affect my concentration! Someone approaches my desk at work? Scares the crap out of me every time. Cleaning the house is that much more enjoyable now that my tunes follow me everywhere with no annoying cords. And if you're on an airplane and you need a cord to watch a movie, no problem! These babies go both ways.

author: defnotclutch
title: Worth It
content:
If you’re debating swallowing the price tag - just do it. These are worth EVERY penny. Great noise cancellation even w/o music playing and also very comfortable. I can use them for usually 2-3 workdays probably 4-6 hours of usage each day before having to recharge.

Only improvement would be wireless charging on a stand. These are $350 headphones after all.

author: John Wright
title: Best tool to get rid of someone!
content:
I got this as a gift for my ex, but now I have to attend her funeral. I gave it to her and she immediately put it on so she wouldn't have to hear me. Anyways, I left the house. I guess she forgot she was cooking and was too busy ignoring me, but a fire started and she didn't hear the alarms or people screaming at her. 10/10 would buy for an ex again.

On a more serious note: I got these because I have really sensitive ears and my brain occasionally switches to "let's hear everything" mode. I'll be sitting at my desk working with earbuds in, listening to a podcast or some music and simultaneously 3 conversations around me. It's not very fun, to be completely honest, and I feel terrible eavesdropping.

The complaint that people state of the "cabin" is somewhat accurate, as is the point that they don't eliminate all noises. There are certain noises that will go through, some voices will be heard somewhat clear, whereas others will be completely nullified. Distance, angle, and more factors, certainly.

Anyways, I'll start with the "bad":
Cabin-like. Imagine you're placed in a glass box. That's how it sounds. If that's hard to imagine, basically everything around you is heard through a wall. If that's hard to imagine, think about Darksight from DnD. You have a 60 foot "hear radius". These headphones halve that. You now have a 30 foot "hear radius". Ok, I think I'm done beating this horse. The cabin seems to be most noticeable when the ANC is off, at least in my opinion. It also makes me extremely thirsty, which is good because I always forget to hydrate. So this ends up being a plus in my book. (I had to pee 6 times today. That's 5 more than I normally do.)
Noise elimination. The first thing I did when I put them on was to click my nails against my desk. I couldn't hear a thing, so I did it harder and harder until it hurt my fingers. I couldn't hear a thing. Tapping my nails on my keyboard, however, made a noticeable sound immediately. It's hard to tell how "quiet" or "loud" it was, since I didn't really hear anything else (no music) and, again, my ears are very sensitive to sound.

The app used to connect the headphones is very straightforward. I can't speak about the android one because my android is currently just an alarm clock because it lags from having notifications. Right away, when you connect it, your phone will start downloading a firmware update. Don't worry, the update won't turn off your headphones, yet. When the download finishes (it takes about an hour of your phone being on the app, I'm not sure if it needs to be the active app, but I left it as such with the screen on because it was going slowly until I did so), then you  can update and your headphones will be "offline" for about a minute. Yeah, sucks, but whatever. The update gave it audio-share capabilities, which is cool but I don't have friends, so.. I guess it's cool?
The app tells you the ANC level, let's you turn off Text to Speech (you hear beeps instead, similar to an Alexa), and controls a few other controls. I didn't use the Google Assistant because I try to be aware of how much noise I make and talking to myself is something I reserve for when I'm in the car. I tried to use the music player, but it currently only connects to two systems, Apple Music and some weird podcast thing. It does integrate into your music player (to access the basic playback functionality), but it doesn't give you fine controls. Not a big deal because swapping apps isn't hard, and swapping tracks is made easy with the headset. There's probably something else the app does but I can't check because the headphones are in my bag and turned off.

The only complaint that I have is that the headphones are nice and tight which is great when they're on, but if I put them around my neck they're trying to strangle me. I guess I don't have to worry about them falling off if I do a backflip, but I'm not flexible enough for a backflip and I like to breath... maybe I can use it for erotic asphyxiation?

I guess I can complain about how much noise I make because I can't really hear how much noise I make so I'm super paranoid, and I also think I start whispering because I know it's easy to talk loudly or yell when you can't hear yourself. Nobody has complained thus far, but it's only one day in. Actually, that's not true, today there were lots of complaints about the office being quiet. I swear it's not my fault. I just didn't want to butt into everyone's conversations.

author: J. J.
title: I can see 4 stars if you want super bass-heavy plodding sound
content: Ha.  Who ranks these low?  I can see 4 stars if you want super bass-heavy plodding sound.  But these are crisp and clear with well defined mid and bass separation.  Love everything about them.  Love that I can put them on and simply use the noise reduction and block out 4 kids in the room.  Lol.  Dre sounds better on these than his namesakes.

author: Cassandra phu
title: Excellent service
content: Love the headphones.  Quick purchase and delivery....

author: lynn mcculley
title: Great
content: Excellent

author: Scout’s mom
title: Wireless not worth hassle
content: Excellent noise cancelling, but the wireless option is a pain. You have to sync it, and it's another plug-in charge as opposed to using regular batteries. I have the 25 and prefer it.

author: Stephane C.
title: What an upgrade from my QC15!
content:
I have been using a Bose QC15 headphone for so many years for my travels, but ultimately felt I needed to get an upgrade. And then I bought the QC35 II.
And what an upgrade!
First the overall sound quality improved, especially when the noise reduction is on (strangely, music sounds better with NR on than without NR).
And then I made a side by side comparison, and wow, what an improvement in the noise reduction field!!
This week end, my neighbourg decided to throw a party with live music.  I started to feel in despair until I remembered I had the QC35, so I put them on, and boom, the noise disappearely nearly completely. I just played some relaxing music to a very low level, and I felt completely in peace.
This thing is magical!
I like that through the Bose application, I could reprogram the asssistant button to select the NR level (3 levels, High, medium, or off).  I guess I am old school, I do not like the assistants like Alexa, Google, and so on. I am not using these things.
I did not have the opportunity to use them for phone calls. But reviews are not so enthusiast about this feature, so I guess I will not use these headphones for calls. I still have "regular" wired earbuds with a good quality microphone to run with my Samsung S10 when I am on the move and need to attend some calls.
FInally, as far as design is concerned, clearly the Bose headphones are not the slickest headphones around.  They look pretty dull to me, but well, at least for me, I prefer having the best noice reduction around, with a decent sound quality, rather than the best looking headphones.

author: Melanie Hall
title: Unmatched sound quality
content: My son's Beats were stolen at a basketball game and instead of replacing with the same, he asked for these. He also has the wireless earbuds (easy to lose), but these are his preferred music source. My husband flies a lot and also has them. He swears by these and won't travel without them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bose wireless headphones
content: I got this for myself as a birthday gift.  Perfect!

author: MBH
title: Bose QuietComfort - Still The King
content:
I come at this review after owning/trying a long line of good headphones. I own Grados, Sennheisers, other Bose, Sonys, and Beats. I just tried and returned the Sony WH1000XM3 due to their dismal call audio quality. These Bose, while not perfect, are pretty darned close.

Audio Quality: I've tried about everything I can throw at them; NPR streaming, Pandora HD, FLAC from Vox, MP3, Amazon Unlimited, Apple Music. They all sound really good. I think the app could use an EQ like Sony has to tweak them for personal preferences. Soundstage feels broad and realistic. I'm not an audiophile, but like music to sound like I'm there. Spatial information, shuffles by performers, resonant buzzes, string squeaks, little breathy inhales, those all add to the experience for me and I can hear them with these cans.

Comfort: They are light and the cups are big enough to clear the ears. The clamping force might be just a bit too tight, but I wore them for 8 hours yesterday without listening fatigue.

Connectivity: They paired with my iPhone and my work Dell laptop with no issues. They switch back and forth seamlessly. The only thing I've found amiss is that sometimes incoming calls don't default to the headphones and I have to switch the audio manually.

Call Quality: This is where they excel against the Sonys. Audio quality on both ands is crisp, clear and natural sounding. My client who complained about the Sonys didn't even know I was using headphones with the Bose. Total win here.

ANC: Really excellent. Maybe doesn't give the shocking "whoomp" of no noise like the Sonys, but my chatty office environment just disappears when I have these on. All I hear is my audio.

Personal Assistant: I have it set for Siri and she is no smarter unfortunately. Response is good though. Too bad she's such a dingbat.

Other little things: great packaging, really nice case, robust feel, good volume, long battery life.

I have not used the music sharing so can't comment on that.

author: Sree
title: Awesome headphones. Very comfortable
content:
Awesome headphones.  Very comfortable, clear sound.  The only thing I have to get used to is that my own voice sounds muffled, because of the noise cancelling.  But everyone else's voice is very clear.

The airline adapter was missing in my package.  I chatted with Amazon representative and they immediately gave me a $20 credit, and a link to order a new one, which I immediately did.($12.99 with free shipping :))

author: jhicken
title: I hear ya!
content: I love these! I use them primarily for cross-country air travel and the time just flies buy. Great sound, comfortable fit, and last well.

author: Bijay Maharjan
title: Bose is the name every audiophile should be able to trust
content: Where do I begin? Can a product be rated more than 5 stars? If so, this definitely deserves it. Yes, it is one of the most expensive headphones out there (not including those fancy pro studio headphones), but you totally get your money's worth. So, stop spending your hard earned cash on cheap headphones and make this one time investment on a premium headphone like this.

author: R. Patrick
title: Great battery, incredible quality
content: Great battery life, incredible sound quality. Definitely will sweat if outside. But i use all the time and while mowing and i barely have to turn up volume when while blade is engaged.

author: David B.
title: Loved them Immediately
content:
Very sleek design and the comfort is amazing.

Noise canceling is so great that I wouldn’t use option while walking.

author: Dopy Doorite
title: Finicky pairing! Don't count on pairing with bluetooth Television.
content:
Been trying off and on for months to get these overpriced headphones to pair to my brand new Sony 43" TV. It just doesn't work. I just wish I had known before my return window was us. If I had, I would have purchased the Sony headphones instead. Otherwise, I really do like these. They're lightweight and have superior sound quality.

But, because I can't pair to either of my Sony TV's, I'm not a happy camper!

author: Dudehere
title: Comfy silence and great sound
content: Sound is amazing. Noise cancellation is very good, but not a complete blanket of silence unless you're listening to music. If you have a dense soundtrack playing, someone could detonate a stick of dynamite next to you and you wouldn't flinch. Very comfortable even if you have a tiny head like me. Pairs with several devices simultaneously and toggles between them seamlessly. Very expensive, but probably worth every penny, especially if you hate to listen to people's inane blathering in public.

author: TIM B
title: Must have for traveling
content:
Great noise reduction and sound quality.

Make flying more comfortable.

author: Remmington Penn
title: High overall quality product
content: The Bose 35 II are a great overall high-quality product. Just to name a few of the pros, they have excellent noise cancelling capabilities, great mic for calls, they are light and comfortable, and they have a pretty good battery life. Also, the Goggle Assistant is a cool feature. I will say, however that I think the best all around headphones are the Sony WH1000XM3. Although, they are not as comfortable as the Bose 35 II. Overall, these are a great, high-quality product, but there are others out there that are just as good.

author: Nicole Davis
title: Amazing Headphones
content: I love using these for listening to music anywhere since the noise cancellation is great. It doesn’t always block out everything but it does a good job. I mostly use them on flights (without Bluetooth) and love them for noise cancellation and peace on any flight.

author: Wilma Lozada
title: Worth every penny
content: Love love love

author: Benjamin L.
title: Excellent noise cancellation and sound clarity.
content:
I’ve tested other brands noise canceling headphones and these Bose headphones were by far the best in the area of external noise cancellation. Clarity of music and Bluetooth phone capability is also exquisite. The microphone in the headset also works very well while using the Bluetooth feature to make phone calls. The speaker can be heard clearly on the other phone.
During a 737 flight, in a seat near the engine exhaust, as soon as I put on the headphones there was a glorious absence of any sound whatsoever.
While cooking and wearing the headphones, I was completely unaware that I had set off the smoke alarm until someone walked into the kitchen motioning me to remove the headphones, and low and behold that smoke alarm was screaming...
They are also very comfortable to wear for hours on end. They are not heavy which also adds to the comfort.
Battery life is also surprisingly good, even when utilizing the noise cancellation feature, and listening at a higher volume.
Would highly recommend.
I am not being paid or reimbursed for this review. Simply giving some feedback on how impressed I am with these headphones.

author: jse
title: Very pleased
content: Super comfortable, the bluetooth works well, and the noise cancellation is awesome. The sound quality isn't as good as my Audio Technica corded headphones, but it's still quite good. I am very pleased with my purchase. Oh, and I really like the carrying case. I can easily carry them around in my computer bag.

author: DSh
title: Priceless for frequent flier!
content: Since I fly twice a week I use it every time and I'm very happy with this purchase. First I was not sure if I need these additional features, but then I understood the whole advantage when the headphones warns you about meeting, received email, can read some text, etc. Priceless!

author: Richard I
title: Must have for flights.
content: Amazing! I’ll never fly without these headphones. They block out all of the crazy engine noise. You music sounds great. I previously ad high end beats, but Bose are in a whole new class. Nothing compares.

author: Rion Morgan
title: Taking care of Girls and Geckos in Las Vegas as Always
content: Taking care of Girls and Geckos in Las Vegas as Always

author: rlmorris
title: Horrible Bluetooth
content: I have has these headphones for almost a year.  I am very disappointed in the Bluetooth,  It is constantly disconnecting from my iPhone, Mac book and Windows laptop.  Especially on WebEx.  I have to go to the control panel (or settings on iOS) and disable/enable the headphones to get them to work properly.  If you use this with one device you may be OK.  Otherwise its not worth the money.  I think Bose quality has really gone downhill.

author: Bryan Cassiday
title: Wire doesn't work
content: The wire doesn't work on these headphones.  I plugged it into my Mac to listen to a movie trailer, and I can't hear a thing.  Sometimes I can hear music, but I can never hear any dialog.  The noise canceling works well, though.  It's not worth its price if the wire doesn't work.

author: Beth
title: Fabulous
content: I use these headphones when I'm on an airplane.  They are fabulous.  Had a little difficulty pairing them with my Kindle Fire, but I found an IT geek at work who got it done for me.  Paired just find with all my IOS devices.  Love these headphones.

author: Dustin M.
title: Good headphones
content: Sound could be louder (Let me decide when it's too loud, and I will worry about the battery life).  Also, they fall off my head when Im trying to do laundry or house work.

author: insertwittyhandle
title: Five Stars
content: Bought 2 - one for work and one for home.

author: Scooter M
title: LOVE IT
content: Along with my other Bose purchases, this QuietComfort 35 (Series II) wireless headphones with noise cancelling, completes my home sound equipment setting.  I've got the Bose SoundLink + 360 and love it, too.  Can't go wrong with Bose. Very glad I got the noise cancelling. I purchased a wired headphone for use on airplanes and when I'm out walking, or listening to music at night through my iphone or ipad. Purchased the blue tooth products for my home television and sound solutions. Can't say enough about them. Very happy to have purchased.  We were in the sound equipment business for nearly 60 years and Bose was one of the brands we sold.  Never disappointed.  You can purchase this with confidence!

author: Tharon
title: Excellent.
content: The noise canceling quality is amazing.

author: Matt&Susan
title: Love, love, love!
content: Really cuts out sound. I love it. Best headphones by far. The only thing I get bothered by it is that i've had a few glitches with it. It would say it was connected and would never play my music so I had to disconnect any other devices I had paired with it.

author: Dan K
title: Comfortable over ears
content: Very comfortable over ears. Noise canceling is excellent. Sound quality very good.

author: J. Wo
title: Perfect!
content:
Bought these for the wife. She said they were the best part of her recent 14-hour flight.
Pricey, but worth it. 6 out of 5 stars!

author: anna
title: Great quality
content: I love them but wish I would have gotten just ear buds.

author: MotoMayI
title: Don't buy these!!
content: At times (daily) it takes a few times of turning them on and off to connect to bluetooth. they have sound latency at times when watching videos. The biggest grip I have with these is that while watching a video, the sound will start to cut in and out. Highly annoying!! Please do yourself a favor and fo=ind a better pair. I now wish I would have bought the Dre units instead. I called Bose customer service and voiced my complaint and the phone agents recommended that I use the audio cable. Are you kidding me!! The reason I bought these is because I wanted WIRELESS HEADPHONES!! These seem like they were rushed in Bose product research and development because this is a very common issue. Just buy something else. These suck!!

author: JakeSpear Productions
title: Yea, you gotta have em...
content: Love these headphones.  They donot eliminate 100% of outside noise - only about 70% - but enough to allow peaceful existance in noisy situation.  Bass is not on par with audiophile equipment.  Wireless distance is about 20 feet without breakup.  Good battery life between charges.  Great to not have to carry extra batteries.  No need for special adapter on international business class flights on Lufthansa and United.  Good enough to close off the “real world” and allow me to enjoy youtube, movies, music, and SLEEP!  Expensive, but whatta ya gonna do?  You gotta have em.

author: Stacey C.
title: disappointed in the noise cancelling
content: Bought these specifically  to help  drown out the constant conversations of a coworker--noise cancelling performance not super impressive.  Sound quality is just okay.  They are comfortable, but  definitely don't  warrant the price tag for what they deliver.

author: Pardeep
title: Effective noise cancellation, great quality overall!
content:
Been using this for over a month now and it's great! I recommend it!

Fitting:
It covers your ears well, comfortable over the ear cushions make it really nice/snug. The strap that sit on my head usually adds pressure, I have to readjust to the right setting and its good.
Battery:
I used this to and fro from vacation, charged it once. It holds battery real well.
I use it in my office for calls and music and haven't charged it since. It's been weeks.
Siri and Calls:
Yes, it works with Siri, not sure why the details doesn't specify this. The general button when pressed and held activates Siri on my apple device.
I use these in my office and the quality is clear. I often ask my caller if my voice is clear and they confirm.
Bluetooth:
Great connectivity! I have my phone and Mac computer synced at the same time. Its automatic after you set it up. Love it
Carrying case:
It comes with a carrying case which is great, looks great, fits well. It also comes with a charger wire.
Noise cancellation:
I used it in the plane and didn't realize how good these were till I took them off mid air and the sound of the jets rushed in! That made me keep them on. Even if you're not listening to music, having them on at home or the office keeps the random noises and chatter out.

Overall a great set of headphones. I researched a long time before deciding on this. This product even had negative reviews which took me a while to order them but I haven't experienced anything negative about this. I do recommend these to travelers, home office users and if you're out and about.. It cancels all noise!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good buy!
content: Love it.  Bought it to listen to music so I don't have to hear my husband's constant politics TV stuff.  Works beautifully and the sound is wonderful.  Also bought it on sale so the price was more acceptable.

author: Vania vieta
title: BUY IT!
content: I got this as a gift for my loved one for his many trips via airplane. It's a life saver for him! I almost wish that I got myself a pair too.(i don't fly often)

author: Sal
title: Five Stars
content: Christmas present- very well received!

author: Richard J. Lee
title: Top notch
content: These are so good, I use them when I mow my yard with a 25 horsepower mover behind me and I can barely here the mower, plus I don’t have ruin my ears blasting the tunes.

author: Moeller
title: The sound and bass are amazing!!!!!
content: Best noise canceling headphones that I have had!  We bought these for our special needs daughter to block outside noise so she could listen to kids bop kids on Amazon music unlimited.  Have not been able to get it to work with my older version Echo dot but, the sound is excellent using fire tablet. Would like to see a kids version of headphones to better fit her head.  But the sound excellent I even use them once in awhile to watch tv. Highly recommend!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best you can get
content: Expensive and worth it.  Battery life is REALLY impressive as is the noise canceling feature.  Connects well with phone and computer.  Would be hot outside in summer since they cover the entire ear.  Only real negative is that they don't use the standard 3.5mm jack to fit into the headset - they use the smaller one.  I spoke with a Bose rep who said they would probably change that in the future.  Had a technical problem and phone support was impressive and solved the problem.

author: Meerkatsrock
title: Can't leave home without them!
content: I never knew I wanted these but they make a plane trip relaxing. I use them guided meditations and times when I want to relax without ambient noise in the house. Great addition and I take them on every travel trip.

author: Daniel Covell
title: Great Sound, Amazing Noise Canceling, Extremely Comfortable, Stupid Wired Audio Cable
content:
On an airplane just put these on and close your eyes and put on your favorite music. Then just disappear into your own world. The sound is very wide and pleasing. A little bass heavy if you are used to monitor quality headphones but for most the bass is very nice. I wish the headphones had different EQ modes. The Noise cancelation is amazing and even after having it on high for a long time it does not wear you out. They are very light and you almost don't notice they are on your head.

The only real complaint is the audio cable is proprietary 3.5mm to 2.5mm. I have no idea why they did this and if you lose the cable you have to buy it online. Unlikely to find in most stores. Also annoying since half the time I have the wrong end and have to flip it around. This is just stupid to me.

author: carolannfranklin
title: Love them, i want a second pair :)
content: omg these are awesome, we love them.

author: Shannon S.
title: Perfect for mowing the lawn
content: My son and I both use these for mowing the lawn.  You can hear a little background noise from the mower, but not much.  I would recommend them for sound and quality.

author: Marg Inoferror
title: Love
content: My wife loves these - can’t hear the kids at all

author: Lisa Finkel
title: I think I should have paid attention to the reviews and bought the Sony .
content: My Bose 35 ii arrived today and I am bummed. 1. They are uncomfortable to wear for any length of time.  Very hot.  Feel sweaty.  2.  The bass is overwhelming.  In most situations that they are used, I cannot adjust that problem (airplane).  3.  I can’t judge the noise cancellation quality because of the sound itself.  4.  Unlike the Sony, which was rated as better, the Bose does not come with the expected adaptors.  5. This may seem petty but I expected some kind of basic instruction booklet to be enclosed so they could be used immediately.  You have to go online to find the info.  I’ve been using Bose noisecanselling headphones since they hit the market years ago so I thought I would remain brand loyal.  Should have paid attention to the reviews.  I am returning these.

author: natgoo
title: Great headphones!
content: I’ve had these headphones for a few months now and I love them. My experience with ANC headphones is limited but I have used others. Most notably the Plantronics backbeat pro headphones. I purchased the bose headphones because the plantronics set started to rip around the ear cushions. In comparison the bose headphones are slightly more comfortable, have noticbly superior active noise cancelation, but unfortunately in my opinion have inferior sound quality. I’d say if noise cancellation is a bigger deal, go with the bose. If sound quality is a bigger deal, consider the plantronics. I hope the bose ear cushions will prove long lasting.

author: Michael Russo
title: What I liked the most was the noise cancelling performance
content: What I liked the most was the noise cancelling performance. It was very good. What I liked least was that no instructions were provided in the package. I had to gain access to a computer, wade through numerous publications, and then download an instruction set. For the price, a users manual should have been included.

author: hellison
title: I love that it comes with a case for storage
content: I was hesitant to spend so much on headphones, but I am impressed with the quality and sound. I love that it comes with a case for storage, too. I bought these for my daughter and will be purchasing a pair for myself as well.

author: william e stanton
title: Best Headphones around
content: These headphones are probably one of the best headphones you can possibly get

author: Amazon Customer
title: Notifications voice and beeps have piercing noise that cannot be lowered
content:
The headphones are comfortable and sound quality great.  But the voice notifications and beeps are deafening!!!  There is no way to turn them down.  I purchased this for noise cancellation and soft music.  When notifications come through, my reaction is to pull the headphones away from my ears because it is so piercing.  I have followed threads of others with the same complaint and Bose has provided no fix.  You can only turn off notifications, not lower volume.  For headphones of this price point, that is very disappointing.
If you are seeking noise cancellation headphones, look elsewhere until they have a fix for this.

author: Mark
title: Excellent head phones and nose cancellation
content: Excellent head phones and nose cancellation. Surprised passive nose reduction was it low by design. Excellent sounds quality.

author: Mo
title: Great product
content: Amazing

author: Amazon Customer
title: A must have if you want good quality of music
content: I usually work at crowded places. these headphones with their inbuilt noise cancellation, helps me focus better.

author: Robert W. Silvers
title: Good sometimes
content: Wanted for night time tv viewing. Seems to work ok when fully charged but drop below 60% and I get broken stuttering sound

author: Edmonds
title: Bought Two.  Both have keep disconnecting Bluetooth after 2 weeks' use
content:
For $384 each, you would think this is top-of-the-line.  I saw the many 1 star ratings and think that they guys are just overly critical.  But I was shocked that after 2 weeks of perfect use, my headsets start to disconnect by itself from my phone.  It would re-boot the connect, the headset audio would say "Bluetooth Disconnected.  Bluetooth Connected."  I cannot carry on a phone call, not a song, not anything without this continual interruptions and disconnects.  A cheap bluetooth $20 headset will lock in a connection solidly for an eternity.  But this expensive Bose is horrible on this essential feature.

Comfort, material, design, construction, performance, ... all fine.  Other than the fact that it connect connect to my device for more than a few minutes long before auto-disconnecting the bluetooth.  I search everyone on the web, but there's no solutions to be found.  There are thousands of instances of this occurring everywhere on this product.  Check out the 1-star ratings on Amazon and you'll see what I am describing here.  After 2 headsets with 100% failure, I know this is not a fluke.  This flaw is built-in and designed into the headset hardware/firmware/software.

I called Bose Tech support.  They took me through a process to turn off the headset for 30 seconds, plug it in to the charger for 5 seconds, then unplug from USB charger and turn on again. This is very rudimentary.  I have unpair, rebooted device, drained the headset battery, reloaded the Bose App, resynch to my phone many times, airplane mode, turned off bluetooth, tried on different phones, computers tablets, ... in the end, it all fails.

Bose Tech support was good, though.  They offered to replace, but I don't think that's the problem.  I just want their engineer to get all-hands-on-deck and fix this serious problem on such an expensive product.

author: Arman Fazeli Chaghooshi
title: Was working fine until the update
content: The noise cancellation feature has been destroyed by the last update. I am really really disappointed. It's been a month with no official resolution from Bose. I strongly recommend you to stay away from Bose until they get their <thing> together and fix this. I am not into conspiracy theories and I am truly hopeful that this screw-up was not on purpose in order to sell the newer headphones.

author: Philip Z
title: Multi-level of noice cancellation is cool, but honestly at work I turn it off
content:
I debated for weeks before deciding to finally put down the $$$ for these, and I don't regret it. I can wear them all day (at work) without any comfort issues. Multi-level of noice cancellation is cool, but honestly at work I turn it off.

I'm told calls sound crisp. Talking, for calls, is a little "odd" -- to get around the noice cancellation, they project external sound into your headphones. This has some interesting "side-effects": 1) you hear yourself in third person which sounds weird. 2) it can pick up sounds normally muted to the human hear, e.g. a coworker dropped a fork on their desk a few desks down from me and the headphones picked it up as if it was me... oops.

My only wish-list item on this is to make noice cancellation is physical flip switch. I have to go into the app, every time, to turn it off.

We haven't tried music sharing, as we don't have a second yet at this time to try.

author: Reagan James
title: Satisfied
content: Better than ever expected

author: Loonz206
title: Noise cancelling is amazing, I preset the button to noise cancelling levels ...
content: Must needed headphones for office with open floor plan. Noise cancelling is amazing, I preset the button to noise cancelling levels as I use the other phone brand.

author: antarlubnan
title: Excellent Quality
content: Cannot travel without it

author: G. Smith
title: 2 Separate new pairs broken within months
content:
I have purchased and used two pairs of new QC 35 headphones (one series I, another series II) and both broke after 6 and 13 months, respectively.

The most recent pair was working in the morning.  I put them carefully into my briefcase, walked to work, and when I took them out sound was not coming from one side.  I followed the Bose troubleshooting guidelines to no avail.

When they were working I used them enough that I'll replace them -- with Sony headphones.

author: Brian A.
title: Worth their weight in GOLD!
content: Sound and noise cancellation are fantastic.  Pairing to your device requires downloading an app onto your phone, but the process was pretty simple for a "low-tech" guy like me.  I absolutely cannot/will not fly without these in my possession.  You can escape into a movie and forget you're on a plane.  And they include a cord so that you can plug in to take advantage of the airline entertainment when available.  No "AAA" batteries on this one.  It comes with a charging cord, so just like your phone, all you need is something to plug in the USB cord into.  Charging takes very little time (maybe 20 minutes or so) and the charge lasts quite a while.  Can't say for sure how long, but I've gone on week-long trips and still had 50% or more power left upon my return.  Headphones are as comfortable or more than any other product on the market.  Comes with a rigid carrying case to keep them safe when not using. I have the black ones, but saw the silver the other day and they look really cool as well....can't go wrong either way.

author: Kimberly N.
title: He has to wear all day for work and he is very pleased..
content: my husband loves these... He has to wear all day for work and he is very pleased...

author: Amazon Customer
title: I am relaxed and not tired when I land
content: It works without nonsense. I travel internationally very often.  You won’t find me on a plane without my Bose headphones.

author: P. Plummer
title: Nice job
content: Bas is a bit lackluster, but overall the sound quality is good. The switch between Bluetooth inputs is easy and stable.Fast shipping. Will work well for those long airplane flights.

author: Matt
title: Worth every single cent.
content: These headphones are of quality. Bose never disappoints. The only con is the airplane "cabin pressure" feel because of the ANC. I got used to it, but some might not and others might get sick from it. I would try these out at the Bose store in your local mall first, before purchasing these to make sure you're Ok with that feeling.

author: Ray-Ray Z.
title: Awesome Sound and Comfort.
content:
First of all, I am a HUGE fan of all things Bose!!!
I still own, and use, my original pair of QC2s (now just for piano practice) as well as my QC15s (@ home office), and QC25s (@ work office).
I originally thought I'd try the QC35 (Series II) Wireless because my Pixel 2 phone is missing the all-important headphone jack (grrrr).

Glad I did!.

The QC35 is lighter, more comfortable, and has better noise cancelling than any of its older siblings. And, when paired with my smart TV, I can hear the faintest whisper of dialogue or really crank up the explosions without waking up the family - even when the Air Conditioner is blowing its hardest!

My QC25s go thru at least 1 AAA battery per week with daily use (6-10hrs per day) so I was very skeptical of the QC35s non-replaceable internal battery, but it really hasn't been a problem thus far. Even after multiple hours of catching up on all things MCU, I have yet to get it below 60% and it charges fairly quickly with a decent wall adapter.

So, why didn't I give it 5 stars???
1.  The new carrying case is way too small and no longer has the expandable outer pocket or shoulder strap that my QC2 case has (been an issue since the QC15s). That could be a plus for some people, but the QC2 case (which I still use!) has enough room for me to carry a couple of airline travel necessities (like a blow up pillow and eye mask).
2.  The included audio cable (for non blue tooth use) and USB charging cord are way too short.
3.  Bose non longer includes an audio extension cable (which would make point 2 irrelevant) or the funky little 2x1 "airline adapter" (who cares, right?).  You can still buy these accessories but, for $350 you shouldn't have to.

All that said... I still highly recommend these headphones!

author: elinor
title: Amazon, the world's number one site!
content: excellent service! I got the product working superbly. Thank you for everything.

author: TryinItTwice
title: Absolutely love these
content: I’m really particular especially in researching things. After trying a couple other products I found these were the absolute best. It does create a little bit of vertigo for some people to get used to you if you aren’t playing music. The Bluetooth is a must do not have the cord attached.

author: Christian Porter
title: Something to experience
content: Never thought I would be overly impressed with noise cancelling but here I stand, quite impressed. Yeah the price tag is outrageous and I cant say peace and quiet at a buttons click is worth $300 but still, these are amazing.  Only nit pick is I would enjoy a wheel to adjust volume but that's a personal preference.  If you want some peace and quiet in any loud area, car ride, bus ride, middle of a baseball game, this will do it, that is If you can look past the 300+ price tag🤣

author: A Customer
title: QuietComfort was not comfortable for me.
content: These headphones really have good sound and the noise reduction really does reduce noise significantly. There are a couple problems though. With a lack of documentation, It was difficult to figure out how to pair with a device other than my phone (hold switch for 2 seconds), but once I figured that out, it was pretty simple. The sound produced by the headphones is definitely superior to that of my previous, $10 headphones, which should be expected, although I don't know that it's $290 more superior. There are some drawbacks, which make me give it three stars. First, the noise reduction algorithm causes a delay. If you are watching TV or a movie through them, the sound will be about a second delayed. Using the "less noise" reduction algorithm gets things pretty much back on track, and still works pretty darn good for noise reduction. The biggest issue I had with these headphones was how uncomfortable they are. Ears hot. Area around ears, where the pads hit, hurt. It's just not tolerable for me. I'm going to send these back (hack, Amazon now charges for shipping things back!) and try the in-ear variety. Sadly, I know noise reduction won't be as good with those.

author: Shelia H.
title: Five Stars
content: Great Find..love the noise cancellation

author: LAT
title: Amazing and worth every penny!
content: I purchased this for my husband for Christmas since he travels frequently.  He is a musician so I knew I had to get a quality product that would meet his expectations and this product did not disappoint!  I shopped around and found the price similar at most venues but chose Amazon for the better price for the extended warranty.  He is very impressed with how effectively these work.

author: EPD
title: not sure just yet
content: Great comfort, intuitive design and light-weight, and good noise cancellation... just a few quirks that really bother me for $300 headphones. Audio cuts out a couple times per minute.  Another problem is range: at the gym if I walk 5-6 steps away from my phone with nothing obstructing the path it severely cuts out vs my 4 year old other headphones.  I'm going to give it a little longer, maybe I got a bad unit?

author: Ryan O’Dell
title: Great Product
content: Very good product with good battery life.  Fully charges quickly and holds charge for a long time.  Very comfortable and great sound quality for listening to music or just drowning out the sounds at the office.

author: KG
title: Good for small, overly sensitive heads.
content: I have a small head and I'm sensitive to too much pressure on my ears and on the top of my head, so not the ideal headphone model.  These are definitely the best I've tried. The high noise-cancellation setting is plenty for me. I'm not great at this stuff but it took me far too long to figure out how to charge and use them though.  : /

author: Patrick Carter
title: Sound quality
content: Overall pretty satisfied but on take off and landing seems to get a little distorted.

author: DorianaGraye
title: Love them.
content: They're great! I'm Bose loyal, so it's no surprise that I'm thrilled with these. I'm surprised at how long the battery lasts, which was my biggest concern. (It felt like I was swapping out the AAA batteries in my old pair all the dang time.) I know lots of reviews say the Sony competitors have better sound, but having tried both, the Bose are just more comfortable. And when you're wearing the cans for ages at a time (which I am), that's a huge determining factor.

author: Aaron
title: Amazing.
content: Work well with Bluetooth, no issues pairing. I've had them for almost a year and they still work like they're brand new.  These are particularly amazing when you're on a plane - they drown out engine and baby noises really well.

author: Matt Truhlar
title: Love these!
content: I ordered these for the noise cancellation feature and recently used them on a trip to Texas.  They were fantastic, one of the legs of my flight I was seated right by the wing and did not hear the engine at all.  The sound quality is great too. Very happy with this purchase!

author: Brandie
title: SO GOOD I ALMOST LOST A COOKIE
content:
These were great!  My only complaint is that they might be TOO good at canceling noise.  I recently wore them the plane ride to Italy.  I put them on to take a nap and woke up an hour later with drool down my face and a cold cookie on my tray.  I somehow slept through the warm cookie distribution, but luckily the lady beside me was looking out for my best interest and grabbed me a cookie. THANKS A LOT, BOSE.

.... would recommend 10/10.

author: Troy
title: Great headset, customer service was great too
content: Product was great for a year then stopped working . Contacted Bose twice to resolve. First call was difficult to understand rep then dropped  the call. Tried back next day and rep was fantastic , setup a return label that I printed and took to ups store to return. New headset arrived about 2 weeks later no charge.

author: S mitra
title: Love
