content: This is a really nice headphone. This was a gift from my husband. Initially i was not ready to spend so much on a headphone because I’m not really a headphone person. But once i started using this, fall in love with the bose QuietComfort 35 II.

author: Kane
title: Defective Bose 35II headphones
content: I love the Bose headphones but the ones I received through Amazon didn't work and took a lot of effort to download the proper apps to sync with my iPhone and IPAD. I took them on a flight and I couldn't use them.  I called BOSE again they said they were faulty and will exchange them for me. I'm disappointed in the hassle-factor but am looking forward to new ones that work!

author: Carl Haupt
title: I desired a better range but also needed something with supreme comfort as ...
content:
If you prize comfort these are the headphones for you but it will come at the (small) cost of sound quality.

I decided to pick up some ANC headphones after getting tired of the in ear buds I had been using for years. I desired a better range but also needed something with supreme comfort as I listen for hours on end while studying. A lot of people have been comparing these to a couple other sets so I will leave my thoughts around those as well.

QCII: Best comfort. Well-rounded sound. Great build quality (glass fiber reinforced nylon, or so I have read). User replaceable ear pads. One thing to note is the good but uninspiring sound. It is far from poor but it has sort of a muted feel. I suppose this allows them to have good marks across a wide range of genres. Can't blame them for that. I'm satisfied with the sound as they are definitely an improvement from the hf5 buds I had been using. Google assistant is cool but I don't care about it. I have that button set to adjust ANC (high, low or off). Where is the airplane adapter? Stupid to leave it out. Also to consider - there are massive issues with Bluetooth pairing in Windows 7. It can be argued that this is not their responsibility but it's still frustrating. For those having issues search up Toshiba Bluetooth drivers for Bose - this workaround solved the issue for me. Also note that this issue is not specific to Bose. The Win7 Bluetooth stack is just garbage so you may have issues pairing with any modern wireless device.

Sony WH-1000XM2: Definitely wins in the features category. Superior battery life, more lively sound, great equalizer customization in the app, touch controls and LDAC support. I kept finding myself wanting to listen to these more than the QCII. However, I could not overlook the build quality issues with reports of headband cracking. Unacceptable and not worth the risk for me. Also, I have larger ears and they were less comfortable with noticeable heating. The QCII have more space within the ear cups. The pads also got quite thin at the base of the ear during wear. This didn't compromise the seal but after removal it stayed flat and did not readily go back to a plush conformation. This may seem like a very particular critique but longevity is a concern for me and I could not help but think how long the cushioning would last. Add on top the fact that you cannot replace the ear pads and I had to rule them out.

B&W PX: Amazing sound and superb sound stage. Unfortunately, too many negatives. They are heavy and caused a hot spot at the top of my head after less than an hour of use. The build quality was amazing and they looked fantastic but it was just too much weight. Sound quality takes a big hit with ANC enabled. You also cannot use them passively without battery power. They also do not collapse for easy storage. It's a shame since they sounded so good but I could not live with these downsides. Maybe the next version will fix some of these issues. I've read the P7 is a good option for those not requiring ANC.

Ultimately it depends what you value. The combination of comfort and build quality with above average sound is what sold me. I hate to compromise but that's what you need to do at this price point. An ideal product would incorporate the Bose comfort, B&W sound and Sony features.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Terrible
content: These mAlfuntioned in 6 months and barely used them !!!!!!

author: alkendy
title: Wonderful Headphone
content: Quit comfortable design, cool looking, amazing sound cancelling and phone call mic, good battery life and working well Alexa.

author: Steven E Price
title: Great sound
content: Bose is always good sounding ido worry about the foam wearing out but I really like the overall sound

author: Illillerent
title: Great sound and noise cancellation
content: I use these(and a set of ear buds for the walkie mic) as hearing protection in an engine room that has 7 ammonia compressors running. It's pretty dang loud in there! They are comfortable and the sound quality is amazing. They do get a little warm tho during activity. Like sweaty warm, not component warm. So far pretty durable too. Battery life is amazing. I wear them for about 6 hrs a day on average and only charge them every other to every three days. Have not completely drained the battery yet. Highly recommend

author: RC CV
title: SO GREAT I DON'T HEAR MYSELF LAUGHING OUT LOUD ON FLIGHTS!
content: LOVE LOVE LOVE MY BOSE IN ROSE! SO GREAT THAT I DON'T HEAR MYSELF LAUGHING OUT LOUD, ESPECIALLY ON FLIGHTS!

author: LuvDogs
title: Happy with these
content: Really like these! I had a pair of Bose noise cancelling wired headphones but once I upgraded to a new iPad, I found that I hated the new adapter. I bought these with a grumpy attitude but have since changed my mind and LOVE these above the wired version. No getting tangled in the wire on a plane, it’s intuitive and the charge seems to last forever. Good investment.

author: Richard Myers
title: Don't Update the Firmware (don't install the Bose app)
content:
I really wanted to like these headphones.  I've had other 'cheaper' ANC headphones, and while the ANC worked OK, I kept hearing how Bose ANC was the best of the best.  So I upgraded.  Or so I thought.  To be fair, the ANC is superior to my Cowin or Nakamichi headphones.

I installed the Bose app right away, as instructed by the Docs that came with the Bose QC 35 II headphones.  That was a mistake, apparently.  The app immediately installs version 4.5.2 firmware without user consent.  There are many complaints about this firmware on the Bose community forums, and elsewhere (Reddit) and Bose claims they cannot find any issues with the firmware (since June '19).  Most of the posts complain of ANC problems created by the update.  Since my headphones were updated right at the get go, I couldn't compare before and after effects.

I had 3 (+1) issues with the headphone (I don't know whether they were caused by the update or not):
1. There was a very annoying 'distorted clipping' when listening to certain meditation music.  I didn't do an exhaustive study of whether the noise was added to other music.  But it was very apparent, and easily discernible by my old ears, and did not exist in other headphones (I went back and forth). I'm not the only one complainting about this issue...
2. The sound was tinny compared to my Cowin E7 Pro headphones.  The Cowin's produce a much richer sound, especially at the low end.
3. The Bluetooth call operation didn't work well.  If I dialed a number while connected, the call didn't automatically attach to the headphones.  I'd have to mess with poking the speaker icon and the BT icon on the phone dialer to eventually get it to connect (Samsung Note 9).  Same with receiving calls.  My other BT headsets just work.  Every time.
4.  Build quality seemed cheap.  Though I don't know how well they would hold up over the long haul.

I will say that they were a bit smaller and lighter than my Cowin, which could be good as long as they hold up.  The control placement and operation were the best of any BT headphone I've owned.

So why pay $300 for headphones that added distortion, tinny sound, and problematic BT integration?  I didn't.  I sent them back and will continue searching for a company that gets the ANC right, along with the other important bits.

author: Imad BOU JAOUDE
title: highly recommended
content:
excellent product
battery lasts forever
sounds perfectly

author: Randy P
title: Amost Perfect
content: If these had an inline volume control I would have given it 5 stars. Since it does not, I had to buy one separately. For the price I paid for the headphones, I think Sony could have put in an inline volume control. so - one star.

author: MBLAQ
title: Best headphones I've ever bought
content: This is my favorite item to pack when I go traveling. I use these all the time in airports and it genuinely blocks out every sound. I was in a busy Las Vegas terminal and I could not hear a single thing except the music I was listening to. Battery life is long. Cord length is exceptional. Very comfortable.

author: Acmelabz
title: Bose are better
content: I got these after I returned the Sennheiser PXC 550 Wireless. I like these much better. big difference is these actually have an app you can find. Bose has more physical switches, that is ok.

author: Robby Reed
title: Like listening to angels and wearing a cloud
content: This was an upgrade from the wired version for me and I am very please with the wireless range and battery life. Noise cancellation is superb, even in my busy office environment.

author: Someone_n_TX
title: Pink Bose - what else do you need to know?
content: I have been a Bose headphone fan for years - I have the silver and found the 2-bluetooth connection limiting for how I use my headset. It has been great to have a second pair in pink that I can dedicate to a specific device so I don't have to unlink bluetooth anymore. I love the pink - it's more of a rose pink color and love the white. This was a fun purchase and I'm glad I made it. :)

author: Matt Krass
title: They were fantastic when I got them, then the update broke them
content: When I first received these yesterday I was very impressed. They're very comfortable, and they sound excellent, and the noise cancelling was so good it was frankly unnerving. Then my phone prompted me to update them, and now I have the infamous 4.5.2 firmware (search the internet for QuietComfort 35 II firmware 4.5.2). Well, the noise cancelling is basically useless now, it's stuck on low, and now TV, cars, people talking all come through barely affected. I owned these for less than 24 hours and now they're useless, so I'll be sending them back. Bose is aware of this, there are several long threads on their forums, and they just insist there's no problem, they removed the ability to downgrade the firmware and they parrot the same repetitive generic "turn them off and back on" instructions that do nothing. Would not recommend these to anyone.

author: lm
title: Can't wear this model comfortably with glasses
content: The ear pieces are quite large on this model but they do not fit comfortably over glasses.  I didn't even try out the sound on these Bose but the noise cancellation worked very well right out of the box when I tried them on.  I only wish the ear pieces could accommodate my glasses.  I had to return them.

author: Bill
title: Bose is Bose
content:
Bose is Bose
So what to say
This is perfect for the music lover and also for techy people who are on conference call
They are costly but the quality is what’s its worth for

author: James Kwak
title: works well with Avantree Privia2 Bluetooth receiver connected to TV
content: occasional disruption, but smoothes out over a while, doesn't bother too much. could've saved 50 bucks on the black Friday sale, but still a good buy.

author: Martin Palomares
title: Great product.
content: Great product.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great headset
content: Loves these

author: Boris Fedorov
title: High Quality Headphones
content: As expected from Bose these are very high quality headphones and do an excellent job cancelling background noise. The accompanying app is also very clean and simple to use. The black version is very easy to scratch and I do wish the headphones were weatherproof so I could wear them in the rain.

author: Makeda Smith
title: Great Headphones
content: I don’t travel anywhere without these headphones. I love them! They stay charged, sound great, and I love the fact that you can use them wired or wireless.

author: Trevor
title: Glad I finally made the purchase!
content:
I work in a noisy office environment and went back and forth as to whether these would help and were worth the money. I also had to decide between the latest Sony and Bose models.
I finally made the decision to spend the money and to give Noise Cancelling technology a try. Based on all the reviews on Amazon I decided the Bose was a better choice. So far I am extremely happy; the battery life is awesome, the sound quality excellent and the noise cancelling abilities have really surprised me. I wish now I had purchased earlier. My only complaint - the ridiculously short charging cable that comes in the box! Come on, these are $350 headphones!

author: Minhaz
title: Amazingly comfortable and great noise canceling!
content:
First off, I have to say I really like these headphones. I had a much cheaper, but nice sound quality nonetheless, pair of headphones (XB50BT) that I used to use before. The Bose QuietComfort 35 is extremely comfortable and has very good noise canceling. There is an option to change the level of the of the noise canceling, and it really cool as you change it! But the sound quality, although it's very good, it's a little bit underwhelming. I expected better from headphones that cost $350. Also, it does have voice recognition with assistants like the google assistant and Alexa and a decent microphone.

Pros:
Great noise canceling
Low profile, is a nice size
Super comfortable
Nice bass
Pretty good microphone with voice recognition assistants

Cons:
Underwhelming sound quality for the price

author: Lawrence
title: Good Quality Headphones, abominable Manual and Support
content: It is astounding how well designed are the headphones, and how poorly designed are the accompanying in-box instructions and online manual.  A fifth grader could do a better job at explaining simple things, like what is in the box, how to access Alexa, how to insert the 3.5 audio cable.  All these things are written in a confusing, convoluted and/or incorrect manner.  Typical of engineers, who are unable to communicate what they know to the user.  Examples.  When you open the box, there is zero information about what's in it, not even the recommendation to find the user manual on line.  The audio cable has two dissimilar ends - they don't tell you that, and you can end up frustrated by trying to insert the wrong end. "Gear icon" is mentioned, without telling you what it looks like. The information about accessing Alexa is incomplete. It goes on and on.  And there is no support, no number to call, no place to send an email for help.  Users without the patience or tech experience will likely return these - not because of the quality, but because the Bose engineers don't know how to communicate what should be simple instructions.

author: C. brown
title: best ever
content:
this is best head phone I have ever owned.....  Light and very user friendly
you will love them.  it works flawlessly

I searched the internet and have seen various prices My only disappointment with the 35ii is that the audio jack is not the standard 3.5 mm (1/8 inch) style that we have known and loved for about 50 years. Instead, the phones have a 2.5 mm jack. I did not see this noted in any of the many reviews that I read---they all mention a standard audio connection. The phones come with a cable that plugs into the 2.5 mm jack and provides a standard 3.5 mm plug on the other end. But for the life of me I cannot even guess why a 3.5 mm wasn't used on the phones themselves so that any standard cable could be used. So if wired connection is important to you be advised that you may wantto buy an additional (more robust and longer) adapter cable, and I do see some on Amazon. Apparently the smaller jack is used on other headphones as well. But why? Makes no sense to me.

author: Kevin M.
title: Price is what you pay and quality is what you get!
content: These are hands down the best head phones I've ever owned and best value as well. I use them to mow the law on the zero turn lawn mower, work out with, and to occasionally block out the wife and kids. Unlike most things you buy, with the Bose headphones, you're getting more than just the name brand. You're getting quality that lasts, and that speaks volume! Pun intended.

author: Carlos Bel
title: Great wireless NC headphones! Bose is the best for NC.
content:
I have every QC generation that has been out there, and this one is top two due to the wireless feature.

Here’s a brief summary after a few months of use:

Pros:

- Wireless: living without cables is great! You don’t have to battling with tangled cables, or cables getting stuck around your things while you’re on an airplane.
- Battery life: I went back and forth between the US-Europe with one charge, so the 20ish hours is true and most of the times enough.
- Noise cancelling: the NC on this pair is good enough, most of the times work great and work at the level of corded QCs. Sometimes is useful to have the two levels option on, as you might want to use them in areas where you need to hear your surroundings. It works so good, that speaking over the phone might sound weird with no background noise.
- Firmware updates: Bose keeps posting updates for the firmware, so the performance and quality of connection improves over time.

Cons:

- Noise cancelling distortion: when I’m close to a window and the panels vibrate too much (landing), the NC causes a lot of white noise. Firmware updates have improved this, but it is still noticeable. So, if you like window seats, keep this in mind. In my opinion, the QC25 NC is the best from Bose.
- Cable needed: eventually, you will need a cable. Let’s face it, the airlines are slow to adopt and the backseat screens can only work with a cord... so make sure you don’t loose it or leave it behind! Also, Bose stopped putting the double plug adapter in this version, so if you’re flying in an older airplane you might be stock with mono sound.
- Charging cord: The case comes with its charging cable, a standard USB-micro USB cord. So if you have apple devices, you will need to carry it too.

I don’t use google assistant, but it works well with Siri. It just needs different command options.

author: Marty the Hun
title: Actually reduces external noise significantly
content: First time I have had noise cancelling headphones. I was impressed. BOSE sound quality is also perfect. The bass reproduction is very good. The noise cancelling has no effect on the sound quality.

author: IXO 🎧
title: Great noise-cancelling headphones!
content:
These are excellent. The best noise cancelling headphones available. I also checked out the Sony W1000x headphones and those are not bad, however the ear open is more like a U shape and they rest on your ear versus over/around your ear like the Bose. I also think the Bose has better noise cancelling, they are simply the industry experts on that.

The app also works very well and allows you to set the headphones up easily and even pair them to more than one device.

I'm an audiophile and while I don't use these as my main music headphones while at home as they are not quite audiophile quality, I do use them often for watching movies on my iPad and for movies, music, podcasts and YouTube while traveling, and I have no complaints. I also use them around the house when gardeners are using leaf blowers outside and they have really contributed to my relaxation. Perfect for commuting or plane flights too, really helps you not be so drained by so much noise.

author: mike ireland
title: it works
content: Wife wears them while in dialysis. Loves them

author: Maun Flanagan
title: Great except poor Bluetooth distance from sound source
content: Great comfort and sound , limited volume level on my i phone, very poor Bluetooth distance from source, only a few feet. Battery not 20 hrs as advertised less. Google assistant only marginally helpful at this time. I hope the app can be updated and improved enough to read mail and support more commands. Overall you are safe from not blowing your ears out with these on your I phone. Noise canceling is very good and can be turned off. Sounds good with a range of music types.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wireless Range / Comfort
content: People who think these are comfortable have never worn comfortable headphones.  I'm on them all day almost everyday and have to move them to keep them from pressing on my head.  Additionally, if you like to take calls on your device and walk very far away...literally more then 7-8 feet with no obstructions the audio starts crackling out and is not usable for you or the other person.  I generally wouldn't give 1 star for these issues but for the price these should not be issues, returning the product.

author: Jackie Church
title: Excellent sound.
content: Excellent sound. Blocks out all noise.  Charging cable and case included of good quality. We’re big fans

author: Ripper11
title: Great head phones
content: Fantastic for long flights, especially when you have a chatty person sitting next to you.  Drowns out the engine noise and ike that it is wired/wireless.

author: Ampersand
title: Life changing productivity tool.
content:
I never thought I would buy these. They always felt like a luxury item...but little did I know they would become the most important productivity tool in my work bag.

The Bluetooth connectivity is great—better than any Bluetooth headphones I’ve ever owned (which ranged from cheapies to B&O). Sound quality is crystal clear, the microphone is great. People tell me they’ve never heard me so clearly.  And on top of all that, they’re incredibly comfortable.

I spend a lot of my time on conference calls, on planes, or writing in noisy environments. These have been life changing in all three circumstances. The only negatives: the Bose app can be a little wonky, and for some reason, the Google Assistant app seems to add a second instance of the headphones to my phone, which interferes with answering the phone, using Siri, etc., but that doesn’t happen often.

author: Rebekah
title: Omits all the Airplane noise including crying adults
content: Beats BEATS by far!! Second pair.

author: Vivian Jones
title: Excellent option for wireless headphones and noise cancellation
content: In comparison to similarly sized Mpow headphones, these are a definite step up. The overall range for the sound quality is only moderately better, but the noise cancelling is significantly better. Access to Google Assistant is fine. It is a little slower than I would like, but response time is consistent and it is not a deal breaker if that is feature you will use often.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very happy with this product
content: Excellent product, excellent quality of noise canceling function, excellent sound doesn’t skip a beat of the clock as far as Bluetooth connection with my phone.

author: Hazyrooster
title: I like
content: Typical Bose sound, a little light on bass. Battery life is good

author: Johnnie
title: Bose is destroying the statuesque.
content: Very nice headphones! I'm still gonna get the Sony's but Bose is no joke. You can hear all discrete patterns of audio.

author: iMinnesotan
title: High quality expected from Bose
content:
I love these headphones! I especially appreciate the ability to pair with multiple bluetooth devices and swap between them by simply bouncing the power switch. It announces each device that it connects to by name.

I got these headphone to replace my Beats Solo wireless model 2 headphones that are utter garbage for noise cancellation and are now my at-work headphones. I am able to use an old pair of wired Bose QC 2s to mow the lawn but the Beats were terrible at blocking ambient noise and could not be used for lawn mowing. I expect the QC 35s to perform like my wired QC 2s in that respect but won't know until summer.

These Bose headphones are also far more comfortable to wear than the Beats Solo wireless 2s. The last time that I flew I noticed that I could wear the Bose for the entire flight but had to take off the over-ear Beats after about an hour to give my ears a rest.

Sound quality is great, although I cannot offer any technical review. Any noise canceling headphone alters the sound somewhat.

author: AllThatJazz
title: How much is peace worth?
content:
Other than being grossly overpriced, they are decent headphones. Highs are bla, midrange lifeless, bass not tight, that’s what you want for extended use or you will get fatigue.  I fall asleep wearing these no problem.

The electronics and app work without issue using iOS.

If the great noise cancelling is worth an extra $175, get these.

author: Traci Wallerstein
title: Husband loved it!
content: Gift for my husband. So good, now he can’t hear me when he has it on! Lol! Seriously, he has been enjoying it since February with no problems. He is very fussy about items like this.

author: Thomas Fenzel
title: None
content: No comment

author: Amazon Customer
title: They need to refund these
content: I bought these in November 2018 they no longer connect on blue tooth. Very disappointed was suppose to be very high quality for what you spend.

author: Christina
title: Husband officially can never hear me!
content:
Lets start this off with an eye-roll...

My husband loves stuff that is quality, so he of course wanted Bose. We purchased these so he could better pay attention on conference calls and travel without too much background noise. However, now he has learned that the headset is great for pretty much constant use all day long for music and constant entertainment.

So if you have a wife or significant other you want to successfully cancel out... these are the headset for you!

author: Brian H.
title: Works great
content: Item arrived as desc and works great. NC is superior to just about all others I've used, owned or tested.

author: Amazon Customer
title: calling all headphone junkies!!!
content: This is the most amazing headphones that i've used and i go back to the early 80's but yeah i'm an avid ocd-ish nutty headphone junkie. i listen to my bible online, i listen to radio shows wiith alternative media sources, i listen to my music, i record music, i mean music is my life. i have excellent hearing at 39 years of age. i love it partially because no more annoying cables! plus you don't have to use that adapter for an iphone 8 or X which hasn't a headphone jack. You can pause whatever is on your iphone playing or start it back up its steller. caveat however, thats latin for buyer beware uh my ipod classic does not at all sync with this so you'll need an ipod touch. other than that i love it. ordered two. plus charging is simple usb connection, it has like never gone below 60 percent of charge. get them they rule!

author: Charity Talbot
title: Not bad but not worth price
content: While I think the headphones are super comfy to wear (an issue I seem to have with most headphones), the noise cancellation is good and so is the sound, they keep disconnecting when I'm using them via Bluetooth despite the battery being at 70% . Giving the high price tag, I was really disappointed with the disconnecting which is why I gave it three stars. Had it not been for that issue, I would easily give them 5 stars.

author: Texas Tony
title: Expensive but worth it to me.
content: I have a very large yard to take care of so, my mowing time is lengthy. This product makes it seem more enjoyable. The noise of my mower is replaced with whatever I want to listen to, podcast, music etc. Bose is like anything of great quality = pricey.

author: Matt-N-Kristi
title: Wow!
content: I have wearing earphones, they tend to give me a headache. These are comfortable with great sound and do a good job of reducing background noise. I am much less distracted at work!

author: Rebecca
title: Perfect
content:
I'm not sure how I ever traveled on an airplane without these. All I heard was the sounds of my downloaded programs, not the screaming toddler, not my friend telling me that story I've heard 3 times already, not the flight attendant asking if I wanted more wine, just my programs.
Update: I got my wine

author: Matt
title: LOVE IT
content: Love it, sometimes I forget to put on music because they are so comfy and non-intrusive.

author: Robert
title: This was a waste of money
content: I have always heard about how great Bose products were but after breaking down and spending $350 for these headphones I am very disappointed. I bought these mainly because they are wireless but if you are more than 10 feet away from the source they start breaking up. If you are into music like me than you would be better off with a different brand these are just terrible compared to my wired headphones that only cost $150. The only good thing I have to say about these headphones is that the noise cancelling is great.

author: Warren Taylor
title: Best Noise Canceling Headphones!
content: Wow! What a great pair of headphones! They are incredibly comfortable and sound terrific. The headphones’ noise canceling ability is too notch, as I can hardly hear the plane’s engine when I fly. Also, the battery lasts an absurd amount of time. These are Bluetooth and wireless, and I seriously can’t get over how good my music sounds on these. I highly recommend these headphones!

author: Henry Beuving
title: Amazing sound and noise cancellation, slight headband problem
content:
Pros:
Strong and detailed bass, clear mids and crystalline highs. Great sound.

Active noise cancellation is very effective amazing for public transportation and school.

Very comfortable on the ears.

Long battery life, I've never had a problem with it running out before I get to a charger.

Bluetooth connects fast and stays paired reliably.

Cons:
Since, the clamping force is pretty light, there is a slightly annoying pressure on the top of your head. I wish the top headband was a little thicker.

ANC gave me a giant headache on the first two days, but it feels completely fine now that I'm used to it so I don't care.

The pros of these headphones dwarf the cons, so I'm giving them 5 stars. They were worth $299.

author: Michael Rush
title: Works with all products
content: Love the sound, the fit and the overall weight of the product.

title: Ambivalent feelings...
content:
I’m not totally satisfied with this product.

Cons: For almost $400 I was expecting that you can actually pair it with devices. Yeah, whenever it feels like it, it would pair with devices. Other times you can just spend an hour, trying everything to make it work, and it still doesn’t work. “Pairing Unsuccessful”. No hints, either.

Pros: When it actually works, it works very well. Great noise canceling, good sound quality. My co-worker who speaks super loud sounds like a talking mouse on the TV in the next room. It’s quite comfortable, but sometimes I feel pressure at the top of my head when it touches it.

author: zoharste
title: Great Headphones
content: I like the Noise-Cancelling feature and the sound is good.

author: Margaret Saunders
title: After 1 Year - Left Ear not working
content: When I originally bought this I would have given it 5 stars but just a little over a year the left headphone has stopped working...ugh ...answer by Bose Support buy another one...hmm not sure if I got a lemon or not but for the price this is crazy.

author: michelle lauer
title: Bass is fab!
content: Love the pure sounds

author: Christine Vaughen
title: Bluetooth does NOT work
content: This was such an expensive product to buy for it to not work properly. The bluetooth is awful, it is super jumpy and cuts our on all audiobooks and music listening. I'm very disappointed that I spent $300 on these and they DO NOT work. I've tried disconnecting my phone, then reconnecting. But that doesn't work. Don't buy these. Save your money and buy another brand.

author: Derek H
title: Exceeded my expectations
content: Exceeded my expectations, great headphones.

author: C
title: Purchased for noise cancelling; works as expected
content: I purchased this for noise cancelling and it works so far. I am a maths student and work sometimes require silence, so I put this one when working in the dorm where I shared with other students. It won’t cancel all the noise but to a level that it does not disturb as much.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great headphones but may cause nausea.
content: This is a great product but if you suffer any kind of motion sickness, then you may find yourself getting nauseous and maybe headache.  This was my case

author: Victoria
title: Issues connecting when battery at 60%.
content: My headphones wont connect to my phone when the batteries get to 60%.  Could be surroundings which are preventing it?

author: Luís
title: Simply great!
content: It over met my expectations!!

author: J S
title: A white noise type of sound cancellation
content: Relaxing for a quiet evening but does not completely drown out a screaming gremlin child at 40,000 feet.

author: Ronnie Tobet
title: Didn't love them
content: I really wanted to love these headphones after having the QC-15 for many years.  My wife bought the QC35II for my bday and I was excited to use them.  Of course,  being wireless was great and I enjoyed not being tethered to a wire any longer but I wasn't happy with the sound right off the bat.  I gave them a few weeks but it didn't change my mind, especially for new $350 headphones.  I ended up buying a wireless adapter for my QC-15's along with new earpads and I couldn't be happier.  The old pair sounds great, they're comfortable to wear and it only cost me $70.

author: Craig Crawford
title: Perfect for flying
content: I wear these mostly on airplanes. These work great to keep out the noise and listen to music or movies . . . and those crying youngsters. Makes flying more tolerable.🤫

author: Garrett James
title: The noise cancelling is absolutely fantastic on these headphones
content: I bought my Bose Q35 last month. I was very impressed with the case and quality of materials on the headphones. The noise cancelling is absolutely fantastic on these headphones! They tune out all noise on a loud bus with your music volume up 60%. Ergonomically speaking, the headphones fit to your head perfectly and are quite comfortable. The battery life is terrific 20 hours on a pair of headphones is great. The one thing I dislike about them is how it isn't comfortable to keep them around your neck. Other than that, they are perfect!

author: Shaunasev
title: Bose headphones
content: Most amazing headphones absolutely love them clarity is awesome and they are lightweight to boot!! ❤️❤️❤️❤️

author: Diego
title: Amazing
content: I fly often and I can't do it anymore without them. They sound great and are easy to pair and use, battery charge lasts for ever and charges fast. Highly recommend them. Yes, they are pricey but....

author: Gary Tasky
title: Quiet and comfortable
content: I've only had the Bose qc35 for 2 days.  It was very easy to sync with my iphone x. The controls are simple and easy to learn.  Charged up in no time (came at 50% powered).  COMFORTABLE.  Lightweight. I don't see a purpose for an iphone owner to use the Google Assist app - the middle button on the right gets you to Siri - meets my needs.  Phone calls - CLEAR.  Person on the other end had no complaint.  I saw some reviews that were negative on the phone calls. Not for me.  The noise cancellation is perfect - IF a truck was screeching down the street to hit me, I'd hear enough to get out of the way. I work in a very noisy part of town and walking around with the Bose on full noise cancellation was terrific.  Sound quality - Good, not the greatest ever but I think playing with the equalizer on my phone should help that along. All in all - 5 star.

author: Amanda
title: Absolutely amazing and worth the $$$$
content:
Ok, these are amazing! I can't hear a single thing when I turn these on. I was looking for headphones that canceled out noise in the background even when I wasn't listening to music (I'm a med student and need constant quiet while studying), and these work really well. Here are some details about the features:

Features: On the right headphone, there are 3 buttons aligned vertically, the volume-up button, the pause button, and the volume-down button. This is also where the On button is. On the left headphone, there is a button for Google Assistant, which I highly recommend. Just get the Bose app for headphones and the Google Assistant app and it'll help you through the set-up. You can even use them on multiple devices at the same time. I use it on my Mac, iPad, and iPhone. Just turn on Bluetooth for all your devices and turn on the headphones and it should connect automatically. Google Assistant is like Siri. These also allow you to speak into them as it has a mic, so if someone calls you are able to talk through these without picking up your phone.

Noice-Canceling Feature Only (No music): If someone in the background is cooking or cleaning I can't hear a thing with these turned on. With just the noise cancelation and no music, I can't hear the dishwasher or even certain levels of music playing in the background. I can hear conversation but really low which doesn't bother all that much. The noise canceling is really good.

Noice-Canceling Feature WITH Music/Video/Sound On: I can't hear a thing! People have to scream if they need to talk to me. Not only does it cancel out all noice in the background, you don't need to turn the volume up all the way and kill your ears in order to hear the sound playing. It's like being in a movie theater. The sound is outstanding and clear!

Overall great headphones that do the job right! I feel like I'm in my own world when studying, and even watching shows/movies.

author: Bob
title: Won't work with Skype for Business on Mac
content: I purchased this headset intending to use them in a cubicle environment in a effort to reduce background noise and talking. While it does well to filter out fans and the AC, it can't filter out or even reduce peoples voices. Worst of all it does not work with Skype for Business for Mac (macOS 10.14.5, Skype 16.26.19) during calls the mic volume would increase to the maximum, and even when turned down it would continue to do this. There is no option in SfB to turn this behavior off. Other headsets such as the Plantronics Voyager QC do not exhibit this behavior. Other than these issues they are a decent headset if not slightly overpriced.

author: Weather Boy
title: Their noise cancellation is better than that of the Sony MH1000XM2 -- the QCs ...
content: I purchased these with the idea that I might return them if they weren't worth the $$. Well, they're NOT going back. Their noise cancellation is better than that of the Sony MH1000XM2 -- the QCs have the good sense to not attempt cancellation of super-low frequencies that are heard in the Sonys almost like wind buffeting a microphone. The bass in the QCs is also just tighter (if a bit softer) than the Sonys. The Bose also get the multipoint right, allowing dual connections where the Sonys really only allow you to split a single connection. The controls on the Sony are nifty but can't compensate for their multipoint blundering. But the big reason that these headphones have gone from a luxury item to the indispensable is that they allow me to listen at lower volume. I don't have to crank up the volume to compete with surrounding noise... and that's going to be very good for my hearing in the long run.

author: Brenda R. Kittrell
title: Bose
content: Great product

author: George B
title: Defective audio jack. Headphones work with bluetooth only. $350 ripoff!!
content: The 2.5mm audio port does not make contact properly with the provided wire and I can't use these headphones with a wired connection.  I just discovered this when using the wired connection for the first time but just after the return period ended. It's very upsetting to spend this kind of money and get stuck with a defective product. I thought I was buying the best. Where is the quality control??

author: Amazon Customer
title: Perfect for studying
content: I originally used a pair of headphones meant for the shooting range whenever I studied. However, there would be situations where I would still be disrupted or distracted by conversation if it was loud enough; these headphones have been essential for proper studying ever since then. They’re comfortable, last a long time, and will only allow outside noise to distract your music if it’s ridiculously loud. I love these headphones, definitely worth the money. (and the google assistant is pretty convenient whenever you get notifications, which is a plus.)

author: Kyle
title: Great headphones
content:
Awesome headphones.  Works with Android and Apple even at the same time.  Switching between  which device is playing can be wonky

Sound and noise cancelling are great.  Very comfortable even with glasses.

Love the wired cord for airplanes and saving battery.  Sound still works if they're dead.

author: SoarinSoren
title: Five Stars
content: What a great headphone.

author: Ellfman
title: These are awesome for cutting out daily noise
content:
These are awesome for cutting out daily noise, like city traffic or dogs barking.

I noticed that I had difficulty pairing and connecting these with Windows 7 and 10, until I purchased an ASUS USB-BT400 Bluetooth adaptor.
The very moment I plug-in the adapter the headphones connect.
I think that the ASUS bluetooth adapter should come with the headphones since so many people give up on these headphones just because of the bluetooth issue.

Hope you all enjoy your pair as much as I do, because these things practically live on my head.
And these are perfect for meditation.

author: Gregory C. Brown
title: Excellent overall
content: I bought these to travel internationally. I used them while trekking in a remote area of Peru, and at about 12,000 feet, in my tent one night, there was a local party taking place due to the holidays, and I put these on and the very literally canceled the music! I was very impressed. I could just barely hear my friends in the tents next to me talking, but that was enough to put me to sleep. On the planes, it eliminates about 80% of the noise, and allowed me to sleep! I listened to some reggae, and the sounds was very literally remarkable! I would recommend these to anyone!

author: SCP
title: Bought 2nd Bose QC 35 Headphones, excellent sound
content: This is a 2nd Headphones. Now my wife and I both have the headphones. The sound is good, wears comfortably on the head. Battery Life is good.Pairs with other Bluetooth devices easily.

author: Chase Randall
title: I can wear these all day and night and remain comfortable
content: I can wear these all day and night and remain comfortable and you can get earcuff replacements for cheap so they last ages

author: Aryeh Wizman
title: Beyond my expectations so far
content: I’ve been wearing these for the last two hours and have never experienced music in this way I’m so impressed so far.

author: G. Appell
title: Great for airline travel
content: I listen to movies or music while travelling with no distracting jet noise,  The only downside is that you do not hear the flight attendant ask what you want to drink!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Get These!
content:
Don’t waste your time with Beats products, they will fall apart on you. Don’t waste your time with the expensive Bower and Wilkins or
B&O products as they aren’t as capable as the Bose headphones and are more expensive. The noise reduction and sound quality are the best part of these headphones.

author: Dez
title: Love these and can’t fly without them
content: I originally had the bose noise cancelling ear buds. I really liked them until my iPhone no longer had a headphone jack. I was hesitant about these because I had used an airline’s older version once and they gave me a headache from resting on my head for 7 hours. They were hot and uncomfortable. I have tried these on several 2-3 hour flights and I don’t have that same problem. They aren’t nearly as hot as the old version (sweaty) and while I notice it resting on my head, I don’t get a headache nor are they uncomfortable. I’ll report back after my next 8 hour flight at the end of this month.

author: Momma Duck
title: These cut out about 40% of the sound which I love. I had to disconnect the headphones from bluetooth ...
content: I have hyperacusis, a noise sensitivity.  These cut out about 40% of the sound which I love.  I had to disconnect the headphones from bluetooth and google assist because the headphones had a continuous voice reminding me to connect to them, which was making my noise sensitivity worse.  After that these are a great buy.  I also own Bose ear bud version of the noise cancellation devices.  I love them both and each have there place.  The ear buds hurt my ears if I wear them too much but are easier to wear when I am lying down or when I want to be less conspicuous.

author: Bob Stapleton
title: Should have done this long time ago!
content: I kept going through the cheap headphones from Amazon and was always disappointed, I finally just decided to spend the extra money and get the Bose ones and THESE ROCK!!! I should have done this a long time ago! Not disappointed now

author: Scarlett O'Hara
title: noise cancellation caused ear pain
content: I missed the return window by one day.  The bluetooth is fantastic, sound quality good, and these fit well on my ears.  I bought them for the sound cancellation, to replace a wired pair whose earpiece fell off.  The noise cancellation on these works to muffle the sound (not as well as on the wired ones), but it has left me with pain deep in my ears. The first time I used them I wasn't sure they were the cause, but this past weekend I knew.  The earpain does not go away.  I may have to see a doctor.  The solution, I guess, is to turn off the noise cancellation, which was the reason I bought them.  I also think it is ridiculous to have to download apps to get instructions, but I know there is a way to turn it off and still use the bluetooth feature.  I am not interested in Alexa.

author: Cameron
title: Planes, Trains, and Automobiles
content: if you spend a lot of time commuting and need to find that happy place that eliminates the sound of the crying baby three seats away from you, then this headphone is what you need. I have used it in a variety of travel scenarios and it shines in all of them. It is compact and fits easily into a small carry on bag. I have used it on planes, trains, and automobiles and it works great in all them. Although it does not necessarily eliminate all noise, it does move the annoying ones to the background which makes a huge difference. I had a new mom and her infant sit next to me on a plane and she immediately apologized for the crying that was sure to come. I showed her my Bose headphones and said not to worry these will take care of it. Now, I could still hear the little infant crying, BUT I just turned the volume up slightly and was able to take a nice nap. The mother remarked at the end of the flight how impressed she was that those headphones actually worked that well. The only complaint that I have is that I can not get the alarm on my iPhone to register in my headphone speaker. In other words, I can't hear my alarm through my headphone. However, it is not enough for me to lower my 5 star rating. I love them. If you want a headphone that is comfortable on your head for long periods and works great at cutting out noise, then get a Bose!

author: Black Birch Engineering, Inc.
title: You HAVE to use an app on your phone to ...
content:
You HAVE to use an app on your phone to set these up.  If you plan on using these with a PC they have issues with connectivity - requires the app on your phone to tell them to connect to your PC.  Once they are connected to your PC it's random if they play sound.  Mine connected to the PC twice - played choppy sound some of the time.  I spent a few hours trying to make them work.  Used Bose online support community and found this was a common issue.

If you plan to only use these with your phone they might be OK.

author: david j matthews
title: Completely satisfied
content: Been wanting these for years. Great sound.

author: Orion The Hunter
title: Best headphones ever!
content: After trying many cheaper alternatives, I decided to take the plunge and buy this. First, it's very expensive, but it's worth every penny. These are simply amazing on every level. I have a tinnitus disorder which makes my life a living hell. This does not cure it by any means, but it does help to focus the sound on what I want to hear. I hear absolutely nothing in the outside world while I have these on. The closest thing to silence and focused sound that I could ever hope for. If you have the money, definitely buy these! It will save you a lot of dollars and searching for a solution that works. I took the Amazon credit card offer and the price dropped by about $80. I buy a lot of stuff here, so the pay back is definitely worth it for me.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing sound quality
content: Amazing sound quality. I took a 14 hrs long flight from JFK To NEW Delhi, it made my flight very pleasant. No headaches after a long flight. I would highly recommend these headphones. Thanks

author: sam
title: Love this product
content: Love this product. Idk how I've been flying without this. It kills Alot of airplane noise, about 90 percent  deifnetly worth the price.

author: Boulderbon
title: Noticeable Audio/Video lag
content:
First off, they are comfortable, I can wear them for a good portion of the day, and not feel pressure on my head.

I have a loud work environment and between my old age/hearing loss and these headphones in noise cancelling mode (even without any sound playing) I can barely hear anything in my office.

I was a little surprised at how fragile they feel/appear. I guess I was expecting something sturdier feeling, but that would probably have been much heavier.

The biggest problem is that they have noticeable audio/video lag while in bluetooth mode. It's a shame that Bose sells a $350 set of bluetooth headphones without low latency bluetooth support. This makes these headphones pretty worthless for watching tv, or watching videos on your computer without a cord.

And that audio cord? It's proprietary, for no reason. It's just a tiny bit smaller than a standard 3.5mm audio cord. This means as soon as you lose that cord, you can't plugin these headphones to anything without buying a replacement. Oh, and Bose doesn't tell you what that special cable/connector is called. And you can see from Bose's Amazon store they don't sell those cables.

Pros: Comfortable
Noise Cancelling is great

Cons: Seemingly Fragile - time will tell
Audio/Video lag is noticeably bad
Special audio cord that is difficult to replace if lost

Overall I'm disappointed with this purchase. For $350 I thought I would end up with something that works well for watching videos on my computer.

author: alejandro arguelles
title: Expensive but the best
content: Sin dudas el mejor auricular con noise cancellation system simple the best, no doubt

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones
content: I'm not very "techie" so it's taking time to figure out how to use.

author: bbeckstead
title: Finally made the plunge and couldn't be happier!
content: I was on the fence about buying these due to the price but they are amazing and I am happy I did it. I use them everyday in the office and they help me remain focused on the tasks I am working on, while also being extremely comfortable. Other noise cancelling headphones (cheaper ones) gave me a a headache after an hour or two of wearing them but I can wear these for 9-10 hours and get so lost in my work that I don't even realize they are on! I am so happy I purchased them.

author: Ken Nguyen
title: Good wireless headphone
content: Good wireless headphone. Quality is good but not better than its predecessors, including the wired one (QC15). What I am really disappointed about this headphone is the battery life. This thing does not last more than 8 hours, why are you (BOSE) claiming that it last 22 hours on a single charge? Totally BS! I routinely get between 6-8 hours listening to music and talk. Listening to music alone would last about 7-8 hours. Definitely false advertisement.

author: Vernon L Berry
title: Worth Every Penny!!!!
content: I've wanted these for many years but could not justify the cost.  The performance is excellent!!!  And well worth the price.  When the product life ends, I will spring for whatever is the new hotness!!!!

author: LS
title: These are the the gold standard for noise cancelling headphones
content: I have been a Bose junkie for well over 10 years, and I got these to replace my very old QC15 wired noise cancelling headphones (which still work and my daughter now uses them).  I absolutely love these - superb noise cancelling technology and sound quality, excellent battery life, and perfect integration with my Google Assistant.  The price may be steep for some, but I have a long, noisy commute on public transit and these are worth every red cent.

author: Helipilot2
title: I love them. They work flawlessly
content: I love them. They work flawlessly. They are light enough to take them in a nice long run. The Noise canceling works very well.

author: drunkel
title: Best headphones ever!
content: Everything sounds amazing with this on. Noise cancellation is wonderful and I love the integration with Google assistant.

author: Jane Smith
title: Uncomfortable cushion
content:
The cushion on top of the headphones where they rest on the head is very minimal and after a day or two I felt a lot of pain. If the ear cups were more tight, the top of the head would not have to support the whole weight of the headphones and it might have been more comfortable. I could not wear these after a few days because of the pain that would last even when I wasn't wearing them anymore. The ear cushions were super roomy and comfortable, though.

No complaints in terms of sound/bluetooth/sound-cancellation. Really wanted to love them but was disappointed.

author: Edward L.
title: These head phones are the best, however
content: These head phones are the best, however, this item did not come with the airplane adapter. Very disappointed in this not being included. I purchased the series 1 at xmas as a gift and the adapter was included.

author: B. Loomis
title: Sound is just ok, but comfort and noise cancelling are excellent
content:
The sound quality on these are just not very good.  I compared them to several other headphones, including an 8 year old pair of cord-only bose triports, and the Plantronics backbeat 2 wireless noise cancelling headset, and these are the worst sounding headphones I own.  Almost no bass and they simply cannot handle some types of music.  But, the comfort and noise cancelling feature almost make up for the lack of sound quality.

Pros:
1. Comfort!  These are ultra-comfortable, pillow soft, around-the-ear bliss
2. Noise cancelling - best in the business.  2 levels of NC... much better than my Plantronics backbeat 2.
3. Phone voice call quality - these are excellent to use as a phone headset, even better than my Plantronics.

CONS:
1.  The bluetooth 4.1  distance is only 100 feet, 3x less distance than the Plantronics backbeat 2 which is 4.2
2.  Cannot control volume while cord is connected.  With the Plantronics backbeat 2, you can.
3.  2.5mm cord port vs standard 3.5 port... now I need to busy a special adapter to connect to long 3.5mm cord
3.  Price... these are very expensive for relatively bad sound quality

author: RAMESH GOPALAKRISHNAN
title: Beware of getting a used product
content: Ordered this product twice on Amazon. First time headphones were loose and did not cancel airplane noise properly. Second time it appeared to be used  - tied to pair to somebody else in Spanish could not pair properly to my devices.  Have had Bose products before and disappointed that I have had to return this twice

author: J and C
title: Bose knows comfort
content:
Used this for a flight to Japan. I bought the adapter to connect the headphones to the on-flight movie. The experience was great! This is the first time I didn’t have to blast the volume just to hear the dialogue.  I brought my iPhone earphones for comparison, which was like night and day.
The headphones were very comfortable and sounded great. When I wear these, I feel like I’m in my livingroom drinking a hot cup of coffee while relaxing to some classical music. The experience is very relaxing.

author: RaeAnn R Slaybaugh
title: Perfection for the introvert. :-)
content:
I bought these for my BF as a gift, but really? It was half for me.

I'm not an audiophile. What I *am* is an introvert who occasionally travels for work and gets completely lost in the right music with the right lyrics. I go on my first business trip tomorrow -- WITH my borrowed/gifted Bose headphones -- and it has cut the anxiety of travel by, like, 50%. It's not going to make the world go away for real, but it sure feels like it.

They're super smooshy, too, which is fantastic -- they cover the whole ear, and I'm sure you could sleep with them on on the plane, so you won't get that weird ear-edge pain. (I spent $50 on a pair of noise-cancelling headphones for myself, and they're a sad imitation of these. These aren't cheap -- to be sure -- but they're a quality-of-life investment.)

If you've got a playlist you love, and these headphones, and you've got to make your way through the world to get there, your trip is going to be so much better with these.

author: Kurt
title: these things are magic
content:
They really do work. The sound envelopes you. The world outside melts away.
The battery charge is long lasting. They bluetooth pair easily with an iPhone or iPad. A voice tells you the battery level and which device you are paired with each time you turn them on. The corded connection option is handy if you need to share a hard wired splitter connection with a friend. These are very comfortable over many hours but eventually they will get to you. Take them off and get some fresh air into those ears...

author: K8
title: These are great
content: My brother has a pair a Sony wh-1000xm2 so I got to compare them to the these. The Bose are much lighter and more comfortable to wear, it almost feels like your not wearing any headphones at all. For sound quality I think the Bose have a better range and better base. As for noise cancelling I think they are dead even, maybe leaning a little towards the Sony’s but the Bose are great I have no issues with them.

author: Robert
title: Useless, bluetooth skips playback
content: The bluetooth cuts out randomly with my brand new iphone XS. Why did I spend $350 on headphones that can’t play back a damn song without skipping? Don’t do it.

author: donna
title: Crisp clean sound
content: These are the bomb!  Great sound!!

author: Maria Bank
title: Wonderful works as described but don’t get if you want to answer calls with them!
content: Bought these for my husband for his birthday! He loves them! Until he found out from my daughter that the brand she bought can answer calls. Otherwise very much satisfied!

author: Rob HNL
title: Stellar product if the support is still there.
content:
I have used virtually every model of Bose NC headphones since Dr. Bose first invented the NC technology- everything from the original $1000 pilot headset with battery pack, to the in-ear version. Most of the time, like many others, I use the NC headphones inflight (“never board an air[liane without them”). Along with the other promising features, the QC35 SII promises 40 hours run time in wired mode. While I would not look forward to testing that claim on a marathon series of flights, that’s impressive. Bose technology is still the uncompromising best, unless you prefer distorted sound and superfluous controls.
The bells and whistles have been well covered by other reviewers and should prove useful over time for those who make the effort to master them.
After millions of miles of inflight use, I can vouch for the “comfort” aspect of the over the ear models. My only disappointment is that Bose no longer supports its very reasonable replacement program for QC ear cups on older or discontinued models. They do deteriorate over time and the otherwise functioning unit cannot be salvaged.
I also noticed that the permanently affixed line wires for the in-ear models are flimsy and eventually fail from wear, and cannot be replaced. When I took advantage of the “discount” Bose offered to upgrade to a new in-ear set, it shipped without case or accessories and appeared to be refurbished. Why not use a double-ended line plug as supplied with the new QC35, at least that can be replaced, and an extra set should be included on the site or offered as an accessory. They will get lost or worn over time. Let’s just hope that Boise policy and service will live up to the high standards of their technology and their past commitment to support. I’m giving them 5 stars on performance, in anticipation that at today’s prices, the service will still be there.

author: Amy
title: Love these with one exception
content: I love my bose headphones with one exception. The material around the ears tends to break and tear over time. The sound quality is great, the battery life is adequate, but the material around the headphones could be better.

author: Shawn
title: Can't go wrong with Bose
content: I was between this Bose and Sony wireless headphones and went with Bose for the all around sound quality and Alexa functionality. I sometimes feel like I should have gone with Sony which has more bass, but it doesn't have the Alexa functionality and you really can't go wrong with Bose quality.

author: Shaun McMahon
title: Over priced!
content: They are better fitting for a larger head than mine. They are almost too big. The sound is not as good as expected from Bose. My no name ear buds sound just as good.  I have not had noise reduction headphones before so I wasn’t sure what to expect. That does work well.  When flying the sound of the jet engines is all but gone.  They are definitely overpriced!!

author: myamana
title: So far so good!
content: Recently got these headphones because I have noisy neighbors and I'm honestly tired of hearing their annoying songs. Unfortunately I thought that the ANC would work with pretty much everything, but that's my own fault for not making proper research. The ANC does block out lower pitched noises very well, but it won't block voices/music from outside since it can't really convert the waves so fast and cancel them. Still, when there's music on, I can't hear anything at all. I was hoping I could use this for pure silence, without music, but I guess that's still impossible! Nonetheless, amazing fit, it's super comfortable. All earphones/headphones I had prior to this would start hurting my ear about 1 hour in. This one I could spend hours and hours wearing and it would still be comfortable. Very light as well. I'm hoping it keeps this way. It's very expensive not to last long lol!

author: Willis Wolf
title: Wireless
content: Seems to work well but will not be able to test fully until my next flight.  Like not having to deal with a wire. Hopefully it will stay charged for a long flight since it is rated for 20 hours with no charging.  Will update after some experience.

author: Jason
title: Not worth the money
content:
I have been owning these little more than a year and I constantly have pairing issues.
For the price, definitely not worth the money.

author: KillCreek
title: Five Stars
content: He cannot hear any outside noise when wearing these! THEY WORK.

author: NC Homeowner
title: Five Stars
content: These are awesome!  Highly recommend.

author: DEBBIE
title: Five Stars
content: Favorite!! Ordered some for my husband too!

author: Francine J Samuels
title: Five Stars
content: Perfect, great sound and keeps the outside noise out while I am listening to music or movies.

author: Aki
title: Great headphone
content: I wanted to get wireless waterproof earbuds for exercising but after going through and having to return several of those for various reasons, I decided to get the Bose QC 3511 headphones. Although I m unable to use it for my intended purpose, these are great headphones which live up to the hype.

author: Ryan
title: BEST TECH PURCHASE EVER!!
content:
Just for reference, I have already purchased a pair of Beats Solo and Studio. I experienced lots of discomfort with both of those pairs of headphones. I decided to splurge a little after reading review of these being best in class. Very very expensive, but definitely worth it. I could wear these for hours and hours and still be comfortable besides it getting a little hot, which comes with all over the ear headphones. Very good connectivity and keep multiple connections with different devices. The app allows you to do change the sensitivity of the noise cancelling as well. Perfect pair of headphones for any type of travel. My only gripe about these are that the cushions, although very comfortable do wear quite quickly. You can purchase a replacement set for $30 which can be user installed. Overall, I would highly recommend this product.

Update: After exactly 1 yr 2 months and 1 week, this happened to the cushions. Be conscious that if you are buying this for heavy use, multiple hours a day everyday, be aware its cushions tend to tear up. You can get new cushions for $30-$40, but this shouldn't be expected when paying $350+ on headphones.

author: D. Hunter
title: Something doesn't add up
content: These are simply better versions of the previous. My only complaint is that the Multi-function button  instructs me to use the Action button on the left headset to use the google assistant... I don't get the point of that.

author: jacob a
title: Best headphones ever.
content: I use these to lounge around and hear my music, out of all the head sets I've owned these are far and away the best. The sound is impeccable.

author: Jonah
title: Great headphones
content: Great headphones. The battery life is amazing, they look good, and I can wear them as long as I want without it bothering me. I don’t use the noise cancellation as much as I thought I would though. Noise cancellation bothers me after too long. But you get what you pay for with these. The price is the only reason I took a star off because normally I wouldn’t pay this much. I’d say if you don’t mind the price, you can’t go wrong with these.

author: Ellen Einsohn
title: The sound is amazing. The noise attenuation is awesome and the battery ...
content: The sound is amazing. The noise attenuation is awesome and the battery life is very good so far. Highly recommend these headphones.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good product with personal deal breakers
content:
First off, the set I got seemed like it may have been a used returned pair or something because the case was scuffed and the headphones themselves had a couple of small scratches and dings on it. I don't hold it against the product but I did end up returning them because of that and because they had a few annoyances about them.

I am not very discerning when it comes to audio fidelity so for me they sounded great. The noise cancelling worked well. Tho build was nice. They folded to be quite compact. I really like the design and they seemed very durable. The hardware power switch is SUCH a nice touch as well. That can not be overstated for me. Using other Bluetooth devices, this is such a convenient feature. Also they charged really quickly.

That said, a few problems that made these not really work for me was that if you did by accident leave the power switch on, the headphones would use power and die eventually. This happened to me and it was a bummer. Might be something I could get used to but it would be nice if there was a feature to avoid this.

Next, I might just have a big head/neck but these felt very tight when the headphones were lowered around my neck. It felt like a slight choke from the earphone modules. In addition to that, the earphones flipped outward when worn around the neck. This is inconvenient because it shoots the sound out if you need to put them down to talk to someone, and the larger part of the earphone is closer to the neck making it feel tighter. Also it feels less comfortable with the earphone pads facing out instead of on your chest.

author: dls74447
title: Can't say enough nice about these!
content:
DREAM headphones for me. Got the beautiful silver which I love.
I ordered at least 4 or 5 other brands. Either didn't fit my-I guess short female head. Or they quit working within a week. Came not working, or the sound was pitiful.
The ear pads feel great. Soft & just perfect around my ear.
Controls are very intuitive compared to the other brands. I love the on/off/pair on the upper side of the right ear piece. I have short arms & older fingers. Searching & searching for the up/down or on/off "under" the ear piece was awful for me. the volume is under the right ear piece but it''s all your fingers are looking for there. Once I set the sound on a movie for example I rarely need to change the volume with these headphones.
I like the the noise canceling button on the left is all you need to deal with too.
The noise canceling with Bose AR is the best I could have asked for. Battery lasts a long "binging" time.
Bluetooth is easy to set up & reconnects almost immediately. If needed to turn off push right side button to right & you are in business again.
Worth the money in every respect. I wasted time & money trying not to spend this much money. Retired-limited funds. Oh my Gosh how happy I am I just pushed order on these headphones & ignored the $299 this time.
I hate to have even one negative because it is only really my problem. That is the mute ability.
For me I can't do it. I really miss muting quickly. The option is there the directions say. I accomplished it one time. But maybe due to my awkward old fingers & position of the muting button in between the off & on volume I have just given up trying to mute all together. I just take the head phones off my head to not hear some things because I love all else about these headphones so much. I pray next model will have a completely separate, easy to do, mute button added away from the volume buttons. Something Quick. Such as right "under" the right on/off/pair button. Not beside to confuse my fingers. Or better on the left outside ear piece in same place the on/off/pair button is on the right earpiece. Away from NC button.
My son is particular with his headphones. Has several for different purposes & work. He liked these so much he decided one of his were not working right, ha, ha. He bought the next up $399 model immediately. He could not be happier. Both sound extremely clear. Oh my gosh!  I like the less bass & more inclined to treble of mine. Helps me hear better.
I can only connect to two devices at a time. We noticed he can connect to 3 or 4. (sorry not sure but at least 3).
If you can be in love with a pair of headphones I AM THERE! JUST DO IT.

author: Terri
title: Just want to say these are fantastic! Definitely Bose quality & clarity
content: Just want to say these are fantastic! Definitely Bose quality & clarity. They are also comfortable & light weight. I have worn them for several hours & still were comfortable.

author: Obrija
title: A+
content: Just as advertised. Great.

author: Jenn
title: Best on the market, hands down
content: Superior noise cancelling headphones. Very comfortable. And the included case for protection is great!

author: Rich D.
title: Just what I was looking for.
content: What I love about this product is the clarity of the sound and the richness of the base. I can ask Alexa to play my playlist Without my phone or iPad. It can connect up to two devices and you can share your music with another person. It paired immediately with my devices. Still learning the function buttons but I am so impressed.

author: C. L. Nicholls
title: Blows Beats out of the water!
content: The perfect set of headphones. Amazing materials and playability. Outstanding sound easy to link up to 10 devices through Bluetooth. Fantastic. Would highly recommend

author: Ron
title: Bose Headphones QC 35
content: I stay up late and my neighbors aren't too pleased with my music. Decided to get these headphones. WOW ! Rock and roll ! I can crank it now ! Never had wireless before but these are A+. Very convenient/lightweight. Save up and buy these. Won't be sorry !

author: dallas alderman
title: Bose headphones are the best
content: The best headphones I own

author: fanoftheliving
title: It's like someone sucked the noise out of your head
content:
I really like these.  Expensive but definitely worth it.  Blue tooth quality is great, wired not as good.  doesn't matter, if you need to go somewhere and want to reduce the outside noise while having a meeting or listening to music you can't go wrong.  Sure, I have a pair of sure headphones that sound better at $900, but they don't shut the world out like these do.  It's sort of uncanny. it's like someone sucked the sound out of your head.  Buy
em, you know you want to.

author: DeeTee
title: Top Quality
content: Bought these as a birthday gift to my husband. We both already had Bose headphones, but the rubber around the ears was finally wearing out. (Sweated through them one too many times mowing the yard). Now that he doesn't have to do any yard work, I'm hoping these very pricey headphones will last...forever! (wishful). Seriously, he does love them and they truly are sound cancelling. He loves that they are wireless, and the charge has lasted for weeks, but admittedly he does not use them everyday. RECOMMEND if you can afford them.

author: Matthew
title: Great investment for studying
content: These are expensive, and audiophiles complain you can get better performance from brands like Sennheiser, but I’ve never tried those. For me, these Bose are great. I use these exclusively for studying, so noise cancelling is really important. A lot of times I wear them without playing audio to improve my focus. I’ve had these for only a month or so and have probably used them for 60ish hours, so a high price could be deemed a practical investment if you’re using them for work.

author: Kristen King
title: They don’t really cancel noise....
content:
I’m not sure if I was expecting too much from these. For the price though I thought they would be better. The sound quality is great... the color is really nice. But I don’t understand why they are called noise cancellation. In fact some noises are amplified. For example, on the plane, the noise of the plane engine was slightly reduced while the noise of the kid next to me talking nonstop to her mom was enhanced. I was hoping I could turn on noise cancellation without any music so I could take a nap but to do that I still had to use foam ear plugs as well or I had to use my white noise app which kind of defeats the purpose.
That complaint aside, the sound is really nice for watching movies or zoning out while listening to music. The battery lasts forever. I went on a three week trip and only charged them once before hopping on the plane back home.

author: J. M. Anderson
title: Comfort and sound
content: Bose I Love Bose almost pulled the trigger on Sony mx3 but it was missing some features that Bose is offers. Very happy with the holiday savings.

author: Bre C
title: Bluetooth quit working after 3 months
content: Bought in June and have been happy with it since then. I use them daily both at work and at the gym. They are comfortable, effectively cancel out noise, and have great sound quality. However, when I turned the device on today, it would not pair with my phone. Tried everything from turning the headphones off, turning my phone off, disconnecting the device from my phone, etc. Nothing is working. Now I can’t use them unless physically connected to my device since apparently I am now experiencing the Bluetooth issues others have identified. Super frustrating!!!

author: theone
title: Worth the money
content: Fabulous! Love having control of noise cancelling, great sound quality, set up is dead simple, connects to multiple devices. Easy to switch between music and receiving incoming call. Functions way beyond cheaper wireless headphones.

author: Fircrestshooter
title: Incredible Sound!!
content: I can’t write anything that hasn’t already been said. These are excellent headphones. Expensive but worth every penny.

author: nevermind
title: Ok product
content:
For the price I would’ve expected better than that honestly . It excelled in noise cancellation, but other than that.  I would say average at its very best . Sound quality might be for classical music or for audiobooks , it’s too bright ! If ur looking for listening to hip hop , rock , metal etc... search for other brands ! Bass is really mediocre ...
if you’re looking to use these at the gym , make sure they won’t hold like u expect ! They are very slippery ...
another thing I need to mention is the built in quality : for this amount of $$$ i would’ve expected stronger and better quality ...
overall , it’s an ok product . I didn’t find anything interesting other than great noise cancellation and battery life ... maybe for audiobook lovers intellects it will do the job ... but for me it’s a no no !!! Sorry Bose

author: Amazon Customer
title: ose QuietComfort 35 Wireless Headphones II
content: Wore these on my flight to Vegas, and all I can say is wow!  These headphones cancelled out the engines, people and all the noise of the airports I went through.  They do tend to put a little pressure on your ear however, I highly recommend picking up a pair.  Great sounds, light weight combined with noise cancelling make these a travelers must.

author: Greg Bond
title: Another great Bose product
content: Never had a bad Bose product.  Have these and Bose wireless noise canceling earbuds for exercise and both delive on SoundCloud quality, comfort, and battery life

author: D.Ayotte
title: Very comfortable and easy to use
content:
I bought these and the latest similar product from Sony.  The Bose are a bit more comfortable and better for all day use in my opinion.  I do like the physical buttons and they are easy to feel and use.  Connecting to multiple devices is a nice bonus.

I wish the app had an equaliser in it like the Sony, but they do sound very good.  Nice rich full sound, something that prior versions of wireless headphones lacked.

I am very happy with these.  And the batter life is great. I have not used them for phone calls, I have a wired headset for that.

author: AndyS
title: perfect, as expected
content: meeting expectation of perfect

author: Izak Hickcox
title: Very Good Headphones, but materials could be sturdier
content:
