I bought these mostly for gaming (FPSes like Rainbow Six Siege, etc.) They sound great and the noise cancelling makes a major difference for determining where a sound is coming from, though after a while it might be uncomfortable from the counter signal (hardly notable if your volume isn't too high).

The major, and really only, complaint I have about them is that the ear cushions deteriorate after a while. It does take a bit... for me it was about a week ago from when I bought them... which was probably around a year ago. You can buy replacement cushions which are not nearly as expensive as the headphones in their entirety, but it is an unfortunate "maintenance" cost you'll have to look forward to with most Bose Headphones.

A my rating suggests, I would recommend these to someone looking for good noise-cancelling headphones, but I think it's important that people know that theirs a 35-45 dollar ear cushion renewal fee for their long-term use.

author: ABDULKHALEQ AYDIN
title: Comfortable for wearing but bad Noise Cancellation!!!
content:
This device is extremely comfortable and has a good sound quality but the only problem is the NOISE CANCELLATION is not good at all!!!
Imagen when I put the noise cancellation option to hight level I still hears everything around me .!!
I bought this headphone to use it for studying or reading books because there is a lot of noise around me and I want to relax from all those noises.

author: krzysamm
title: Just what I was looking for
content: Well worth the cost. I have tried several different types of noise cancelling headphones Sony, Skull Candy and Dr Beats and by far these have provided the best of what I was looking for. They are light weight and cover my ear. It was easy to connect not only to my kindle reader but to my I phone and I pad as well. They fold up nicely into the provided carrying case for when they are not in use. I have no issue recommending these to family and friends.

author: Terence90
title: The fit and sound are great. Way better than the Dennon headphones I purchased ...
content: The fit and sound are great. Way better than the Dennon headphones I purchased last year. Those actually fell a apart.

author: Alex
title: It depends on what you’re looking for
content: So let me just start by saying I love music and have used many different headphones: Sony, Senheiser, Beats and Rocketfish just to name a few. For me at least, there are two things you need to look at when buying headphones: sound quality and noise cancellation. If you’re looking for noise cancellation and that’s the number one thing you want, then look no further. Bose is hands down THE leader in that category and these headphones are amazing at it. However, if sound quality is more up your alley, these are not for you. Sound quality wise, these are average at best, and that seems to be the trend with Bose headphones. If you want sound quality I personally would recommend Sony, very affordable and also excellent sound quality. That being said, there is nothing wrong with these headphones and they are hands down the best in the market at noise cancelling.

author: Big dog 22
title: Headphone
content: Bose makes the best

author: Dabs
title: I always hated having to crank the volume to 11 on airplanes ...
content: The noise canceling feature on these headphones is out of this world. I always hated having to crank the volume to 11 on airplanes to still have my music drowned out by the hum of the plane. With these bad boys on I can listen to something at a comfortable volume, and not hear a thing outside of them. Battery life was also surprisingly good. Pricy for sure, but well worth the investment if you travel a lot, and will utilize the noise canceling.

author: Tigerose
title: Great Noise cancelling Headphones
content: Bought these for my nephew who lives in a very noisy apartment building. He is very pleased with them, he doesn't here the neighbors now while trying to study.

author: Saud
title: Brilliant!
content:
Love it! I like that it switches between my devices without the need to click anything.
When I'm working on my computer and listening and want to play something on my mobile phone I just playing that on my phone and the Bluetooth is switching magically!
That's brilliant.

author: Josh Jones
title: Money well spent
content: I love these headphones my only wish was that they had a way to easily turn on the external mic like the Sony’s do, When you’re on a plane or in another situation when you need to hear what someone is saying it would be nice to have an easy way to hear them instead of just taking off the headphones. But I love these headphones.

author: Tommykai
title: Very nice headphone
content: I like it. sound is good with high fidelilty. But I feel a little bit uncomfortable if keeping using for hours.

author: Greg Altringer
title: Not the premium product I thought I was buying.
content: Good headphones that are very comfortable. The pairing process is easy. The battery lasts forever. The main issue is that I continue to have is a frequent sound distortion that sounds similar to what blown speakers sound like. This is a connection or software issue. It goes away if I shut down my phone and headphones and then reconnect.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent Device
content: Love this headset. Use it all the time while flying. Great noise cancelling. Sound is super.

author: VA Carrie
title: No audio in the left ear after 18 months
content:
Great sound, excellent at eliminating surrounding noises. Perfect for airplanes and travel

Not reliable!  I use the headphones for traveling, and they are great.  But the headphones lasted 18 months only.

author: Amy
title: Great for noise cancellation!
content: My husband (who’s a major technology guy) LOVES these headphones!

author: Guido
title: Amazing
content: best headphones ever.  From the google voice assistant feature, to the wireless capacity, to the crystal clear phone calls even when doing work in a loud coffee shop.  Would highly recommend.

author: Rae
title: Love them -- definitely worth the money!
content: Love these so much!  I really researched and read many, many reviews on different noise cancelling headphones and decided to go with these.  Even though they were more expensive, I didn't want to spend less and hate them.  I'm so glad I did.  They are everything I was looking for.  They are very comfortable (even with glasses/sunglasses), love that they sync to my phone, sound is great (even with wireless), battery charge lasts a long time (as long as you remember to turn them off if you have to take them off & set them down), and the biggie is that the noise cancellation works like a dream!  I use them mostly at work where I can concentrate.  If you don't have music on you can hear muffled voices, but other sounds are damped down.  With music on I don't hear much of anything around me.  Definitely worth the money!

author: Brian with a Y
title: Very expensive, but very well-built
content: I just got these for my 5th flight to China in the last year. I wish I would have bought them for the first one. 14 hours of comfort and sanity that I otherwise haven't found. Even with no audio, the noise-cancelling is amazing. This is a fantastic tool for frequent travelers.

author: Alan G. Crump
title: The best
content: Great headphones.

author: Francis Gonzales
title: Was great in the first 2 days.....
content: I really enjoyed the qc25 but the qc35ii had bluetooth issues with my galaxy s9+, randomly disconnects and a very loud static sound blast my ear when it finds a wifi connection.  I was very disappointed and I even downloaded the firmware update deleted and re added and re download the bose app nothing was fixing my issues hope they make the qc45 soon.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great headphones
content: Purchased these for husbands birthday in Jan and the little stinker found out and of course I gave them to him early, basically for xmas. He loves them ! I tried them too and wow these are pretty fantastic. Glad I did it .... now let's hope I get a pair for Birthday in Jan😉 Great price too!

author: Future Dietitian
title: Say what?!?
content: The music quality is amazing and clear! Noise canceling works good and helps elimates most background noise. Makes commuting on BART more enjoyable

author: B. Zenith
title: Best, but 1 negative
content:
I've had my for I think 10 years, then just bought this for my son who's 18.  Why anyone would choose 'Beats' is beyond me.  ok... maybe cooler colors that match your shoes with the Beats, but for noise reduction on a plane, playing music these are the best on the market.
My only complaint is the 'leather' on the ear pieces do wear out.  easy to replace but for this price they could use something of better quality.  It's for that I give them 4 stars.  I can't confirm if this was fixed for this version, but in 10 years on my last pair I've replaced them twice.  I think about $15 to replace is all.

author: SM Gondal
title: Great Quality Product
content: Absolutely love the precision and effectiveness of the noise cancellation on this product. I debated for years with myself before purchasing this product. Recently I've really developed a need for noise cancellation and this product delivers on that. The sound quality is also great. I highly recommend.

author: Baby Bee
title: I am very happy
content:
Just amazing quality. I am very happy with headphones. As long as I can drown out the annoying co-workers, people on public transportation I am happy.  You really do feel like your in your own world.

I ordered skins for my headphones to pump them out.

I am very happy with the purchase.

author: Mimi K.
title: Almost Perfection
content: These are exceptional quality headphones, which I fully expected from Bose, but I did purchase them for their noise cancellation feature.  On this one feature, they fall short.  I am using them at my workplace, which is noisy and where the acoustics are so bad, we can hear each other breathing.  I needed help to cancel all of the conversations around me but alas, these are not 'voice' cancelling.  Voices come through clearly but at a lower decibel.  I would have returned them but the quality of the sound of the music coming through the headphones was breathtakingly beautiful.  So I kept them.

author: ezplayer
title: Wow
content: I've spent so much money on headphones, trying to buy the right for me, my intention was never to spend more than $100 bucks for headphones but I've decided to invest on these and yeah, it's way more than $100 but let me tell ya, they're worth it, I just went to Mexico for vacation and these headphones helped me so much on the plane, they canceled I would say, 85 to 90% of the noise on the plane while listening to music, I mostly use them for the gym but you can take them anywhere with you, I would totally recommend.

author: Robert McGill
title: I’ve been a “Beats” headphone man for years, my ...
content: I’ve been a “Beats” headphone man for years, my colleague allowed me to listen to their Bose headsets (series I’s). I conducted some research by comparing Bests Solo 3’s to Bose Quite Comfort 35’s. I was blown away by the sound clarity. Plus, Bose has the Google Assist button. This allows you to have text messages read to you and then reconnect you back to your music, receive phone calls without touching the phone, and reconnects you back to your music.

author: Matt
title: Amazing noise cancellation but issues with multiple bluetooth connections
content: Great product but has trouble playing music when laptop is in hibernation and phone is connected since it doesn't disconnect from the laptop so you have to manually disconnect the laptop bluetooth

author: Will Dunn
title: Best sounding headphones!
content: WOW WOW WOW!!! I never realized how much I have been compromising my listening experience until I purchased these Bose headphones. Very rich and clean sounds! The Bose connect app makes a great companion in operating the controls and adding the Google Assistant adds to the enjoyment and convenience of accessing information. The noise canceling feature actually works very well for me. The noise canceling feature doesn’t noticeably detract or diminish the sound quality in anyway in my experience with these headphones.

author: Kubidemon
title: Supremely comfortable. Middling sound quality
content:
I purchased the QC35s2 headphones at the Black Friday special pricing. I own a pair of the now frayed QC15 model. These are absolutely the most comfortable headphones bar none, and the storage box is extremely functional as well.

I do travel quite a bit but am still not a fan of ANC. The QC35 noise cancelling is good, not great. After 2 weeks with the set, I returned them to Amazon. Two main reasons: below average sound quality that made me say “meh” over and over again regardless of music genre. The microphone quality during phone calls was adequate at best.

I have since purchased the B&W P7 wireless as I was looking for better sound quality with acceptable tradeoffs on portability and comfort. I could not be happier.

author: David Horsley
title: Great build quality with lots of nice touches
content:
These really make you appreciate the difference.

I've had noise canceling in a similar price bracket that have nothing on these. I bought them just for travelling but have found I wear them everywhere. The sound quality is good, the noise canceling is amazing. Everyone I call says the mic sounds really good, and the foldback is fantastic addition. Battery life is really good, in fact surprisingly so. The Google assistant shortcut is handy and the app works well. Syncing works well.

I really have no complaints.

author: Longhorn
title: The very best!
content: The very best but I expect nothing less from Bose.  My third pair in 20 years.  I wore out pair #1 and they were so old the factory could not repair them.  I still use pair #2 (wireless earbuds).  These new one's are the best of all.  Incredible sound, effective background sound cancellation, very comfortable, easy to pair, quick charging, nice carrying case, charging cable could be a little longer, does not include charger (but hey - most people have a dozen of these things laying around by now anyway).  Not cheap but the best usually isn't.

author: Robert E. Ridgeway
title: Amazing noise-cancelling capability
content: I like that these are compact enough in their carrying case to fit in a briefcase.  I use them on my daily train commute to and from work.  The noise-cancelling feature is superb and most welcome.  The sound quality is excellent and the battery life is more than sufficient.  I am completely satisfied with the purchase.

author: LGFitness
title: ATTENTION SMULE SINGERS! REALLY, BOSE???
content:
The Bose QC35 II is by far the best pair of headphones I’ve owned...and I have used quite a few...

I haven’t owned this long enough to give feedback on battery and interaction w/my Echo Show (Alexa) but I’m hoping those will be good experience.

I’m here mostly for those who are considering investing in these great headphones for the purpose of singing in Smule (the Sing app).

First of all, I think it’s pretty ridiculous that Bose would include an audio cable/wire without including a MIC audio wire!  But since it’s not a big deal and no big investment, this is resolved by purchasing a 3.5mm wire w/mic, right? WRONG!
To make matters a bit more frustrating for consumers such as myself, not only Bose made the female input jack in these headphones smaller than 3.5mm but they also make no mention of it in the owner’s manual.  To say such thing is super lame on Bose’s part is gross understatement!

So...if you are indeed thinking of buying these to use with Smule app, you’ll need to invest in good audio wire with microphone (I invested in Beats mic wire...can be found at Walmart for $20) and had to purchase a 3.5mm female converter with a 2.5mm male plug in order to connect the Beats mic wire to my new QC35 II.  Now, what was BOSE thinking?  After all, they know about Smule and how the worldwide popular singing app has and is creating plenty market for the audio equipment industry...and Bose didn’t impress me when it comes to making it rather inconvenient to use these Bluetooth headphones work w/wired mics.

And no, I haven’t found any headphones with wired mics that supersede the sound quality that my Bose QC35 II headphones render.  So it’s something for Bose to improve...and their marketing folks ought to know better than omit important info from consumers.  While Bluetooth option is an awesome thing, there remains certain online activities that require wired mics...Smule being one...and trust me, I’ve tried using “state of the art” expensive audio equipment to sing in Smule and even the most advanced of audio equipments (such hand held microphones; stand mics (Yeti), mic filters, digital headphones, etc, etc) render poor audio result compared to using wired mics with a good set of headphones.  As far as Smule sing app goes, even cheap earbuds do far better (because it has wired mics!) than expensive audio equipment without wired mic!

So either Bose “forgot” that some of us need wired mics w/a 3.5mm male plug, and by the way, that’s SUPER USEFUL for when battery time is shorter than the consumer intends to use these headphones for, or Bose purposely made these nice headphones w/a 2.5mm female input to make us go out and spend more money just to plug into their nice Bluetooth headphones??

Whatever the reason, I expected a LOT BETTER from BOSE, especially while paying almost $400 (that price includes extra service protection warranty) for A PAIR OF HEADPHONES that don’t even come with a wired mic and HAVE NO input to connect a 3.5mm audio cable to the headphones! I feel that there’s always some type of sound quality loss when we have to use adaptor connectors so I truly don’t understand why Bose chose to make the QC35 II with a 2.5mm female input in the headset while providing a cable that has no mic in it!  Yes, some use these just to listen to music, videos, news, etc.  But what if I’m listening to something in my device while wearing these and using the audio wire and my mother or a friend calls me via FaceTime or Facebook messenger or whatever else?  I can easily accept the video call but must unplug the headphones, which usually causes an audio problem in the video conference app, because it doesn’t transfer audio, once the audio device first used is disconnected. Something Bose seems to have completely disregarded.  Obviously, the focus in these is the Bluetooth capabilities.  But I ask Bose this question: why would I buy a wired pair of Bose headphones that cost not a lot less than these while getting less quality sound?  So if these work with audio cable, which it does, why not include an audio cable with a mic???  Charge the extra $20 or so dollars for goodness sake but it’s pretty sad to make such great quality headphones without sending it with a wired mic while knowing that the microphones in our devices don’t handle all recordings and are not designed to work well with singing apps!  Headphones aren’t just for listening!  What do professional singers wear when recording their songs inside a studio?? HEADPHONES!  Is it important for them to hear their own voices through the headphones they wear? You bet!  This is why those headphones are well connected with whatever microphones professional singers and studios use.  The same is true for ordinary, amateur singers such as myself.  But unlike pro singers, all we ordinary singers need is a wired mic that connects directly to the fancy expensive Bose headphones we invest on!

It’s a BOSE so yes, they are awesome headphones.  But needless to say I’m rather disappointed.  I can’t use these until the extra pieces arrive and worse than that, I had to find out the hard way!  Nothing in the specs here or even in the Bose website or in the owner’s manual shows that these headphones have a 2.5mm female input to the audio cable.  I feel a wired mic w/the appropriate size plug should be something to expect in a pair of headphones that cost $350!!!! Most of all, I feel that any type of electronic should come with pictures of it indicating the physical parts inside and outside of it.

Bose mentions that they include the 3.5mm audio cable.  Unfortunately, they make NO mention that the end of the audio cable which plugs into the headphones is actually size 2.5mm!

REALLY, BOSE??  A $20 mic wire with the correct size male plug to fit into the headset unconventional female input size would’ve saved a lot of frustration here...not to count given you a perfect “5 stars” score...

author: Francesco Georg
title: Bluetooth is terrible and audio skips
content:
The bluetooth is an absolute nightmare.
If you have multiple devices connected, like an iphone and a Mac, you have to physically disconnect one (and make sure it doesn’t reconnect automatically) or you can’t hear audio from the other.

When I’m playing audio from my mac, it  frequently skips and I have to turn the headphones off and on to fix it. It’ll randomly go into “robot mode” where all sound is crackly (fixed by turning it off and on again)

I returned my headphones thinking it might have been faulty hardware, but my next pair was just as bad if not worse.

I *strongly* suggest you get the wired QC25s instead. I had those for 3 years and after they broke “upgraded” to these

author: Ricardo Epps
title: Noise cancellation is key, solid sound performance, and comfortable to wear!
content:
If you live in an apartment with noisy neighbors, the noise cancellation feature on this is a godsend. For example, over the last four months, when the gardener revs his lawn mower motor or the parents next door scream at their toddler-aged children, I've put these on and the noise is reduced by 80%.

The sound quality is 2x better than Apple EarPods. If you're looking for the absolute best sound on the planet, this is probably not it. That being said, it does produce a sound that can vaguely be described as robust with bass performing very well on a sound quality test and treble not far behind. So, unless you're a sound engineer or hardcore enthusiast, I think sound quality is as good as you would need.

The headset is comfortable to wear— even 4+ hours at a time. There is padding on the ear cup, which I find to be quite nice, and on the headset that rests on your head. While I personally wouldn't wear these during workout sessions, they seem perfect for home and travel use, and because they’re wireless, it’s easy to multitask.

author: Kyle Turner
title: Not impressed w/ the Alexa feature.
content: I was not impressed with the Alexa feature.  Because I’v Got to turn on the Alexa app on my phone first. What’s the benefit here. I assumed it would process like the Eco.

author: Entrepreneur22
title: Five Stars
content: Headphones work great, much easier to focus on work in a distracting environment with the noise cancellation.

author: Mike
title: BEST HEAD PHONES I OWN
content: THESE WERE PURCHASED FOR TRAVELING AND THEY HAVE SERVED ME WELL OVER A LOT OF AIR TRAVEL. LOVE THE SOUOND AND THE EASE OF USE! PAIRS FAST WITH MACBOOK PRO, IPHONE, IPAD!!!!

author: Danielle
title: I am not an audiophile but I am extremely picky about what I like and don't
content:
Bought these and the Sony WH-1000Xm2 noise canceling headphones.

I already have owned and been using a wired Beats Studio noise canceling headphone for the last 4 years.

I've got Bose wired and Bluetooth sport headphones, AKG buds (came with my S8), Apple buds (came with IPhone 6), Sensier buds and various other sets.

Sound Quality is subjective so really I think everyone has to try each headphone out for themselves.  I am not an audiophile but I am extremely picky about what I like and don't, subtle differences make a big difference to me.  To me, the Sony headsets sound the best out of any of the headphones I own, wired or Bluetooth, noise canceling or non noise canceling.

Noise Canceling - Sony and Bose were neck and neck, very little difference except... the Sony app let's you do some useful stuff with the Noise Canceling, set it to filter out ambient noise but not voices so you can hear announcements in the airport.  It can be set to an active setting that monitors your movement, opens up what you hear if you are moving for safety reason.  Gesture sensitivity - you can cup your hand over the right ear and the headphones shut down all but for the mic that allows you to hear someone.

Features - Sony hands down has more features than any headphone I have seen on the market.  Adjust the noise canceling levels as referenced above, set EQ to make meaningful adjustments to sound quality.  There is a feature that has preset surround sound settings which appears useless, sound quality sounds terrible in any of the setting so unsure why it's included on the app.  Touch features for volume, pause, play, answering calls.

Bluetooth functionality - both the Sony and Bose had the best sound quality of any Bluetooth headset I own.  Bose wins out for functionality as it will allow you to be connected to 2 devices at that same time.  Useful if you are traveling, are using them with your phone and you then want to watch a movie on your tablet or computer.  Bose, no problem, Sony you have to disconnect from your phone and then connect to the other device.

Comfort - Bose wins hands down - no contest.  The Sony's are comfortable but not on the same level as the Bose which are the most comfortable headphone I have every worn.

If I was ranking them purely on sound quality alone - Sony, Beats and then the Bose.

Overall I prefer the Sony's due to the sound quality, noise canceling performance, features, customization and Bluetooth performance.  If you are looking for comfort and noise canceling above all else, Bose would be the winner.  Both the Sony and Bose are great traveling headphones in my opinion, if you are looking for a set, really think everyone needs to try both as almost people review is subjective beyond the features and connectivity aspects.

author: Wael
title: Good but...
content:
- good but the sound quality not matching the very high price, but still one of the best headphones
- the mic very bad

author: Northerner
title: Get this pair if you're looking for comfort and ease in pairing
content: This can does exactly what it's supposed to do: super comfortable wearing, 2 audio sources at a time (this is super convenient). The only down side is micro-usb charging. But overall, highly recommended. The Sony MX3 has microphone issue and unreliable performance when wearing in the cold weather (sub 30)

author: G. Bush
title: Former Series I user very happy with the Series II
content:
I had a Series I and liked it very much, but I was frankly surprised how sound quality improved over the Series I.  Not sure that is a feature/benefit Bose pushes marketing wise, but mine was very noticeable. I'm very pleased and you are considering upgrading, it is a worthy upgrade.  Throw in the ability to change the noice canceling level with the new button, it is great.

I'm not a Google user so can't speak to that new feature.

author: DTodd
title: Bose hits it out of the Park with these!
content:
I was in the market for a new set of premium headphones and I agonized for days over whether I should choose the QC35s, the Sony WH1000XM2s and the Sennheiser P550s. They all had their strong points.  I finally broke the logjam by selecting according to what I wanted in a set, versus cool but unnecessary features that I would probably seldom use or need.  And as you can probably guess, I ended up selecting the Bose QC35s.

I recieved my QC35s within 48 hours or ordering from Amazon.  Upon opening the package I was both pleased and underwhelmed with a few features.  Let's talk about something good first.  The semi-hard case really rocks.  -Well-built and padded to keep the QCs relatively safe.  However, the provided USB charging cable was ridiculously short. Without measuring, I guess-timate the cord to be a out 8 to 10 inches.  The included headphone cable was less short but still a bit underwhelming in length.  Bose is a premium company, and for the price of entry to purchase these headphones, there is no reason why they could not include cables that are at least a serviceable length. Without checking, but having owned many Sony and Sennheiser headphones over the course of my lifetime, I'm willing to bet they would not make such a remedial mistake.

Fortunately, the QC35s made up for the cable issue with outstanding sound characteristics and excellent noise-cancelling capabilities.  The sound stage of these headphones is expansive.  I can hear separation between instruments that sounded muddled and undefined in my previously award-winning Plantronics. In fact, I would say that you probably would be hard-pressed to make a pair of headphones that were siginificantly better using a Bluetooth connection.  And that's just because you get to a point in sound quality that is really only limited by the Bluetooth standard.
As for the claims that I've seen in other reviews that these don't have any bass response, I will tell you that anyone that thinks these headphones don't have bass needs to immediately get their hearing checked. And anyone who needs more bass than these are capable of producing are probably causing themselves some real hearing damage.
In terms of sound quality, will these compete with my wired Sennheiser HD 380 pros?  No way.  Not even close.  In fact, any Bluetooth headphones I've ever tried, no matter how much money you throw at them will get stomped by a decent set of wired headphones. And that's just the reality of Bluetooth, until a new technology takes its place.

BUT what you're getting here is an excellent portable set of headphones that sound pretty sweet and have excellent noise reduction.  I ride the Washington DC Metro (subway) to work every day, and once I set the ANC and turn on the music, I never hear another sound other than the music.  They're also reasonably comfortable and actually fit my big ears and head very well too. Bose claims 20 hours of use from a single full charge and I am inclined to believe that figure.  I can charge them on Monday, and by week's end, I have ridden the train a combined 15 hours, and have plenty of juice left. If you've owned a decent set of Bluetooth headphones before, these probably won't blow you away, but they certainly won't disappoint either. Bose gets it right here, and I'd wholeheartedly recommend these to anyone looking for premium set of headphones.

author: JD
title: BEST PURCHASE EVER!
content: Wish i would've made this purchase sooner, these are clutch for all flights to prevent the noise of the plane from impacting your entertainment during a flight and for those moments either in the office or at home where you just need to concentrate or remove yourself. Great job syncing to all devices and honestly wish i would've made the purchase sooner!!

author: Franklin Mendes
title: Awesome
content: The brand says everything.

author: Erhan
title: great noise cancellation
content: unbelievably great noise cancellation that's for sure. Comfortable around the ears. I like them a lot.

author: MarcusMiller6158
title: Amazing headphones
content: Amazing headphones. They are very comfortable to wear and last a very long time. The sound quality is top notch as expected with a Bose product. You definitely get what you pay for with this product. I have had cheaper noise cancelling headphones and none of them compare to these headphones.

author: Dennis L. Chamberlain
title: Not cheap, but you get what you pay for
content: Easy blue tooth setup, good noise cancellation, excellent sound quality, and the battery lasts a long time.  I'm very happy with it

author: Jen Kakuske
title: Awesome headphones but poor range
content: These headphones have outstanding sound quality and I highly recommend them. The noise canceling is also great. When I mow the lawn, I can’t even hear the mower. The only thing I don’t like about them is the limited range for Bluetooth. As soon as I walk around the corner from my phone, the audio starts cutting out. Not an issue if I just keep my phone in my pocket. The battery life on these is also excellent.

author: Donna
title: Love the freedom of listen to things on this.
content: Love this to listen to my audible book and music. Still having a little trouble with answering calls.

author: Client d'Amazon
title: Awesome headphones!
content: Noise cancelling works really well. Used this on my long haul flight for Australia and I could not be more satisfied with how much noise it has reduced. Can connect simultaneously to different devices. Very comfortable and lightweight.

author: Joe
title: The best headphones
content: This is so good bought one as gift for everyone in the family.

author: Chris
title: Must have for long flights!
content: Fantastic for long airplane rides.  These totally soak up the auxiliary airplane sounds and make you forget you're on a flight.  I used them for a 15 hour flight and had no issues.  Still felt comfortable even with extended wear.  Setup can take a few minutes to sync and update with your phone so don't pick these up last minute if you're not going to have data service on your phone.

author: Barbara Lovstad
title: Airplanes have incredible levels of noise...buy these.
content: Gift for professional daughter who travels and finds these as her first necessity.

author: Conner C. Mullally
title: not worth the money
content: Great except cannot be used reliably for Skype calls over internet and it us a HUGE pain to get them to connect to any device that cannot usenthr bose app.

author: Richard Rys
title: Bluetooth issue
content: The bluetooth connection often started out garbled on the headset on both a MAC and Dell Windows 10 machine. Made it unusable for skype/goto meeting or U-tube. Connection did clear after some time. When it did work properly it was great, but I had to return it as defective.

author: Gw
title: Slightly too bass heavy
content: bass heavy

author: JP Buchanan
title: Work well
content: I fly a lot and these take you out of the aircraft and to a quiet place.  Cool tech.

author: Amazon Customer
title: If you're an everyday user, buy these
content: My 2nd pair. Worth every penny

author: Lee Miles Bradford
title: Quality of Life Saver
content: Living in a condo can be loud and these headphones save my quality of life. Upstairs neighbor is so loud its difficult to even watch a movie without being distracted by whatever the heck she's doing up there. Using these with bluetooth transmitters connected to the television allow me to watch movies or shows without distraction. And the improvement of the sound quality is an added benefit. I have two pairs and had issues with cutting out on one. Bose replaced them for free.  Definitely recommended.

author: Reviewer1234
title: Noise cancellation fails after a week ☹️
content:
These were great - for about a week. Then the noise cancellation completely died.
These were a birthday present for my son. He’s very sad.
Returned. 😞

author: Mr. Wise
title: Bose
content: The sounds are crisp, clear, and has good range. The bass is not all that strong. So if you're looking for headphones to play music with deep bass these are not for you. The noise cancellation is great. The earphones seal well around your ear  and helps to block out any noises. The battery life last for hours. The headphones fit well over the head and adjust easily. The only negative is that if you are using these to talk on the phone, it picks up a lot of the background noises! So the person on the other end has a hard time hearing you, unless you're sitting in a quiet room.

author: Jordan Kunz
title: All around good. Would repurchase.
content: Definitely quiets my surrounding. Not perfect but has allowed me to focus much better in cafes and other noisy work areas. Microphone for calls works better than Apple headphones. Sound quality for listening great.

author: H. Sohal
title: Flawless and amazing
content:
Got this one today, absolutely wonderful sound. Was debating between beats studio 2 and these. Got beats because it was on deal for Black Friday. Unfortunately could not enjoy the songs with beats studio. Too much is bass sound. Got these to see if it's just not my ears. Started to listen and don't want to take them off. It's expensive for sure but worth it.

It's interesting that it comes with Google Assistant configured but the cover says made got iPhone iPod and iPad. Using it with Android phone without any issue. Maybe Bose should update the packaging.

author: Daniel McCoy
title: Emjoy music at another level.
content: Not cheap... but best designed, functioning, and highest quality item I have purchased in a long time. A pleasure that adds peace and calm to  my life with music in otherwise noisy and distracting times on planes, work, etc...

author: Donna M Day
title: The best
content: Best

author: Zack L
title: The sony's sounded better and had better noise cancelling
content: I tried these alongside the Sony WH1000MX2 and the Beats Studio 3. The sony's sounded better and had better noise cancelling. The Beats fit better.

author: Dustypants
title: It's ok.
content:
It's ok. Sound quality is nice for both wired and wireless.
If you use the headset wired while it is charging, you will notice some noise coming from the headset even though nothing is playing. Headset can not use bluetooth while charging.

The 4 ft wire appears to be intended for mobile use. I would have preferred the wire be 6 ft instead for practical use at my computer, and use bluetooth for mobile.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Does the job
content:
These headphones are amazing. They provide decent sound quality and top of the line noise cancellation.
The best feature is the engineering - they are light and I can wear them for long periods of time without any discomfort.
Case (included) was welcome in keeping these safe.

author: Mary Movielover
title: Nothing Better than BOSE!
content: I bought these for my son and he was thrilled. He said the sound quality was perfect. Expensive yet it IS a BOSE product! Nobody does it better.

author: Larry A Miller
title: The Right Choice!
content: Comfortable and lightweight with excellent sound and great noise cancellation. Used on air flights with very satisfying results listening to music on my phone and watching movies on my iPad with jet engine noise virtually eliminated. I have also used the wired connection to airliner video/audio entertainment equipment with excellent sound results. The headphones made the flights so much more enjoyable without ear fatigue in comparison to having regular ear buds that did not have noise cancellation. Excellent materials and build quality. Using Google Assistant for cell phone notifications, stock market prices and walking directions. Linking to my Samsung Galaxy S 8+ was easy. I compared these Bose headphones to the Sony WH1000XM2 Headphones prior to purchase at a local retail store before selecting the Bose. My use to date indicates I made the right decision.

author: Aaron's Aunt
title: Saved my sanity
content: We're under construction in my office and I also work with a talkative bunch, so it's more noisy than usual at work, and difficult to concentrate. I can switch these on and actually hear myself think. Fabulous noise cancellation and sound quality. Worth every cent!

author: Max
title: Excellent audio quality
content:
I can always count on Bose's quality. Again I was not disappointed.
The process to connect is simple, the noise-cancel feature works amazingly, the audio quality is great considering it's transmitted via Bluetooth, and the integration with Alexa is incredible.
They're comfortable to wear for hours, and the battery lasts easily a day and a half of continuous use.
While I do not use these for gaming, I don't think they're that good because Bose has a noticeable delay in this aspect, so if what you want is for gaming, consider other option. If what you need is just music, videos, and calling (I love calling with these), this is your best option.

author: Keko
title: These keep getting better
content: This is my fifth set of Bose headphones in my life. These are superb. A must for air travel. Bose leads on noise cancelling tech.

author: yamichi
title: Dang near life changing
content:
I took a new job that is going to require some international travel.  It was recommended that I get some good quality ANC (active noise canceling) headphones for the long flights and I decided to get them a bit early.

HOLY CRAP!  I spend ~2.5 hours a day on busses 4 days a week and my comfort, my alertness, and my overall attitude when I get to work is so much better.  The bus engine and vibration becomes a dull hum in the background. You can't even hear the air handlers. Most conversations are damped down to a level you don't care.  You can HEAR your music (or podcasts) without turning them up loud.

I wish I'd bought these years ago.

author: robert
title: Most versatile, comfortable, and quality sounding headset EVER.
content:
I purchased this item twice. The first one would constantly pair once sound was initiated from my iPhone (tried multiple iOS related items). It did work on windows/android though. The replacement set paired without a single problem.

By far  the MOST comfortable headphones I've ever owned. I love how I can switch between paired items (phone, tablet, pc). The sound quality is amazing too.

Cons: I now get shot by coworkers with nerf bullets to get my attention.

author: Real Raleigh Reviewer
title: Very, very disappointed
content:
Very, very disappointed. I really wanted to love these - as I had wanted to when I purchased a pair of original QC35s. I love Bose speakers, esp. bluetooth speakers, and have Bose stereo systems in several cars I currently / recently owned (currently two Mercedes and one Audi), all of which are excellent systems.

These are the most comfortable headphones I've tried - which includes, for reference, Sennheiser HD1, Bang & Olufsen H9 (my personal favorite of all headphones), Bowers & Wilkins P7s, Bluedio, AudioMX, etc. etc. These ARE comfortable.

I do think these have the best noise-canceling in the industry, including the Sony MDR-1000X (or current WH-1000XM2). Much of that has to do with the softness and plushness of the ear pads; you'll notice that about 2/3 of the noise canceling is accomplished simply by WEARING the headphones, even while off.

I like the addition of the multifunction button that toggles between noise canceling high / low / off. Very good.

These are attractive. The ear cups swivel 90 degrees so you can lay them flat on your chest while around your neck. They just look nice - look like quality. The two-tone covers are a great touch and executed with precision.

Audio performance is still in the bottom 25% of all bluetooth headphones I've ever tested. And that numbers somewhere near 50 over the last several years. Here, the Bang & Olufsen just trounces the Bose. Plantronics Backbeat Pro 2 is a runner-up. Bowers & Wilkins P7 is also superb. The Bose sound performance at all volume levels is a forgettable also-ran. Even with the ANC turned off, the bass is wimpy and the mids - vocals, strings - are flaccid, underwhelming. There's no warmth, no voice, no presence. No different than the original QC35, and wholly inferior to the B&O, Plantronics, and B&W named above - by an order of magnitude. This isn't the "Bose sound".

And now the cardinal sin: connection quality. I tried with two phones to confirm (although both work extremely well with all other offerings mentioned above, and many more). On a clear day, the Bose QC35 has about a 15 foot range with a clear line of sight before it starts cutting out. If you put your phone in your pocket and walk outside, the music skips constantly. Unusable. Even indoors, you have to have the phone in the pocket on the same side as the bluetooth receiver - which appears to be in the LEFT ear cup - or it will also skip while your phone is in your pocket. Outdoors it doesn't matter; it skips constantly. If I didn't have a list of 60 or 70 paired devices on my phone - speakers, headphones and cars - I would say, "maybe it's my phone". It isn't. It's the QC35ii. Unfortunately, this is exactly the behavior I observed on the original QC35, which was also unacceptable. And, like the original QC35, I will have to return these.

If you want attractive headphones that are very comfortable and very aesthetically pleasing, and don't particularly care about the quality of the sound they're producing, these are clear winners, best in the industry. They tick off those two boxes very well. But if you want Great ANC and Great comfort, but dominant sound performance, these are not contenders in any way. Regardless of price. Check out Bang & Olufsen H9, Bowers & Wilkins P7, and Plantronics Backbeat Pro 2 for excellent comfort, three very different aesthetic options, and vastly dominant sound quality. Out of the three, the B&O is the top dog, but both of the other two are simply excellent and can't disappoint.

author: Traveler3000
title: Ear Candy!!!
content: Two words...ear candy! This headset is nirvana to my ears. The sound and quality of the headset is fantastic. The app actually lets two Bose headsets listen in on the same music. I am impressed.

author: Hayk
title: Disappointed
content:
Good parts:
1. The product materials are of very high quality
2. It is very comfortable to wear and is very lightweight.
Bad parts:
1. I had headaches during one week of usage and decided to return the product.
2. Another issue is that there is a white noise in the background, which I heard and it feels not good.
3. I do not recommend this headphone also for calls. If noise cancellation is enabled you will not hear your own voice as usual and it is very strange.

author: Ash B
title: Great
content: Great

author: John Lovelock
title: They're Bose, their reputation trumps any review.
content: But here goes ... Fantastic headphones, so glad I saved for them and finally took the leap to buy. As soon as you put these things over your ears and power on, it's remarkable how much noise they cancel out .. and when the music starts, that's all you hear. In-between tracks you might hear some faint conversations around you, but once the music starts playing again you are back in your own world. Music sounds great thru them, and the bass (whatever level of volume you are listening to) is pitch perfect. The Google assistant (via my Android phone) works brilliantly, hands free, talk-back via the headphones is outstanding. The android app is ok, but a little annoying that it has to restart every time you go back to it even though the headphones remain active. The headphones are very comfortable, they fit like a glove ... I am extremely happy with them. Bose ... the best !

author: Daniel Jozwik
title: Amazing worth every penny!
content: Excellent!!!! Best headphones I have ever used no regrets buying them! Have also used beats studio, beats pro, beats solo 2, Samsung level.  The only ones that come close in my opinion are the beats pro but I wanted wireless headphones. I’m no audiophile but I like listening to my music piano, violin, rap, electro.  The bass is maybe not as high as the beats but still good enough for me to enjoy my music and not complain. Noise canceling is amazing!!!

author: Scott Simpson
title: Tight fitting earbuds (with inserts to match your ear size) produce the same net result without the bulk and does a better job of killing high-frequency noise from a child crying
content:
I had the previous generation Bose headphones and was looking forward to strong improvements in the sound reduction on flights... well it's the exact same when comparing them side by side, which is to say it's only okay.  Tight fitting earbuds (with inserts to match your ear size) produce the same net result without the bulk and does a better job of killing high-frequency noise from a child crying.

Bose needs to do something to reduce the bulk on their headphones. The headphone case is nice, but the old style was better -- this new version requires the ear pieces to be folded so they rub each other on the exterior plastic part (in no time I am sure these will have rub/scratch marks from storing them in their case).

Also, it may be obvious, but avoid wearing these headphones in hot environments (think florida or hawaii in the summer) -- your ears and head will sweat considerably.

author: Mauricio
title: Feels kind of delicate
content: it feels kind of delicate but it is extremely comfortable and you could tell that it’s made with very high-quality material making it extremely lightweight but also giving it that slight delicacy.  The only problem I had was trying to connect it to a different device after I connected it to my main iPhone. It wouldn’t connect. But other that that it’s amazing at a high price.

author: Tracy L. Sharpe
title: Heaven is a headphone away..
content: Wow. Amazing sound. Emmersive and crystal clear. Close your eyes and it’s like you’re in the recording studio with the band. I heard notes, lyrics and instruments in songs I’ve heard a million times and never know existed. I bought these to muffle airplane racket and now I’m looking forward to flying again. Hasta la vista snore-a-sauruses and bawling urchins! Woot!!

author: pawsondemand
title: ... the description included cosmetic imperfections so it could be worse. They work 100% though
content: Minor scratch on side that wasn't in the pictures but its very mild and the description included cosmetic imperfections so it could be worse. They work 100% though.

author: MAVRIK
title: Bose knows Noise canceling!
content: I was going to get a much cheaper headphone but I see Bose headphones used by a lot of travelers.  I did a little research on them and they were a bit too much but I figured I would get them at the $299 price.  I also saw that the SONY ones that are much like these were also on sale at $299.  Anyway, i ordered them and I got them Monday afternoon as promised.  Everything was in tact and no damage to the box or the headphones.  I opened them up and charged them up while I got ready for work.  I took them with me along with my iTouch.  I took my phone and downloaded the Bose+ app to my phone and went through the process of setting up and pairing it to my Galaxy 7.  It did not take long and it also had to download some firmware which did take a few minutes for it to download and then install to the headphones.  Once completed I walked through the features and it added Google assistant so I can use one of the buttons to initiate and ask Goggle assistant questions or have it do something.  They are very comfortable on my head and on my ears.  They don't cause any discomfort or stress out my ears after wearing them for a long period of time.  Just have to get use to the location of the buttons.  The Noise canceling is pretty good and you can turn it off if you like and save on battery.  I have yet to see how long the charge lasts in prolonged use.  Overall on my first use and test of it I really like them and glad I ordered them.  Well worth the money in my opinion.  Will give a more detailed update on them after I have had some time to test them out and see how they perform.

author: Mike
title: great sound
content: Smooth sound which I really love. I can barely hear the airplane when I am in one and using these headphones.

author: OneShot Hunter
title: Best sound quality ever
content: Absolutely the best headphones I’ve ever purchased. Sound, comfort, quality is awesome.

author: Alireza
title: Great Headphone
content: I love the sound quality and the noise canceling. The bass is not too strong and kicking, good for office and regular use.

author: 11Bravo11
title: So glad I bought these instead of Sony
content: If your like me, over research/think, just go with these.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wow awesome
content: Sound quality is amazing. I've been hearing things in songs I never noticed before. Noise cancellation is great, completely blocks out the continuous stream of cars passing my house. Can still hear higher pitched noises like voices but they're muffled. Very comfortable as well even with glasses on. Love these things.

author: OCW
title: Lexus of headphones - reliable, stylish and great comfort
content: This is my 3rd pair of Bose noise canceling headphones, loved the first ones, the second ones were better - over the ear model, these are my first wireless headphones.  Love them more than the first two. I fly 200 days a year, sleep with them on when jet lagged in a hotel...not the best idea but they are comfortable enough to use for 10-12 hours straight.  My daughter usually gets my old sets and she still enjoys using the old ones - in her noisy office.  They still work after 15 years.  Lexus of headphones.

author: Alfinio Monique
title: I love these headphones
content:
I love these headphones. Last year I was shopping around for wireless noise canceling headphones. The girl at Best Buy talked me into the Sony MDR-1000x. I used both the Bose and Sony headphones. I borrowed the Bose from my boss but I decided to go the cheaper route and Sony did sound a little better.

Well, you get what you pay for. The headphones cracked all of the time and the plastic broke. So I ended up buying the Bose headphones. I love them! They are comfortable and I know they are durable because I have the QC 25's but they have the wire. They are still holding up so I know these will too.

I love how you can pair two devices to the headphones because I have my computer and phone paired. I really wish I bought these ones first.

author: JT Mon
title: Great Product / Failed Customer support options
content:
Love the product. One of the best on the market and it should be for the relative price.
Warning about Bose service/support policies.
Just 2 months after the 12 mo warrantee ran out I had the right side of the headset come apart from the headpiece.  The culprit was a small screw which could have easily been shipped to replace the lost one.  I called Bose and the only option they offered was to replace the Unit for about $300. They clearly stated their policy was to replace at a very small and unreasonable trade in. Absolutely ridiculous in this case for a small screw.
Bottom line: Bose repair policy is way out of reasonable and so ridged one cannot imagine.  If I could rate Bose customer support in this case it would be a whopping zero.  It certainly will effect my decision to purchase future Bose products

author: Tracy
title: Glasses friendly!!
content:
I wear glasses, and tried a different brand, but they smashed into my ears and gave me a headache.
These fit comfortably over my ears and sound AMAZING! And I LOVE the color!!

author: Sal
title: Best of the Best!
content: This is my first set of Bose headphones and now I see what the fuss was about. Have used them for several months now, several airplane flights and wow, feels, sounds and works great.

author: Stephen Crewdson
title: Very comfortable until you hear music from them
content:
I was very disappointed in the sound quality from these. I have had many pairs of headphones and ear buds from Bose and these are simply not up to par. The best way I can describe it is they sound “hollow.”  The sound is what I would expect from a pair I pick up from the drug store for $19.99, in a pinch.

The reviews from practically every trusted site said they are very close to the Sony competitors for sound quality whilst being more comfortable. I can’t say for sure because I haven’t heard the Sony WH1000m3 cans but I hope they sound far better than these or else wireless cans are still just garbage. I find that the Bose SoundSport earbuds have far superior sound to these at a much lower price.

Comfort was excellent and noise canceling was very good. Bluetooth worked flawlessly as well. However, I cannot countenance paying $350 for headphones, the sound from which makes me frown.

author: JanMan
title: Great set of Headphones!!!!
content: Without a doubt, the best headphones out there! Excellent sound and noise cancellation.

author: Karen Shull
title: A high quality and comfortable headphone that deliver.
content: High quality construction and performance.  Use with iPhone 5 and Konnecta blue tooth transmitter/receiver.  Had problems connecting to Konnecta initially but resolved self after several connection tries done in different ways.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I cannot imagine flying without it
content: Great for travel or office use--anytime you need a moment of quiet. I like the sound more than I liked the sound quality on a comparably priced competitor.

author: J. Summers
title: Non-Bluetooth Was Better
content:
I've used Bose headphones for 7 years now, and they're lifesavers for someone who's noise-sensitive like me.  Previous models were great against roommates, neighbors, etc. and great for traveling.  I finally opted to upgrade to bluetooth "for convenience."  Sigh.  The promise is so rarely as good as the reality.

BLUETOOTH PROBLEMS
The bluetooth will only support two devices at once.  "No problem, who uses 3 devices at once?" I thought.  Well, what they don't tell you is that it won't auto-switch between devices, so you are constantly opening the app to adjust devices if you need to switch between MORE THAN ONE.  Why one?  Because one of them always has to be your phone to use the bloody app!  So, it really only supports your phone plus one.

Bluetooth randomly disconnects.  And randomly tries to connect, beeping and beeping in your ear or just failing completely.  Pain in the @$$.

App constantly forgets the device, tries to connect with other people's devices, creates delays while it figures things out, etc.  Pain in the @$$.

NOISE CANCELLING
Noise cancelling isn't as good as previous models.  You can't just turn on the noise cancelling either like you could with the others.  It has to be audio on.

APP
App is a stupid, pathetic piece of garbage.  It's slow to connect, it's a pain to manage connections that CONSTANTLY need to be managed (HIDDEN IN A SECONDARY MENU - ARE YOU F'ING KIDDING ME!?).  And even with the stupid app I shouldn't have to use, I still can't adjust sound quality.

BASS
Bass is too strong and un-smooth.  And there's no way to adjust it.  I can't listen to some of my favorite songs through these headphones.

All I can say is that Bose better get their act together or I'm finally following my friends to other brands.

author: Dulguun Gankhuyag
title: Perfect for flying, just cancels all engine noise
content: Cannot think of anything to complain about this headphones, just perfect. I`m a student pilot and I use the noise cancellation while I`m flying and its so good just cancels out all engine noise and trust me its very loud. There is only one headphone that compete with QC35, the Sony MDR 1000X and only advantage that MDR 1000X have is the Ambient Sound mode and the Quick Attention but it looks too silly for me, who would have a conversation with someone while they are holding their hand on the headphone like that. I think Bose can implement Ambient Sound mode with software update hopefully they will do it soon. Haven`t tested the MDR`s Ambient mode so cannot say anything positive about them.

author: S. Pemble
title: worth every penny
content: My son recommended these headphones but they were *far* more expensive than I was willing to spend, but when I got an unexpected bonus at work the first thing I thought of was rewarding myself with these; the moment I used them I was absolutely stunned. I told my husband "It's like I've never heard music before!", and when he tried them he understood. Beyond that I don't know what to say; the battery life is fantastic. They're easy to use because the switches are positioned so well and easy to identify with my fingertips. They are profoundly comfortable. If you can afford them, don't hesitate!!

author: J. Northrup
title: Husband Can't Hear Me
content: Husband purchased for when he works from home and needs to focus away from kindergartner and baby. They work great, very comfortable.

author: M. E. Maldonado
title: ***GO WITH BLACK NOT SILVER***
content:
Amazing sound !! BUT....the silver version of these headphones have 1 major flaw...
Both the ear cushions & suede headband will discolor with wear. The oils from your skin and any hair products such as hair spray or hair gel will turn the grey colored ear cushions and headband to a yellowish tone. GREAT PRODUCT...GO WITH THE BLACK COLORED HEADPHONES.

author: Dayman
title: Perfect for TV and music
content:
When buying these I never thought about how easy it would be to link with my Apple TV in addition to my phone. Major game changer for someone that can never hear the tv and usually blasts the volume to overpower the roar of the heater.

Best purchase of 2018 for this guy.

author: Jamie
title: great headphones, but android issues
content: yes they are great in almost every way. However, I have been having a continual issue with the bose app for android (S8 running android 9). notification sounds no longer can be muted at all (without disabling per app), as in silent vibrate or do not disturb (even with all volumes down) still played notification sounds. the issue is not as bad as it was originally after some updates but still a problem.

author: Andrekolber
title: Five Stars
content: Best noise cancelling headphones on the market. Enough said.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great
content: Great headphones. Very comfortable and high quality. Worth the $$$.

author: David S.
title: Not as advertised!
content: DOES NOT CANCEL NOISE! I bought this, thinking it will help cancel airplane noise when i travel but it dies not reduce noises in my home. I sincerely doubt it will help on an airplane. I truly believe i could have accamplished thevsame thing if i flushed my money down the toilet!

author: Bdv
title: Love it
content: Love the sound.  Very comfortable to wear.

author: Merle
title: Not loud but constant and dull. WOW
content: In my office there are A/C and lights that make a noise.  Not loud but constant and dull.  WOW!! not with these.  I am in Heaven.
Good value

author: ELIZABETH
title: Great headphones
content: I really like these headphones, they would be 5 stars but i hate, stressing absolutely hate the method of charging.  fairly short (1 ft maybe) microUSB charging cord included with no power adapter, so you would need them to be plugged into some usb power source, like your computer, but now your need to leave it on overnight so good one Bose.  only one device can talk to them at a time via bluetooth, I suppose that's to be expected, would be nice to get pandora and my pc games working together behind the noise cancellation.  Oh and there's the microphone that windows seems to completely misunderstand the point behind noise cancellation as it likes to play back the external noise (not a bose feature, this part is purely windows 10 counter intelligence).  Bose please to be making magnetic charger plz plz kk thx! microUSB = bad

author: Tye
title: Extremely comfortable headphones
content: I have used a variety of headphones for the gym and around. I have used EarPods for the gym and liked them, but disliked being able to hear my surroundings when I'm trying to zone out. I decided on the Bose QC35II's and I was glad I did. They are extremely comfortable. I can wear them for hours without any fatigue. The noise canceling is great. I do wish there were a few more smart features and EQ adjustment as I would like more bass. Overall the sound is neutral and nice and blocks out a lot of unwanted noise.

author: Alex L.
title: High Price, But a Quality Product.
content: My only complaint, about the QC 35 II, is that the price dropped $50, shortly after I bought them, when the newer version was released. Other than that, that are fantastic. I, primarily, use them during air travel, and the noise cancellation is fantastic. You don’t have to crank the volume to the max, to drown out the ambient plane noise, and damage your hearing. The battery life is as advertised. They’re light and comfortable; you hardly realize you’re wearing them, after awhile. They fold up, conveniently, making traveling with them a breeze. They are plastic, obviously, but it does not seem to be an overly cheap plastic. I am very pleased with the purchase, overall. Hopefully, this review helps people make and informed purchase and, if you decide to purchase them, you enjoy the QC 35 II as much as I have.

author: DSeyller
title: Great, just not as loud.
content: Wasn’t as loud as I had anticipated.  Great otherwise!!!

author: Vernon Anderson
title: The best
content: One of those purchases you think are overpriced until you use them. My roommates are super noisy and these have brought me great peace. So durable and comfortable I don't mind falling asleep with them on. They also charge super quick and last for hours if not days. Oh, they sound great too!

author: Spacemom
title: Not Impressed with Customer Support
content: I called Bose support when the power button on my  head phones stopped working after 6 months. I took really good care of these head phones. When they were not in use or charging, they were in the case.The support guy (obviously not in the US) said all would be taken care of. When I did not receive my mailer I sent an email to Bose support. The response I got was that they had no record of my call. The call took an hour. Beware of Bose and their new international support.

author: Heidi
title: Kick back and relax with these
content: The new style of Bose headphones are awesome! I decided to upgrade from the Bose Quiet 35 to wireless. While nothing was wrong with my old pair, I must say that not having to deal with a cord anymore is amazing and was one of the driving factors in getting a new pair. I travel quite often and the cord would constantly get in the way when I was shuffling through my bag or getting situated in my seat. Technology is always advancing and the Bluetooth capability is a nice added feature that my old pair did not have. Although the price is high, I am happy with my purchase. Bose creates a good quality product that I would highly recommend to anyone. Especially if you are constantly on airplanes and want to completely drown out all background noise.

author: TimC
title: Noise cancellation is awesome
content: I wasn't sure what to expect while traveling on an airplane, but the noise cancellation is most impressive.  I heard the movie I was watching and nothing else.  If you travel by plane a lot get these Bose headphones.  You wont be disappointed.  The battery life is very good too. 3 hours of travel and the battery went from 100 percent charge to 90 percent.

author: Gugo The Bald
title: Noise cancellation is not complete. But enough.
content: Used while studying. Very comfortable. Noise cancellation dependes on music and volume. But overall, very good product.

author: Christina Philips
title: DONT BUY!  Beats are better!
content: These are ok... no where as good as my beats wireless ones. And much more complicated w the buttons and answering the phone. Will stick w my beats from now on. S

author: L. A. B
title: Really does cancel noise.
content: I really really love these headphones; I knew I made the right decision. I live and commute in NYC and the noise do sometimes get to me and want to tune out the NYC traffic and this does the job!

author: Shannon
title: Life Changing!
content: These headphones are life changing! When the world gets to loud just put these on and and listen some Chopin perhaps? The noice cancellation feature is excellent and they fit comfortable. I just wish they could adjust to a smaller setting as they fit a little big on me personally.

author: Andrey
title: NC is very annoying and can't be disabled permanently
content:
Regret buying these, because NC by default is always set to Maximum.
It's not comfortable to have enabled for more than 30 minutes.

There's a way to turn it off - via mobile app, which is pain. You need to do it EVERY TIME you turn the headphones on.
You can also assign the function button to control the level of NC, but 1. you still need to do it EVERY TIME you turn them on. 2. It kills the main function - Google (or Alexa) assistant functionality because you cannot use it now.

author: Jake1987
title: Technical issues
content: I get a lot of stutter. It seems like I am not the only one. It actually caused issues with a FFXV for PC. For some reason when the headphones were in 2 way communications mode the game froze every couple seconds. Weird but not a big deal. The thing that kills it is the fact that the sound stutters when I am just listening to YouTube videos. I am right next to the Bluetooth receiver with updated drivers and I still get the stutter. I had the MDX1000 until they cracked and had no issues with the sound or connection. Its disappointing that Sony can figure it out but Bose cant... I guess you have to choose between poor manufacturing quality (Sony) and poor Bluetooth implementation.

author: B. Hesse
title: Absolutely Fantastic in Every Way
content:
These are THE perfect headphones - it sets the standard that every other pair of headphones should be judged by.

I am not an audiophile, so take my review with a grain of sand, but to me these headphones sound fantastic. They are by far the best sounding headphones I've ever owned. Even better is the noise cancellation! The Bose QC 35's have the best sound cancellation of any headphone I've ever owned. It's a real pleasure to use them on an airplane or a bus, and these are a must-have if you want to be able to focus in an open office environment.

Overall, these headphones are expensive but I would say they are 100% worth every penny.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Noise Cancelling Headphone
content: All the other noise canceling has a brand name or serious name, but this one is THE NOISE CANCELLING HEADPHONE. I have been using Bose QC25 for 5 years, it was amazingly comfortable I actually slept with it on. But when the cellphone maker no longer put 3.5mm jack hole on their smart phones, I know it is the time to make a change. I waited for the Bose NC 700, but when I finally got it, it was a totally disaster. The new design makes it look cheap and hippie, the 10 level noise cancelling is not necessary at all, the new clamp design put extra pressure on head. I had to return that. Then I turned to Sony WH-1000XM3, because I have heard so many times from my friends that how much progress Sony has made to create this headphone that finally beat the Bose. But again it was another headphone with noise cancelling function. Although it has a good sound quality as any other Sony headphone, but it is not necessary for any situation when you need to turn the noise cancelling function. The other hand is that it is less flexible and wide compared to Bose25/35, so the top and side of your head will have pressure feeling after one hour. Finally I had to go back to someone I am familiar with - Bose QC35ii. When I put it on, the same comfortable feeling that I could wear to sleep for whole night, state of the art noise cancelling function, excellent sounds quality for music and movie and a phone call, last but not the least, bluetooth connection and no AAA batteries anymore. That is THE NOISE CANCELLING HEADPHONE.

author: kbaer57
title: Stop the Madness!
content: I’m a headphone geek and frequent flier. Spend the money once on these headphones. End your searching madness.

author: Kindle Customer W
title: Excellent noise cancellation
content: Noise cancellation is excellent. Sound is excellent. Easy to use and easy to pair with our devices. We have taken them everywhere, to work and on leisure trips, and we have bought a second pair. The built in microphone is very sensitive and picks up a lot of background noise it seems, so doesn't work as well for taking phone calls.

author: MR
title: Good, Comfortable headphones.
content: Very comfortable headphones, which are their main selling point AFAIK.  Noise canceling feature works well.  Replaceable batteries as the last model had are preferable.  Sound quality so-so.

author: A.
title: Best headphone on market.
content: Very pleased, excellent product.

author: Frank Wolking
title: If you like Bose buy these headphones
content: They're Bose so they are all you'd expect if you're a Bose fan. Excellent noise cancelling, easy to set up, and great sound quality for music, movies, etc...

author: Amazon Customer
title: Game changer!
content: Amazing! The noise cancellation is top notch. I went from a pair of no-name low-dollar variant of "noise cancelling" headphones and didn't know what I was missing until I put my big boy pants on and bought the Bose.

author: Jordan
title: Great Headphones... Save For One Glaring Issue
content:
I just started using the Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) wireless headphones, and generally speaking, they are pretty great. My intended use is to try to drown out the background noise in my open-plan workspace. They do an okay with human voices- certainly better than my old earbuds. They are relatively comfortable, and the sound quality is very clear.

That said, my main issue is with the port for the audio cable. It is EXTREMELY particular, and I have to wiggle it around to actually get it to get both ears to work. This is rather disappointing for a brand new pair of $350 headphones. My PC does not have Bluetooth, so I am sort of stuck using the cable. My ultimate concern is that the jack will wear out fast. I will give the headphones a few more days of trial, but there is a real chance that I will end up returning them if things get worse.

author: Danielle McMahan
title: Great sound, connectivity can be a problem with older devices.
content: When it comes to BOSE the sound quality is unmatched.  My only knock on these is that in order to connect you have to  download and use the BOSE connect app, you can't just connect via Bluetooth.  If you have an older device (neither my iPad 1 or iPad 2) or a laptop you won't be able to connect which can be frustrating.

author: Avi  Dori
title: Excellent product, 100% Satisfaction.
content: It’s the best headphones I have ever had.., using it on the flight, and it works perfectly.., Excellent product, 100% Satisfaction.

author: Chris Hedgecock
title: It works waay better than I had expected
content:
As an avid music listener I had always assumed that noise cancelation wasn't a  big deal or worth the money.  I was so wrong.
These headphones improve everything that goes through them.  Makes Mowing the lawn pleasant They are worth every penny.

author: Henry
title: The Best Headphones I've Ever Had
content:
I've had these for about a week now, and I'm using my headphones now more than ever. Stellar connection quality, wonderful comfort, and a surprisingly-great battery life. Connected to my PC with zero fuss, and can pair to multiple devices with the swipe of a button.

What I most want to discuss is the buttery-smoothness of its feel and the noise cancelling feature. Both are top-notch. I never get tired of wearing them, there was zero discomfort, and my time on the PC is distraction-free. I didn't even notice how loud the AC outside my window was until I started wearing these.

author: Judy
title: Sound reduction is excellent.
content: The sound reduction is excellent. I have a small poodle who loves to make yipping, playful noises in the morning while I try to sleep in. I don’t hear the dog while wearing this product. Note - the dog is fine when she yips like this, she loves to “talk”. If she barks loud, I can hear her and check to make sure she is okay. I love these headphones.

author: JohnQReview
title: Good but...
content: This is the second pair of this type of Bose I have had, and while the design and durability are much improved, the sound has stayed the same. Maybe from a lack of competition. Not really sure but it also seems that the noise cancellation is actually weaker.

author: Sue
title: Love having these for travel
content: Pricey but still a good investment. Airline travel is so stressful, but when you can block out all the airplane noise with these headphones, it makes it  much easier. Didn’t give it 5 stars only because with my glasses on, it can get a little uncomfortable after a while.

author: John W. Michael
title: Great hardware & sound; pitiful software and app makes all wireless features useless
content:
UPDATE February 2019:  The latest software update eliminated most of the problems with hijacking my hearing aids and linking with my iPhone is now more reliable.  Unfortunately, it is now virtually impossible to connect to my MacBookPro unless I do a hard reboot of both laptop and headphones.  That makes the Bose phones useless for videoconferencing, listening to music via laptop, or pretty much anything headphones are routinely used for.  It appears that the software engineering at Bose continues to be second rate, and if problems aren't fixed a year after the product was sold - I fear that they never will.  This is the last Bose product I will consider...

UPDATE December 2018:  None of the problems from my original review have been addressed by Bose despite multiple app updates.  The implementation of Bluetooth connection on these phones is poor and unreliable; the associated app features are terrible and non-functional.  Lowered review from three to two stars now that it's clear Bose is unable or unwilling to fix the fundamental problems with these phones.

If you rarely use Bluetooth or only connect to one device, you might be satisfied with these 'phones.  If you have no intention of using Alexa or Google Assistant, the fact that they don't work won't bother you.  Otherwise, you will be disappointed in a Bose product that doesn't work as advertised.

Until this purchase, I've been a loyal Bose fan for decades and went out of my way to pay extra for Bose quality.  In the future, I will think very carefully before purchasing anything else from Bose...

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
Wrote a glowing review immediately after buying these headphones, but this has turned out to one of the worst Bose purchases I ever made.  First the good news: the sound and hardware seem to be as excellent as the Bose reputation.  I had to switch to over-ear phones now that I wear hearing aids and decided to go all out and pay extra for the wireless features, including Alexa compatibility.

Ten months later, it's clear that the wireless features are so flawed that they're useless with my iPhone 6.  Like many, I experience sound drop outs for no apparent reason, but the most annoying hassle is that these phones are unable to connect reliably unless you manually reinstall them almost every time.  For many months, they defaulted to my Bluetooth hearing aids no matter what so all I heard was tinny voice frequencies without any bass at all.  I emailed Bose support on all my issues but they never responded.

I can link the phones to my iPhone, iPad, MacBook Pro and LG TV.  BUT, unless I manually turn off all but one option, these phones never synch after the initial connection.  Alexa control is a joke because it takes too long to find the app and carry out the option.  Google Assistant isn't much better but the software is clearly biased toward Google products so be forwarned.
