I gave up on both after numerous trials and just manually open the app in my iPhone and manually change playlists or whatever else I need to do.  It's much faster and more reliable to use the wired connection, which works flawlessly, but defeats the purpose of buying the wireless capabilities.

The connection seems a bit more stable after several iOS updates this year, but sometimes these phones become less stable after an update.  Don't tell me to skip the iOS 12 update: updates make my data more stable and my Apple devices more responsive.  Bose shouldn't advertise a product that's not functional with modern OS.

Based on my experience and the lackluster Bose support, think twice before paying more for the Bluetooth versions of these phones.

author: L'Chaim the Maggid
title: Great sound
content:
I am not able to do a fair comparison. These are the nicest headphones I've ever had, better than those expensive Sony pair and far better than Dr. Dre's Beats...at least for me. The Beats were way too bassy and I'm a confirmed bassaholic. The ambient sound suppression is good. Again, I can't offer a comparison. The range, going wireless, is okay. The audio cable is very thin and seems fragile, but it's held up so far. Just like all former headphones of mine, the thin plastic cover over the foam ear pads doesn't hold up very long. They'll gladly sell replacements.

This is my second pair of QuietComfort 35, Series II headphones. They're still unboxed.

author: Adrian Sanguyo
title: Clear bright tones. Amazing Bass...
content: It is an awesome headset..It is lightweight. And it produces and vibrant sound...It has a powerful bass.

author: Thekeithfan
title: Comfortable, quiet, great battery life.
content: So far so good. Great battery life so far (I’ve had them 4 months). They work perfect on a plane. I also use them mowing and don’t have to turn up the volume a lot to drown out the mower. They are comfortable.

author: Christopher S. Welch
title: these things are great
content: I use them while traveling or working and the sound that comes out of them is amazing.. the battery life is fantastic as well.... Well done Bose!!

author: patrick j evans sr
title: they fall apart
content: the head phones are very cheaply made the ear peices fall apart so you dont have a seal for the noise cancelation  to work properly and sound quality dropes way off  an trien to get hold of suport is a big run around sending you back to where you started on the web site or call a number for 350 dollars an can buy junk at wall mart an replace them every month or 2 all an all the worse purchace i have ever had with bose

author: Jim Bihr
title: Wow!, Why the heck did I wait!
content: The sound quality is so clear it's like listening to music you never heard before. The noise cancelling, fit , and feel is outstanding. I formally had very high end stereo gear and now the quality is back. Could not be more satisfied.

author: Ilene
title: Super comfy and great sound
content: I travel a lot and these have saved my sanity more times then I can count. Especially on the plane. I wear glasses and have found these to be comfortable while wearing both (glasses and headphones. U can change the noise canceling setting so you don’t lose your situational awareness. Also, I’m told that the phone calls sound a lot clearer when I’m using the headphones.

author: Fashion is my Passion
title: You get what you pay for.
content: Fantastic gift. Our granddaughter loves him

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love it!!
content: Love it!!

author: Era
title: Not surprising...
content:
These headphones are AMAZING. I owned the Bose On-Ear headphones and wanted something that would completely block out other sound, yet remain comfortable. They are fantastic and do both of those things, plus some.

When the sound canceling option is set to High, it does give me headaches and I can't listen to it that way for very long. When set on Mid, it doesn't affect me as much. I'm not sure why this is the case, but I usually find myself turning off the sound canceling option, completely defeating the purpose of the headphone's main feature. They also heat up very quickly when using the sound cancelling features. The cups are incredibly soft with a leather padding, making them quite comfortable to wear, but I believe this is the main reason they heat up so quickly. I have yet to try different ear cups, but I may do so in the near future. These two reasons are why I had to give them a 4-star rating.

These headphones produce amazing sound, don't get me wrong. I do find myself using my On-Ear headphones more than these, but they're still great. These headphones would be perfect for someone who travels and finds themselves on airplanes often. I know that's rather specific, but blocking out the sound of the plane is an amazing feature. If you're going to pick up these headphones, you MUST download the Bose app to your phone. It isn't necessary to using them, but it is a HUGE help if you find yourself in the same headache-y predicament that I was.

author: Holt109
title: Expected better from this brand.
content: I love my headphones, but I really thought the sound canceling was going to be stronger & the sound more crisp.  This was my 1st bose set and unfortunately, not so impressed. I have yet to see if there's a more quality headset on the market.

author: R. H. Dudley
title: Happ With  - My Bose headset
content: On time and performs as expected

author: Pete Fife
title: The BEST and nothing less than Bose sound quality.
content:
I am a cheap guy, and I have continued to buy cheap < $50 headphones.  This was a giant leap to make but so glad I have.  My primary desire was seamless switching between my computer and iPhone.  I make many video conference calls while needing to take calls on my phone so needing a set of headphones which can connect to two devices via Bluetooth, Multipoint.  These fit the bill to a T.  Only had them for a couple of days but worked with making phone calls and video calls without one issue!

The other thing I wanted was the noise canceling due to working from home AND my kids are homeschooled AND my office butts up against the laundry room.  At times there the laundry is going as well as kids running around, my son plays the cello.  I will have to say I had no clue when the washer was on the spin cycle and my son was playing the cello, and I did not know while on a call.  When I took off the Headsets, it took me a second to figure out what all the noise was.

Previously I have purchased a set of LG and Mpow headsets and both connected, however, had constant issues with connecting to both and voice call quality from cell phone when it was connected to the computer as well.

author: Jonathan Linford
title: Great heaphones, Bluetooth needs help
content:
Let me start off by saying, these are the best headphones I've ever had. I love them. They sound amazing, fit great and are very good for an active lifestyle. I have only one issue with them:
One of the advertised features is that you can connect to 2 devices and the headphones will intelligently detect which device is sending audio and sound it to your ears. This has been very glitchy for me. I have a Macbook Pro and a Galaxy S7. When it is connected to both devices, it will always prioritize my Macbook, even if no audio is coming from the macbook and audio IS coming from my galaxy.
This is my only gripe with the product. Other than that, I love it. Send me any test products that you would like me to test and review.

author: Kora
title: Bose sound quality does not disappoint!
content: Purchased these for my husband who is a PC gamer.  He loves them and they have amazing sound quality.  They do have a slight lag for gaming but not too noticeable.  I had to purchase a second pair for myself for listening to music and podcasts.

author: gd
title: my set has a flaw, otherwise might be 5 stars
content: So the fit is great, battery life too.  As long as I'm not moving around sound is good.  But just walking, with NC turned on, causes a scratching sound on right channel.  Going to be sending it to Bose and hope they can fix it.  If the NC is not on, the scratching is either gone, or so low I don't hear it.

author: Andrew S.
title: Bluetooth Nightmare
content:
Updated: Increased from 2 stars to 3 stars. The quality is magnificent and when paired with 1 device, seems to work well without any problems. The multi-pairing is still a huge issue and should never be advertised by Bose as a premium feature. I use these routinely for travel and for listening to music, but simply cannot recommend them for professional use.

I loved my Bose QC2's from way back when, and was really excited to order this pair since I have been saving up to go wireless for some time down.

I am disappointed. Not in the sound quality or noise cancellation at all, as of course Bose is the top of the line.

It is the bluetooth software. These things cannot stay connected to my devices (2016 13" Macbook Pro and iPhone X). I bought these to use in a business setting as I work from home and have video conferences with my colleagues everyday. I have had nothing but issues so far. I want SO desperately to like these, as when they are paired to a single device and not being used for phone calls, they are magnificent. But that is not the function as advertised, and its not what I expect from the top of the line headphones that cost $350.

I have been in meetings with clients where my audio completely stops working and I need to exit the Google Meet window and completely restart Chrome. Not to mention, when connected to two devices, if one of the other devices makes a sound of any type (notification sounds, music playing) the audio lags and drops out, then comes back sped up and then drops out again, rinse repeat. There are even times when I have my phone in my hand, and the headphones will just randomly unpair with them. At this point, I have owned them for 2 weeks and I am bitterly disappointed.

If I got a lemon pair, I'd love to hear from Bose to explain the situation, but from what I can see from forums online, this is not an isolated incident. If I cannot figure out how to make these work more consistently, I will be returning them and looking for an alternate brand. For shame, Bose. I am a huge fan and these are a disgrace.

author: MPetrova
title: Fantastic
content: I love these. My second set (lost the first). Incredibly comfortable, sound is pristine.

author: Sean Whipple
title: This is my second pair and I still love them
content: Had the older model of these but they were unfortunately stolen out of my car :(.  Replaced them again and these headphones are fantastic.  Excellent noise cancellation, great sound quality, and I use them all the time

author: Octavia T. Parker
title: Best headphones
content: Love the headphones. Noise canceling is great and sound is wonderful.

author: Megascott
title: Great performance and fit.
content: I use these on my travels and I travel allot. So far the battery last longer than even the longest 14hr flight. And the ear cups are lasting much longer than expected. I have had to replace the cable to plug in to most Airplane IFE. But that's the only failure.

author: Brandon Zeng
title: Bose QuietComfort
content: I'm normally not a headphone user, but after using these I wear this everyday going to and from classes. These headphones are very comfortable and don't strain your ears over a long period of usage. The sound quality is pretty good and balanced for all types of music. The noise cancelling feature is very convenient, especially when trying to study in noisy places, makes it feel like your in your own isolated place.

author: Matt H.
title: Difficult to keep connected
content: I bought these as I take many conference calls and enjoy listening to music when working.  Music is great, but the headset keeps disconnecting from my phone and computer.  Makes it very difficult to use them and prob will be sending them back

author: C. Webb
title: Amazing sound quality
content:
Love these, amazing sound I'm so glad I finally bought these.
Very comfortable
Hooked up to my tv... love them!

author: Keith Goreham
title: Wonderful Hardware Let Down By Poor Software
content:
This review would be 5 stars if not for one very bad flaw in these headphones. The moment you make a call, the noise canceling turns off and you (and whoever you're calling) will hear everything around you – amplified – while you're on the phone. It's so bad that I have to use my old QC25 wired headphones for calls (which work perfectly for this), and only use the QC35-S2's for wireless listening to music/podcasts/tv while doing other things. This is beyond ridiculous for headphones of this price.

As for their performance purely as listening devices, the noise canceling is slightly (but only slightly) better than the wired QC25's, but the tonal range is slightly worse in the base tones. Their ability to connect to multiple devices is great, but suffers from a tendency for them to want to connect to multiple devices AT ONCE (iphone + something else, for instance), which about half the time causes no audio to be played through them at all, even though the source is muted when they're selected. You then have to remove them from each device you've paired them to, and start over to get sound back.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best purchase I ever made!
content: Love my headphones!  Quality....as Bose always is!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not value for money
content: Not value for the money. Also product kept losing Bluetooth connection. I have the wired one and guess will have to still to it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Witchcraft Involved in Noise Cancellation?
content: I am forced to the conclusion that witchcraft must have been employed in the creation of the noise cancellation in these headphones. Just now I had nothing playing on them while lying in bed and out of curiosity I turned off the noise cancellation. I was confused when I suddenly heard a loud rumbling. I took off the headphones and realized it was my white noise machine on my bedside table. I keep it pretty loud to drown out noises from outside the house. I turned the noise cancellation back on and the sound completely disappeared. How in the world can it do that? I mean, maybe white noise is something particularly easy for them to cancel out, but that is still incredible. Is someone playing a prank on me and just turning the noise machine off as soon as I hit the noise cancellation button? I might think so, but if I lean in really close to it, a bit of the sound gets through. A seemingly unrealistically small amount... and yeah, yeah the headphones sound amazing when you play stuff in them or whatever too.

author: Michele Wierman
title: CONSTANT CLICKING NOISE
content: Just received and tried my new quitecomfort 35 II headset and there is a loud and constant clicking noise when I try to listen to music.  Which I now have a headache.  I just noticed the back of the box states made for ipod, iphone & ipad.  I have an LG phone.  If this is the reason why I get the clicking noise, than maybe when purchasing an option should be given regarding if your phone is apple or android for no where on the product description does it state for Apple.  So disappointed.  Will definitely be returning.

author: kelly
title: Comfortable
content: Best headsets on market.  Use in airplane.  Needs doggle of phone.

author: Dana Stabenow
title: I was worried that these headphones couldn't possibly be worth the price.
content: But after a five-hour overnight flight with the two guys in the row in front of me talking loudly from takeoff to touchdown, I caved and bought them. Great sound for music and podcasts and pretty effective white sound as well. Way better than the in-ear Bose earphones which keep falling out. My only quibble would be that my ears are sore after having them on for that long.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Quality
content: The quality of sound of these headphones is outstanding. I could not believe the highs and lows produced which almost replicated the experience of being in the concert hall.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Underwhelming, would not buy, would return if possible
content:
It's hard to describe how disappointed I am with this product, especially at its price point. If you're on the fence about buying this item, just google "QC35 can't connect to PC" or any similar phrase. Hundreds of still unsolved posts with a handful of solutions that don't work for most people.

Getting these headphones to pair with your PC via bluetooth is a NIGHTMARE. Even using a USB bluetooth dongle is not a guarantee that the headphones will stay paired to your PC.  It's also a widely known issue that Bose hasn't adequately addressed. If you're not planning to connect the headphones to your PC, you might have better luck with this product.

The sound quality is decent, but again underwhelming for the price point. The bass is pretty weak.

author: vulcan
title: As perfect as can be!
content: These are as perfect as they can be especially for airplane use.  They are designed to allow voices to come through (although somewhat soft) so you can hear the announcements but they block out all other background noise.  I used them on a plane where a baby was screaming the entire flight.  I mean screaming!.  These headphones blocked that almost entirely.  And of course the Bose sound is great.  Soooo comfortable.  I wore them on a 4 hour flight and had no head/ear fatigue whatsoever.  Super easy to set up and connects flawlessly every time.  Somewhat pricey but worth every penny!

author: zookeeper
title: Noise cancellation could be better. My QC20 earbuds are MUCH better at reducing ...
content: Noise cancellation could be better. My QC20 earbuds are MUCH better at reducing noise (conversations on the train) but the sound quality is better here.

author: Spencer
title: Superb sound quality.
content: Accidentally dropped 1st pair in a pond. Stopped working. Loved them so much I purchased another one. Perfect sound. Pretty good at noise canceling. Long battery life.

author: Rachel
title: Exccccceeeelllleennnttt
content: Believe the hype. Best headphones on the market compared to competitors in this price range. Know that you’ll still be able to hear people talking but not what they’re saying. Really helps when your distracted by noise or have to work in an open/public space.

author: dmf
title: Great buy
content: Love sound quality and noise cancellation.

author: Luis
title: Amazing sound quality but wasnt satisfied with the noise cancellation
content: The sound on these headphones are very good, its what i expected. Was a little disappointed with noise cancellation even with music on i could still hear my surroundings. Bluetooth gets cut off randomly for like a couple seconds then continues to play music again. They're good but they got its cons.

author: R. Lehmann
title: Comfortable for my 12 hour shifts
content: I work in a server room at work at a desk for 12 hours, these block the noise and are very comfortable. Some pressure for my ears when using ANC for the first time or two, don't notice it anymore though. Ears do not get hot which is a plus, the only complaint is the fact it only comes with a 3 foot audio cable (5ft would have been nice). Still - 5 stars.

author: Amazon Customer
title: system goes into infinite loop about the battery and if I plug in the wire directly the sound is horrible. I need to hold the wire in place ...
content: They stopped working after 2 months... system goes into infinite loop about the battery and if I plug in the wire directly the sound is horrible. I need to hold the wire in place to hear anything... They are too expensive to go out so quickly.

author: Vernita Mitchell
title: Excellent noise canceling headphones
content: I love them. They help my tinnitus quiet down. Plus they are beautiful and have great sound quality.

author: Alan Johnson
title: Simply Amazing
content: Simply Amazing!!!!  Great sound quality.  Battery life ridiculous.  Love it.

author: Chris Behringer
title: AWESOME!
content: Very impressed with these! I gave them to my boyfriend as a gift and he loves them! No comparison to the other BOSE set he used to use!!

author: Esther Rodriguez
title: Listed as Series II, but when Bose looks up serial #, it is a Series 1
content: I had this product for a little over 1 year. I enjoyed it up until the charging port stopped working out of nowhere. These headphones were always really taken care and only used on flights (not used very often). It surprised me that with minimal use, the charging port would stop working. I called into Bose for trouble shooting, they do not repair the headphones. What they do is try and up sell you on an "upgraded" product. That is not even the most disappointing part!! I paid extra money at the time to have the Series II. It turns out that once the product serial number was ran with Bose, they confirmed that Amazon sold me a Series I that was listed as a Series II. Amazon is usually great, but this specific situation was not very pleasant. : (

author: Regina Flaten
title: Must use with Apple Music only!!! Really Bose??? This is America!!!!
content: Must use with Apple Music. This is a deal breaker for me! I sent it back!

author: Danay
title: Doesn't switch devices properly
content: It doesn't switch properly between devices, I have a Macbook and a Pixel2, and was a nightmare to get it to switch to my phone. It connects to the phone and I stop getting audio from the phone speakers but I don't hear anything on the headphones and the switch button is useless. On top of it when I open the app in my phone it can't connect to the headphones. Also I couldn't achieve really high volume on them, but this is minor, everything else was great, but with this price it needs to be just perfect and they weren't, I returned them.

author: Lawlady0505
title: I love these
content: I wear these everyday.  I have some trouble answering and disconnecting calls from the headset but overall I will buy again

author: Jennifer Adams
title: Superior in every way
content: Researched a lot between this and Sony. I have no regrets. Superior in every way. I live with a disabling Traumatic Brain Injury. Very sound sensitive. These are a Godsend!!!!

author: Adam
title: It's great
content: Bought this through Amazon with payments and I couldn't be happier.  Great headset with easy connectivity and great sound.  Phone calls on this are perfect, my friends can hear me better than ever and vice versa.

author: Lindy M.
title: Great sound and noise canceling
content: My husband accidentally left his new headphones on plane.  Came home and ordered another one. Love them

author: Ariel
title: Very good. Not excelent
content:
I expected more of noise cancellation. Was not as effective as I expected.

Sound is very good, but again not was I expected. For a $300 bose headphone, I expected more bass.

Battery life is lengthy. You can use it for several hours (maybe about 8 hours?) before need charging.

I found it EXTREMELY hard to connect to Windows 10. As I Googled the "how-to", I've seen several posts with people going thorugh this. Apparently, you must charge bose to 100%, clear the bluetooth list, and hope for Windows to list it. Not Bose's fault though, just so you know that you'll end up succeeding, despite the strife.

Overall, it is a good product. I don't regret purchasing it. I'm a Bose fan, but if I could go back in time I wouldn't mind trying other brands as well.

author: natalie
title: Terrible bluetooth connectivity
content: The connectivity to apple devices on on these via Bluetooth is terrible. It won’t find my device, keeps connecting to the same one, and won’t go into pairing mode. So much for “up to 8 devices of connectivity.” There’s no way.  I’m having so much trouble that I may have to return them. Huge bummer.

author: IMRAN AFZAL
title: the best head phones ....
content: love these head phones....

author: Happy Camper
title: that pretty much explains the 5 star rating
content: This was a birthday gift for my husband, after we set it up he commented "how did I ever live without this!"  So, that pretty much explains the 5 star rating!

author: Alex Felger
title: My new favorite headphones!
content: I've been using the Audio Technica ATH-M50x for a while now with my phone but I wanted something with noise cancelling and bluetooth functionality. The price is worth it for what you get here. I am very happy with all of the features these offer. One of my favorite features is the ability to switch between paired devices easily through the mobile app.

author: David Zweben
title: Surprisingly good sound
content: I was never a Bose fan, but I bought these for someone and was gifted them back, and they're great. Very comfortable, good battery life, best noise cancelling I've heard (although it still has its limits), and surprisingly good sound quality that, to my ear, keeps pace with $310 wired headphones. Recommended.

author: Michal Malus
title: Excellent noise reduction
content: Great audio quality. Amazing active noise reduction (even in the open space you know people talk around but their conversations do not bother at all). Not that great for phone calls (especially with the noise reduction - hard not to talk to loud).

author: Marco Forcone
title: A lifesaver for frequent flyers
content:
It took me a long time to pull the trigger on these given the cost... but I'm glad I did.  I've used them on several flights already and am kicking myself for not having bought them long ago.

Noise Cancellation:
They do an excellent job of cancelling the most of drone of the engine noise and most loud conversations/babies.  Operative word is "most".

Comfort
Very light and comfortable.  I wear glasses and find that the temple of the glasses is uncomfortable with the headset on, so I simply remove my glasses when wearing the headphones.

Build Quality
I don't get the sense these are rugged by any means.  That said, it's a trade off between the weight.  Personally, I would have preferred an extra ounce or two and more solid feel.  That said,  if you take good care of your toys, I don't see any issue.  The hard case that they came in protects them well when not wearing them.

Battery life seems fine.  I don't foresee any concerns on long-haul flights.  I keep the charging cable and plug in my case with them.

Headphone Jack
They come with a cable so they can be plugged into typical airline jacks for entertainment.  They do work on the proprietary airline two prong jacks (typically in premium economy or business) by plugging them in the single larger jack.

Bluetooth Pairing
Work great with my iPhones and laptop.  Which is perfect for taking work calls while at home.

author: Greg in Jax FL
title: Five Stars
content: Did not think they could be better but they are.

author: PJB
title: They are ok
content:
Bought 1 pair and didn't care for them so I gave to my husband.  Bought a 2nd pair because of crying kids and loud excited old ladies on train at christmas and didn't want to listen to them on trip home on train. My head might be a tad too small. Wish they made them in a smaller size.
They do not block out sound at all, not even close to it. It just muffleds sound. Makes sound less sharp and shrill.

author: Johnny B.
title: I wish I bought this a year ago......
content:
Very comfortable
Great noise cancellation
Works w/ 2 devices
Good sound quality
Button to switch off noise cancellation
Great headset
Compact for travel.

author: PC Master
title: Poor Signal
content: Signal is very poor with even the slightest interruption or distance. They work great with direct line of sight for about 10ft. Any impediment will cut signal. I had my phone on an arm band and sometimes if I would turn my arm it would cut out. Putting my phone in my back pocket will make it cut in and out. Beautiful quality of sound and such just not worth it if you don't have direct line of sight within a few feet.

author: Jeffrey D. Milton
title: Five Stars
content: So amazingly nice when working from home during the summer with the kids.

author: Sharise A. Keels
title: Must buy!!
content: My daughter loves these.  Great sound, noice canceling and heavy duty wireless headphones.

author: Robert Cochrane
title: Best headphones.
content: Amazing. I cant wait until they update it with Alexa.

author: J. Pinegar
title: Great headphones. Perfect if you also own AirPods.
content: Perfect if you also own AirPods. Top of their class. But could be better for working out. Especially if the over ther ear cushion was waterproof. Everything I don’t like about one I love about the other. Not to they are not both excellent in their own right though.  Both doing what they do best exceeding well. Together they fulfill all of my headphone needs. The Bose has better sound and superb noise cancellation. I only gave it 4 because it isn’t 100%. But no consumer headphones are. I only have to charge it about once a week. The AirPods are the most portable and convenient to use headphones I’ve ever seen. When you wear them they are practically weightless. And I don’t have to worry about them falling out. Your mileage may very on the fit. Plus being able to hear the outside world is about a plus when you are jogging or skiing. For home, office, airplane, and the like these Bose headphones will not disappoint.

author: BMo
title: Really good 'phones
content: Whoa! These 'phones are super! Previously used Bose wired 'phones and liked them a lot, but these are even better. Highly recommend. Seller delivered promptly.

author: hidden name
title: Go to a store to buy these.
content: Do yourself a favor and go to a store so you can hold the product you are buying.  I am sure my order was used because there was wear in the joints and wear on some of the pivot points where the plastic started to fade from use.  As well I think these have been sitting in the warehouse so long that the batteries are no good, I can only hold a charge for about 6 hours with low noise cancellation.  The photo only shows about one month of use, use that consists of me sitting at my desk to use strictly with my desktop computer.

author: clbsnakeriver
title: Great for cancelling noise on a plane, e.g., crying children or barking dogs.
content: I liked that I was not connected to a cord.  I have used them several times since purchasing them from travel on planes to use them when I vacuum.  They do a great job of cancelling the noise of the vacuum.

author: Anonymous
title: Excellent headphones.
content: These Bose Quiet Comfort 35’s are great for flights that have talkative people or crying babies. The noise canceling is a true saver. The music streamed via Bluetooth is high quality too. Definitely recommend.

author: John D. Coutts
title: Best Noise-cancelling Headphones Ever
content: I like the fact that these headphones will Bluetooth to two devices at a time. If my phone rings while I'm watching TV, it will automatically switch to my phone's audio. When I finish the call it tunes back to my TV's audio. I mean to tell you it cancels out ALL outside sound. So if you're cooking food set to a timer, don't wear these because you won't hear the timer or anything at all. Outstanding for noisy situations around the job or home when you're trying to concentrate on music or audio on your TV.

author: Ernie Simpson
title: Love music and silence, these give me both.
content: I’m not an audiophile and do not want to get into THAT argument. These deliver not only pleasant sound quality but also SILENCE when I need it. I use it every day, they are easily transportable and the battery life is long. They are also easily rechargeable and connect with all my stuff. Seems like the kind of item that does better when cared for.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent sound, comfortable, good for telephone, but a bit fragile in material.
content: Note this review is from a very recent owner, so no idea how well these headphones will hold up in the long-term. Music sound quality is excellent. Talking on the telephone is good both for the user and the person at the other end. Noise cancellation works decently but don't expect this to be of construction quality if you like listening to music while using jackhammers.  Material quality seems fragile, the item appears prone to easy breakage/tearing. The provided semi-hard case is protective but not crush-resistant.  In the online instruction book if you want to find how out how to watch movies on airplanes using the headphones, good luck finding the answer; you have to plough elsewhere through reviews and ‘questions asked’ for the answer. No airline adapter is included; apparently the headphones can be used with the provided cable on many airlines (but I have not tested this). The headphones work well for a phone or laptop without apps so consider staying away from all the associated apps if you have privacy concerns.

author: IZOMU13
title: Perfect
content: Good noise canceling

author: Leonardo Baez
title: Perfect for frequent coach traveler
content:
Incredible noise cancelling. I bought this pair since 2018 will be a heavy travelling year for me, and after first travel it does not disappoint!!!
International coach travel could de painful in many ways, but having a crying baby nearby a 7+ hours flight can be hellish.
It makes my travels more tolerable, its like put your surroundings in mute, but still can hear safety demonstrations and announcements. The assistant button i have it set up as NC level switch.
Some people complains about discomfort after several hours, but for me the only problem is taht in warm conditions my ears get wet, I hope the leather cushions hold it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Sounds good
content: Noise cancellation not the best

author: Mvera
title: Sound quality
content: Very comfortable, noise cancelling is excellent. Sound quality is overall good. I personally prefer deep bass on my headphones but this Bose headphones do not deliver on that. My Jaybird X3 have excellent sounds quality, if only Bose's headphones had the same or even better sound quality I would 100% recommend.

author: SHERRY VOGT
title: Bose
content: Best ever purchased anywhere. These are exceptional, my boyfriend loves them

author: me
title: I can't hear my husband snoring!
content: These keep me from hating my husband for snoring! I dont even hear his box fan. I have very sensitive outer ears and can not stand to have them touched these fit around them perfectly. I've had to learn to be a back sleeper instead of a side sleeper but other than that these are great. Battery life is awesome. I listen to books while I fall asleep and have them on every night and I charge them on average once a week. My husband uses them for gaming some but they are difficult to connect to the TV/ps4 through blue tooth but once he gets all that set up he likes them.

author: Britt Mabry
title: Well worth the price
content: These headphones are pricey but are well worth the expense if you travel a lot.  I'm the kind of person who prefers to read on planes, but on my last trip I wore these and just listened to Spotify while reading.  It was such a relief to not have the loud, constant background noise of the engines droning on and on!  My husband and I each have a pair and they're awesome for travel.  We also use them a lot when watching television... if one of us is working on homework, the other will use their headset to watch their favorite shows so it's not distracting.

author: David J. OBrien
title: LOVE these
content: Bought 2 of these for my wife and I when we take our trip to Las Vegas. Need something to drain out the airplane noise as we watch movies. The sound is awesome, we had purchased my son a Sony brand similar to these for Christmas and he didn't like them and had me return them for a set of these as well. Love the case they come in to help protect them in your backpack as well.

author: Vilius
title: I'm loving it
content:
It's my 1st ANC headphones. I'm huge fan of Bluetooth headsets, so I'm using it wirelessly.

Pros:
• Very good for work - I'm not distracted by colleagues' conversations any more.
• Noice cancellation is perfect - all outside sounds are removed, but if I someone would talk loudly near by, I could hear it quietly. That's perfect for not being distracted by random conversations around, but still be able to hear if someone would want to talk to me.
• Battery life is great
• App is very nice (only just few little complaints)
• Holds on my head very conveniently
• Has automatic sleep mode, so it's convenient if I forget it on my table turned on
• Supports two devices. Works better than expected (no other headphones worked that well for me before)

Cons:
• I can hear some ultrasound
• Strange feeling during 1st days of usage, but I think, I got used to it already.
• App does not remember what noice cancellation level I had set before (wanted to use it in a Low mode during 1st days, but now I got used to High mode).
• I'm not yet used to keep it on my neck - too big for me, restricts my head movements
• Some small issues with switching between two devices. Got confused couple of times which device is being connected to, but overall it supports two devices best as from my experience with other devices.

author: Kevin W.
title: I love them
content: After reading several reviews I was very hesitant to order these headphones.  I took the plunge though and I couldn't be happier with them.  I'm not a music fanatic like a lot of people are, but I do enjoy nice quality sound.  These headphones do the trick for me.  The sounds are crisp and clear with these.  One thing I did find is that, like others mentioned in their reviews, the range of the Bluetooth is not very far.  For me that's not a big deal at all, but for others it may be a consideration.  Overall I'm very happy with my headphones and I use them everyday.

author: Kathy Geske
title: Comfortable, easy to use
content: Comfortable, easy to use. I get good battery life from them. The only negative is that you can't really get too much volume from them. I know .. we're not supposed to blast music, but sometimes I want to crank them up higher! Sound quality is excellent, however. The noise cancellation works pretty well too. That's a plus when you have noisy neighbors like I do.

author: Austin Sommer
title: Best headphones
content: Love these headphones because i prefer headphones that go over my ear instead of ear buds. Noise cancellation works beautifully. They also hooked up to my poll hone without a problem. The option of either wired or wireless is great.

author: Hui Yue
title: looks great
content: Looks, and sounds great. Though I'm annoyed that I can't set the noise cancelling to a  lower level by default with the app nor on the headphone. Other than that no problems.

author: James M. Rhoades
title: Bose vs. Sony: use case matters
content:
Don’t write reviews often but I recently struggled with the decision between these headphones and the Sony wh1000mx3. I ended up purchasing both to test and landed on the Bose. First and foremost, these are both phenomenal noise cancelling headphones and most people would be happy with either. Just to name a few things I liked about each product and why I seemingly went against the grain and chose the Bose over the Sony’s:

Fit: both were extremely comfortable. I give a slight edge to the Bose as I received a little less clamping force. Mind you I have a larger sized head so most people likely wouldn’t perceive the difference.

Controls: I preferred the Sony’s controls only because I feel like everything is touch now and it felt natural. I know there is a cold weather issue but I’m mostly using these indoors in an office setting and occasional air travel.  I also preferred Sony’s inclusion of usb c.

Sound(music): simply put my ears preferred the Sony sound. The Bose sound very good (neutral) but I preferred the sound of the Sony’s.

Phone: and here is why I chose the Bose. And this is where for me, my use case meant the Sony’s were not an option. The Sony’s were unusable on work conference calls. Even in a quiet environment other participants couldn’t hear me. The Bose were exceptional in this regard. Also, the ability of the Bose to connect to two Bluetooth devices simultaneously is invaluable (for my use case).

In summation, both are great headphones and you should really determine your use case before deciding.  For me, the Bose voice quality and the seamless Bluetooth connectivity between multiple devices out weighed the Sony’s exceptional noise cancelling, controls, and audio sound.

author: J. Wong
title: I love these headphones more than I thought I would
content: I love these headphones more than I thought I would.  Great sound, fits very comfortably even on very long international flights; I've worn them from west coast USA to Singapore and back.  The Series II also makes it very easy to switch between your devices.  I've had these for almost three months now and I love them.

author: Dennis
title: The best. Buy them, you won't regret it.
content: I bought these for my wife, because I often have loud band practice in our basement. Previously, she could hear it through the floor. Now, she watches TV in peace while I flail around with my other 40-something buddies making noises on guitars and drums. She couldn't even hear me vacuuming in the other day, in the same room. Crazy!

author: Linsey
title: Walk Away Homie
content:
I searched and researched and stressed. Then I bought these.
At first I was really impressed; noise cancelling was excellent, sound was vibrant.
After just 2 weeks I was noticing I wasn't getting text notifications and the upper end was blown out. I was always craving more bass.
They also fit me pretty terribly. I have a large head and the band was still too large. The pads pressed uncomfortably into my industrial and gauged lobes.

Needless to say, I returned these headphones. The Sonys I replaced them with are a much better value and sound.

author: Extract0r
title: Very comfortable but sound quality is mediocre at best
content:
My silver QC35 II arrived with a deep crease in the right ear cushion.  You can say it is a minor cosmetic issue, but it is annoying on a brand new product.  Anyway, here is my brief review of this product.

1.  These headphones are very comfortable to wear, but when the noise callenation is turned on, I feel a weird pressure sensation and minor pain in my ears.
2.  The iOS app is minimalistic and there is no EQ adjustment option.
3.  The volume is way too low.  I have to crank it up to 85-90% to achieve what decent earphones put out at 60%.  (Btw, I have a very good hearing and never use excessive volume when listening to music.)
4.  The system voice has a horrendously funny accent.  Everytime it connects to my iPad, it makes me giggle.
5.  The biggest problem is the poor audio quality.  Everything just sounds very flat and unremarkable.  High and mid range sound very dull and muted and bass is just average.  Shockingly, the sound quality of these $300 headphones is comparable to the $10 Apple earphones that came with my iPhone.
6.  Multi pairing is very convenient when swapping between an iPhone and an iPad.  You don’t have to disconnect and reconnect the bluetooth connection, but sometimes it gets confused and wouldn’t play from the correct source device.
7.  Nice clicky physical buttons for controls.
8.  Bose should have killed the Micro USB.  Micro USB is DEAD.

Here is my score for Bose QC35 II and Sony 1000XM3.  I have owned both and this is my subjective opinion.
Bose QC35 II (9.5/9.5/10/5/8)
Sony 1000XM3 (8.5/8.5/9/9.5/8)
(Design/Build Qualify & Material/Comfort/Sound Quality/Features)

author: T. F.
title: The sound is good. Comfort is nice
content: The sound is good. Comfort is nice. But beware petite girls out there. Not for us. This does not fit our heads, it falls off all the time. Sony one seems to fit better, in the sense that it feels more secure. The noise canceling though is best with Bose, no doubt about it, although I will say I was expecting more. I am very unhappy that this is too big for my head. Now I understand why people say it's so "comfortable" compared to Sony's. No wonder. This is for giant heads. Although I am petite, my head is not small. Anyway, I don't know. But the product is good, there is no doubt about that.

title: Not as comfortable as the original QC35 headset
content: I have used Bose headsets for years and like their simplify and performance.  That being said I find this set of headphones is not as comfortable and they tend to pinch the top of my ears after wearing for more than 2 hours.  I have tried adjusting the head strap but have not yet found the sweet spot.  Sound quality is good and I like the flexibility of the bluetooth versus wired.  The wire cable they provide is kind of wimpy and can easily be broken so I replaced with a better quality.  The ability to share music with another set of headset is great.  My wife and I can watch a move together

author: EricP
title: Do it
content:
Been using these in the office for a few weeks now. Great noise cancellation for drowning out the sound of chatty colleagues. Also, work great for Skype/BlueJeans conference calls.

Finally took these on a  business trip & absolutely love how these perform on flights. Battery lasts very long - been using a lot over the last 3-days and still have 60% battery left. Great sound quality & the noise cancellation saved me from having to turn the volume up super loud. Very happy with my purchase.

author: Ian Donnelly
title: High Quality Sound & Long Battery Life
content:
Material Quality: This is a high quality build that is pretty durable, but will require some taking care of and case protection traveling and not in use [4/5]
Comfort: The headphone ear cushions are pretty comfortably, but can irritate after long periods of time for those that don't wear over the ear headphones[5/5]
Sound Quality: The sound quality is amazing a really captures a 360 experience (Pretty close to Dolby Technology), but with the noise cancellation (i.e. when you power on your device) while traveling in any moving vehicle moving at 20+ mph can feel like the high pressures disturb the eardrums. [4/5] Recommendation: utilize your radio or speakers when you can.
Loudness: Just enough not to destroy your ears. But, you can also install an audio enhancement app on your phone to modify this easily (not recommended or needed though) [5/5]
Battery Life: Rarely need to charge the headphones as the batter life is great, even when playing for long periods of times (4-6hrs for 2-3 days) and not charging it until the middle of the week. [5/5]
Recharging: Fast recharging and Fully charges even faster [5/5]

author: EW
title: great if you are totally dead inside
content:
I’m a 35 year old woman. I’ve got good ears but I’m not a hardcore audiophile. I got these to listen to music in the house and work out with. They fit comfortably and I thought, how bad could the audio be? They sell a lot of these right? Big mistake. If you want comfort + the audio experience of thin background music with no bass and muffled highs, look no further. But if you want to feel alive and experience a range of joy and feeling with your music and aren’t completely dead inside, run the hell away. I don’t know what BOSE stands for, but it may as well be Bass Obliterated Sound Eviscerated.

Even if you aren’t middle aged, these headphones are enough to give you a midlife crisis. If this was all I had to listen to, no amount of sex or fast cars could make up for the deadening, soul numbing mediocrity of these headphones. Bring me some Ativan and a Coldplay Spotify playlist and let me end it all now. This hollow, consensual hallucination I call a life has nothing left in it for me.

That got dark quickly. I’d better return these. Getting the Sennheiser HD1 instead.

author: Evaluator
title: Works great and comfortable too.
content:
I wear these at work almost all day. They are very comfortable, stay charged a long time, charge fast and sound good. They are also fantastic on the plane to reduce noise. I usually travel first class so I can't say how well they'll work nearer the engines. I only had them for 6 months so how durable they are remains to be seen.

At work I use the headphone jack since my laptop doesn't let you eq anything going over wireless.

author: L337M4573RK
content: Great for long airline flights

author: Will
title: Top of the line.
content:
I haven't stopped using these since buying them at Christmas. They are amazing. Sound quality rocks, easy to install, works flawlessly with my phone, my computer and my echo devices.

All day comfort, shuts out distractions s all day long.

author: Vijay
title: Awesome! Just awesome
content: Awesome! Just awesome! Bluetooth connectivity is quick. Easy to install and well made, A great buy. I like it so much that I got another pair for my wife.

author: Michael Schaetzl
title: Great Product
content: Fast shipping and product as described.

author: FD Firefighter 121
title: Cant beat bose
content: Got this for my son for Christmas. I have the QC35 Series I so I expect this will be just as good if not better.

author: Public Name
title: Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) vs Sony WH1000XM2
content:
I purchased both this Sony WH1000XM2 and the Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II).  I am happy that I tried both because there are some big differences. The touch pad on the Sony was really nice for skipping a song on a playlist. The cups over the ear on the Sony are SMALL and the band puts a pretty tight pinch on your head. After using them for an hour it was uncomfortable. I couldn't see using these all day. The sound was excellent, bright and scintillating. For certain types of music this might be preferable. The base was not impressive. If you crank it  up, the base falls apart.
The QuietComfort 35 (Series II) as soon and I put on... I knew the Sony had go back. The larger cup on the Bose don't cramp your ear and the pads were like putting a soft pillow on your head.. so comfortable. You could wear this ALL DAY or on a long flight... in blissful comfort. The Bose have a more natural and undistored sounds compared to the Sony. The base is solid and tight all they way to the maximum volume on my phone. There is no question in my mind, or for what I need them for, that the Bose are hands down the better choice.

author: L. S.
title: Hubs Loves Them!
content: Got these for my hubs for Christmas and he loves them. Wore them for a few hours...super comfy and amazing sound. I want a pair now!

author: DDBYYZ
title: Outstanding
content: Love these. Convenient and sound is high fidelity

author: Ellis Freeman
title: Not worth the price
content: The best thing I love about this headphone is noise cancellation. By buddy bought from other brands 2 times lower price. Sound quality is same, although his headphone has more battery life. It seems I paid for branding not audio quality.

author: caconym
title: meh sound, great everything else
content:
The sound is about on par with what I'd expect from a good pair of headphones a third of the price (driven by an in-device DAC/amp, nothing fancy). Totally usable but the detail and presence just aren't present (heh).

Everything else is great, though. The noise canceling works very well, and even when it's turned off there is a fair amount of passive isolation. They are *very* comfortable and quite light. Build quality seems quite good; there's a thoughtful use of different materials throughout and there's no creaky plastic. Battery life also seems very good, and they charge relatively quickly.

The software side also seems to be in decent shape. I've had occasional weird connection issues but overall things work better than I generally expect.

I"m only dinging one star for the audio quality because it's fine and I'm sure the other constraints on closed-back wireless noise-canceling headphones with great battery life make it difficult to achieve sound like other headphones at the same price point but with none of those constraints. Overall I'm very glad I made this purchase.

author: Robert J. Cote
title: Had to go wireless with iPhone X
content: So I broke down and went for the high end Bose QuietComfort 35 at close to $350, and then went for a second pair of Bluetooth devices, the SoundCore Spirit X Sports Earphones by Anker for about $30.  For sound quality alone, the Bose wipe out the Ankers, no surprise.  Comfort also is much better with the Bose, although the multiple earpieces with the SoundCore really are helpful.  Noise cancellation - I can weedwhack while wearing the Bose and actually hear the music!  So no question, the Bose, is the first choice to be on my head.  That being said, the SoundCore take a close second place.  Why?  Working out they are much cooler on my head!  I do a lot of yard work, and it doesn’t take much in 70 degree plus weather for the full Bose ear muffs to get too hot.  Also, there are many circumstances when sound blocking is a very bad idea, such as being out walking or running along any trafficked road, etc.  And sometimes having something not so obvious on one’s head isn’t a bad idea.  Yes, for $30 you don’t get mind blowing sound, but the SoundCore’s are respectively fine for listening to podcasts, news, and music when needing to be aware of the external environment.  So my suggestion is to buy both.

author: Mary Ruiz
title: Beautiful sound ! Exceeded my expectations.
content: I like high end audio systems -  I own a full Sonos system at home - crisp sound and a good bass is very important to me. We are in the process to move the office to Open Space, and I decided to purchase these headsets to drown all sound and be able to concentrate. The day they arrived I tested them by vacuuming my house while my 2 dogs were barking like crazy. Normally this causes RUKUS and is an annoying chore, but this time, I couldn’t hear anything but my jam! Highly recommended

author: zackery blair
title: Five Stars
content: I love these!!!!!!!  They work fantastic!!!!!

author: youngun kim
title: amazing
content: you get more than what you paid for. this is the number one noise cancelling headphone

author: MrsNDuncan
title: You Can't Go Wrong!
content: Its Bose what can I sat! Traditionally I have always been a Beats gal but after moving to Bose I will never go back. Sound quality is excellent. Beats is not bad but the sound from BOSE is a WOW and the noise cancellation is my favorite.

author: Joe Sauvage
title: Great headphones
content: We had the previous Bose QuietComfort model earphones and thought those were awesome but the Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones are amazing. The noise-cancelling performance is much better than previous models...they are amazingly quiet and the sound quality is superb.

author: Adam Wespiser
title: My solution to our open office floor plan
content:
First pair of noise cancelling headphones. My use case is everyday office wear, light music, and using them without music to dampen office sounds. Comfort - Nice fit, without feeling like suction cups. I've worn them everyday for a couple weeks at work with no problem.  My ears sometimes get a little sore after 3+ hours of consecutive use.
Sound - These sound very good, especially at low volumes. Bose just does good speakers.
Noise Cancelling - It took me a day or two to get used to not being able to hear people come in and out of the office! Naturally, the class of sounds that are most easily cancelled are droning noises, so distant conversations, the sounds of people walking down hallways, and air vents are all gone. Two types of sounds do still come through: The first, is that I use a mechanical keyboard, so the sharp click of my keys pierces through. The next, is that deeper voices have a little bit more difficultly being filtered.

Overall, this noise cancelling is great, and I often use the headphones for this without music. It was between this pair and the Sony WH1000XM2. I went with the Bose for a couple reasons: My love of the last pair their headphones I owned (they sounded so good) vs. the current Sony headphones I have of the same type, the reviews stating the Sony NC headphones are uncomfortable and a little hot sometimes, and that the Sony pair requires you to have something actively playing for noise cancelling to be on.

So far, I've been very satisfied with this purchase, and I believe its increased my productivity by isolating me a little bit from my environment. The one thing I would make a little better is comfort into hour 4. I highly recommend these headphones.

author: MommyGreenest
title: Great Sound. Great Comfort. CHEAP MATERIALS
content: I loved these headphones, they were comfortable, sounded great and made long family car rides tolerable. BUT the earpiece cracked off the headband in less than 2 months and now I can't use and can't return them.

author: Brittany Minnesota
title: Amazing sound quality
content:
I upgraded from the 2nd wired edition and I’m never looking back, I love them!
A rep tried to sell me a competitor product at the airport and honestly is there even a comparison with music quality? I think not. These are comfortable over the ear, adjustable to fit your head preference. I love the cordless and corded feature in case you want to listen on the plane like I do. The only thing I would change is a quick button to turn off noise cancellation feature l. It may have it, I just haven’t figured it out yet.

author: gmolony
title: Inferior Bluetooth
content: I've been using noise cancelling Bose headsets since the 90's and they are excellent.  This is my first pair of Bluetooth and I am having the opposite experience with these. They are  difficult  to pair and have an extremely short range. With a direct line of sight a max range of 15' if there is a wall or door blocking line of sight the bluetooth fails. I have two other inexpensive $49 & $79 bluetooth headsets that out perform these. Very disappointed in these especially considering the price.

author: Rachie P
title: Great sound. Definitely would recommend.
content: Loving this headphone so far. Have had it a few days. The sound is fantastic. I use it for meditation mainly to block out the hubby and kids. Haha!

author: Jonny S
title: Outdated Technology
content:
I would give these Bose Headphones 5 Stars if we were living in 2016. We are in 2019 and for whatever reason, they still haven't upgraded these to Bluetooth 5.0 (which is a major upgrade from Bluetooth 4). It's behind the times. Catch up Bose, or someone else will.

Also, the style looks really cheap. Sony's WH model is super sexy.

Bose - your sound quality is great. But people want and expect more than that with wireless headphones. You know better than that. Prioritize properly or you'll lose a lot of business.

author: Minerva L. Granger
title: Best Christmas Present EVER!!
content: I bought this for my husband for Christmas.  He literally did not take it off until he ran out of battery sometime in mid-January.  He slept with this thing!  Luckily I'm not the jealous type.

author: Patricia Colbert
title: Perfect gift
content: My husband loves them, best birthday present.

author: CassandraRN
title: Good enough
content: I feel like for this price point the volume would be better as far as base goes.  Keeping just because I am not wanting to return to try the Sonys.

author: Shannon Lee
title: Light sleepers and misophoniacs - this will help your life
content: So first I have misophonia, im an insomniac and overall just very sensitive to sound. I was hesitant to spend so much money on headphones but I really needed something to give me a barrier between my brain and all the annoying sounds surrounding me day and night and I have to say these headphones are worth every penny! I no longer am woken up by my upstairs neighbors loud footsteps, I can hear my favorite songs clearly and vividly and when someone’s chewing loudly near me I can peacefully separate myself from them. I know most people aren’t seeking out this item for such extreme circumstances lol but I needed to share. Highly recommend.

author: terpsichorean
title: Well built, great sound... blows away the Sony MDR 1000X cans
content:
Quality cans. I bought these to help me relax and sleep on flights, not particularly for sound quality. But after a month I started using them on the old phone, computer, etc. I compared these head-to-head with some Sony MDR-1000X headphones - not so much that these were great, as the MDR-1000X had poor audio quality. My reference of 10+ years was my reliable set of Sony MDR-V6s. The MDR-V6 are known for their flat response - the QC35 II sounded 20% boomier and lacked some fine detail at the high end... but they blew away the MDR-1000X. The 1000X sounded far too boomy, to the point where I had to put on a "bass reducing" EQ.

OK, noise cancellation. I'm slightly a Sony fanboigh, and the noise cancellation quality is far superior to the MDR-1000X. Not even close. The 1000X sounds "artificial" - not-quite-cancelled - whereas the Bose feels like I'm turning on a mute button for the outside world. I am aware of Sony's "best noise cancellation industry" claims for the MDR-1000X and uh, no - not even close. Claims is just that, claims.

Best part of these headphones is the subtlety. They don't look flash. They felt a little plasticky, a little wobbly when I took them out of the case - closer inspection revealed they were made of GRP (glass-reinforced plastic). This is deceptively high quality stuff and is superior to the MDR-1000X. They blow away the Sonys in build quality. The Torx screws showed over torque marks but not more than by 1-2 lb/ft. I'm picking nits here, people. They are worth the scary high $400 if you need noise cancelling. If you just want great wired cans buy V6s - they will sound 20% better but don't have the woooonderful noise cancellation - I'm serious, it's very very good.

author: JM
title: Great product
content:
Work as advertised
Worth the cost

author: Sunshine 🌹
title: One word to describe this headset… Amazing!
content: This I believe is the best purchase I’ve made by far. I get motion sickness when flying but I’ve noticed since I’ve purchased these noise canceling headphones I no longer need anything for motion sickness because I don’t get sick anymore.

author: WhiteDog
title: Excellent Cat Toy
content: These are excellent headphones. But they depend on the quality of the Bluetooth transmitter you uses. I use an Avantree transmitter/receiver now that enables me to get good reception anywhere in my apartment. I've use inexpensive ones in the past and they had serious issues pairing reliably as well as more limited range. So don't cheap out. If you buy these expensive headphones, you need to match them with a good transmitter. By the way, the Bluetooth transmitter in my Sony TV doesn't work. At any rate my headphones don't see it. YMMV.

author: Brittany
title: Headphones
content: Boyfriend lived them

author: Armand Gerstenberger
title: good sound, poorly built..?
content:
Once the input jack connection inevitably wears out, the headphones will switch from bluetooth to wired connection
if you move your head slightly. This will trigger an automated voice message within the headphone to spell out the name of the Bluetooth connection each time- very obnoxious. I think a physical switch would be a huge upgrade for the headphones, as physically turning the input jack to switch between Bluetooth and wire connection can be extremely finicky. Also, make an option to suppress the connection voice within the app. From light use, my headphone switch is damaged and often only outputs from the left or right headphone unless the input jack is positioned just right. The quality of the physical product doesn't match the price imo.

author: Jacob Johnson
title: Buy once cry once! (Expensive because they are the best)
content: Killer headphones! The best I’ve ever owned! Using them at the gym and at work pretty much daily. They look classy and have great sound quality! I sweat a lot at the gym so they don’t stay dry all the time and bounce around in my gym bag; despite this rough treatment they are holding up very well! I wipe them down daily with standard disenfecting wipes. No problems to date in just over a year of owning these. Buy once cry once!

author: Tippitt
title: Works as advertised
content:
Works as advertised.  I do have a big head an the ear pads get a little uncomfortable after a few hours, but has been true for every headphones I have had. My Shure headphones sound better but are plastic and I have broken twice.  These seem to be made much better.

Noise cancellation is awesome on a plane or in my house when I am just trying read and my kids are running around.

author: C.C.
title: Comfort and Amazing Sound
content: Used on two 7+ hour plane trips. Very comfortable and amazing sound quality. To see how well the noise cancelation works, turn them off in flight. What a difference. I even put them on during an early morning hail storm - without playing music. Could barely hear the hail hitting the window.

author: J&K
title: Comfort, most external sounds decreased.
content: Cancels low engine rumble for air travel. Comfortable for 8-12 hour flight. Does not cancel voices- or sound within vocal range.  They are muted, but not removed. Sound quality is pleasant, but very non- linear. Strong increase in upper midrange, with gaps in certain sounds at middle and frequency ends- typical of bose sound.  A must for air travel- good investment.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Do not buy
content: DO NOT buy these headphones. Had them for just a year and took care of them and over the last few mi the they just stopped working. Audio would cut off. They don’t charge they don’t hold a charge and are constantly turning off .

author: Syed Shah
title: Very disapointed
content: I purchased this and was extremely excited.  This was one of the first Bose products I have owned/purchased.  Upon opening the box, I was extremely disappointed.  For $300, you will receive headphones that feel and look extremely cheap.  I initially thought the product might have been knock-off and called Bose.  I was assured this was just the way the product was.  The plastic feels extremely cheap and I was not impressed with the sound quality as I was expecting something much better than the $20 headphones.

author: Granimals70
title: My Favorite Headphones
content: I love these headphones; I am not an audiophile by any means, but I own several sets of headphones, both in-ear and one other pair of over-the-ear, and I will choose these Bose ones first when I am not listening outside or while doing something that inhibits the use of the Bose ones. I love the color, the noise cancellation is excellent in my opinion, and they are great for listening to classical music on Primaphone. I do not use the Alexa feature, so cannot comment on that. If I needed another pair of headphones, I would buy these Bose Quiet-Comfort ones again.

author: Brien Lemmings
title: Working great so far!
content: Working great so far!

author: Rajvir Singh
title: Excellent voice quality and easy connection
content: Excellent noise cancellation with up to 3 levels - low, off, and high. Great voice quality even at low volume. Easy Bluetooth connection with 2 devices at the same time. Clear call quality even in the noise environment. Battery lasts almost 2 days plus a quick 10 min charge lasts up to 2 hours. Highly recommended. One of the best product in the market right now.

author: Alden Globe
title: Excellent wireless headphone
content: I use these mostly for air travel; much better than earlier models because - no cord to get tangled. Excellent noise cancellation helps enormously with in-flight music, podcasts, movies. Or, if you just want to screen out engine noise. The way this one folds up is also superior to earlier models - takes up less space. Expensive, but very nice.

author: Ned Flanders
title: Noise Cancellation Does Not Work!
content: I don't know if it is a defective product or not, but it definitely is not noise isolating. I can hear everything like my coworkers phone calls, computer noise, even the conversation in other rooms. After 2-3 hours my ears start to hurt which i would expect much better earpads. I am very disappointed about this product.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth every penny
content: Absolutely love my new headphones. The noise cancelling has room for improvement but it’s perfect for basic household noise. Sound quality is top notch.

author: Michael
title: Right choice.
content: It was time to change to wireless after years on the wire.  Made the selection based on research and reviews and have not been disappointed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bose Quality
content: Incredible quality, Bose is the best.

author: BAMBAMBAM
title: Great noise cancellation, reception. IGNORES DO NOT DISTURB.
content:
IGNORES DO NOT DISTURB.

Can't use connected to my phone because of spam callers ... headphones start beeping when you get any call or text. This will interrupt you while working, relaxing, etc.

They are excellent when connected to something other than a phone.

author: OBryant Ashley
title: Bose for the win
content: I love these headphones, from wearing them while travelling or just in the comfort of my own room, they do an amazing job at blocking out annoying sounds and focus only on delivering the best quality sounds. I always have these with me now whenever I travel and the voice control works well with the google assistant on my phone. It will notify me whenever I have notifications and even talking on the phone with it on is an ease. I highly recommend these to anyone who is on the fence for a great pair of headphones.

author: Cal Sand
title: Incredible
content:
I find these to be amazing. They are expensive but they do what they say. By now many people have used sound cancelling headphones but I had not. I tried on a friend's and was shocked how well they worked. I was going to buy a different brand that was much cheaper and had good reviews but they were all so much heavier. This Bose system is very light and comfortable and cancels out most of the background noise in a way that should amaze most people.

I have not tried other systems. I do not know how well these work long-term. That's important if you're shopping around. I have only tried these. But they are magnificent and for that reason I have no reason to complain.

author: az_ras
title: but nothing beats these in the noise cancelling along with great sound category
content: I'm usually more of a Sennheiser fan, but nothing beats these in the noise cancelling along with great sound category.  The Google Assistant is way more useful than I expected it to be.  Works great to request songs etc.. by voice and works well for answering calls and talking on the phone with these headphones that have hidden microphones.

author: Stephanie Martinez
title: Wonderful Product!
content:
Wonderful product!
I had the old Quiet Comfort 15 and they worked amazing for years (battery powered and with a wire--only complaint the material around the ear began to peel and shed everywhere, but they still work fine)
I upgraded to the QuietComfort 35 to have the wireless capability and am extremely pleased. They are beautiful in both silver and black and are extremely good at noise cancellation. The case is also more compact for convenience and they fold down easily. The google assistant is a nice feature, but I haven't used it much. Very easy to pair to new devices.
One small annoyance-it announces the entire device names you are connected to every time you turn them on, so if you are listening to something it will lower the sound of what you are listening to announce this. I will also say these fit a little more snug than the last one, but everyone's head is shaped differently and they are still comfortable and soft.

author: Terry A. Stephenson
title: Best headphones on the market!
content: These are fantastic, the noise cancelation is amazing! walking on the sidewalk walking my dogs I can't even hear the cars driving by, and that's at low-to-normal listening volume. Truly amazing. Of course the sound quality is the best, it's Bose.. If you are thinking of using them for workouts or hiking where you build up a sweat these might not be right for that purpose because you ears/head get REALLY hot from being covered. Walking it's not an issue.

author: Shayne
title: Audio Lag makes these unusable for games and movies
content: I love how these headphones look and feel. I love the quality of the noise cancellation, and the audio quality is beautiful. However, these are useless for gaming and videos because there is a 1/2 sec audio delay. This is a well documented issue, and I wish I had done further research before purchasing.

author: T. PARKER
title: Love it!!
content: Worth every penny. Especially on the plane its a lifesaver!!!

author: Jennifer Karpinsky
title: Didn't let me down
content: They helped me take naps on long flights and train rides.  I don't fall asleep easily so being able to tune out other people was great! The sound quality is definitely not up to what is offered with other BOSE products, but it's worth the price.

author: Dana
title: Really really bad
content:
If you're looking for a sign whether you should buy these or not - this is it! DO NOT PURCHASE THESE! It was unimaginably bad!!! I've had the QC 25's for several years and use them in my home office to block out my neighbor noises. These QC 35's are basically like having your loud neighbors shouting in your ears! No matter what I did the talking wouldn't stop. The moment I opened the box I was excited to use them and get some work done but unfortunately the voice kept telling me I HAD to download the app and would not stop repeating every 60 seconds until the app was installed. I called Bose support and their suggestion was to turn off the headphones then turn them back on....voice still there. Also what kind of a suggestion is that? I also brought up the fact that the Bose rep here on amazon said you didn't need the app to use it, so why would it not let me use the headphones without the app?  They say that is incorrect, you do NEED to install the app (clearly, unless you want the voice yelling at you to install it). Ok fine, i'll install another unnecessary app on my phone. After spending so long with bose support and installing the app, my battery was drained, so I  plugged my phone into charge, then sat down to get some work done. The talking started again! The voice said it could not register the connection to my phone. My phone was too far away. All I wanted was noise cancellation, I wasn't trying to play music or do literally anything, just sit there in silence with noise cancellation and type on my computer and it would not let me. After that I had enough, I reboxed the headphones and sent them right back. I was excited to go wireless but it's not worth it when the item is not easily usable. I don't want to have my phone on and next to me every time I want to use these headphones. I travel a lot. Am I expected to keep my phone on during a 15 hour flight?

IN SUM:  These headphones are ONLY usable with the app turned on and your phone nearby to pair with. You cannot just use noise cancellation with no active phone. Of course I would like to use my bluetooth on my phone occasionally, but not every time I use these. I'm joining the rest of the world and buying the new Sony headphones. Bose is no longer what they were.

author: Raj Shankar
title: “Noise Canceling” lol
content: Base is weak, I can still hear a baby crying 5 rows in front of me on this plane, overall not worth the price

author: Amazon Customer
title: Thumbs up
content: Expensive but worth every penny when you are on a long plane flight and don’t want to hear all the chatter and screaming babies

author: Bookworm
title: Bose Noise Cancelling Headphones
content:
Ordered these as a gift for my son as he travels a lot and he loves them.  I also got the
case to put them in when not in use.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Disappointed
content: For this expensive of a product and the BOSE name, I expected way more. I wanted to get them for talking on the phone and cancelling out noise while at work, but it doesn't really do that for the customer you're talking with on the phone. I have also been hearing that I am breaking up and have bad connection.

author: Brian A.
title: Great Headphones
content: I highly recommend these headphones. They are comfortable, they block-out the noise, the battery lasts for a long time, and the sound quality is very good. I wear these while traveling and they do a great job cancelling-out the plane noise (engine noise, crying children, etc)! They are expensive, I feel like you get what you pay for and they deliver an excellent value for the cost.

author: Craig Kummerow
title: All around great headset!
content: Great sound, super battery life, comfortable, noise cancelling is very effective. Waffled on buying a pair of headsets for about two years. This model was well worth the wait. Loving them!

author: Ladbuyer1912
title: The best headphones I have ever owned
content:
I always wanted a pair of Bose QC headphones; I just never had the opportunity to have a pair until now. I had a pair of the Beats Studio Wireless 2.0, but they fell apart after 3 years. Because of that, I ordered a pair of these, and I eagerly waited as the headphones were delivered. I was able to try them the next day, and I was not disappointed. I know there are a lot of reviews about how these deliver while traveling, listening to all sorts of music, etc. I would like to share a few pros and cons that I have noticed, as well as a few observations that I have noticed that aren't necessary pros or cons.

Pros:

1. Sound Quality: There is always a fine line for creating sound that is balanced. These are the best headphones I have used for balanced sound. The highs are crisp, not tinny. I can hear the mids quite clearly, and the bass is full without blowing out your eardrums. At first, I thought the bass was not loud at all, but then I figured it was because of the Beast that I owned for years. If I want my eardrums rocked, I would go to the club. There are sounds and details that I haven't heard before on songs that I have known for years, and the Bose headphones bring them out, making the experience feel like new. When I listen to orchestral music, the playback is so lifelike. I feel like I'm in the room with the orchestra.

2. Comfort:
An issue that I have had with headphones is that I immediately start to sweat under the earcups, and this is an issue that I've had for years (since high school, in fact). However, I keep going back to headphones because, naturally, they sound the best compared to earbuds. Earbuds also aren't comfortable after an hour, especially the Passive Noise Cancellation ones that go in your ear. When I put Bose on, I feel like a cloud is enveloping my ears. My ears still get warm, but the temperature is much more manageable because the headphones aren't weighing down on my ears. The quality of materials is superb (much better than Beats), and because of that, I can wear these for hours.

3. ANC
Bose's Active Noise Cancellation is the best in the market. Hands down. For reference, I would wear these commuting to and from work on the public bus, and during work.
