My other experiences with ANC have resulted in white noise from the headphones while blocking out 50-75% of sound. The other headphones barely cut out the bus's engine noise and noisy passengers. These Bose have 3 modes of ANC: High, Low, and Off. The High mode cut out 90% of noise. The bus's engine noise is reduced to a vibration, and all I could hear from passengers is a loud laugh, and this is without music going. When the music is playing, I'm in my own world, and I literally have to restrain myself from bopping along. :)

Cons:

1. Range:
I was surprised about the range of these. I have a water cooler at work that is about 15-20 feet away from my desk, and with my other headphones, I could walk to it and to the bathroom without my phone and I wouldn't get any cutoff or delays. I was barely 15 feet away when these started to cut off. I was puzzled. In the end, it's not that big of a deal because I can just take my phone with me.

2. Third Party Voice Control
I have noticed that these headphones were optimized for iPhone users, since the play button can be used to talk to Siri. However, in order to use the Google assistant, I would have to use the action button? I find that odd. Do people with Androids have to do the same thing? It just seems that Bose doesn't want to make a version of these headphones optimized for Android users, since there are a lot of them. But what do I know? This is just a first world problem, so again, no big deal. I have figured out that the action button can be changed to control the ANC modes, which is better for me.

Those are the only cons I have for now. I may update if needed.

In my opinion, these are the best headphones money can buy. I wouldn't spend more than $350 for headphones though. If you need to spend more than that, you can get a speaker system that would sound MUCH better than headphones.

author: ashar
title: Good battery life
content: These headphones feel amazing and look amazing too, the battery life is insane and I usually charge it only once a week with heavy use. The sound is GOOD not GREAT, but these really aren't for an audiophile like me, but they are for a daily commuter. On the subway, train, plane, etc.

author: Zurdita
title: Love them!
content: Pros: Needed them for the noise cancellation feature and they work wonders!  I can concentrate in my work without the distractions.  The only con is the cord for use with a computer or any other artefact that does not have bluetooth; it is too short and you will end up purchasing a longer one.

author: rdsOLDschool
title: Alexa App Now on Action Button.
content: Just download app version update v6.6.2 and added Alexa to my QC 35 2s and its awesome. It's another link to control my Amazon smart home devices. Use my favorite skills all at the touch of the Action Button.

author: Hiroki
title: Only One Problem...
content: At first, I rated these headphones 5 stars due to how comfortable they are. I wear them 10 hours a day so comfort was my main priority when choosing headphones. However, after owning these headphones for a few months, a problem came up that I can't ignore. For some reason, when I connect my headphones to my laptop, the mic picks up the background noise and plays it back along with the audio being played from the headphones. This is obviously a software issue, because it only happens with my laptop and not my other devices, but it's still a huge inconvenience since I have to deal with terrible audio quality when using my laptop (if I want to use headphones). I also have this issue when making calls with the headphones, but this has always been a problem so I kind of just accepted it. I've tried everything to fix this, even disabling all microphones in my sound settings in Windows, but nothing works. The only reason I don't rate it less than 4 stars is because technically this is a Windows problem, although I don't have this issue with any of my other Bluetooth headphones, so idk...

author: uncleslappy
title: Pricey, but very good.
content: Great connectivity: has not dropped out when hooked to my phone. Sound is very good. Might need to push the highs a little bit, but my hearing has taken a beating over the years, so could just be me. Not real tight on my head, but don't seem to slip much, so maybe not a problem. The price is ridiculous, but nobody has a similar model as highly rated, it seems. Overall happy with these.

author: pccm, inc
title: Perfect
content: I travel by plane a great deal and these are wonderful.

author: Maicie rea
title: Best headphones on the market
content: If you travel a lot don't second guess this purchase

author: Jeff Willoughby
title: Best purchase for travel
content: I was skeptical of spending this much on headphones, but after using them for a few months I can honestly say they're more than worth it. The noise cancellation works flawlessly and makes air travel much more tolerable. Battery life also exceeded my expectations. When comparing these headphones to smaller alternatives (airpods), make sure to consider the battery life - it is exceptional in the bose headphones. They are comfortable, sound and look great.

author: Stephanie
title: I’m in love.
content: These saved my sanity. Bought them to block out the screeching free-range crotch goblins in my neighborhood and they work like a charm. I never want to take them off.

author: SLY DI
title: Truly noise cancelling.
content: I love these, especially on a plane & the gym.

author: bc1969
title: Wireless headphones
content: Great addition to headphones collection for all audiophiles

author: Elizabeth Moulds
title: Quality
content: I bought this as an open box though not cheaper.  Why? Anyway it has contained a fair bit of static right near my phone with bluetooth.  Sendind back. Hopefully without static.

author: Jed H.
title: Just hit the buy button.
content: Love the Bose connect feature that allows you to add a second pair and listen to one phone or source. My wife and I share music and audiobooks easily this way. Comfortable to wear for hours at a time and the battery life is awesome.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Cancellation not as good as earlier model. Blutooth cuts out and restarts
content: Bought for use on plane. Needed blutooth too. Bit of a pain to link with droid app. Disappointed the noise cancelation is not as good as the old model. Sounds good and cancellation does work. Blutooth sometimes  cuts out then restarts.

author: Fabian
title: Do Not buy! Firmware issues.
content: These were great when I first bought them in 2018. But unfortunately they are trash after the latest update. I started to have a problem with the headphones and that problem was that the headphones would not shut off after switching them to off. The headphones would automatically turn back on after 10 seconds without the button being toggled. I researched online about the issue and it turns out it’s a very common problem after the new update. It seems there hasn’t been a fix for a long time now. Save your money! I’m never buying Bose products again.

author: Kevin Pereira
title: Bluetooth Nightmare.
content:
Really disappointed with these. I'll be watching something on my macbook, and then it goes out of sync with a 2-second delay, or it will disconnect, or it will connect randomly to my TV. Extremely annoying... The ios app only works half the time.

It's also difficult to move from iphone to macbook, if you click the button, music starts playing instead of transfering you from iphone to macbook. It's a total mess and it's hard to get beyond how much bluetooth sucks.

Other than that, it's great.

author: JA
title: Most comfortable wireless noise cancelling headphones.
content: I also own the Sennheiser MOMENTUM 2 wireless noise cancelling headphones, which I think look much nicer (especially white version) and sound amazing, but they're unfortunately just not as comfortable. The Bose are FAR more comfortable, so ultimately they're the ones I prefer just because they're so much more comfortable to wear for extended periods. Both have great sound and noise cancelling for my tastes, though I'd say the Sennheisers sound a bit better overall. The differences there are not nearly as dramatic in the differences in comfort, though. If the Sennheisers improved their comfort I would pick them over the Bose, but until then I'd rather have something that doesn't make my ears and head hurt.

author: Don C.  ( Daytona Beach, Fl )
title: Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) Wireless Headphones, Noise Cancelling - Black
content:
These are the best wireless headphones i have ever owned. I use these for listening to music. (I prefer Classic Rock) The comfort and sound quality of these headphones is just fantastic! I like to sit outside in the breezeway, and listen to my tunes. A city park is nearby, and is sometimes noisy when football games or other events are going on.
When i set the Noise Cancellation on high, all the outside noise is gone, and i can hear the music the way it is MEANT to be heard! I am building up a great Classic Rock Playlist of music videos and some of my favorite Classic Rock albums. The Noise Cancelling feature blew me away the first time i heard it. I could not believe what a difference it made! In my humble opinion, this feature alone makes them worth the higher price than some of the cheaper wireless models available. I am very pleased with these headphones, and i recommend these to anyone who cares about quality sound and well fitting headphones. Try a pair! I think you'll like what you hear! I sure did!

author: ancient uchiha
title: Last only for 9 months
content: The Bose Qc35II works great when it works. However after using it for 9 months it starts to disconnect from your phone and resetting constantly. From what i heard it was because of a firmware update that killed the Bluetooth connection on my phone. If you do buy it do not update. At the moment I am thinking whether I should return it because it is still within my limited warrantly. Will update on the status on it.

author: Diyaeldin Ahmed M El-sidig
title: Good
content: Good item

author: Emma
title: best headphones i owned
content: best headphones ever buy these

author: Amer
title: Simply the best
content: just awesome. Have been wearing these for weeks at airports, walking around town and at work.. and these are by far the best noise cancellation headphones i have used.

author: Suzanne
title: Bluetooth default - Music skips!
content: I did some extensive research on which noise cancelling headphones would be best. I decided to splurge for the Bose NC QC35 ii.  I pulled them out of the box, downloaded the app, did the update, paired it to only one device, and immediately it began to skip. I tried troubleshooting which is when I found out this is a common issue with the headphones. It seems to be a Bluetooth issue because they work great plugged in. I did everything Bose customer support said to try without resolve. In the end there seems to be a known glitch. For many, their problem didn't start until a few months or 1 year after purchase. I'm so sad because they are light, so comfortable, with great sound!!

author: Mehmet Yorulmaz
title: Good headphone with multi device connection problem...
content:
I was in between Sony WH 1000XM2 and Bose QC35 II. After spending hours on watching/reading all the reviews, comparisons, I chose Bose over Sony, although almost all professional reviewers rated Sony higher than Bose. Let me do a quick review and explain why I did so:

i) Sound Quality: 8/10. Very "clean" sound. Definitely high quality and pleasing. In fact, it can be described as "calming". Not very base heavy. But my main use for this headphone is to cut the background noise and listen to a relaxing music while I am working/studying in a cafe. Therefore, keeping my aim in mind, the sound quality is right on target.

ii) Noise Cancellation: 8/10. It cuts out most of the outside noises. But, don't expect miracles as some people describe. For example, if somebody talks, you definitely hear them. There is also a slight pressure in my ears due to ANC, but I got used to it pretty quickly.

iii) Comfort: 9/10. The best one in the market in terms of comfort. Especially compared to my Plantronics Backbeat Pro. However, after wearing it for an hour or so, my ears still get warm to a level that I have to take off for a while. This was a surprise to me given all the positive reviews regarding the comfort of Bose QC35II.

iv) Call Quality 6/10: As mentioned in most of the reviews, Bose pick up external noise during phone calls. It is not to a level to prevent communication. However it certainly disturbs the other party. Compared to my Plantronics, this was not an issue at all on my Plantronics. People could not figure out whether I was using my headphones or not. So, if you are purchasing Bose for all day long phone calls at work, chose another headphones.

v) Features: 3/10. We all know that Sony has many more features (touchpad control of songs, adaptive noise cancelling, quick attention mode, etc.)  than Bose. To me they are not essential but nice to have. Especially quick attention mode. When somebody talks to me while wearing Bose, I do have to remove it which is a hassle. In my Plantronics, I could have handle those situations without removing headphone. Another important feature is multi-device connection simultaneously. That was one of the reasons why I did not chose Sony. I was hoping to connect to both my laptop and phone at the same time. However this feature is not working as it should. When I connect both my laptop and phone and try to listen to a song on my laptop, it doesn't play smoothly at all. It stops and starts at every 3-5 seconds by itself as if there is a problem with data transfer speed. And after 1-2 mins, my laptop (Dell XPS 13) crashes (it crashed 4 times within 30 mins). And let me tell you this. I have been using my laptop for the last 2 years. And it has not crashed even once until now. It is also up to date; all Windows & Dell driver updates are installed. Long story short, I can't connect Bose to both my laptop and phone as of now. I hope Bose solves this with a firmware update ASAP.

Regarding bluetooth connection strength, it is worse than my Plantronics. It disconnects at shorter distances that Plantronics and once it does, it does not automatically reconnects when I get closer to my device which Plantronics always did without any problems.

vi) Final Verdict: 7.5/10: Bose is a good headphones with some flaws and major weaknesses. It is far from perfect as many reviewers/users wholeheartedly claim. To be satisfied with your purchase, you need to decide what features in a headphone is  most important for you and what will be your main use. If it is the best sound quality or call quality, or if you want the most feature packed cook headset, skip Bose. You will hate it. If you more care the noise cancellation and comfort and then a clean sound, then go for it.

I hope this helps...

author: ben browne
title: Great noise canceling-
content: Love them!  Someone stole my original QC 25’s.  As much as I travel, it was an easy decision to get the 35’s.  I don’t do the Alexa thing, I do not need every thing I say recorded and kept forever at a sever farm.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Easy to link with ipad
content: Love these headphones....great for travel.

author: Islandman
title: The best
content:
I’ve owned three over the last 15 years. By far this is the best one I have ever owned.

Great sound quality, better case storage and the battery life is awesome.

author: john h everitt
title: good sound quality
content: These are great, I can listen to Audible while operating a bobcat skid steer loader at work. I do get a bit of wind noise while biking however.

author: Linda A Oyster
title: It's perfect
content: Great for my motorhome when air conditioning is running..knocks out the noise.

author: Andres
title: They are great!
content: No surprises, fantastic noise cancelling headphones.

author: abdulrahman al-shareef
title: great quality
content: i just liked it .

author: Edward Gutowski
title: Excellent sound quality and noise canceling performance. Well built quality
content: I've had these headphones for about a year and a half.  I use them mostly for airplane travel to reduce the fatigue of constant noise bombardment everywhere and long flight sleep, but also for music when I want the absolute best sound quality, pc/conference calling and video chats, TV watching to avoid bothering the spouse (paired to a bluetooth dongle/audio jack), and sometimes for creating perfect silence to have a lazy afternoon nap.  If I would have one criticism, it would be a software peeve; since I have them paired to about 4 devices, the moment I switch the headphones on in hope of immediate silence, the software voice announces it is searching for bluetooth devices and has not found it, then searches for the next device and the next, each one is announced by the voice multiple times.  When you just want some peace and quiet, I wish there were a switch to shut out the voice prompts.

author: DR. Smith
title: Best things around
content: These work great. Tried several other brands with poor results. Happy I bought these.

author: nagyjl74
title: Very high quality, which you would expect from Bose
content: Very comfortable.  Excellent sound quality.

author: Debra M
title: Amazing
content:
I will only buy Bose. These are my 2nd headset. The older ComfortQuiet 35 are now for exercising, these new ones are for all else. However he older ones still work like new. Love love the Alexa feature. It will actually read my books to me.
Note: I also have 3 earbuds.....

THE BEST IN THE WORLD

author: El Don
title: Worth the price
content: I've been using a set of NC Bose headphones for about 4 years before I decided it was time to upgrade.  I struggled because the cost is high and there are a ton of other options out there these days.  I can't say I've tried those options but spent a decent amount of time reading reviews before I decided to play it safe and go with the latest Bose QC 35 II.  I was not disappointed.  They improved the noise cancelling quite a bit as compared to my old pair of Bose.  Sounds is good.  Not sure it's overwhelmingly great but I'm not an audiophile so that is not critical for me.  Wireless is solid and I've had limited issues connecting to devices.  What I REALLY like is the microphone for phone calls.  Unlike every other headset I've ever used I DON'T get complaints about my audio with these.  Given how much I'm on the phone that is really nice.

author: G.H. Santi
title: Great buy
content: There are not dislikes al all.. it does what it supposed to do..

author: J. Kapur
title: Excellent Product (from someone who has not been a fan of Bose "sound")
content:
This is a great product and perfect for what I was looking for.  Excellent noise cancellation (heaven sent on long flights; great for tuning out in the office; so on, and so on).  AND - GOOD SOUND - I listen to a wide variety of music (Classic Rock, Jazz, Bollywood, Classical, Indian Instrumental - you get the point) and the sound quality has been consistently excellent from these head phones.  Bose has a hit here as far as I'm concerned - getting these for the kids as b'day presents (both in college...).  It comes in a case that is perfectly designed to protect these and the Bose App connects quickly and without any bother.  Previously connected (via Bluetooth) devices are automatically connected (up to 2 at a time and you can toggle which two [if it has discovered more than two in the past] from the Bose App easily and quickly)
I am truly enjoying this product and I would highly recommend without any constraints.

author: Timothy Owen Koneval
title: Insistent voice stating that headphones needed to be connected. ...
content: Insistent voice stating that headphones needed to be connected. They were not effective at noise cancelling. Supposed to be effective even when not listening to music.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth every penny!
content: I have always used the cheap $30 headphones. I decided to buy these Bose 35 to see what all the hype was and see if it was as good as Bose says. After week one these are, by far,  the best headphones I've ever had. The sound is clear and the bass is deep. The noise cancelation feature makes the price worth every penny. I work in a noisy warehouse environment. These headphones block out almost all the noise! Beautiful headphones. WORTH IT!

author: Lee Wright
title: Good Headphones - Used Package
content: When I received my headphones, they were already paired to two devices and named already. Didn't think I was ordering a used product and will be contacting Amazon about the issue.

author: Hop Sing
title: Great Performer
content: Had to replace my son's Bose Headphones after our dog devoured them. Had them in a couple of days and he absolutely loves them!

author: alfie
title: they are good. Beat the pants off the Sony's I have
content: Wow, they are good.  Beat the pants off the Sony's I have. Noise cancellation is tops, while comfortable. Nice feature of audible battery status when connecting to devices.  I was skeptical, but they are really worth it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: BOSE - a name you can TRUST!
content:
I have always purchased genuine BOSE products. I can depend on the workmanship and performance
Brand  recognition is critical when you want  worry free purchases.

author: T. Noggle
title: worth it!
content: much better noise cancelling then my current Beats Studio and love the adjustable ear pieces

author: W. Johnston
title: You can pretend you have an office
content: Best noise cancelling headphones on the market. Purchased since the human rights violation that is the open office plan is unlikely to go anywhere any time soon. But with these, I can be less accessible than I would have been with an office, and almost as focused! I've been using it for a year now, and it is going strong.

author: Vernon Smith
title: Great product
content: I haven’t found anything I don’t like.  I can shut off the world, turn on some classical music and read my latest book.

author: Miguel Dias
title: Best product
content: Fantastic

author: J. M. Doloboff
title: Wow, Wow and Wow - Bose Knows (how to make outstanding headphones)!!!
content:
I had a pair of Bose wired, noise cancelling headphones for several years, and they were my cans of choice when flying or otherwise in an environment with unimportant background noise.  With these wireless headphones, Bose hits the mark once again.  The music plays as it was recorded and mastered.  Isn't that what we all want?

Apparently not, given the success of Beats headphones, a marketing machine created by Jimmy Iovine and Dr. Dre.  Beats headphones enhance the bass, to the point where I feel that I am trapped in a car with a driver who has the treble level but the bass turned up to the max.  If you MUST have overly-compensated bass in everything that you listen to, then Beats are for you.

But if you want clear sound, together with a package that lets you easily choose the amount of exterior noise cancellation, then these Bose headphones are your best choice (at least with a price point less than a nice used car).  You also get simple volume controls and easily found buttons to skip forward or backward on your song list.

I have not yet tried Bose AR, so I cannot comment on that aspect of these outstanding headphones.  I expect great things from Bose.

So you won't be wearing the hot Beats headphones.  Even the NFL, which has a marketing deal with Bose, has trouble preventing the players from wearing Beats.  The Beats headphones are part of a well-planned marketing machine, and Bose just isn't as "cool."  But if you want to hear the music the way the musicians and engineers want you to hear it, forget about what the market views as "cool."  Go with Bose.

author: amazingLarry
title: Four Stars
content: for the price i hope the next Gen is a little more feature rich

author: Elsa Yang
title: So I do not prefer this Bose 35II anymore.  I still have to test Sony with my other headset on planes.
content:
I bought the Sony and Bose and I prefer the sound of Bose over Sony because maybe I am just used to Bose sounds-have 2 Bose sound systems.

But just have issues reconnecting the Bose to my smart phone and laptop recently.  (The first time were ok) I was in doctor's office and cannot use it.  I went home and tried even disconnecting to all laptops but will  not connect to any device.  I searched and found a solution to reset. Basically turn off the headset for at least 30 sec,  plug the headset to the wall or power for at least 5 seconds and then unplug and wait for at least 1 minute and turn on then it works but cannot connect to two at the same time. Then found out to clear the list by pressing the on switch all the way to the blue tooth until the list is clear. Still cannot connect to 2 devices then found out that to connect another device is just do the same until you hear connect another device.  But now the Bose smart phone app cannot connect.  So deleted again and again and see what will happen.

My problem is - I have probably 7 wireless/blue tooth headsets from cheaper to average price ones and I do not have these problems and I have this problem with the top of the line expensive no discount Bose 35II?  This is unbelievable!

If you do not need good noise cancelling, just buy the average wireless/bluetooth headsets, some do sound amazing.

author: TRob ARob
title: Enjoying the sound(s)
content: I enjoy putting these on my ears. Still learning how to work the buttons, but have had many conversations thru the headphones. Quality is excellent. Glad I made this purchase and would recommend them for those in the market. Have not tried them on a plane yet, but I am so looking forward to it.

author: David Peterson
title: Nice but disappointing with wired connection
content: Headphones work well with wireless connection. But the plug connection for the wire supplied with the headphones is faulty and causes the connection to an airplane wired system to disconnect. I am disappointed that Bose would produce something that fails the first time it’s used in with the wire Bose has supplied. The problem seems to be in the connection within the headphones, not the wire.

author: Tony
title: great quality
content: i use these even when im not listening to anything just to cancel out noise. The sound quality is good and they are very comfortable

author: Sam G
title: Best in class
content: All you want and more per description

author: Dennis
title: Sound cuts out
content:
They worked good for about 1-1/2 years.  Now the audio cuts out intermittently.  Audio does not cut out when hard wired to source.  After having the bad audio for 15-30 minutes it becomes less and less until after about an hour or so it appears to be O.K.  Same for any Bluetooth device I connect.
Battery fine.
For $350 I expected much more.

author: nancy wilder
title: ... travel~ airlines and when my husband snores and is super grumpy.
content: I use these when I travel~ airlines and when my husband snores and is super grumpy.

author: Byron Bailey
title: Perfect Bluetooth headphones!
content: Perfect Bluetooth headphones for no matter what I need.

author: K. westcott
title: These headphones stopped working almost immediately
content: After listening to music on these headphones for four days while at work they stopped functioning correctly.  They would restart themselves repeatedly for no reason (roughly 5 times per minute).  When they restart they're not just turning off and on again.  The  process is that a voice says "connecting to <your device name>, connected to <your device name>, battery level; <your battery level>" and then I have to go into my phone and restart the music.  Having to do this a few times per minute makes listening to music not worth the trouble.  I contacted Bose, they sent me a return label and I'm waiting for a replacement.  Hopefully my next pair will actually be usable.

author: Grayson
title: I can study anywhere!
content: These headphones are amazing. I know the price tag might scare a few people off, but they are totally worth it. The noise-cancelling effects of these things are fantastic. Before I could only study in the quietest corner of a library, now I can go into a bustling cafe and focus like I'm all alone with these things on. I love technology!

author: Brandon
title: Don’t waste your time....
content: I have had these for 2 weeks now. I have given them as many tries as I can. The sound quality is okay, the volume level is poor. The noise canceling is almost nonexistent and don’t get me started on the Bluetooth connectivity or syncing issues. The amount of money these cost is not worth the product you received. I am returning them ASAP

author: Virginia
title: I am in LOVE. These have changed my life and my marriage
content: I'm a writer and my husband plays his tv shows and sports or music which really detracts me. I must have ADD or something because I get distracted so easily. In the room I have this ceiling fan that does not know how to move air quietly, the "special silent" motor isn't silent anyore—unless I put on these headphones! I have no idea how they work, but bluetooth connects them to my computer and my phone so I can use them like regular bluetooth speaker headphones. It's summer now and my neighbors always have bbqs with lots of beer. I like to sit by my pool with a glass of wine and write. I can't even hear any of them unless someone shouts I got the silvery ones and am glad I did. They sort of disappear on my head easier than big ol black ones. I have never had pain from these either and wear them all day. When I bought them, I also bought the Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones WH1000XM3 which are actually just as amazing but Bose was just one tiny bit better. But mostly, I didn't like the dull finish on their silvery ones. Looked cheap. sooooo happy with these I'm going to buy my son a pair who is starting college and gets way too distracted by his roommates. His grades are going to improve so much!

author: Chrishna
title: Quality product
content: Comfortable and sound quality is amazing. My complaint is actually that the product is almost too good in the noise canceling department — it actually makes me nauseous to have these on when theres no music playing because of the very odd sensation that the noise cancellation has on my inner ear.

author: Erinn Voigt
title: Makes studying a breeze
content: I'm the worst at focusing, the slightest noise & I'm frustrated and distracted.  While I was very reluctant for many years to purchase a pair of Bose headphones I'm glad I finally did.  I can finally tune out all the distractions to get my work done, increasing productivity and quality of my work.  I take them from the office to home and find joy in them every day! Recommend to anyone who struggles at focusing!

author: Ella C.
title: excellent build quality and sound with nice clean highs and ...
content:
Had them for about a week, excellent build quality and sound with nice clean highs and great bass.
The noise cancellation is the best in the game and you can hardly hear anything with it on high.
Tldr great buy, worth the money

author: Jonathan
title: Great sound quality and noise cancellation
content: Great sound quality and noise cancellation, battery lasts a long time even while using Bluetooth and with noise cancellation at the max level.

author: Renee
title: Work great!!
content: Work great!!! I bought these for my husband, for travel and for when he works at home. He was very impressed with the comfort and quiet when needed

author: Gilberto A.
title: Audiophile galore
content: I’ve been waiting to buy this product, by far the best headphones I’ve ever bought from day one I was impressed with the quality from material to the technology, such as it’s noise canceling abilities. I hope it has a long life span because I plan on enjoying these for as long as I can.

author: Don Moops
title: Music lovers dream
content: Best audio I have ever heard, Listening to remastered Led Zeppelin on these is like listening to the songs for the first time, little nuances you never noticed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent all around headset
content: I use these for my phone, laptop, desktop and PS4 (wired connected to controller).  One headset for all uses.

author: bikerdoc
title: One of the best
content: Can't fly without them. Great product.

author: Wild-Haired Gurl
title: Noise-Cancelling may be a slight exaggeration
content: I splurged on this rather pricey product for one reason, and one reason only - so that I could listen to my Mindfulness meditations (my daily attempt at post-work stress relief), while drowning out the irritating sounds of the reality shows my boyfriend likes to watch. Unfortunately, noise-cancelling is a bit of a stretch... they do a pretty good job of cancelling out mechanical sounds, like the washer, dryer, and air conditioner; however, they are not as adept at cancelling voices.  I still hear his reality shows. I have decided to keep the headphones, as they do provides pretty good sound and are better than any other earbuds than I've tried. They are comfortable and allow me to increase the volume higher than Bluetooth earbuds. I haven't used the Alexa/Google button much, other than some initial testing. I like the fact that I can switch from one to the other, depending on which virtual assistance I wish to use. The battery seems to have a pretty long life. I have recently used it to listen to some audio books and it seems to barely make a dent in the battery usage, providing it is reporting the accurate battery level.  Overall, these are a keeper, and a decent purchase, given Amazon's flexible payment policy.

author: SoCal John
title: Awesome
content: Would highly recommend this if you are flying long distances. Cancels out the engine and cabin noise

author: Mike Schmitt
title: Works excellent. Recommend highly
content: Tried all brands in stores. Very happy with Bose. Sony comes a close 2nd.

author: sreeraj
title: Good
content: It’s an expensive product, the sound quality and the noice cancellation capacity is great. I work in a noisy lab but this one does a good job to keep my ears protected

author: O. B. Juan
title: Pairs With Cisco Model 9951 Office Phone
content: FYI, I did not purchase these Bose headsets but received them as an award at work.  My desk is in the middle of a call center, but I'm not a call center rep.  Therefore, my day is filled with the constant chatter of other people's phone calls.  I do lots of math so to minimize the distractions I paired my Bose QC 35 II headphones with my Cisco Model 9951 office phone.  I pretty much wear them all day, and when I do get/make a phone call they work great.  That said, I use my Sony WH-1000MX3 headphones at home to listen to music, the TV, Audible, etc.  I prefer the noise cancellation and sound quality of the Sony's a bit more than the Bose.  I give the Bose 4 stars when compared to the Sony's which I give 5 stars, but the Bose are great headphones!

author: Howie
title: Great but weird quirk that may make some nauseated
content: I love Bose overall and have had these for almost 4 months but they can cause some pressure or something that tends to make me nauseated at times.

author: JuanKrls
title: Disappointed
content: This is a very good headphones but unfortunately they ruin the Noise cancelling with the last update 4.5.2 and it was months since this! And the worst is that the Noise concelling was the main reason to buy them. Bose don’t worry about their customers

author: Amazon Customer
title: the best part about them is that they are the most ...
content: The ANC on these is just phenomenal.  I put them on, and there is a HUGE reduction in background noise.  And for me, the best part about them is that they are the most comfortable I have every experienced.  I could probably where them for an entire day with any so much as any hear strain.

author: Zeeshan Husain
title: awesome
content: got this as a christmas present for my wife... very easy to sync with your phone.  i may end up getting one for myself!

author: Pavel Chernikov
title: Comfortable and great sound
content: Noise cancellation on these things is top notch. Sound is great. Very comfy.

author: acubens555
title: Five Stars
content: not a great sound for $300. but amazing active noise cacellaion.

author: Amanda
title: Amazing headphones.
content: Loved it. The headphones were comfortable and cancel noise really well. Great for traveling

author: Lizzard
title: Price poinr.is pretty high but it.is a Bose and good quality.
content: The best features are noise cancelling and bluetooth quick pairing, the low points are over ear comfort, over time my ears sweat, but ventilation could possibly effect noise cancelling properties.  I would like to see enhanced voice when in noisy environments such as on planes where you can hear someone talking without removing the headset.

author: John Guzewich
title: A surprising improvement over older QuietComfort Headphones
content: I have QuietComfort headphones that I purchased 10 years ago and used quite often, particularly on plane flights. I purchased the new headphones mostly for the bluetooth feature. What I found is that not only does the bluetooth work well but surprisingly to me the headphones sound much better that the older pair!

author: jms417
title: Awesome gift for dad
content: Bought these for my dad as a Christmas gift. He’s obsessed. He’s already tested them out and says they’re exactly what he wanted.

author: Ted, from Denver, CO
title: Best noise canceling, solid Bluetooth, really good sound
content: Best noise canceling headphones you can buy imo. Just can’t beat them if you fly, makes even being center seat in coach not so bad. Bluetooth is awesome, maintains connection for something like 30’, not that I’m ever that far away from my phone, but it is nice if you get up to go grab something from the fridge while your connected to your laptop. Sound quality is decent. I get better clarity and bass from my wired Sony non-noise canceling headphones, but that’s not why I got these. Battery life is super good, and it’s really nice it tells you the level every time you power up. Price is definitely on the high side, but overall I’m impressed and pleased with my purchase.

author: Denis
title: Most comfortable headphones I ever had
content: I play poker tournaments on the side which could last up to 13 hours a day. These headphones have a good battery life, but the most important thing is COMFORT. I don't even feel like the headphones are on my head their so light.

author: Eric M.
title: Best-in-class noise cancellation
content: Having tried nearly a dozen different noise cancelling headphones, the QC-35’s no doubt have best-in-class noise cancellation. Would highly recommend to any frequent commuters or travelers.

author: Kindle Customer
title: BUY!!!!!!!!! BUY!!!!!!!!!!!! BUY!!!!!!!!!!!!!! These things will change you!! If anything can save a Marriage its these, LOL!!!
content: These Sound SO GOOD, work So well and Feel so good that you should be begging me to stop buying them so I can leave some for everyone else. I bought 2 pairs of this one for myself and one for my father. These things can save marriages and relationships by the droves. I combined these with a Lenovo Yoga Tab3 and a 27000mAh and I love it!!!! Sounds superb, the software works excellent and is easy to use. these things tune themselves in a sense and they sound Fantastic.  Anything sounds wonderful in the s they have excellent bass and clarity all mixed into one. If you are thinking about a set of Beats headphones, check these out first... I'm telling you they are worth every penny, durable as all get out and I have been using them nonstop since I got them. I am listening to music through them right now while writing this review.

author: Sure
title: The range on these headphones suck
content: Not even 15 ft away and its already bugging out, i go an extra 10 ft and they disconnect 350$ for 15 ft range? wtf, but they headphones themselves besides the crappy range are good, great noise canceling.

author: Codi Fant
title: Fantastic Noise Cancellation
content: I decided to look into getting some noise cancellation headphones after moving into a more crowded work environment and getting some new noisy neighbors. Being super sensitive to noises, it was important that I had high quality headphones that did absolutely as advertised. These headphones are fantastic. The noise cancellation is great, it's almost like magic to me. Turning them on is like cutting off the world and that's exactly what I wanted. Having good sound quality was also important to me since I listen to a lot of music. I'm not an expert on the technical aspects of sound but I found the quality to be pretty great. I do find myself having to turn up the sound higher than usual to really get an immersive experience with music, if that makes any sense, but still great. The price was the only thing that made me hesitate. Not used to spending that much on anything, but I can say that it was worth it. I've barely taken these headphones off since getting them.

author: ACB3344
title: Disappointed, Old Version Alexa Not pre-loaded. Not wind-tight.
content:
I intentionally ordered these, even though they were pricey, so that I would have Alexa built in. I have come to find out Amazon sent me an old version without Alexa preloaded and without the Alexa logo. I'm a big Alexa user so this was important to me. I selected these after watching the commercial for them lauding the Alexa connectivity and intentionally held off buying these until I was sure they were being issued with Alexa from Amazon.

I've struggled with Amazon for over a week with chat and emails trying to get them returned and new version issued without success. Very frustrating and disappointing.  When I tried to get the newer version from Amazon they said it wasn't possible and that I would just receive the exact same item. I'm not sure why I got a stuck with the older version and others got a new box for the same amount of money. Disappointed for sure.

I can tell from the answers of other users that they received the newer version because they talk about Alexa being pre-loaded and pressing the button being all it takes to get Alexa to work. For me it was much, much more difficult, frustrating and disappointing. It's been a pain in the backside trying to get them setup because there are no instructions in the box addressing the fact that these are the older version without Alexa pre-loaded. I finally found an article on Engadget that at least got me started in the right direction. It took me multiple attempts to get the firmware update applied because, 1. without instructions I didn't know to load the firmware update; and 2. they kept disconnecting from the source .... Ugh. After 3-4 attempts I finally got it loaded. But the frustrating experience tainted my satisfaction with this purchase.

Also, I wore them on a walk on a slightly windy day. I had to cover the headset with a hood to keep the wind noise from entering the ear covers and disrupting what I was listening to.

author: Steven Sherri Williams
title: Alexa voice control has stopped working.
content: I bought these in November of 2018 and they have worked exceptionally well up until March 2019. My Alexa voice control has stopped working, i has been acting out sporadically around January or so. Now I can’t control with Alexa at all. Will reach out to Bose and update their helpfulness if they give it.

author: wdw_rob_b
title: Very Happy
content: Have used multiple lower cost headphones over the years.  Finally this year I took the plunge and invested in these Bose headphones.  Wow, what a usability difference.  Very comfortable.  Like how they automatically connect to two devices.  They just work, consistently all the time.  Sound quality is good, not great.  Like others have stated, bass could be enhanced.  This was my first Bose product, was so impressed purchased the Soundsports for excercising.

author: Daniel J. Hughes
title: Outstanding Performance
content: Really excellent noise cancelling and outstanding performance listening to music or a movie.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent, but a bit of trouble switching sources when two bluetooth connections
content:
Excellent product.  But I did have a couple of issues:
1.  With some changers, it fails to charge. It seems that if too much current is supplied, it stops charging and you only learn when it is not fully charged overnight.  It is simple to switch chargers, but it would be better to have the head set do the right thing itself. and work with any charger.
2. If connected to my laptop and my phone, I sometimes must use the phone to disconnect from the headphones to allow the sound to be received from the laptop (ubuntu 18.04).  It would be better to switch more easily from the headphones.  When telling it to switch with the switch on the headphone, it attempts to switch, but mostly stays connected to the phone when I want the laptop, etc..
Overall it is a great product and I am glad I purchased it.  Just be aware of these issues so that lean how to work around problems.  At first, I thought i couldn't charge fully - until I tried a different charger.

author: RTM135
title: Decision Depends on Priorities
content:
Like many of you, I was torn between the Sony WH 1000XM2 and Bose QC35 II.  The decision is going to come down to your priorities.  Sony's headphones overall sound better, especially with dance or bass-heavy music.  If you have FLAC or ALAC tracks, you'll notice the Sony sounding better since they support the LDAC Bluetooth codec, which is more advanced and uses higher bandwidth than Bose,

However, if you're heavily invested in the Android ecosystem and need the headphones to travel, the Bose are more comfortable and have better controls as the touch controls on the Sony are hit and miss.  The built-in Google Assistant is actually very helpful once you learn it's capabilities.

So overall I give 4/5 stars since the sound technology is not as advanced as the Sony's but overall the best choice if you need a good home/work/travel solution.

author: Freddy
title: Alexa never works
content: Overall these are good quality headphones but the Alexa features don't work properly at all.

author: pp
title: Phenomenal Sound Quality & Comfort
content:
After trying out a few other headphone purchases that left me unhappy, I finally decided to try Bose after glowing recommendations from friends. I had resisted due to the lackluster physical appeal of Bose compared to other brands, but I can't express how much better the sound quality, comfort and noise cancellation were with Bose. These headphones are outstanding!

I actually couldn't believe how much more comfortable the earpads were than any other pair of headphones I've tried at this price point (e.g. Sennheiser HD1). Wearing the Bose for 2+ hours left me forgetting I was even wearing them and I completely tuned out my surroundings.

Accessorywise, the travel case is a good size for travel with interior pockets for cables - I was hoping an AC USB adapter would be included but I ended up using a spare one.

The physical UI on the exterior of the headphones makes pairing and powering on/off incredibly intuitive with a slider button and the voice instructions always let you know the battery life and to which device it's paired.

All in all, Bose really exceeded my expectations and lives up to all the hype. Seriously, worth every penny!

author: C. Fraley
title: Great noise cancelling, comfortable fit
content:
I was thrilled at how comfortable and light-weight these headphones are!  I purchased them primarily for air travel, as the drone of the engines really irritates me.  I was expecting some neck stiffness due to wearing these for six hours, but they are so comfortable I've had no problems at all.

I also had the opportunity to wear these at night (in a dorm for a conference, and construction started outside before 6am!).  Again, I was amazed I could sleep with these on, and still get a good night's sleep, even laying on my side.

The sound reproduction is very good--nothing like studio headphones (Sennheiser HD 650s or the like), but certainly way better than any ear buds.  There are now more choices out there than when I bought mine (others have temporarily taken the noise cancelling crown, or sound a little better), but these are still worth serious consideration due to comfort (and the noise cancellation and sound aren't bad either!).

author: Jacob
title: Amazing
content: Great product overall but the price is a bit expensive

author: Mature Customer
title: Fantastic sound, so so range
content: We bought this for use with a Samsung smart TV. It works after jumping through some hoops (on the Samsung side of things). The sound is excellent, but the range is not that great. I'm not sure if it's the headset's fault or the TV's, but I can't walk out of the living room into the kitchen without the headset loosing connection. It works great as long as I'm on the couch.

author: Dr. Thilo Gross
title: Unacceptable app policies
content: The noise cancellation of these headphones is as impressive as promised (at least so far). Sound quality is ok. The cable connection is a bit dodgy. However, the Bose connect app that one is forced to use has some policies that I find unacceptable. The app uses your phone's data connection to download firmware updates when it wants to.  There is no option in the app to disable this and the app even ignored background data restrictions set in the operating systems. This may seem like a small detail to most, however there are good reasons you may want to stop these updates. First, there are currently widespread reports that installing newer firmware degrades the noise cancellation. Secondly, secondly the app also happily downloads its updates over metered connections.

author: Clyde Logan
title: Noise cancellation not as good as with dedicated industrial earmuffs
content: I have a set of Amazon purchased industrial noise cancelling hearing protectors, which are in the same price range as these Bose phones. But they are purely hearing protectors, without bluetooth or any other sound input. Since I spend at least a couple of hours a day on a loud diesel tractor i decided to buy these Bose headphones to get the ability to listen to audio books while I cut, drag, move dirt, and plow.  Unfortunately the Bose noise cancelling in the Deere diesel sound range isn't up to the task. The industrial dedicated hearing protectors are better - way better.

author: mfg
title: Noise cancelling???
content: Felling quite perplexed here with the reviews, the reason I bough these is to cancel out moderate noise while Im working, however as soon as I set these up I could still hear all the noise around me.  Check and double checked. Did a test with my laptop 1 foot away from me and an audio book on, can still hear every word!  So the tiniest bit of noise cancelling but no more than you'd get from a cheap throwaway pair from a flight.  Massively disappointed.  Have looked online and it appears from april 2019 there was a software update that hasn't rendered headphones that worked great before useless with noise cancelling.  So Ill be sending back and getting the sony, apparently they aren't as comfy but Ill put up with that over this piece of cheap rubbish.

author: hihosilver
title: high sound quality
content: Amazon music sounds just okay. Have not got them to hook up to the computer yet been meaning to call them.

author: John
title: Bluetooth Connection to Microsoft Surface and Windows 10 is a disaster
content: The Bluetooth connection to my wife’s iPhone is seamless, as it should be.  We have struggled with the connection to her Microsoft Surface and Windows 10 since we got these headphones at Christmas last year.  Today I spent 7 hours working on this, as I determined I would get them to work on the Surface.  I talked to two folks from Microsoft Support, each for well over an hour, plus waiting for software updates and other stuff it was a legit 7 hours.  I gave over the control to my computer and watched the support folks try to figure this out, but in the end they couldn’t get it to work.  The last thing we tried was updating the Bose software on the headphones, but that didn’t fix it either.  To be fair, the Windows 10 searching through many different screens and settings was not convenient and was very confusing.  At the start of this process, I was not able to connect to an Amazon Echo, which we did get to work.  I was using the connection to a Yamaha Sound bar as the bogie, and that worked from the get go.  At this point I don’t know who is at fault, Microsoft or Bose.  All I know is we were not able to get them to work on the Surface.  As I said, they work great with an iPhone, and also with an iPadPro.  Maybe the Apple developers at Bose can swing over and help the Microsoft developer team???????  Or maybe Windows 10 just is what it is.

author: TriniBlue
title: Excellent product
content: The headline captures my review. Nonissue should thus far. It works as promised.

author: Rene C.
title: Comfort and Oblivion
content:
Love how comfortable they are. I have a pair of Beats on the ear but they make my ears throb after 30 minutes.
We can listen to mush at work and these are something that I can wear without ear pain. I hate ear buds, do have bluetooth hearing aids, but these block out all the surrounding sounds that affect my concentration. Love them! I did not however get the airplane connector in with mine.

author: kathy warren
title: Noise cancelling is top notch!
content: This is a great product.  I’ve never had a Bose product before, but I plan to in the future.  Easy to use and fantastic sound.  I haven’t used it on a flight yet, but plan to do so in the very near future.  I use it primarily at this time to watch Netflix on my iPad!  I highly recommend this product!!!

author: Topspin
title: Noise Canceling Minimal in Office Environment
content:
I bought this product because I work in a “new” open space style office.  Problem is that it is difficult to concentrate when you write technical papers due to voice chatter.  These headphones decrease the noice somewhat but they do not eliminate it unless you play music.  I don’t like listening to music when I write or read technical papers.

If you want total silence don’t buy these.

author: John Q.
title: Perfect
content: The best quality and excellent noise cancellation.

author: Chad C.
title: Great set of headphones
content: Great set of headphones.  Upagraded from Bose Soundlink.  These are amazing. The Assistant button is great. I use mine to adjust noise cancellation level (you have to pick what you want the button to control Google or Noise). I think I am more sensitive to the noise cancellation, day one it bugged me but now I leave the NC on low for hours with no issues. I never use high NC.  The one thing that is sightly of annoying (I might be getting picky...). When I pair them to my Samsung phone or my iPad they always pair with the NC on high. I wish they could remember the last NC level of the device it was paired with - then I could use the button on the headphones for Google control and not NC control.  Sound is great though and that is the real reason I bought theses headphone...no regrets.

author: matt hohertz
title: The "best" to Sony's "rest"
content:
I use these headphones primarily to listen to podcasts and Google Play music: in particular, I am not a musician, audiophile, or expert on acoustics, and I am at most an infrequent and casual gamer.

That said, I enthusiastically recommend these headphones over Sony's -- hands down, no contest, no questions asked.  Let me count the reasons:
* Idle timer that switches the headphones off to preserve battery (as opposed to running until the battery dies if you pause and forget to switch them off)
* Low battery warning (as opposed to just kind of turning off when the battery is out)
* Multiple-device compatibility, with one-button switching (as opposed to manually-disconnect-from-first-device-then-manually-connect-to-the-second switching)

Noise cancellation is good enough for my needs.  Assuming that the headphones are playing sound (at which point their noise cancellation will function optimally), they will dampen -- but not fully cancel -- loud ambient sounds (e.g., a screeching subway, loud PAs, traffic).  On the other hand, they do an excellent job of muting distracting noises, including nearby conversations, which makes them excellent supplements to a day of rigorous study.

author: Paul D.
title: Love Bose
content: So comfortable and work excellent

author: Lynn
title: Ah-mazing!
content:
I bought the Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) Wireless Headphones after doing my research and wading through reviews. Overall they had a better rating.
I'm hyper sensitive to noise, and was about to lose my mind at work. I cringed at the thought of spending this much for headphones. I've been using air pods trying to drown everything out, but had to have the music so loud I still couldn't think. The difference these headphones have made in both my sanity and ability to concentrate is truly game changing!

author: Susan N
title: Best noise canceling headphones
content: Outstanding quality headphones!  Worked prefect on a cross country flight.  Highly recommended better than. All previous headphones, noise canceling  really works!

author: Joshua
title: Best noise canceling headphones I've ever used, Period.
content:
The only thing about these I can complain about is the range. But who really needs to walk away form their phone over 25ft away anyway.
They are very comfortable, to the point that you forget they are on your head.
The sound quality is amazing, I've never had any headphones that Have been at this level of quality.
Now for the sound canceling? Well like every set of headphones it won't cancel out every sound. But this is pretty darn near as close to drowning out ambient sound as you can get.
They feel very sturdy and look like they would be difficult to break.
The carrying case is also pretty good and sturdy that it comes with.

Over all I would recommend these headphones to anyone.

author: Poolboy
title: Comfortable, powerful, long-lasting.
content: Can’t do better than these. Very long battery life, powerful bass, good and easy connection, intuitive app for control, great sound and quality. You won’t be disappointed.

author: M. Martin
title: Don't buy for wired use
content: I was very disappointed when I tried to use with the cord.  It doesn't seem to maintain a good connection.  And, yes, I did check that it was well seated.  And tried replugging multiple times.  In Bluetooth use they seem fine.  I guess I have to retire my old iPod and just use my phone from now on.  Two bad, I loved my old wired QC2's.

author: Bubba
title: Love these wireless headphones
content: Great quality, great sound. No complaints thus far.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome sound
content: Get you a pair

author: KyleK
title: Great Sound, ANC, and Comfort
content: These are the most comfortable pair of headphones I've ever worn. They have incredible sound quality and good ANC. I don't normally like spending $300 on a whim, but it sure was an amazing purchase.

author: Fabi
title: Excellent noise cancellation
content: I had been looking for a headphone which had a better noise cancellation feature.These are best at this and also the sound quality is better than any other headphones i owned so far.I can make the calls or take the calls outside of my home or office without outside noise. I purchased one in sliver and another in triple midnight blue for my husband. My only purpose was noise cancellation but my husband he is a music lover,he always has his headphone on,whenever he is at home or we are travelling together. The best part is that we both can share the same music or watch the same video though we have our own headphones on,that makes the travelling more fun on flight.Overall its a pleasure to use these headphones,worth the price.

author: Neufology
title: Love, love, love these headphones
content: The price is steep but the joy from use and noise cancellation is great.  My only beef is that the series II should come with the airplane adapter that the series I comes with.  If you can afford to spend on headphones these are great.  After extended use, my ears get quite warm and I have to stop.  I wish there was a better way to let air in without sound coming with it.

author: Angeleia
title: Best kid cancelling headphones for flights ever
content: Fantastic kid and airplane noise cancelling headphones - so comfortable - awesome. I found myself wearing them even when not playing music or watching films.

author: Bertus Kock
title: Light, Sounds Awesome but lacks in Bluetooth quality
content: The Bose QuietComfort 35 II sounds is great and it is very comfortable even over long periods. It is also quite easy to connect to another device and it stays connected to multiple devices.  The only flaws for me is the plastic look (small price to pay in order to keep it light in weight), which is more obvious in the silver colour, and secondly the Bluetooth range isn't that great. It is almost like it needs direct line of sight and not too far.

author: DGD
title: Crystal clear
content: Do you want the noise in an airplane to disappear.  This will do it.

author: RedSox6115
title: Great Headphones Ruined by App Requirements
content: The sound quality is great but you can't utilize any of the features, including adjusting noise cancellation levels, without the app... and the app requires location tracking. Location tracking for bluetooth headphones is a deal breaker for me. Further, these aren't worth the price tag when you can't access any of the nicer features.

author: Ryan H.
title: Amazing noise cancelling and sound
content: These headphones are great. For me they are the best I have ever tried. The noise cancellation is awesome. If you fly a lot you will definitely enjoy these. They block people and the sound of the engines very well. They are spendy but definitely worth it.

author: Candela Armstrong
title: Wirless= Awesome. Wired= Worthless
content:
The headphones are amazing if u plan to ONLY USE THEM WIRELESS. However, I have tried them multiple times on flights with cable and its worthless. U have to play with the cable and get lots of static and poor connectivity. Ur better off using a 99 cent cable.
Wirless= Awesome
Wired= Worthless

author: luro
title: Ear Pressure can't wear them
content:
Build quality, sound are very good, unfortunately I noticed immediately ear pressure, in both noise cancellation levels.
I am sad because I did like them but I can't continue using them. I read a couple of reviewers with the same problem.
It seems that not everyone is affected by it, but I notice the pressure in every setting.
I have to return them, too bad.

author: Leonard Fu
content: amazing sound coming from it. Love Bose! Crisp effects but could use a bit more bass.

author: David Jacobson
title: Amazing noise cancellation, high quality sound
content:
Absolutely amazing noise cancelling.  I can listen to delicate harpsichord music while sitting in a jet airplane, and music is totally enjoyable.

The sound is very good.  Good bass.  Clean highs.  They sound a tad better than my Audio Technica ATH-M50s.  Bear in mind that I'm 72 years old, so I probably can't hear much above 10 or 12 KHz.  It can Bluetooth pair with with multiple device, an you can switch from one to another.  (Very very nice.)  You can have the noise cancellation high (normal), low, or off.  This is good if you are, say, using them at home where the isn't much noise, but need to hear the doorbell or phone.  There is a built-in rechargeable battery.  It last a long time.

There is one button that you press it once to stop/start the music twice for something else, 3 times to go back to the beginning of the track.  This is difficult:  there are too many things to remember, and worse yet, there is no nice little cheat sheet, and no manual; you have to install an app and then read through the FAQ and look for the question like "How do I advance to the next track".  This could have been much better.

author: C. McChesney
title: Super great!
content: these are really great - cancels out noise, even lawn mower and weed wackers- super impressed with the quality

author: Carina V. White
title: Happy Costumer!
content: Great product and fast shipping!

author: Steve Barduson
title: Superb noise canceling
content: Most impressed with this product. Should’ve done this years ago. Worth every penny! Nothing compares.

author: Ram
title: Sorry can't hear you
content: Noise canceling on these is by far the best of any of my nc headphones. No more barking dogs, nagging wife, or noisy little grandkids. They have turned me into the hermit I have always wanted to be.

author: Heather Stoner
title: The best
content: Top quality and functionality. Love them.

author: Reader one
title: The perfect headphone
content: This is the first time I purchased headphones. However I sampled different  brands in the local store. This is the best that I tried and subsequently purchased it.

author: sevyna9
title: Sound limiting, not sound-proof.
content:
For the price, I thought I  wouldn't hear anything once Iput these on,, but I guess that's for people who blast whatever they're listening to.
I travel on planes often and needed something to quiet my surroundings and also for noisy hotels.
I find they do drown out a lot of noise, but aren't totally sound cancelling. I can still hear the murmurs of people talking loudly around me, faintly hear a baby screaming, and definitely heard the chimes when the lav smoke alarm went off.
They were great when I was in a noisy hotel room and didn't want to use earplugs because afraid wouldn't hear the alarm, but used them and my white noise app drowned out the weird stuttering air conditioner, the traffic outside and still heard my alarm in the morning. I thought it would be uncomfortable, but slept soundly. Then noticed after 8 hours of night use, the battery was only at 70%.
Those minimal times I do listen to music loud, I find I don't disturb others around me with sound leakage, which is great too.
So I think it's still worth the cost.
The seller I got mine from (outlet) was an individual who smoked so it about 3 months to get the smell to go away but enjoy the headphones immensely.

author: Josh
title: Hands down my favorite headphones yet, base and manule eq lacking
content: So I don’t like first looks right after getting a product, so this is just at 14 months of owning these. My only reason these don’t get an all around 5 is due to a lack of base and no Manule eq settings. Besides that battery life is boasts 20hrs a year later stands true with noise cancelling the whole time I flew 15 and 1/2 flight with a 2 he flight preceding. And to include airports. Probably ran total of 24hrs and still had 20% left. Construction is not my favorite lots of plastic and aluminum don’t hold up great if you aren’t careful. Sound cancelling is amazing unless there is a medium wind. For some reason messes with it and it’s a little loud. Ease of use. Parr’s every time I’m with little blue tooth games. Unlike some headphones you have to forget turn off turn on. All that. They auto connect in seconds. I purchased a case with a battery to charge them and honestly hardly ever use it. Is nice for cause can it can charge you phone too. Or any usb so I still carry them in that. Besides the eq and base and construction. They have held up well under my falling asleep with them in and ending up going Through who knows what. I annoy a little more weight for matirials that feel sturdy. But as far as them holding up they have done well for me

author: E
title: Rose gold very cute, definitely a novelty bose item
content:
i've loved bose for a long time and always dreamed of the day that i would finally purchase one of their products. i was pretty set on getting the silver QC35 II's and then they came out when the rose gold color and that one sold me. I would have liked more if the white portion was also rose gold. i try not to wear them when i'm wearing face make up or i was my face/hair before wearing them because i don't want to get those white portions dirty. very simple to use. nice rounded sound, could use more bass unfortunately. noise cancellation is great, i use it when sleeping at my gf's house because her family is very loud.
unfortunately, you can't pair this to anything, even if you download the bose connect+ app. it only pairs to my iphone via bluetooth. if i want to listen to music using this headphone on my laptop or old android phone, i need to use the wire. i'm going to see if it connects via bluetooth to modern samsung phones soon. really wish it could at least pair to my laptop.
it's a bit heavy on your head at first, but you get used to it. i'm still too scared to wear it in public because it's so pretty i feel like someone will just run by and steal it off my head if i'm not paying attention.
i really don't use the google assistant/alexa button ever. if you use siri or whatever a lot, it would be useful to you.
calls are crystal and people say i sound clear. people have said if i have the volume about halfway, they can hear what i'm listening to, which i don't like.
overall, these headphones are a gem. definitely very expensive, but i plan on using these for a very long time. battery life is good. i'm not a heavy headphone user. i've charged it once since getting it (couple months ago) and have just reached 60%.

author: Sam Z.
title: Sound and equipment quality is poor independent of cost
content: The jacks and plugs are of poor quality.  I've had to play extensively with the jacks in the headphones to work properly.  Sound drops out of one ear regularly.  I've only used the headphones on airplanes a few times and had to resort to an old set of Iphone earbuds in order to listen to my podcasts.

author: Rachell Youngman
title: Disappointed
content: Just could not get it to connect to the echo

author: Anthony Pettway Jr
content: Greatest headphones ever

author: Shane Akerson
title: Buys These!
content: I just got the Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones today, and they are absolutely awesome!  I spent hours researching these and other headphones, read all the review.  I mainly wanted to use them mowing about 4 acres and they were everything I expected and more. After 2 hours of mowing I couldn't even tell I had them on,  very soft around the ear.  The noise-cancelling and the sound are just the best.  I hope they hold up and last a long time because I was so happy with these I wanted to write a review right away.  If your going to spend around $300 for a good set I recommend these 100%

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing quality, you’ll hear nuances in the music never before heard.
content: Quality, quality, quality.  Love the noise cancelling.  Take a phone call, then they take you back to your music.  Great for Costco shopping, yard work and generally blocking out and staying in your happy place with quality sounding music.  You’ll hear small nuances you did not know were there.

author: David F.
title: As expected
content: As expected

author: Karen Midgett
title: Great headset
content: I was needing a noise cancelling headset and bought this one. It is comfortable, sounds great but most of all noise cancelling works great!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth the price
content: Great quality

author: FLmiami
title: Recommended
content: Recommended. I had hesitated due to the high price and how bulky "over the ear earphones" and their cases are (another bulky gadget to carry in the briefcase when I travel), but now that I have been using them for several months, in multiple flights, I am glad I purchased them. They do reduce the airplane's noise significantly. I can listen to music at lower volume, and I like that it's wireless.

author: PersonaGratis
title: Very happy with my purchase.
content: Comfortable. Beautifully designed. Great noise cancellation. Outstanding audio quality.

author: Amazon Customer
title: High quality
content: Great headsets, long batter life and comfortable after wearing for any length of time. They sound like being in your private theater.

author: Jose M. Lopez-Marron
title: Keeps away the noise, but it’s stiffer, more uncomfortable, than previous ones.
content: Better for noise cancellation than the Bose I bought six years ago, but the ear padding is not as comfortable. It’s stiffer and made with lower quality plastic.

author: john pinkerton
title: It works great
content: Very good product. I have PTSD and this is a lifesaver

author: Kim
title: Great sound canceling
content: Great sound canceling and quality. sometimes it gets muted for half a sec idk why. It hasnt bugged me that much yet. Headphones itself has to be updated.

author: Krichek
title: When it says quiet, it means quiet
content: It is easy to lose yourself in your surroundings with these.  Extremely comfortable...I had a competitor's headset for a few years, but there was some part inside the right headphone that would constantly rub on my ear; the Bose QuietComfort 35II has no such issue.  I fly to Asia constantly, and these headsets are a must for anyone doing so.  Can't hear engine noise, screaming kids, arguing lovers, etc.  Well worth the cost if you want true noise cancellation and comfort.  Well done yet again, Bose.  Also, connecting to all my different devices is a breeze; I have not had a single connection issue yet.

author: Tami
title: Warning!
content: Warning!!!! You will want to wear them when you cannot. I wish I could wear them at work!  Parenting five kids! Yup.... don’t want to take them off! Oh and I slept with them on a flight overseas without anything playing. They helped drown out all of the noise around me and were perfectly comfortable!

author: emily
title: Amazing! Heavy duty
content: Amazing! Heavy duty. I’m not worried about rough housing these and I use them for my daily commute. Travel case is good and easy to open and durable. I have a different pair of headphones for work and the case is cumbersome. Not these! Great noise cancellation. I like the option to have high, low, or none. Walking on the streets is good to hear some traffics noise. These really block out noise so well and sound quality is awesome. I haven’t had to charge them yet and it’s been almost 2 weeks.

author: Customer
title: Love these
content: I absolutely love these headphones.  Very expensive but worth the extra money.  I was recently delayed at the airport 4 times so I went to sit in an empty part of the airport.  A couple with their toddler (screaming) child literally sat right next to me.  OMG.  I put on the headphones and turned a very irritating moment into a pleasant one :-).  You can still hear things around you if you do not turn on music (or whatever you listen to) but it does remove the white noise.  I put on the headphones  and turned on music at a very normal level.  I then turned on my tv and turned the volume to 30 before I could hear it - which was awesome!

author: Christie
title: perfect for my son in college to drown out noise
content: perfect for my son in college to drown out noise , also to take on his wrestling trips... You get what you pay for and this Bose headphones are awesome !

author: B. K.
title: Works great for focusing on audio/video at places with loud ambient noises
content:
I'm using these to do some transcription and video coding work, and I was surprised at how well they blocked out noises at cafes (the cafe music and espresso machine, any echoes from people's conversations), and construction work next door to my house (which will be going on for ALL summer). Before, I never would have considered doing this kind of work (where I have to pay attention to audio very carefully) at a cafe, but these headphones enable me to do so! If you're not listening to any audio while using the noise-canceling feature, you can still hear people's conversations, but a lot of the ambient noise is cancelled out.

They are very comfortable over the ears and don't squeeze my head (or earrings) like many other headphones do. The only uncomfortable bit I've found is the top of the headphone band that rests on my head, but because the headphones are fairly light, it's not so bad.

The headphones come with a cord to directly connect to a device (I use this when I don't need to use the noise-canceling feature and want to save on battery), and the case is nice and sturdy, so I'm not worried about my expensive headphones getting crushed or damaged when jammed into my bag full of books and other junk.

I also like that the buttons are easy to find while wearing the headphones, so I can pause and play video/audio without having to click out of any note-taking windows I have up on my computer.

I was lucky to have some research funds to buy this item. Otherwise, I'm not sure if I'd be willing to shell out $300+ for this. If cost is an issue, I'd probably recommend that you rely on cheaper headphones and find quieter places to work if that is an option for you.

author: Mauricio
title: Great sound
content: Microphone also works great

author: T.hand
title: Excellent noise cancellation/high level sound quality
content: Great battery life could be a bit louder for the price they ask...still extremely happy with this purchase

author: Amazon Customer
title: Perfect for travel.
content: Construction is nice, the plastic can seem somewhat cheap but you can wear these things for days and they'll never be uncomfortable. I just took mine on a 12 hour flight and wore them the whole time with zero issues. Sound quality is killer but the real benefit is the noise cancelling which makes these perfect for travel when you want to drown out the child crying two rows up and the guy with a bad cough in the seat behind you. The battery life is absolutely incredible as well, I've fallen asleep with them on bluetooth with noise cancelling on max setting and the battery will only have gone down about 20% after 8 hours. They come with a nice hard shell case that protects them and holds the charging cable and 3.5mm cord as well. The only thing I didn't really like was the fact that during setup for bluetooth operation is that you have to download and connect the bose app to set the headphones up.

author: futureboy
title: Best set of headphones I've ever owned - ALMOST perfect
content:
I love love love love love these headphones. I use them daily, I travel with them, I never leave home without them. I used to be afraid of Bluetooth headphones because of concerns over battery life or headaches I would sometimes get from Bluetooth (true story!). That being said, these QC35s are AMAZING and I am so happy I own them.  I used to think the Bose QC20s were the absolute best, but I have since gone cordless and I don't think I can go back.

The battery life is solid - I can use these pretty almost all week without recharging them. The sound quality is solid. I'm not an audiophile but it sounds great to me. The noise canceling is fantastic and I can't really imagine flying anymore without these.
