There is only ONE problem with these and the rest of the Bluetooth Bose headphones: the ability to pair with two devices simultaneously is both awesome and super annoying. I tend to pair between either my MacBook Pro and my iPhone, or my iPhone and my iPad, depending on where I am. The headphones will pair with both, but sometimes the headphones will "listen" to one of the devices when I want to hear audio on another, which makes me end up doing some jumble of turning off Bluetooth on one device so I can force the QC35s to listen to the device I want. For example, when I fly now, I try to remember to turn off Bluetooth on my MacBook Pro if I'm not using it and leaving it up in overhead storage, because even when asleep the Bluetooth is still on and the QC35's will pair with them, when I only want to use my iPhone or iPad to watch movies or listen to music. So in these situations, I have to load the app on my iPhone and disconnect the Mac, or pull out my MBP and turn off Bluetooth. Super annoying. Suggestion to Bose: add an extra button that lets users toggle between which Bluetooth device we want to hear. Perhaps even allow a third connection. Then, I could sit there on the plane, paired to my iPhone, iPad and MBP, and I could click a button to toggle between which device I want to hear. Problem solved and I would be super happy. USB-C charging would be great too since this is inevitable for our devices.

I'm still giving these 5 stars because despite this Bluetooth issue, they are still my favorite headphones for daily use. So, in summary, I love these, but here are my three suggestions:

1) Add a button to toggle between paired devices.
2) Increase number of allowed simultaneously paired devices to 3.
3) Switch the port to USB-C for charging since this is the future.

author: Ninja
title: If you have the money buy it
content: What to say, I loved the series I and this is even better. Probably is the best of its kind: comfortable, sound quality, noise canceling and battery life.

author: Leo Martinez
title: Battery and signal is good
content: Battery last a long time. I would buy again

author: blaine wilkinson
title: Great headphones!
content: Love these headphones! The noise cancellation is great, and the sound is awesome. Would definitely buy again. Also, love the color.

author: Empty Pockets
title: Love the sound and quality
content: I went back and forth between Bose and Sony. I decided on the Bose and I’m very happy with my purchase. The sound is great as you would expect and the Alexia option works great. I love taking walks on the beach every couple days with these.

author: Jets
title: Fantastic
content: Works .  My wife says they're wonderful.  Great for working around loud machinery.

author: Stephen Jaggard
title: Absolutely necessary if you travel/fly for work.
content: This product makes plane travel way less burdensome. It just takes you away to your own quiet area to get from A-B and the battery lasts forever.

author: oweky
title: They work Great! only problem at all is the google assistant
content: They work Great! only problem at all is the google assistant. It doesn't really do much but that's on googles end and maybe with a few upgrades it will be handy. I thought i would be able to send a text by using google assistant. It wont do it on my iphone. They never fail to connect and the sound quality is great. Love the noise cancellations so I can hear my podcast/music in noisy environments.

author: Ed Everhart
title: Great Product That's Worth the Price
content: I've wanted a pair of these headphones for a long, long time, but I couldn't convince myself to spend $350 on a pair of headphones, but now that I've experienced the bliss that is Bose Noise Cancelling I can't imagine traveling anywhere without them. I travel to Europe and Asia several times a year and take domestic, cross country flights regularly. I decided to purchase my Bose headphones before my latest trip in Week 37, 2018. I put on my new headphones, settled into my seat, hit play on my travel playlist, and everything else disappeared.  I didn't realize just how good the noise cancelling function worked until I took the headphones off for a minute. The noise of the plane seemed almost deafening.  I quickly put the headphones back on and enjoyed the rest of my 10 hour flight with everything around me silenced.  I've bought several pairs of headphones prior to purchasing the Bose headphones because I wasn't willing to pay the price.  I can tell you that they don't even come close to the noise cancelling abilities of the Bose headphones.  In addition to the noise cancelling feature, the look and feel (especially the feel) of the materials are of the highest quality. The way the headphones feel when I put them on is like nothing I've ever experienced.  Again, all the other headphones I've bought and tried don't even come close.  The sound quality is also exceptional. I would definitely recommend these to someone who wants their own little oasis, especially people who travel a lot. The other headphones I've tried aren't even worth considering. If I could do it all over I would have saved myself the $200 I spent on lower quality headphones and gone straight to the Bose headphones from the beginning. I will use these headphones for a long, long time.

author: Minnie
title: High quality product
content: Absolutely love them. I’ve had them for a week so far. The battery life is about a full day with the noise canceling on high. I enjoy the sound quality and the noise canceling is fantastic; i can still hear a voice if they are right next to me, but in general it blocks out a significant portion of the office noise around me. The build is sturdy and the case is just the right size

author: Callen Bagley
title: The best purchase I have made in years.
content:
These are an absolute game changer. I don't leave home without them, especially if I am travelling.
They are a little pricey, but 100% worth the money.

author: JoeDingles
title: Pretty darn good
content: I can pretty much tune out the wife and kids.  I like them.

author: Anthony
title: 5 out of 5
content: Best noise cancelling headphone I have ever get. Worth the price

author: nia
title: Love the sound quality
content: The noise cancellation is pretty good .. I had a problem with the initial head phones returned those and they are great they do disconnect sometime when in an active call other than that very satisfied

author: Leota Sweetman-McPeek
title: Don't buy a storage case
content: I have only used the noise cancellation headphones once.  They seem great, but I was very frustrated that the description didn't state that a storage case is included.  I spent an extra $14. for a case that I don't need.  Returning the case is costing me $7.  plus a trip to UPS.

author: nollhouse
title: Outstanding quality and function
content:
I’ve given mine a good workout now. I play music and love the sound quality- high tones and bass tones.

I also use these everyday for my phone calls, conference calls and I love them. The functionality for making, accepting calls, Siri / Alexa directions etc is excellent.

Finally for travel the noise cancellation is simply remarkable on airplanes etc.

author: David Ellsworth
title: Great product but overpriced
content: I like it. Cable too short to connect to pc. Good quality but about $100 too expensive.

author: Noelle K.
title: Awesome noise canceling headphones
content: Soooo happy with this purchase! You notice a difference the second you put them on. Bluetooth works well with my PC laptop and YouTube while working. Sound quality is everything I hoped for from Bose. Over-the-ear pads are super soft and comfortable even when I'm wearing earrings. I highly recommend these headphones, well worth the price

author: BigWurm9023
title: For those who like to be left alone
content: These things are life savers! Annoying co-workers got you distracted? Say no more! The noise cancellation makes it so i can’t even hear myself think let alone those pesky colleagues. Sound quality is crystal clear.

author: Robert J. Zamorski
title: MOST SATISFIED
content: These headphones are the top quality as advertised. My only disappointment is my inability to hook up with Alexa. I keep being connected to Google.

author: Vikram
title: Almost Perfect
content: This is perfect in almost every aspect. Price is a little bit higher but I would not mind paying since the sound quality is amazing. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because when I wear them for long hours, they hurt my ear and cause headache. Please improve the design. I'd love to come back and change it to 5 stars

author: Amazon Customer
title: Falling apart after 4 months
content:
Update-Bose replaces my headphones without question. While they shouldn’t fall apart, I’m glad I have new ones with a new warranty.

I give it two stars because the noise cancelling is amazing and I loved these headphones. But I have had them for only 4 months, I take good care of them and they have screws falling out. I can hardly wear or use them now. These were way too expensive to have them literally fall apart after 4 months. So disappointed.

author: Mariah S.
title: Not worth the money.
content: These are not what I expected of Bose. Don't waste your money.

author: Jacob Bradford
title: No complaints
content: Great noise cancellation and clear sound

author: this and that
title: Yasss
content: Birthday prezzie for the hubs. He loves them ! (Wish I had some now) we tried a few different brands in store .... these won... besides the sound they fit so comfortably.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Happy I bought them. Wish I had not wasted money on cheap stuff.
content: Everything I hoped for. I love love these guys.

author: Willis
title: Leakage
content:
These are great headphones! I love how I can just check out of the world.
Issue I have is so much sound leakage at medium volume people can hear what I am listening to very clearly and I worry it is disturbance to them.
this is kind of a big concern to me and I might return for this reason. Other than that they are incredible.

author: M. Cochran
title: Very happy with all features.
content: Love this headset. I have hearing problems. Can turn hearing aids down very low and still wear inside headset, then no squeal. Excellent range and customer service. Sound=the best. Can answer phone with them while watching TV. At first had problem with hearing my own voice, but turned off noise cancellation, reconnected, made call and then could hear myself. Works with Moto e4 and g6 play. Only drawback for me is robot "status" voice is hard to understand.

author: Minh
title: most comfortable
content: I'm not a audiophile but do listen to music many hours at work. this by far is the most comfortable ever!! noise cancellation is not perfect but it's damn good; i can barely hear the train coming...so please pay attention to your surroundings when using these things!! the only thing is i can hear the reverberation of my steps when i'm walking so i dont know if it will sound good during running...but have been too lazy to find out =(  Overall i think it's worth it.  Just hopeful it will last for long time

author: Sara Sheedy
title: Annoyed at the price but otherwise great
content: Paid too much. But they were his favorote gift

author: Phuong Pham
title: Comfortable, great sound, and great noise cancelling feature
content:
Very comfortable and great sound quality.
Noise cancelling works really well, I really love it especially during a flight. However, your wife/girlfriend may kill you if you wear it at home :p

author: Patti H.
title: Quality sound
content: All the description says they are. Good quality, great sound.

author: HappyGirl21
title: and totally love to pieces
content: Wear everyday, and totally love to pieces. Best headphones ever. Block out all distractions and make it easy to concentrate.

author: Gary E. Masters
title: The sound reproduction is EXCELLENT.  They always connect, very comfortable on the ears, not hot or heavy.
content: WOW... I use them to listen as I watch movies on my Microsoft Surface and the sound reproduction is EXCELLENT. Plus they always connect, very comfortable on the ears, not hot, not heavy and wow, they really eliminate the outside ambient noise. I'm pretty impressed by how capable or effective the noise cancelling feature is. I choose the silver and no one plays with them. My guess is they don't look impressive or high tech enough. Works for me....

author: Patrick Riley
title: Five stars from a glasses wearer
content: I’ve noticed I can’t wear over the ear phones for a long time because they will push my glasses into my head and it’s uncomfortable. Not these. I’ve worn them in flights for hours and hours and no issues whatsoever. They’re also super light.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Poor connection
content: Connection cuts out, come to find out its a common problem for this product

author: Amazon Customer
title: Perfect
content: My husband loved this and uses daily

author: VIKO
title: Good item.
content: Good item.

author: Online Shopper
title: Excellent purchase.
content: Cancels out the Hallmark channel that my wife watches endlessly. I can enjoy watching movies on my tablet and not hear the non stop blubbering.

author: Devin Grifo
title: I ordered these for a trip to Tokyo and the noise cancellation was fantastic. Very good sound - balanced with not too ...
content:
After a lot of research, I ordered these for a trip to Tokyo and the noise cancellation was fantastic.  Very good sound - balanced with not too bright or too much bass - for both rock, jazz vocals and trance music.  The Bose fit my head well and were comfortable for the whole 14 hour flight - my head is on the large side and many headphones (Sennheiser, Sony, Audio Technica) were are too tight after an hour.

Battery life is good - I think I used about 50% for the Tokyo flight.  I have other Bose headphones and they have held up well, so I expect the same for these.

author: BaileyK
title: Great product, bit pricey
content:
I bought it as a gift for my husband on his birthday. He loves this. He works in an office with an open floor plan and he used to complain about the noise. After he got it, he is really happy with the noise cancellation and of course the sound quality. In any song, you can hear every minute sound clearly as intended by the artist/sound engineer; its amazing.
  The negatives are, the person on the other end of the phone call can hear the background noise. For headphones, which cost $349 thats unacceptable; when some cheap bluetooth headphones can give you better background noise protection for phone calls.

author: Shen Xin Bonanno
title: Conditional noise cancellation, but overall amazing
content: After a few months of having these headphones, I have mostly positive reviews for them. For one, while on a train back to my home town, they kept the noises of crying children from my ears. However, on a bus to and from classes at university, I still managed to pick up voices and bus noise. It seems that the noise cancellation is very dependent on the type of music you're playing. I also notice occasional problems with syncing. It's noticable if you're using them to watch a movie or video only. After reconnecting the headphones, they sync perfectly. Overall, they're very good and comfortable headphones and the battery life is excellent!

author: Mike D.
title: Awesome headphones but not good for gaming
content:
Great headphones, love the noise cancelling, the quality of sound, the ability to easily connect and switch to different devices, and the headset feature for taking phone calls.

The only major gripe is the lack of quality support for gaming on a Windows computer. It is possible, there should be 3 options for connecting over bluetooth in windows, one of them is a 'handset' option and that should work within pc games. The problem tho is the quality is really horrible.. like a very bad signal phone call for audio quality.

author: Eddie
title: Excellent Headphones
content: This is an incredible set of headphones the soundproofing is great it blocks out all outside noise.

author: Denise O.
title: Love these headphones
content: Wireless, GREAT Sound Cancelation in a Very Noisy Vehicle, holds battery life for many days.

author: Eileen P
title: Great for noise cancelling
content: I got these for my husband and he loves them... especially the noise cancelling aspect, when I’m calling him to take the dog out.

author: Kindle Customer
title: bluetooth stop wroking after 2 months
content: 4th Bose headphone, this one is real disappointing because bluetooth never get connected after 2 months, tried on ipad, iphone, none works, connection unsuccessful. I have to use it with wire like QC25.

author: David D
title: The noise cancellation is a life changer! Most comfortable headphones I've ever bought.
content: These headphones are absolutely amazing. It was hard to get a sense of how the noise cancellation would be or what that meant. When first turning them on, you are surprised at how isolated you feel even before your music has started playing. It feels like you are in a sound proof room or like a quiet airplane. Sound quality is definitely the only thing slightly less perfect. It's not super rich or bass-heavy, but have the perfect balance to wear for hours on end. I bring these to work and they definitely help block everything out, improve my productivity, and provide comfort not many other models/brands can match. Hands down my best purchase this year.

author: Mike Massey
title: A very good thing to have when flying
content: Excellent purchase. The wireless feature is worth the upgrade

author: glendoor42
title: Everything is excellent
content: Superior sound. Didn't think I would get much use of the noise cancelling but I can't live with out it now. Very comfortable. Had a pair of Sennheiser 4.40 BT before this and the difference is night and day. These are worth every penny.

author: ddev
title: Irritated at the Amazon/Bose price dropped $50 in less than a month
content: And thought about returning to Amazon for the refund. But the sound is so exceptional that I'd already bought a second pair for my son - and prying those away from him would be a struggle too. So I'm sticking with the headphones but still annoyed. Bose was a customer when I was in computer sales and I respect their technology and general attention to detail - but that might be out of date thinking if they're now giving out price reductions. So minus 1 star.

author: Blake
title: These things are amazing, from working at a coffee shop
content: These things are amazing, from working at a coffee shop, traveling on an airplane and in between, they are great for noise cancellation and keeping your focus while working or just listening to tunes. I have no problems with battery life and I use them mostly with bluetooth and not plugged into the aux cable, but it is nice to have options. Would definitely recommend.

author: M Stakes
title: Awesome Sound
content: Great sound. Compared with similar popular products at brick and mortar before deciding this was the right one to buy.

author: RosAnn
title: Life Saver for Me
content:
I have reviewed my review after having these a good while now and have come to the conclusion, though I really could not afford the price tag, it has been well worth it for me here in this place.
If I had to listen to the noise at full volume here, I surely would have gone mad by now, so...

They do have the good sound cancellation however not perfect, but have been a life saver in some respects in my situation here.
Not sure what causes it, but they do cut out now and again.
The one thing I will say is that they are comfortable and do fit around the ear.

author: Wayne W.
title: Easy to use and comfortable
content:
These headphones sound great, are extremely comfortable, and easily pair with my iPhone and laptop.  I typically use them on flights in lieu of earbuds that provide no background noise cancelation.  I liked the headphones so much I bought a second pair for my wife.  Highly recommend.

This is a 5-star product but gave it 4-stars on noise reduction because I could hear some background sounds.  All that said, it effectively cancelled out most of the background noise and i’ll Freely admit that I don’t really know what the criteria is that would make any headset a 5-star product so it’s possible that this one is as good as anything out there.

author: Andrea W
title: Great
content: I love Bose products!! I have a pair of my own and I bought this one for my Dad. No complaints about them!! Except for that, after owning it for 2 years, the ear pads on mine are ripping. It has been a long time, and definitely worth it when it comed to sound quality and fit. Just be aware that you’ll be needing new ones after a couple of years.

author: Archie
title: Sooo comfortable
content: Very comfortable and the sound is amazing.  I've had beats pro before and they just crapped the bed and I decided to go with these...so glad I did.  I also like that they fold up more flat than others...into a great case.

author: Dawn Koch
title: Love love love
content: This were purchased for my 16 year old son and he loves them, takes them everywhere.

author: Joe’s account
title: Love the Bose
content: I’m a Bose person and love the weight and the flexibility of these headphones. I had a pair of the battery operated corded version that are 15 years old and love them. These are better.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good but not mind blowing for the price
content: I bought this headphone obviously considering the brand. But, after listening to other headphones, i feel that this headphone is kind of overpriced. Would suggest to consider other options before buying this.

author: Double A
title: Great Pair of headpones
content: My wife loves these she wears them a lot. and says they are very comfortable and she like the looks. They have also been working well with her iPhone, iPad and MacBook.

author: Marshall G. Johnson
title: Best headphones I’ve ever owned!
content: I can tell you these are the most comfortable headphones! The noise canceling is the best I have ever heard. Walking around wireless is a great joy. The Google Assistant is a great plus.

author: Misty Robbins
title: Best headphones ever
content: These are the best headphones I've ever had!  Not only do they sound great, the rose gold is beautiful!  Love love LOVE!!!!

author: Christian
title: They are not worth the price tag
content: I am comparing these to a pair of $60 headphones from Sony that I got 3 years ago on sale. Noise cancellation definitely works on these, no doubt about that. The build quality seems great. The problem is is that my old Sony's have better sound quality than these do. There should be no competition for these and $60 headphones.

author: SCTexan
title: Lives up to the Bose reputation
content: So far so good.  We are very pleased with the 2 we bought.  The real test comes in the near future on our 10 hour flight.

author: Traveler
title: Sometimes there is no sound
content: Only used it on 2 flights, there was already inconsistency of the sound.  Sometimes there is no sound coming through.  Would like to return the item.

author: wilder osorio
title: Over rated
content: Noice cacelation not so great.

author: jilly
title: Sweet
content: A+

author: Sudhakantha Girmohanta
title: Automatically stops music in iPhone
content: Had to return the item within 3 days of buying it. Had connection issues with iPhone. The headphones automatically stops the music. Tried clearing all the Bluetooth  memory and reconnecting, but the problem still persists. Don’t buy this headphone if you have an iPhone. Had similar kind of issues with my iPad.

author: Ben Clark
title: When high standards are normal
content:
It’s what you’d expect from Bose
Quality, clarity and comfort

author: Pat McDermott
title: These are not worth the price tag, I returned them.
content: I bought these to use to block out the noise in my office, to listen to music, and to make conference calls on the phone and computer.  They blocked noise while listening to music but when on calls they actually pick up noises from around me and transmit the noises into the headphones and to the people I was speaking with, the exact opposite of what they should be doing.  On calls everyone had problems understanding me and I had to switch to a landline headset every time.  People said they could hear people in my office about 15 feet away better than they could hear me.  I really expected more out of a $350 set of headphones.  I have owned free earbuds that came with my phone that did a better job at canceling out background noise through the microphone.  I looked up the issue on Bose support forums and they have known about the issue for a while and have just basically shrugged and told customers that they would have to live with it.  When asked if there would be a software fix they claim they never know what might be in the next release.  The headphones and the lack of service are not worth the price tag, I returned them.

author: James B.
title: I give it five stars. My wife hates them ...
content: I give it five stars. My wife hates them she would give it 1. I put them on and that’s it. I can’t hear her any more.

author: Gan Jin
title: Good Headphone
content: Amazing product. It helps reduce the surrounding noise when I am studying and working. Highly recommended to those who prefer a quiet space and need to focus.

author: ObiJuan
title: Stay away from the Bose Black Headphones QC35 II.
content: Stay away from the black set. I work from home and I am on 4 hours of conference calls a day and dont want to be tethered to phone or pc for that long so I need a comfortable, reliable and long lasting blue tooth headset for work and play. So I purchased the Black QC35 II set first to replace my Samsung Level headphones that just snapped with normal use.  Within the first week I noticed the BT connection dropping intermittently for 3-4 seconds at a time, didnt matter if the phone was in my hand or several feet away sitting on my desk. So I went thru the normal troubleshooting steps of reinstalling and updating software and no luck. I went to Bose website and checked their support forum and found that's its a known issue with no apparent fix that i have found. A customer mentioned he purchased both the black and silver set for himself and his wife and the Silver ones worked fine with no issues.  So I wasted no time and sent back the black set for a refund and purchased the silver Q35 II.  I have found that to be accurate, no issues with the Silver headphones. Now that thats out of the way.  Easy pairing with my Galaxy S8 using the Bose app.  The battery life was significantly longer with Silver Heaphones than the Black Headphones which makes no sense since the were both new. For music, the sound is fantastic, my music tastes ranges from techno Daft Punk to Metalica and everything in between except country. The reliable Blue tooth distance at least my house is acceptable but thats not a big requirement for me. The Silver Bose QC35 Series II headphones are what I expected from Bose and for the price.

author: Ed
title: A noticeable step up from QC20 in-ear
content:
These things are dope!!  Better noise reduction than my QC 20 in-ear headphones, even with foam earbuds.  Going wireless is sweet, easier to move around.  Battery life is great.  Only place QC20 does better is for sleeping.

The full-ear pads take a bit of getting used to.  At first the pressure behind my ears bothered me, and if it's too warm the area around your ears will sweat.  But after several hours I got used to it and doesn't bother me anymore.  I can leave them on for hours at a time now.

Flying with these is a much more pleasant experience.  You still hear a tiny bit of hum from the plane, but only if you're really listening for it.

author: Daniel J. Mooney
title: These things are phenomenal and I love the ability to use them for hands free telephone ...
content: These things are phenomenal and I love the ability to use them for hands free telephone conversations. Perfect for travel with the noise cancelling feature and the sound quality is amazing. They also fold up into a small case and they are definitely worth the investment!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Husband approved!
content: Great noise cancellation and very good quality for both music and phone conversations.  Comfortable to wear as well.

author: charliec3
title: Very happy
content: These headphones are the best I've owned.  I love the google assistant, love the noise canceling, sound quality, and the fit and finish.  There aren't a lot of bells and whistles; they simply work.  I have another 10 year old Bose headphones (non- ANC) that are still rocking, and a 20 year old Bose AM5 speaker system, so I'll say this for Bose over Sony... they last!

author: Michael Speer
title: These are fantastic at blocking open office noise allowing me to focus
content: I struggle sometimes to stay in to zone and these even without anything playing block distracting noise / conversations.  These also have light feel and solid sound.  I have used these traveling and they are fantastic. These are great in coffee shops.

author: Tim in NY
title: Top Notch
content: These are great although the Google Assist is still kind of a gimmick.

author: Mickey T Goodridge
title: Outstanding purchase
content: Great connection, outstanding sound quality, great for teleconferences

author: Just Jim
title: They sound good and the noise cancelling is great
content:
These are so expensive but what can a person do? It is hard to pass up the benefits. The comfort is great although ears do feel warm after a time. The ambient noise is greatly reduced. The sound is OK for me, but I am no audiophile.  They are big and a little clunky and I can't wear them for more than an hour without airing out my ears for a few minutes. They seal quite well around the ears and there is no air flow, I suppose to make the sound cancelling work. Oh well, tradeoffs.
I find the battery lasts all day at the very least. I don't do any telephone conversations with these as a rule but a time or two and I did receive a call while using them and it went OK. I don't use the Google or the Alexa silliness but I suppose younger folks might like that. I do like that I can control the volume very easily with the control. Also, I have no problem with connecting via Bluetooth  with my iPad and my android phone. It just works. I wish I could pair more than two devices at a time, but I can't say it's really a problem. Things stay connected, too. I've had no communication failures. The radio link is really solid. I maybe should say that I am updated to the latest firmware and had no trauma. It simply worked. I've used these on airplanes and they really cut down the noise. Sometimes I'll just wear them and turn them on and I'm not listening to anything. I'm just using the noise cancellation. Certainly better than the constant noise of the plane, especially if you fly cattle class like I do. To me, Bose is very over priced and they drop products and move on to the next newer thing so in time you end up with an orphan device. Still, they have the market pretty much to themselves with these nifty QuietComfort headphones so props to them for that.

author: no problem
title: very good
content:
sound quality is very good. i am not an audiophile though. i love the sound. the sony XM3 has better bass. the XM2 has maybe slightly better audio. i do like the bass so i will give XM3 the edge here.
noise cancelling is comparable to the XM2 but inferior to the XM3 whose noise cancelling is noticeably better.
comfort of wearing the headphones: i feel these are more comfortable than both the XM2,XM3.  the sonys are comfortable, just less so.
comfort of use: the bose have physical buttons, which i prefer over sony's touch interface.
another advantage the bose has over the sonys is that i managed to connect it simultaneously to two devices. i did not manage this with the sonys. you can pair them with more than one, but i could not connect them simultaneously. this basically means i use the bose when i am at home because i like being connected to my laptop and my phone. the switch between laptop and phone is automatic and usually good. some bugs, but overall, worth it.

to sum it up, i will use the bose when i wanna connect to two devices, and the XM3 when i want superior noise cancellation and bass for music, which usually means when i go to the gym, or on flights.

author: Alan S
title: Sound quality and Noise cancellation are fantastic and the wireless operation is a real joy
content: Sound quality and  Noise cancellation are fantastic and the wireless operation is a real joy.  The Comfort is not overstated.  Great experience.

author: JustMe
title: Excellent!
content: Bought them for my husband for Christmas and he loves them.....listening to music, at the gym, around the house...... He's picky when it comes to headphones...kind of a headphone snob as it were....but he raves about these.

author: Stacy BH
title: The noice cancellation is phoenamonal
content: Best headphones I have ever owned.

author: Amazon Customer
title: There were a gift and not for me.
content: No review/rating to send as it was a Christmas gift for my daughter.  She plugged them in and was flying back to Colorado and was going to try them out.  However, she was thrilled to receive them as others she know have them and love them.  Amazon is amazing from the time you order to the time they arrive.  Just amazing!

author: Loading
title: Not a great purchase.
content:
The headphones would randomly emit a death screech. The sound quality is good but dealing with an issue like that after paying over $349 is not acceptable.
Also I paired it to my phone and laptop and the connection would randomly drop. I have to turn it off and back on to get it to work again. SMH

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great for traveling
content: Use on airplane is wonderful! Can sleep not hearing anything

author: Marty
title: Everything I need them to be
content: Sound is really fantastic. Bass is solid (not the absolute best, but very good), noise cancellation is awesome, and the battery life is excellent. There are certain frequencies that still creep in during the noise cancellation, but it's still much better than other products I have tried. These are especially useful when traveling by train or air. They are also shockingly comfortable to use for long periods of time.

author: Andy
title: Five Stars
content: what else I can say. Bose name tells you everything you need to hear

author: ulhwa jenkins
title: has a great band width and the bass isn't over powering the treble
content: love them

author: MrBungle
title: Great sound quality, comfortable, and good battery life
content: I am loving these noise-cancelling headphones.  This is the first pair of noise-cancelling I've ever had, and  it's really quite amazing how much noise it blocks out.  When I take them off, it becomes immediately clear what a good job they've been doing.  It seems like because of the rejection of all that outside noise, I can really hear the detail in the music I'm listening to all that much better, which leads to a really great listening experience.  Battery lasts a good long time too, and is easy to charge via mini USB.  No problems pairing with multiple devices via Bluetooth.  Can't wait to take my first flight with these and just cancel out the outside world.  :)

author: Brent
title: Great sound!
content: I purchased these as I fly frequently for travel. Was hoping for something to help combat the typical noise associated with air travel. They definitely fit the bill and the sound quality is outstanding!

author: Corvette
title: Life changing using this in an office environment
content:
I will say that this pair of headphones so far has been life changing for me at work. While I do have my own closed door office, there is always noise and gossip happening outside of it. The noise canceling really allows me to focus and enjoy my day.

The buttons are easy to find and press to do a quick pause of the song when someone stops into my office or I recieve a phone call.

author: Not Tryna Be a Diva
title: The Best Over-ear Headphones Out There!
content: I truly couldn't love these more. The bluetooth can be temperamental when you're around multiple devices that these headphones have synced with in the past, but that feels like more of a bluetooth issue than a headphones issue. Super comfortable and great sound quality - would recommend to anyone.

author: djsh4dowfan
title: Bose QC 35 vs Sony WH-1000XM3
content:
I purchased both both Bose QC 35 and Sony WH-1000XM3 headphones. I ended up returning the Sony headphones. Here is my comparison of the two:

- Both have very good active noise cancellation (ANC)
- Both have good sound, although the Sonys probably have more base, which I personally liked
- Both come with an app you can install on your phone to configure them to an extent. The Sonys are more configurable, with an EQ and more granular noise cancellation.
- The Sonys have an adaptive noise cancellation feature that will change the ANC level based on where you are and what you are doing (e.g., sitting vs traveling). I personally don't care about this feature or find it that useful.
- I found the Bose to be more comfortable and easier to fold up put away. The Sony earpads weren't as soft, and the headphones clamped down on my head with more pressure.
- I found the Sonys to have more intense ANC overall. My ears are sensitive to ANC, and I get the feeling of having pressure in my ears with ANC enabled. That feeling was much less intense on the Bose, even on high, despite the Bose having very good ANC, which gave me the impression that the Sony ANC was more brute force and less accurate.
- The Sonys have neat touch controls for volume, play/pause, prev/next, etc. While it's a cool feature, it wasn't something I cared that much about, and I was often worried I was going to accidentally change something when taking the headphones off and on. I don't think the buttons on the Bose headphones detract from their looks.
- The Bose can connect up to 2 devices at once, which is pretty nice. I can be connected to both my phone and my laptop and seamlessly switch between them.

Ultimately I returned the Sony headphones because I found the Bose to be more comfortable. My biggest gripe about both pairs of headphones is they do not save your last ANC setting! I cannot believe this feature was overlooked. I don't plan on using ANC all of the time. If I turn the ANC to low or completely off, when I turn the headphones off and on again, it will reset to high. The Sony app even allows you to configure the ANC at a granular level and allows you to configure the ANC for different usage patterns when the adaptive ANC is on; however, those settings also didn't persist, making them basically useless. I found the Sony Android app to be pretty buggy in general. I would strongly prefer an actual physical switch for the ANC setting instead of just having the setting be software controlled.

author: Andrew J. Frazier III
title: The cord is a piece of crap.
content: The cord it came with doesn’t work. Really pisses me off. When I pay $300+ for a pair of headphones, the cord should work. Other than that, the headphones sound really good. But, I’m overly pissed off that I haven’t been able to use these on my flights since I bought them.

author: Randy Snow
title: Best I have used...
content: These are without a doubt the best headphones I have ever owned. I love them

author: watchout4snakes
title: Awesome
content: Super comfortable and precision sound. I wear these phones all day at work and I barely notice their physical presence. External sounds are squelched so you hear the music in detail against a background of silence.

author: McKenzie Robertson
title: Noise cancellation is amazing!
content:
You never realize how loud an airport is until you take these headphones off and put them right back on! The noise cancellation is amazing!!!

The only thing I wished it did better was keep the music more internal. I'll be jamming out and my husband says he can hear everything so clearly. Now I listen to everything so quite so I don't disturb others.

author: KathyNguyen
title: Been wanting these for a while.
content: Very happy with my purchase

author: Sonya Menk
title: Awesome Sound
content: I bought these as a gift for my husband and I should have bought me a pair.  The cushioning on the ears is so soft and it truly cancels out all the noise once you secure them on your ears.  I love too how you can determine your own sound with the appI don't truly know about the battery life cause my husband kept leaving them on all night.

author: Cesar
title: bluetooth disconnects
content:
I have had this for about 2-3 months. I use them for school 5-7 hours a week they have always being kept in the box.
The Bluetooth stopped working, sometimes by turning off and turning them back on the Bluetooth connects again. Also, after it disconnects the noise cancellations stops working and it needs to be restarted for the noise cancellation to come back on.
Very disappointed with the quality level and longevity. I expected a lot more for my a product that is over $300

author: Ben Matthews
title: Great Sound Cancellation
content: These headphones are great for noise cancellation, by far the best I've used so far.  That being said, you will still be able to hear background noise when no music or audio is playing but it will dampen the sound quite a bit. The sound quality is great as well, crystal clear sound whether you're using Bluetooth or have them plugged in. The bass does leave something to be desired, you can't really 'feel' it hitting you with the low notes as opposed to some of the other headphones that specifically focus on boosting the bass. I assume this is a result of having such a solid noise cancellation system. Overall, this is a great buy, very sleek stylish look (you will see some paint wearing off around the raise BOSE logo after awhile), superior sound quality and cancellation.

author: M. Mossbrucker
title: Absolutely do everything the description states!
content: I purchased these amazing wireless headphones as a Christmas gift for my husband!  He says they are the best gift he has ever received.  They deliver amazing stereo sound quality while completely blocking out peripheral noise!  Another great feature is that while my husband watches TV with the headphones channeling the sound to him, everyone else in the room can also hear the television, but he doesn't have to be distracted by the other noises or conversations taking place in the room or the house!  We couldn't be more pleased!

author: brutus
title: Great phones
content: Great phones. Bose as usual. Can still hear my wife though. LOL

author: lowjumpingfrog
title: Google Pixel 2 Users Beware
content:
The noise cancellation is fantastic. The sound is great as well. However, Bose does not deliver on all functionality. The multifunction button does not work to pause/play or skip track on current version of Android on Pixel 2 or Google Pixel Chromebook. Plus, don't bother using it to make a phone call. The call quality is poor and there is a constant echo of every word you speak on both Android and the iPhone.

Update: After restarting my Pixel 2, the multifunction button works for pause play for now but, using this this headset for for making phone calls on Android or the iPhone is unusable. Unless of course you are calling yourself. Everything you speak into the microphone is repeated back in the headphone about a 1/2 second later. That wouldn't be so bad if the echo was faint. The echo is louder than the voice of the person you are calling.

author: 0kaywhy
title: Great sound, noise cancellation works well
content:
I largely blame myself for not doing enough research before buying these.But they don't at all live up to the expectations I had for top of the line headphones. If all I connected to were my Android phone, then they'd probably get 4.5 stars. Great sound, noise cancellation works well, microphone is powerful, and calls come through clearly both directions. And they're very comfortable.

But I also wanted to use these to connect to my PCs. I had to buy a Bluetooth dongle for my desktop, which works well with other wireless headsets, but I frequently hear static and other random noises when I connect these Bose headphones.

And FYI, these are NOT SUPPORTED on the PlayStation! I realize that's actually Sony's fault, forcing you into their brand, but just a full disclaimer in case you (like me) thought the Bluetooth standard was supposed to all play nicely together. No worries, I thought, I'll just get an aux cable and hook up through the controller... at least the headphones came with one because you need a 2.5mm jack. That was sort of a work around, but the microphone doesn't work so I can't use these for online play as hoped.

Speaking of using these while plugged in: you can't use any of the additional features while doing so. No noise cancellation options. No volume or playback control. Honestly, I would return these if I could.

author: CFlores
title: My First Wireless Headphones
content:
Best headphones I've ever had. The sound quality is crystal clear, not for bass heads like many have said. The comfort level is unmatched and they are so light. I know these will last me a few years.
EDIT:
After about 6 months of use, these are still my headphones of choice. The battery life seems like it never drops below 50% and the bass is well presented in this product. As for the comfort: its still like no other I've worn and the light weight allows me to wear them hours on end. As soon as I start  working on the desk - these headphones are already on my head.

author: Davis Ian Wiechert
title: Very solid pair of headphones
content: Everything about these headphones is amazingly exceptional. The only issue I have with them is when listening to certain songs at the highest volume I experience popping noises out of both earphones, so if you like listening to music super loud maybe watch out for that. But other than that these headphones have great sound quality, are super comfortable, and are still quite sleek and stylish. Overall great product other than that one small issue.

author: Rick Patterson
title: Noice quieting and wireless - great combination!
content: Use my headphones mostly when flying. Love them!

author: Scott Kimbrough
title: Comfortable, two-device pairing, sound great, great mic!
content:
Bose Quiet Comfort II

You should get them if you don't have them.  I used to use the in-ear headphones, but didn't like them and thus, rarely used them.  My expensive bluetooth headset would just sit there sad and lonely.

And I often thought, why would I buy the Bose headphones?  They are so expensive.

Well, I bought them and I love them.  I keep using them.  They just stay on my head all the time.  They connect to any device instantly, accept voice commands, are super comfortable (no ear fatigue), have great fidelity and clarity (both for mic and sound).  I use Zoom for video conferencing multiple times a day and I can run my sales calls with clarity and convenience.

Now I see what all the fuss was about and I wish I bought these years ago.

author: Ed
title: The gold standard
content: It is very difficult to identify anything that I don't love about these headphones. Great sound and noise cancellation, lightweight, foldable for storage, great battery life. You get what you pay for.

author: Andrew
title: Amazing headphones
content: Amazing Bose sound quality just as you’d expect from them. The fit is great although they seem to want to slide off my head sometimes when I lay down. Just a little adjustment takes care of that. I wear them when working out and so far so good

author: Tim L Edgar
title: wish i would of read bose complaint section before buying these
content: I tried my brothers series I and was so impressed that i ordered the q35 series II for riding on my side by side with turbo right behind my head.  i does cancel half of the turbo noise but if there is any wind at all it is very loud in the headphones.  i have since read from many customers that they are having the same problem with theirs too.  I put electrical tape around the small groove and this got rid of the wind noise but not sure if they cancel the noise as well now.  time will tell.  not sure the $349 price is worth it.

author: Barbara & Charles
title: Great headphones
content: very comfortable, great sound, noise cancelling works great. don't hear the landscapers in my neighborhood, just. the music. fast shipping, and was able to use immediately because they had 70% charge out of the box.  would definitely recommend.

author: mitzie
title: Good headphones
content: Love these headphones although I wish it had a little more bass other than that everything else is perfect. But I really  want to thank world wide stereo for the amazing customer services; they responded to my question quickly and delivered the item quickly.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent quality
content: Excellent  noise cancelling and very good sound quality.

author: Jeff
title: It should be all about that bass
content: Works decently, but I had higher hopes for such a high price tag. Lacks bass, but is excellent in regards to noise cancelling performance. Light-weight, charges fast, and doesn't hurt your ears for long-term use. Just could use better bass!

author: J. Salone
title: Love them!
content: Awesome sound! Blocks out noise amazingly.

author: Ender
title: Noise cancelling is a joke
content: Only cancels white noise like the airplane noise or passing by car noise. Those don’t bother me anyway. Doesn’t cancel human voice or any other non-repeating noise. These headphones are joke. Will try again after full charge. If it goes like this, I will return them. Have no idea what makes them $300+

author: Amazon Customer
title: Poor bluetooth connectivity
content: Sound quality and noise suppression/cancelling are excellent, but bluetooth connectivity (to a Samsung smart TV) is problematic -- range is poor, compared to a Bose QC15 (over-ear) set, and pairing and connection is inconsistent.

author: Scott B. Crouse
title: Very comfortable. Excellent feature set.
content: Very comfortable. Noise cancellation is excellent. I bought these for air travel but use almost every day at home. Battery life is outstanding and they pair easily with my iPad and iPhone. Switching between devices is absolutely seamless (unlike my AirPods).

author: Robert L.
title: Expensive but worth it
content:
I used these headphones to block out background noise at work.  The noise cancelling feature works so well it is disappointing to take them off.  I had not considered how nice it would be to use these to make phone calls until I just made a call.  Not only could I hear the other person on the line, they could also hear me very well.
* You should note that Alexa integration is available after you update the firmware on the headphones, so don't be surprised when, during the setup process, you are only presented with Google Assistant as your voice control choice.
* The headphones came with 60% battery and this lasted me a long time, about a week.
* I like the Bose-supplied case, I don't see what another third-party case would do for me.
* I ordered this with standard free shipping at 10:00am and they were delivered before 8:00am the next day.  This was a pleasant surprise.

I hope these last because they were expensive, but things seem good so far.

author: MT
title: Worth the money
content:
So right before I bought these headphones, I had bought another much cheaper wireless headset (boltune 2019 upgrade version).
The cheaper headset actually surprised me in terms of sound quality and ear comfort. However you do begin to feel the pressure of the headband after a while which leads to headaches.
I’m on my pc a lot and wanted headphones that wouldn’t hurt my head during long sessions so after comparing the countless Bose and Sony reviews I decided to go with Bose since every review said they were more comfortable.
 I haven’t had it long but I can already tell it’s the best set I’ve had.  The comfort is at a level which I didn’t think was possible for headphones.  Really just enjoyable to have on.
The sound quality is something I also really like.  The reason I like it is that it doesn’t try to over exaggerate everything that’s played through it with bass or effects.
It has a very balanced clear sound when it needs to and it has great sounding bass when the song calls for it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love em!
content: I use these every day. They cancel "noise," not sound. So you can hear if someone tries to talk to you, for instance, but the noise that surrounds our lives is muted.

author: Pete
title: Five Stars
content: Confortable and really nice sound quality

author: Justin B.
title: I feel fancyAF with these.Good earmuffs.
content: Block out the world and live in your own music paradise.I decided to get something bigger for commuting and they're perfect. I barely hear anything on the bus and they also keep my ears warm in winter!

author: Chris Wightman
title: Money well spent !
content:
These headphones are well designed and very much exceeded my expectations. Sound quality, noise canceling, and having a phone conversation with the mic is amazing.
Thanks Bose

author: Mark  Customer
title: Do NOT buy for PC use!
content: Work ok with cell phone.....BUT WORTHLESS if you're running Windows 7 and many times Windows 10.  Nearly impossible to get sound from Windows 7.  I spent hours and hours researching and found SOMETIMES SOME fixes will work....MANY times just temporary.  I've done everything.  Bose says not their problem but they sell the damn things so it IS THEIR EFFING PROBLEM.  There are pages and pages and pages of people struggling for MONTHS trying to get these QC35's to work with windows 7 (both home and professional). I'm not going to devote my life to TRYING to make this work.  For $350 they should jump out of the box and connect themselves and then jump right onto my head.  SENDING THEM BACK AS MY MAIN USE IS PC.

author: William
title: great for everything but PC calls or gaming
content: These headphones are great however i would not recommend them if you would like to listen to something AND use the mic at the same time on a PC. The quality is drastically downgraded when the mic is turned on due to limitation of Bluetooth and lack of a second Bluetooth driver. I would recommend this for music and noise cancelling use but not for calls or gaming through a PC.

author: joseph
title: I totally recommend to all my homies holding it down in da ...
content: damn.  really does work.  Noise canceling feature is no joke.  I totally recommend to all my homies holding it down in da hood.  Yous really cant hear the gunfire in yo hood wit deez.

author: QuackerOats
title: Worth the wait.
content: I waited two years to buy these headphones. They were worth the wait.

author: Albert Sheakalee
title: Great quality and sound.
content: It is the best I have bought and used. I have a few comparable to this product from different manufacturers, I prefer this one. Pricy but worth the price.

author: Philip D Bernstein
title: Worth every penny!
content: This is my first purchase of headphones and it was exclusively to cancel noise in the city. The headphones are amazing; incredible noise cancelling, beautiful sound when playing music, very comfortable. Do not hesitate to get these.

author: John K
title: Superb
content: How can I ever travel overseas again without my super-cool noise cancelling=, sound enhancing magical headphones transporting me to heavenly clouds of happiness.

author: Tonez78
title: Connectivity
content: I like these but the quality seems flimsier than previous versions.  The sound is good but I'm not impressed with the WiFi range; just a little ways for the device you're connected to and you lose signal.  Bose needs to improve on that and I would most likely give a 4 or 5 star rating.

author: Michelle
title: Amazing comfort and fantastic neutral sound.
content: Love these headphones. I spent a considerable amount of time comparing the Sony Mark3 to these. Sure the Sony's have more technical features and I would say the sound quality is definitely more "fun" with the Sony's (deeper bass rumble). But I need noise canceling headphones for studying, and boy are these comfortable! Much more comfortable than the Sony's. These headphones do what they are meant to do best. Straight to the point, not many bells and whistles, very VERY comfortable.

author: Kendall Osborne
title: Very big lipsyncing issues.  Poor firmware implementation
content: Does not suppoert aptx so there are severe lip syncing issues.  Figured i could just get used to it, but for $350?  Why should i?  Poor headphones for anything but music.  Just music, not even watching music videos.  I am in the process of returning it now.  Also, do not upgrade the firmware, if you do buy these.  Bose messes them up and a white noise/pressure starts in one of the ears.  Cannot downgrade to either, as the the drop down box to down grade is blank.  I tried several browsers.  Mo luck.

author: TobyD
title: Bose has always been great...wireless makes them even better!
content: These are great! Comfortable to wear for long periods and the quality or noise cancellation is the best I've tried. There was a bit of a weird smell when they were first out of the box, but it went away within a few weeks.

author: Shopper 60s
title: Used on airline flights
content: Works well to reduce jet engine noise

author: Carol Mae
title: Amazing for airplanes
content: I tried a lot of headphones and kept coming back to Bose.  The sound and noise cancelling is incredible.  I finally bought these mainly for air travel.  I'm not a great flyer, but these headphones actually put me at ease.  They are well worth the money

author: Gdshort
title: These work great
content: Everything as advertised.  Fantastic experience

author: Nathan A.
title: I liked them so much I got a second pair
content: I thought the noise cancelling would be less effective, but there's a HUGE difference between these and other offerings. I tried the newer Sony set when looking at a second pair and stuck with Bose.

author: Adude
title: Has critical flaw that Bluetooth mic drops during calls
content:
Product has a critical flaw that the mic drops during calls (phone, video conference, facetime, ...) making it useless for this function.

Another flaw is that if you just want the noise cancelling and no audio (say you are sleeping on a plane), there is no way to prevent the bluetooth from trying to connect to one of your devices. Solution is to attach the headphone wire and not connect it to anything, or turn off bluetooth on all your devices.

author: RileyMcEwan
title: Look no further
content: Fabulous headphones

author: Kevin Kamakahi
title: Great Set of Headphones
content:
Great sound, Noise cancellation is top tier.

If you're a Bass junky get another pair of headphones. The bass is high quality still but it isn't going to make your skull vibrate like how some people like.

author: Kelli
title: Must buy
content: This is a great purchase if you live in an apartment and want to cancel out the noise of your neighbors. Very comfortable. They block out a good amount of sound but not all. Television sounds great through these as well.

author: JP Vic
title: Slightly Better than Beats Studio 3 - worth the extra $$??  - up to you
content:
I also have the beats studio 3  all and all they both are really good headsets.

The Bose fits me with glasses a bit better.  Overtime the beats give me ear  fatigue where my glasses / sunglasses touch my ears.

Sound on both is great.  I think a little better than the Beats - but really the only way to know is to listen to them both side/side.  It's pretty minor.  Not sure it's worth the extra $$ for Bose - as the differences are so minor, but for sure the Bose is a small bit better.

author: Ronald G. Smith
title: Awesome headphones!
content: I really like these headphones. They sound great.

author: Francisco J. Rendon
title: Great product
content: The only thing I don’t like is that the charging cable is too short.

author: Tathagat Varma
title: Didn't meet my needs!
content: I wanted to play my kindle books from my iphone on this headphone. Neither the store guy could get to pair it correctly, nor I could find anything online to help. Finally decided to return it within the return date. Maybe wait for next upgrade that works properly!

author: Lisa
title: Awesome sound
content: Gift but she loves them

author: wbigwil
title: This are awesome
content: My husband purchased these for me and I must say, I love them.  I usually wear beats but I find these are more comfortable and appears to me to have a better sound quality.  They were easy to connect to my mobile devices.  Great for plane noise cancellation.  Highly recommend.

author: Kevin K.
title: Wow!!
content: Wow!! These are way better than my previous version by bows. I would highly recommend them. Battery life is fantastic. Rechargeable. Case is smaller than my previous one.

author: Alex
title: Incredible sound and ANC. Terrible mic. Questionable Bluetooth.
content:
Sound and noise cancellation is fantastic. I use my headphones primarily at the office and on planes.

Unfortunately the microphone is terrible unless you’re in a very quiet environment. Ambient noise is picked up and amplified to the point of extreme distraction for whoever is on the other line. I use these for business calls so have to be very careful where I am when I do. Others appear to have this issue but not everyone. It’s frustrating and not acceptable at this price point.

The other major issue is Bluetooth. I regularly have my phone and computer connected. They consistently disconnect and reconnect throughout the day. More rarely, my voice is garbled to people on the other line and I end up have to shut them off and finish the call with another headset. Again, not good at this price point.

Despite the flaws, I still use these everyday. The sound, noise cancellation, and lost calls in quieter environments are very good. But for the cost, the mic and Bluetooth issues really need to be fixed. So I can’t wholeheartedly recommend them.

author: Jay F.
title: Awesome noise canceling headphones .
content: This is simple,  it’s made by Bose so the quality is outstanding the noise cancellation is phenomenal three different levels and the Bluetooth works so what can you say about the product other than it is worth purchasing

author: DMD
title: Four Stars
content: Great sound, I’m having trouble finding right fit though.

author: J. T.
title: A real disappointment
content: Sound canceling feature is ono-existent. Way overpriced for what you get. Sent it back the next day.

author: Pj & Becky
title: Best wireless headphones ever
content:
These headphones are awesome.  Sound quality is what is expected from Bose.  They have the google assistant button, which I don't use, but I have used the headphones on phone calls and no one has complained of the quality of my voice yet.  It can pair up to 8 devices, and doesn't have much issue connecting to them.  It's read back capability is pretty good as well. The comfort of the headphones are second to none as well.  Noise cancellation is impeccable.  Definitely worth the extra money over Sony or Beats.

Update March 2019.  I have continued to use these almost nightly when everyone goes to bed.  Battery life is great, sound is impeccable, they were worth the investment.

author: john e king
title: The music sounds fantastic.
content: Like the color and are very comfortable.

author: Peter
title: They work as advertised.
content:
The noice cancelation was much better than others when traveling on air planes.
They are comfortable and the sound is clear. They also fold into a nice compact size.
You need a two or three prong adapter for most air planes.

author: alex
title: Faulty
content: I used these headphones wirelessly for about 6 months with no issues, but when I tried to use the headphone jack to plug them in on an airplane for the first time, they didn't work in one of the ears. Tried plugging them into my phone and laptop, and same thing, so definitely the headphones at fault. I hate to leave a bad review on these, since I liked them until then, but headphones this pricey should really be fully functional. I'm pretty disappointed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bose headphones are great!
content: I bought these for my daughter.  She absolutely loves them.  I tried them and couldn’t believe the sound quality because it really does cancel the noise around you.  They are light weight and very comfortable!

author: Bokun Zhou
title: Impressive
content: This is my first noise-cancelling headphone. It works great. Though, sometimes, the connection interrupts, it might due to my iPhone.

author: Airic
title: Best Noise-Canceling headphones
content: Best Noise-Canceling headphones. The only negative is that it keeps your ears warm. If you live in colder climate these will work great as ear muffs.

author: AV
title: Best noise-cancelling system
content: Bose quality. Can't think of working in my noisy office without them. One of the best purchases I've made

author: Liver Dude
title: CRAPPED OUT AFTER 5 MONTHS- but Bose replaced due to 1 yr warranty
content: Loved these headphones until they began to crap out and malfunction after only 5 months of use. The audio quit working, noise cancelling continued to work but worthless as headphones. For $350 I absolutely expected these to last longer. Unable to return or get support from amazon, however Bose was great to work with. These were fabulous headphones before they quit working but I am s0o0o disappointed the longevity. I contacted Bose and they accepted the faulty headphones and replaced them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bose does it again!
content: Love it. Does everything it says it will. I am on a plane at least 5 times a week and use it on every leg. Worth the extra bucks to save your hearing.

author: Ryan Ali
title: Not what expected
content: The sound is as good as I though and very expensive

author: Bryan Hayward
title: Quality and style at its best.
content: I put these earphones to the test, 1), living in New York City. 2), traveling by flight. And 3), on the noisey train. It gets the job done at its best. I don't think there's anything else that's better out there. Besides noise counseling, the sound is full and rich with deep bass. However, not the best earphones when wearing in the summertime. But in the winter time, they also make stylish earmuffs. They are very expensive. But you get what you pay for with style and comfort.

author: Dan Olson
title: No mic mute and can't walk more than a few feet from laptop before losing signal
content: I wanted an "upscale" set of headphones for use at work, mostly conference calls but some music listening as well. While these sound okay, the lack of a microphone mute makes them unusable. I checked forums and some people said they could push the volume up and down buttons briefly for mic mute but that didn't work on these even after firmware updates. I also can't walk more than about 10 feet from my laptop without the sound breaking up. I have a $30 set of MPOW's that I can walk all the way across my house with crystal clear audio. Returning and would not buy again.

author: Mr. Scott
title: Product is great, delivery "Not so great"!
content:
Very happy with product, but when I pay close to $400 for an item, I expect the delivery by Amazon (Dynamex) not to
throw the product around on a brick landing.

author: Heather Quast
title: Very happy with Noise Cancellation feature
content: Dramatic improvement on noise cancelling from earlier Bose version I owned (purchased 5 years ago). Didn’t want to spend the money, however I really needed the best noise cancellation feature and it delivered!

author: Christa
title: Best purchase!
content: The sound quality is good, they are comfortable to wear for long periods of time, and the battery life is great. I use them at work and on flights, and they are very effective at drowning out white noise. The sound quality could be a touch better, but maybe that’s because they are wireless?

author: Samantha TBD
title: Best headphones EVER
content: I had taken possession of my husbands Bose Quiet Comfort II headphones for about a year before he finally told me he needed them back. I was delighted to find the same ones in rose gold!! These headphones are so comfortable you can wear them all day. They don't squeeze your head and give you a headache. They don't hurt your ears.  The noise cancellation is adjustable too!! There are 3 levels: off, low and high. Its brilliant! On a walk and want to hear a car coming-turn it off! Trying to listen to a book while your husband snores-high it is and you will listen in peace! These are expensive headphones, but it is an investment I found worth every penny!

author: MercuryMat
title: Way overpriced, a nonsense buy for the embedded functions.
content:
This was a present for my wife that loves branded products (Apple, Bose etc etc)...so I gave it a shot. Noise cancelling is top notch. Period. The good stuff is this. But...it is waaaaaaayyy overpriced considering the sound quality, unless you like tons of bass and a kind of "unreal sound". There is not such a great definition in the sound. Then: build quality is good but again, it is all light plastic and fancy soft material that is wearing very fast even if, because of the price, you'll probably take good care of it. And again: the noise cancelling is especially useful during trips on trains and airplanes (and I bet most people will use it in this situations), where you have a lot of other noises coming from everywhere (because noise cancelling works, but non totally), so the sound quality does really matter? Probably not, and nobody can say the sound quality is good in this kind of environments...
And if you travel on a not brand new plane you'll probably have to deal with the odd dual-jack connector, and guess what? The adaptor IT IS NOT PROVIDED with this headset (well...you pay 350$...you cannot pretend to have a small piece of plastic in such a premium product... isn't it?); I got a great deal the day a travelled with my wife and I had to give her my 10¢ adaptor so she could enjoy the entertainment on our 12 hrs flight!!!
Last but not the least: you'll probably look very fashionable on a plane with this headphones, but you still have to carry them in a case that is quite big, cause over-ear headphones are big, even if foldable. So consider this.
Ah, the charge connector is a mini-usb, sooooo old style, not even a lighting nor USB-C...beware apple fans, you'll need another charging cable! And Bluetooth is not even v5, but the old crappy v4, so good luck with the connection stability and the delay.
Compared to my cheap wired Taotronics made in China (like the Bose) that I payed 40$ and they are small, feather light, in ear (the most comfortable I ever had in my life), with an airplane adaptor, a super good noise reduction and a astonishing good balanced sound for the price, this Bose are a totally nonsense.
This is just my opinion, but maybe you really like to throw your money away.

author: Merty98
title: Awesome Product!
content: These are hands down the best earphones I've ever heard.

author: Yvonne
title: Nice but not for me
content: I ende up sending these back because the volume and noise cancellation did not work as I was hoping. They are a nice quality but a little too big for my girly ears and mainly the volume limitation.

author: Ron Bassilian
title: Exceeded expectations
content: Easy to connect and noise cancelling is beyond what I expected.  Only downside is the wife now has to tap me on the shoulder if she wants my attention.

author: Monty Batchelor
title: Excellent
content: Very good head phones.

author: Bean
title: life changing
content: Even with headphones, the office noise at work was driving me crazy.  Then one day I bought these and work noise is no longer an issue for me.  It's very rare that I'm so pleased with the results of a technology purchase.

author: Ernesto Villalobos
title: Good overall noise cancellation and sound quality
content: Wonderful sound quality and noise cancellation but a bit pricey

author: Tarkesh
title: Has a problem with Bluetooth Connectivity
content: I really liked the product but after couple of months the Bluetooth kept disconnecting and reconnecting with my phone in few minutes interval. Very annoying. ... In fact I got a replaced the unit but the  replacement headphone also doing the same. ...

author: NYCStu
title: Was expecting a lot more
content:
I've had these for a couple of weeks, but am kind of regretting the purchase.

I bought these to wear on airplane trips and for basic commuting (NY subways are LOUD), thinking that they would work better for traveling than my go-to headphones, Bowers & Wilkins P5 wireless.  However, though I read through many reviews lauding the Bose noise-cancelling technology, as far as I'm concerned, it isn't all that great.

The big problem with the noise cancellation is that it doesn't appear to suppress sudden loud noises such as a train door slamming--there is a momentary uncomfortable rise in ear pressure when that happens, and as a result it is far more distracting than when I wear the B&W headphones.

As far as sound quality goes, the soundscape is nowhere near as rich as the B&Ws; there's something insubstantial about the sound coming from the Bose.  The Bose also aren't nearly as powerful, volume-wise--I have to turn them up to about 9 out of 10 to get the same volume I get at a 5 out of 10 on the B&W.

At least there is one improvement on the QC 35s: they no longer have the booming bass of earlier models (I had some Bose QC 15s a few years ago that had terrible treble response and way too much bass); there is more of a flat response to these.  They sound best, ironically (and probably logically) in a very quiet environment, where they approach (but don't nearly exceed) the quality of the B&Ws.

All in all, while the noise-cancelling properties of the newer B&W PX headphones (according to reviews) aren't as good as the QC 35s, I wish I had bought those instead.

author: Tom
title: Love these headphones!
content: I finally broke down and replaced my wired Bose headset with these and sure wish I had done it sooner. They provide the very best in music replay. I also use them for conference calls at work the noise canceling helps to keep me focused.

author: mark mendelson,mark mendelson
title: Not what I expected - has the name
content: Not what I expected for the retail price paid. This was a gift for a teen as a going back to school present. Unless you have a large head the headphones will fall off. Will send back for credit .

author: Lyle Swann
title: Buy from Bose Instead
content: Purchased the silver and gold headphones.  Silver ones manufactured so long ago they are not compatible with Bose AR, even after a firmware update..  Amazon is selling old stock here.  Gold ones were made in 2019 and work with their AR.

author: Ricky
title: Sound
content: Nice feel, good sound

author: Rafael Torres
title: Shut up and take my money
content: The noise cancelling feature is awsome.  The headphones are very comfortable and the sound is just incredible.  The Mic works pretty fine regardless of being so far away from the mouth, so that gives it extra points.  I haven't checked the battery lifetime yet, but it seems like it could last as many hours as the specs page says.  Once Bose, always Bose.

author: Jeff
title: Excellent product - highly recommended
content: I resisted Bose noise cancelling products because of the price.  And after trying other products that pretend to perform, I decided to try the best -- NO REGRETS! Absolutely the best!

author: DaveH
title: Garbled when used with Sony AV amplifiers
content: I use a Sony 1080 AV amp. After initial bluetooth pairing, the Bose were almost unintelligible. After going thru the logical troubleshooting, like checking sound quality with other devices (which sounded fine), I began looking for posts on the Sony specific problem. Lo and behold, on the Bose community site, others have posted the same issue of sound quality with Sony amps. Bose response to the issue is "must be a Sony issue, call them". But my older Bose  AE2W bluetooth headphones work perfectly with the Sony amp. Don't you just love it when something doesn't work and companies point fingers at each other? So in the end, these Bose are going back, and ordering some M3s.

author: Will Berninger Whitewater Aviation Inc.
title: Give credit when credit is due
content:
I resisted purchasing these Bose headsets for a while since almost all of the noise reduction is from electronics and not much from passive design.
Well I finally bit the bullet and gave them a try and I have to say, Bose got it right.  Yes, not a lot of passive noise canceling but the electronic canceling is wonderful.  Even wearing a ball cap and sun glasses they cut out all of the offensive noises I expose them to.  I even tried them on my Cub Cadet Tank which is a noisy beast.  I normally use the best (passive) Peltor headsets and the Bose are better yet.
One word of caution, they are so good that you could easily forget that a piece of equipment is operating which could lead to injury.

They pair up with my phone and MP3 player immediately which is another good thing.  Sound quality is very good. I got these for the combination of sound reduction, adding music to my day and comfort.

author: Sutaru
title: ... a pair of these on an impulse and I love them. They're wireless
content:
I bought a pair of these on an impulse and I love them. They're wireless, they have a great battery life, they're comfortable and the sound quality is great. They block out all sound when music is playing though, so if you're jumpy, it may be best to turn down the volume or wear it with one ear partially out of the cup. I wore it on a trip to China and watched movies comfortably the entire flight.

I also use them at work, which is actually slightly problematic because I can't tell when someone has walked into my office and has been talking to me for several seconds if I'm working with my head down.

author: J. Kirby
title: One of the best head phones in the world for the price
content: This is my second set of Bose headphones. The bluetooth is awesome. You can pair up multiple devices at the same time. Battery life is good. It would be nice if Bose could double the battery charge. Otherwise, no complaints.

author: Cecilialei
title: Must buy
content: Love this item. Noise cancellation is excellent.

author: Chris Flangas
title: A must buy for any sound enthusiast!!
content: Amazing!! These are extremely comfortable and the sound quality is incredible. Noise canceling is very effective, you can take calls, and connect either via Bluetooth or wired. Great battery life for 20 hours Bluetooth or 40 hours wired

author: Papa Crumpz
title: The Best Out
content: Literally the best headphones I’ve ever used and I’ve used MANY throughout my life. I’m most amazed at how lightweight it is. It feels like nothing is on my head.
