The noise cancellation is excellent... I hate taking them off lol. Get these headphones if you’re reading this.. you won’t regret it.

author: Jing Xie
title: I like it
content: Comfortable and good quality as I expected.

author: Wes N
title: TREAT YO SELF to the Best Noise Cancelling Headphones on the Market
content:
No other way to put it - these are extraordinary. I made the mistake of trying these on at some point in the past, being amazed, then attempting to duplicate the experience with a much cheaper substitute. The quality of the the noise cancellation, the quality of the sound, the comfort, and the physical construction are all far, far superior on the Bose device. If you are looking for the best noise cancelling experience around, you'll need to pay for it, and you will likely not be disappointed here.

Just a word about expectations: these cancel ambient, background noise: airplanes, airports, air conditioners, white noise, etc. They do not silence (or really even quiet) conversation, screaming babies, fireworks, shotgun blasts, pneumatic tools, bowling alleys, breaking glass, car alarms, fire alarms, carbon monoxide alarms, falling cookware, crash symbols, and the like.

Cheaper headphones also produce poor sound quality that seems to be affected by their own noise cancellation. With Bose, you're getting top quality noise cancellation without sacrificing in sound quality - and that's sound that's coming from Bose speakers! If you fancy yourself ANY flavor of audiophile, some headphones of this quality will be your baseline. Cheaper imitations warrant no discussion.

The battery life is excellent, and they charge quickly. These are not the cheapest headphones in town, but in this reviewer's opinion, they are the best.

author: Susan
title: Bit expensive but worth the price.
content: Just took a trip overseas and LOVED my Bose headsets. I was concerned that they would be too hot since my temperature leans on the warm side but they were great. Very comfortable and I didn't have to press them to my ears to hear better like my old headsets.

author: ManiacMagic
title: but they sound great like the Series 1
content: For some reason these were a pain to connect to a few of my devices ... but they sound great like the Series 1. Unlike the series 1 they allow you to adjust and even turn off cancellation.

author: Joshua
title: Audio mini jack defective. Too small for hole.
content: The audio mini jack is defective. The mini jack provided is too small for the hole. Or the hole is too big for the jack. The sound is all crackly and distorted when hard wired. Couldn't use it on the plane which is why I got it.

author: Jessica West
title: Feels like I'm listening to music for the first time all ...
content: Feels like I'm listening to music for the first time all over again. I love the sound quality, how good they feel when wearing them and how seamlessly I can switch from my phone to my laptop or any other device i have paired with them. The only thing I would change is that they tend to heat up my head if I'm even moderately active while wearing them other than that, no complaints. I'm seriously in love with these headphones.

author: Angels-R-Real
title: It’s a BOSE... the best headset made today
content:
My lifesaver for the Dailey weight lifts and speed walks in the park...
.
my third pair of Bose headsets in thirty years forever Loyal

author: vitor Correia
title: Incredible
content: Best sound and noise cancelation I've heard on a headphone. Worth its price. Connects with devices flawlessly.

author: Craig
title: Quality
content: Awesome - great sound. Worth every penny

author: Frank Yoerg
title: Five Stars
content: The sound is great and they are very comfortable.

author: Alexander Hoffman
title: Silence is black
content: Silence is golden but the head phones are black. If your going to buy these you already know how great they are and totally worth the money.

author: dra-phx
title: Same High Quality from Bose!
content: Best investment I've made. They're light weight, battery is rechargeable and stays charged. They are comfortable on my head, and I wear them sometimes for 6-8 hrs. each day. Sound quality and noise reduction/cancellation is superb. My phone calls and music sounds great.

author: Hans
title: Just works
content: Great product and comes with a wire to plug into airplanes etc. Love it.

author: DJ Lyte786
title: Better than the rest.
content: Loves the fit, comfort, sound, versatility. So far, so good. No issue with sound not working or durability like with Sony.

author: David Lin
title: Flawless Bluetooth and great noise cancellation
content: Basically perfect Bluetooth implementation. If you’re used to crappy Bluetooth that can never figure out how to connect, buy this and be done. Noise cancellation is amazing as well. Sound quality is also solid.

author: mathew
title: Not the same Bose quality of old
content: I've had them for six weeks. They started having random crazy loud static which can't be safe. They also start pulsing, even if you aren't listening to anything. It is a second of audio and a second of silence continuously. This is the 2nd Bose product I've bought in two years that have left me disappointed.  The brand means nothing these days. Buy a $40 pair and get the same results.

author: Don
title: Over Joyed
content: these over the ear head phones are 100% better then the DR. Dre Solo Beat 3 . Dump your Beats and get some Qualty .... The workmanship, sound and easy to use features make BOSE the #1 head phones

author: thunderstorm
title: Wonderful headphones
content: I love these headphones. Sure they're pricey but I can say wholeheartedly you get what you pay for. I live in a city where trains and or buses can get pretty loud and sometimes regular headphones don't block the noise out completely. These do just that and more. When you turn them on you already can tell the difference in background noise and once your music starts playing that's all you hear. You don't hear people's conversations or whatever is going on around you. The headphones adjust accordingly to many sized heads and they're very comfortable. I have Google assistant with my headphones so the button that controlled noise cancelling now can control my notifications. For instance if i get an incoming text message i can press the button to have message read to me then I can hold to reply and press one more time to send. My only small gripe with these headphones is the microphone is a little sensitive and from my own experience when I talk to someone on the phone they can hear the background noise very loudly even if it's really not that loud. Maybe it's an over exaggeration since I can't really tell but overall well worth the money. Sound quality is phenomenal in every aspect

author: Ming Paul Wang
title: Solid quality product
content: I've always loved Bose headphones. I bought a noise cancelling in-ear bose ear-buds a few years back, still works like a charm for travelling. I needed another set for the office and these on-ear ones are great. I listen to music at least 8 hours a day on these and only charge once every couple of days. The batter life is insane.  The noise cancellation level can be set to high, low, or off. Each has its own advantage and use case. Love the product.

author: Geison Porfirio
title: Excellent noise cancellation
content: I have used it in flight and it really works, helps a lot to keep everything quite. But about the bass my old Headphones was better.

author: Kent J.
title: Very Sensitive Microphone - No Fix Available
content:
I own a Bose QC2 NC Headset, purchased in 2004, and still use it today and love it.  This is a huge testimonial to Bose Quality of a great product and genuine durability.

I was looking for an over the ear NC w/Microphone and found the Bose QC35-II.  Of course I said that’s the ticket and ordered it on Amazon.  Overall, this Bluetooth Headset with Bose quality sound is outstanding.  Even the Microphone is crisp and clear when I’m talking.

I attend small user conferences which there is low levels of chatter amongst other people nearby.  To me the QC35-II would be perfectly to hold phone conversations; noise cancelling, clear microphone, what more could I ask for?

Unfortunately, the Microphone is so sensitive that when I stop talking, it picks up a whole ton of other conversations and disrupts the personal or conference call as the folks on the other end can hear other conversations.  Needless to say, the noise cancelling technology of the QC35-II does cancel what I hear, but not for the Microphone.

I have to say, that this isssue is worsened by the use of conference calls using WebEx, GoToMeeting and Zoom calls.  One-on-one calls the two are able to hold a conversation, but can be distracted or even drowned out by say a passing loud bus or train.

To use this headset on a conference call you need to employ a strategy of muting yourself before and after you speak.

I checked with Bose and their is no current fix.  But I did read that Bose Engineers are on the problem.  So, maybe a fix is forthcoming.

author: Amazon Customer
title: These are the best headphones I've ever bought
content: These are the best headphones I've ever bought.  The noise cancelling features is life changing. I pop these on when I need to focus and reduce any external distractions.

author: Joel
title: Amazing quality
content: These headphones are incredible. The noise cancelling and sound quality are too notch. Talking on the phone through them is a little tricky with background noise, but it's certainly still functional.

author: Ej
title: Bose continues to improve
content: I bought these only because I could not get replacement foam cushions for my QC15's. The aftermarket ones just kept falling apart. I didn't know what I was missing. I love the wireless feature of this headset. Love the compact folding, taking up less space when I travel. Being able to adjust the noise cancelation feature I also found useful.  These are even better than the 15s for sound quality. I didn't know it could get better.

author: 101 User
title: Best...Headphones...ever
content:
Honestly there is nothing to dislike about these headphones. If you are willing to pay the price they are more than worth it.

Great sound canceling, comfortable feel and solid sound quality. These are a must get for any traveler.

author: Ben Dittman
title: Owned a pair for 2 years now!
content:
The Bose Quiet Comfort 35ii are some of the best headphones I have ever owned!
In the last 2 years the cushion on the headphones basically wore down to non-existent, but a easy fix was picking up a $20 replacement  ear cushions which did not take away from the quality at all.
Unlike some of my other headphones giving out these have stayed strong.
I have a business in which my headphones are the item I use the most (8-10 hours a day) So the fact that I use them this much for 2 years straight without any external issues makes me so glad!! The price is worth if long term!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Sound quality is great noise canceling is perfect I couldn’t recommend a better product
content: Sound quality is great noise canceling is perfect I couldn’t recommend a better product

author: Charlotte, NC
title: Do not upgrade your IPhone to IOS 13 if you want to use these headphones
content: Works great with IOS v. 12, does not work with IOS v. 13, even latest update; either does not pair, or volume stuck at the same low level. Somebody needs to fix this, either Bose Connect or Apple.

author: [Redacted] c
title: A+++
content: These were a gift for my sister so I am just relaying what she has told me about them.  She flies every weekend and her old headphones quit working so I bought her these.  She advised they are very comfortable with great audio quality and has had no problems with them so far (since Christmas).  She does not use Alexa so I cannot comment on that aspect, but in all other respects these are great headphones from my understanding.

author: Jimmy
title: Father’s Day gift for me, and I love them.
content: Father’s Day gift for me, and I love them.

author: Songhai
title: So far so good. I bought it because I often forget taking ...
content:
So far so good.I bought it because I often forget taking earbuds on flights and have to buy them on flights which I quickly loose before my return trip! So I thought maybe carrying a sizeable wireless headphone will solve the problem considering the significant size.Additionally, it helps to watch and listen to TV program at home when others are doing their own thing without me distracting them.

Pros:
1.Sound quality is good.I like that the equalizer self adjusts to the sound continuously and you do not have to make any manual adjustment. The sound it delivers is undiluted. It is as rich as the sound coming out from our old Phillips surround speakers connected to an OPPO audio/video system.
2.The cancellation effect is excellent.At a high level, it effectively cancels out all external "noises".  For safety reason, I use it on the low level so I can still be aware of my surrounding.
3.It is very comfortable on my ears.I do not just place the ear piece over my ears .I deliberately make sure I place it over my ears coming from a back approach.That way the ear lobe sits into the recess and no pressure is applied on my ears.Then I push the piece up but not pull it down as one would normally do.Compared to prior headphones I had worn many years back for listening to music, my ears do not get uncomfortably warm after a prolong use, by prolong use, I mean wearing it for 20 minutes or more.I have worn this headphones for 5 hours continuously without feeling any discomfort of warmth or pressure to my ears.
4.Have not tested the limit  of the battery life.But as noted above, it has  served me for 5 hours of continuous use.Also,I make sure I charge it after each use. I believe that the battery life will even be longer than it is today.
5.The unit is not heavy to carry but I think that as the technology improves that lighter materials will be used to make it lighter. I have not tried using it to make hand free calls with my phone.Other reviewers say that, that feature works well.
6.Reconnecting to any bluetooth devise automatically has always been smooth and seamless. Has excellent memory. Have not tried other brands to compare with, I doubt I can afford to do that.I am happy with this wireless headphone and will recommend it.

Cons:
1. Expensive.
2.The manual that came with it was not very helpful.

My wishes:
1.That the system automatically shut itself off after 20 seconds of being taken off from the ears, if it does not detect any pressure from the ear pieces.This will save the battery life.
2.That it has a storage compartment in it you can store the wired cable.
3.That it comes with an "instructive" instruction manual. I had to go online to download a manual that made more sense.
4.That I do not have to take it off my ears to listen to someone talking to me. Planatronics unit I have read has a feature to overcome this little incovenience. By placing your palm over the right ear piece makes you hear external sound and temporarily pauses the internal sound.Removing your palm, resumes the internal sound and cancels out the unwanted external source of sound.Boss could learn a thing from Planatronics here.

author: C.L. Cho
title: Good!
content: Good sound quality

author: dale dumbrille
title: Best headphones on the market
content: Love them excellent headphones

author: Johnny Brewer
title: The best
content: You can’t go wrong with  them

author: joie de vivre
title: Bluetooth Connection Is Faulty
content: I really like these headphones for their noise cancelling qualities as well as the quality of the sound, but I have to use the wire cable because the Bluetooth connection is faulty.

author: Jim Smith
title: A decent pair of noise cancelling headphones
content:
The one drawback I have is that the wifi ability is seriously limited in distance - like one room away and it is unreliable. For the money, this should be much better.

Nevertheless, I live in an urban environment filled with traffic, barking dogs, and home improvement neighbors running saws and mowing lawns. These headphones have been a lifesaver - ah! calm peace.

author: Daniel Garcia
title: Would recommend these to anyone who loves to get lost in music
content: I love these headphones. The highs, mids and lows sound awesome. Rock music hits all the right places with out over bearing bass. Hip hop sounds good too with good bass while still being able to hear the other melodies and instruments. I absolutely love acoustic music with these. It sounds like if you're there listening live. Battery life is awesome and the buttons are easy to learn.

author: Sheldon Tan
title: Really like it.
content: It is so easy to operate and fit better  for my ears. Very easy to set up the Bluetooth connection with multiple devices and manage them via the app. Really like it.

author: Reviews2
title: Great ANC Bass Cancellation
content: Had to return the newer Bose 700 as it has an auto turn off.  The noise cancellation on these especially on the lower end is amazing and with a soothing sound track like wind, rain or ocean almost perfect.

author: Wayne H. Wilson
title: Great at noise cancelling. Horrible to set up. Music sound is meh.
content:
Never experienced such effective noise cancelling. Really great at that.

Did not expect such an annoyingly intricate setup hurdle, especially for such an expensive product. Had to go find and load an app that includes a sort of bizarre navigation and that sometimes just does it own random thing. Finicky Bluetooth connectivity, and difficult to switch between devices. Poorly identified/labeled Left & Right. Non-intuitive controls. I was seconds away from just sending them back, and will never again buy Bluetooth headphones. I will not use them for music... they aren't even close to the frequency range, depth, and clarity of my wired Sennheiser headphones.

Also did not include battery charger... only the USB cord for charging on a standard mobile phone charger. The sound connection cord is pathetically cheap.  Wish I had bought the Bowers & Wilkins or Sennheiser unit. It is just too much of a hassle to return these.

author: Fnord
title: Excellent wired sound and ANC, but nearly useless Bluetooth audio
content:
POSITIVES: Extremely comfortable to wear, sound when connected by a cable is is top notch, noise cancellation is excellent, and it comes with a tough case.

NEGATIVES:
- The sound over the Bluetooth connection is simply awful. At best, it's like listening to AM radio, with a muffled high end, muddy mids and dead bass. At worst, it drops out, distorts, skips, makes bizarre low-frequency digital beeps and loses most of the frequency band. This is what I would expect from a $9.95 pair of cans, not one that costs over 30x more than that.

- The Bluetooth connection has an effective, reliable range of only 3-6 feet (and even then, the sound quality is as described above!) At just 10 feet, it often starts dropping out and skipping. Going around a corner inside a house, even if it's only 10 feet away, normally kills the connection. Going 15 causes it to disconnect. This was the same on two different laptops and a mobile phone, so it's definitely a headphone issue.

- You cannot use the headphones while charging. Seriously?

- The included audio and USB cables are a joke -- the former is maybe 2 ft long and so thin it seems bound to wear out in weeks; the latter is maybe 3 inches long.

- The built-in volume controls only work over Bluetooth, which is unlistenable.

- The synthesized voice that tells you about various headphone statuses cuts out to the point of unintelligibility.

I would gladly pay $29.95 for these headphones knowing that the Bluetooth is essentially unusable. At the price they're sold at, however, these headphones are a massive disappointment.

author: Gabrielle J Jones
title: Tasty Music Blasters
content: I love the sound quality of these. I wish there was better noise cancellation for close sounds, however, it's probably best that I'm not completely deaf to my surroundings as I walk around on the street. They connect to my S9, HP touchpad, msi GT72S, and Echo all without a problem.

author: Rachel R
title: Kind of an overrated product
content:
Pros
- comfort A++
- noise cancellation (besides wind) is fantastic
- battery is great (non replaceable but easily recharged)
Cons
- sound quality good with bass and highs, but mid-ranges need more love
- bluetooth connection clips frequently (a few times a day, I used them all day) for 10 seconds or so
- microphone doesn't always work the best for phonecalls

Apparently the clipping issue is a common one for these headphones-- seems like Bose's firmware caters more to Apple brands, so if you use iPhones and such clipping may not be an issue. Bottom line: with the reputation Bose has for top-quality, the kinks were deal-breakers, definitely not worth working around with the high price tag.

author: AL
title: Very pricy, but if you want NC these are the best.
content: I tried cheaper options, but they didn't work very well in my experience. So, after shelling out the money for these, I certainly do not regret my purchase. Despite being over 3x the price of the alternatives, I can confidently say these are more than 3x better.

author: Sunia Spencer
title: B/T WONT CONNECT
content: Day 1, could NOT get the Bluetooth to connect. All day worked on it over and over.  Nope.  Won’t connect.  Send back the very next day.

author: Mr. Splinter
title: awesome headphone!
content: Got this for my husbands christmas gift. He loves it!

author: John
title: Good headphones but not the best
content:
Here’s my take after using these headphones for a week. In terms of comfort and noise cancellation, they’re absolutely amazing. In fact, the noise cancellation works so well that when you take off the headphones after using them for awhile, you will be amazed at how loud the outside world is.
My main complaint is the sound quality. I believe the sound quality is good, but not great. Personally I like headphones that give a nice rich bass sound, and these headphones are lacking in that department. For a high price tag of $350, you would expect the sound quality to be top notch. Now, an easy fix for this is if Bose implemented a sound customization/equalizer in their app. I currently use Jaybird headphones for exercising, and their app has this neat feature and it’s quite amazing. I’ve customized the ideal sound that I prefer, and I think this would be a nice yet necessary feature Bose should have in their app.
Overall I am pleased with these headphones. The comfort and noise cancellation are what you’re really paying the high price tag for with good but not great sound. If you’re more focused on sound quality, I would choose another brand.

author: bptlage
title: Not what I hoped for
content: Don't get me wrong, the sound is good for watching TV, you can hear things you would not normally hear, but the headphones lack in music. Many years ago, my older brother had quadraphonic headphones that I listened to from a reel to reel player, that was the best music ever sounded to me. I had hoped the Bose Quiet Comport 35 headphones would come close, but disappointed I am. So, I can only give them 3 stars, which means average. Maybe I am being unfair, but digital music just does not compare to analog, what can you expect from 1's and 0's.

author: kyle ketchum
title: Surprised at sound quality
content: Sad to say the sound quality seemed less than my Bose Sound Link so I returned them.

author: Pete
title: Noise Killers
content: I charged these up overnight and then while home sick went to the basement in the man cave. As it would happen, it's winter in New England, and the cave is also the room the furnace is in, and it kicks on A LOT this time of year, which has dampened our enthusiasm for movie nights down there. I put these on and watched three movies before remembering that I hadn't heard the furnace kick on at all. I took them off, and had to laugh because the furnace was on just then! I like being able to adjust the noise cancellation level, and being able to connect via bluetooth to my Apple TV. They are comfortable, and give the Bose sound quality you expect to come with the name. A little pricey, but will be worth it for long flights or night time TV watching. Would totally buy another pair of these.

author: Erica
title: Disappointed...
content: Disappointed to say the least. Doesn’t cancel voices, and only about 60% of other noise. Wore them on a plane and didn’t feel they made as big a difference and I expected. They don’t fit well either - fall off easy when I lower my head or move suddenly and they feel loose around the ear. Not gonna send them back but wish they were more to my expectation. I also seem to get headaches when I use them which I know can happen with some people and noise cancelling headphones.

author: Jeff Boylan
title: Amazing Headphones
content: These are a great as the advertisement says. Just turning them on without listening to anything helps deaden the noise around you. Very comfortable. The battery life is great. You will not be disappointed.

author: erd
title: Excellent headphones
content: I LOVE these headphones. I’ve had them for a year and 8 months and they’re still working great. I got them to help concentrate in a loud, open floor plan office and they do cancel out a lot of noise. Now I wear them while walking my dog and I really don’t hear anything around me. They connect easily, I wish they didn’t connect to multiple devices at once because that only makes things more complicated- you can only really be connected to one at a time or another device might interfere. I’ve also had a few instances where the headphones have worked improperly and started picking up ambient noise from my surroundings, or the audio gets fuzzy, but that is not a common occurrence. But other than that, they’re very sturdy and durable and worth the money.

author: Larry W.
title: I also love them when mowing grass and doing other outside work
content: Bought these for a long trip to Okinawa and they were lifesavers. Made the plane ride much more tolerable. I also love them when mowing grass and doing other outside work. In the past I always used my earbuds and was constantly having to stop and put them back in my ears after knocking them out.

author: Kierah Siegel
title: The silence is so soothing!
content:
Sometimes I'll turn these on and wear them just to sit in the cocoon of silence they make. The noise cancellation on these headphones is great--exactly what I'd hoped for in buying them, and having tried a few models at lower price points, very worth the money, especially if you, like me, are particularly sensitive to noise and sensory overload. These make train rides, the subway, riding in cars, even walking down the street so comfortable.

There are a few issues, like with any piece of technology, but I would see them as more of a .5 star deduction than a full star deduction, because overall the problems are rare, and easy to manage or correct:

- The microphones that create the noise cancelling effect seem to magnify the sound of high winds. If you're planning to take a stroll in a cyclone in these, well... don't... but that's really the only environment where it would be a massive issue; all you need to do to correct it is turn the noise cancellation to low or turn it off. The ear cups do block a certain amount of noise on their own, so you're not 100% in the lurch.

- Connectivity issues do occur. Sometimes they just won't be recognized on my phone, which is where I control the headphones' connections (they can connect to 2 devices at once). Usually this is solved just by turning them off and back on.

- Once--but only once--the headphones refused to connect, and through googling I found I had to plug them into my computer's USB drive and download a Bose installer to update some kind of firmware. This is, obviously, inconvenient and roundabout, and was an annoying 10 minutes of searching, installing, grumbling, etc. but once it was done it was done, and I had a solution for future issues.

That's it. These are otherwise my dream headphones.

author: Kimanae Claiborne
title: Headphones
content: Best headphones ive ever had. And i have a pair of monsters as well as skull candy.

author: jenly
title: Works great for noise cancelling!
content:
I bought these to dull the loud, muffled radio that comes through the wall next to my office. I don't mind music, just can't stand when its muffled and you can't really hear it, just the thumping bass. Can't do anything about it. I tried earplugs from the pharmacy, they work great but aren't very comfortable. These headphones, while admittedly about 1,000 times more expensive are welllll worth it. With the noise cancelling setting on low I can still hear whats going on around me, people talking in the next room, or when someone is talking to me. But I don't hear the boys in the garage blasting their radios at all! I can't hear the clicks of my keyboard when I type, but I can hear my calculator when I'm working on that... to give an idea of how much noise gets blocked. The ear plugs from the pharmacy blocked EVERYTHING, I could only hear myself breathing, which was kinda creepy, lol

They're very comfortable. Yes, I get some funny looks when people come in my office, but then they hear the background noise and understand!

I haven't tried any of the other features yet as far as taking calls, or the google assistant. I don't think I can use that since I'm using bluetooth to be connected to my MacBook instead of using the Bose app on my phone, don't really care, that wasn't why I bought them. Will be great on an airplane I'm sure.

author: Brandon
title: Best headphones on the market.
content: Will always stick with bose. Very durable materials. I use these every single day and they are well worth the money.

author: Jan Smrcina
title: Awful quality issues for a premium product... twice!
content:
I have now had two of these sets of headphones and am in the process of returning the second. I'm writing this review in comparison to a set of Plantronics BB Pro 2 headphones that were separately connected to the same devices as this Bose headset, so the issue is definitely the headset and not the device.

First device:
- Noise cancelling worked sometimes in one ear, sometimes in both, and sometimes in neither.
- The headset would randomly emit a death screech at maximum volume in one ear.

After returning the first device, I thought that there was no chance I'd get a defective product twice in a row. I was wrong.

Second device:
- In a 15 minute period, I experienced 4 random power flickers which resulted in the device power cycling, announcing battery level, and reconnecting to the device it lost connection to.

I'm really disappointed with the quality level of these considering they are a ~300$ premium device. Hitting 1 quality issue happens, but two devices in a row is absurd. In contrast, I've had my other noise cancelling set for years and it has no issues. It's unfortunate as this device has a lot of positives (good battery, great sound, easy to use, nice carrying case and compact fold pattern) but none of them matter if the device doesn't work. 1 star.

author: Luke E Harding
title: Bose is still the best!!
content: The noise cancellation is kind of amazing! The comfort of the headphone is superior. A 10 hour flight is no problem with these bad boys, plenty of battery life too. Highly recommended!!!!

author: Oregon Reader
title: Worth the price, worn frequently
content: Purchased as a gift for my husband to use when traveling overseas. He is not a ‘gadget’ person nor fond of headphones. I’ve been surprised by how much he uses and enjoys them. Used for flights but also worn during gym workouts. Excellent quality.

author: Dennis S
title: Perfect for yachts, the first class cabin on your next flight, and for blocking out your partner's rants when needed. : )
content: Enough to break the bank but perhaps the peace and quiet is worth it! : )

author: La
title: Awesome noise canceling headphones
content: The noise canceling is wonderful, the battery life is very long, and the sound quality is great.  They work great for traveling.

author: Martyzman
title: Excellent Noise Cancelling
content: Great on air flights or when you need to hear someone next to you talking in the Data Center. Earpieces fit well even with glasses and just the right amount of pressure to mask off noise.

author: JTuck
title: You won’t be sorry you did!
content: Get ready to hear every little nuance of your music. You’ll hear your music like you’ve never heard it before. Seems like your sitting in the middle of a circle while each performer plays/sings around you. Comfortable, great battery life! It was hard for me to let go of $300 for a set of headphones, but I’m sure glad I did. If your looking for thumping headphones look elsewhere. These produce a very balanced blend of music without being too bass centric. Awesome headphones!!

author: Rick J.
title: Excellent microphone quality.....
content: Have a box full of varouis different $25 to $75 versions of OTE Bluetooth headphones, each have OK listening quality, all have terrible microphone quality for phone call use, mushy sound or in a barrel response from listeners. Wish the iPhone app had an equalizer for listening to music. Should have purchased these in the beginning, now I have a box full of stuff I will probably never use

author: Christine N.
title: Must have for studying! Perfect for audible books!
content: These are super comfortable, great sound, and excellent noise cancellation on the market. From busy cafes to noisy commutes, I find myself still focused on studying and audible books.

author: Kenneth
title: Amazing fidelity and noise cancelation
content: Upgraded to these from mid-range Beats headphones and couldn’t be happier. Noise cancelling is fantastic, battery life was at 80% after my 6 hour flight, and the sound is amazing. 10/10 - would buy again.

author: Nahid
title: Do quite a bit of traveling
content: I can say this does an amazing job at blocking out engine noises and people.

author: Kambiz
title: Very good product
content: It changed my life lol, i am commuting with train and it is really annoying when people  talk loudly , this headphone saved me

author: D. C. Christopher
title: Not as nice as their aviation headsets but still a great experience
content: Not as nice as their aviation headsets but still a great experience. I have not played around with the different noise cancelation profiles. I just wish it could cancel out some of the more annoying sounds around me (inane chatter, etc.). Also, I wish it wouldn't interrupt an ongoing call to announce an incoming call. That's just dumb.

author: Shreyas
title: Worth the money!
content:
Listening to bass heavy hip-hop music on QC 35 II is like having continuous orgasms in ears. It catches every minute beat. "Just a lil bit", "In da club", "Forever", "Rap God", "Survival", "6 foot 7 foot", "Look at me now", "Boyz-n-the-hood" to name a few. The noise cancellation is amazing, my first experience as well. But it leaks the sound out when blasted at max volume. Feels physically good on ears too, very light weight.

My only concern is battery life and the leather quality which touches the skin.

author: Steven R. Gottry
title: My new favorite headphones.
content: Everything i’ve Come to expect from Bose!

author: KAR
title: Worth The Price Tag!
content:
I was skeptical about spending this kind of money on headphones, but I needed something to protect my hearing in my side by side atv.
  About a year ago I purchased a Maverick X3 Turbo R with 172 HP, which is pretty loud. Then I added a full cab enclosure, which makes it even louder inside. My ears would ring after a long trail ride. So I decided to give the Bose noise canceling headphones a try. I borrowed a pair from a friend for a day, then ordered these that evening!
  When the noise cancelling level is turned to high I can't hear myself talk. The sound of the engine can still be heard, but it's very quiet. The sound quality of the music is amazing, even with the light engine sound in the background.
  I'm glad I decided to go this route instead of installing  a stereo, which would have to be turned up really loud to hear over the engine. Then I would really go deaf!
  I haven't been able to use half of the battery life yet. They will probably go for a couple days at least.
  Borrow a pair, or just buy them. You won't be sorry!

author: Juan M.
title: As espected
content: As espected

author: Sandy Angle
title: Best ever!
content: Excellent!

author: Sam Flurry
title: Bose Connect won't install.
content: I have been trying for 2 days now to get the Bose Connect app to download on my Android phone.  I just keeps timing out and going back to the Install button again.  I can't do anything with the headphones without having this app, so the headphones are useless and so I'm giving them 1 star.  I will return them if this problem persists for very much longer.

author: Joe Pasquale
title: Requires another device to control
content: Very disappointed, as you need another device (like an iPhone) to control it.  If you simply wish to bring it on a plane, turn on the noise cancellation, and not be connected with any wires (which is what I wanted and expected), you'll need to put up with an annoying voice prompt that tells you you need connect via bluetooth every 20 seconds.  Cannot believe someone actually thought this was a good design.

author: Rick37
title: I have to lower the noise cancellation to a minimum(there are three settings) because I like the reference of noise with a running machine
content: I've tried both the Sennheiser and Bose and I must say that Bose wins the trophy with the noise cancellation. I have a very loud wood shop that consists of jointer/planer, table saw, cyclone vacuum,router table just to name a few. All very loud yet while I can stand next to these machines I have no trouble listening to music at the same volume whether they are running or not. In fact the table saw being the least noisy, I have to lower the noise cancellation to a minimum(there are three settings) because I like the reference of noise with a running machine. Plus the sound quality of the music in my opinion is second to none. I would recommend these to my mother.

author: Wayne Ngo
title: Perfect Headphones Ruined By Firmware Updates
content:
I received these with firmware 2.0.1 which worked phenomenally with my Mac and iPhone. ANC was nice and bluetooth stable. Unfortunately, the google assistant app decided to update my firmware to 2.5.1 by it self!! Seriously Google? Ask me for permission first.

Afterwards, ANC got noticeably worse. I played various background noise on my speakers and there was no difference between low and high ANC. Bluetooth skipped every 2 seconds if both Mac and iPhone were connected whereas it worked seamlessly before. Symptoms didn't go away after updating to the 3.1.8 firmware via Bose's website. These are getting returned.

If you get these headphones, DO NOT update them - please. If it ain't broke don't fix it.

Notes:
-I did the Bose reset and re-paired multiple times. No dice.
-This ANC issue happened on the original QC 35 too
-google assistant initiated update WITHOUT prompting "yes or no". This happened when opening the app.

author: Amber
title: Worth it.
content: Great for flights. Not 100% noise cancelling. But enough that I was not bothered by what did/does come through. Good range on the bluetooth. Good audio.

author: Devin Bender
title: It's.. Fine
content: It's fine, the sound quality didn't amaze me, sounded just like my Astros did. These were a little less comfy than my astros. The real reason I can't give it a good rating is the bluetooth lag is crazy. I've tried four different bluetooth receivers on my computer and these headphones ALWAYS lag. It makes playing games with them impossible. If they fixed this it would easily be a three star review

author: Brenda Pearce
title: It's a Bose!
content: I am in love with this headset. Never had one before. Love the color!!!!

author: Cole
title: Perfect for wireless, bad gamble for wired.
content: As far as the comfort, the sound quality and the ANC goes, wonderful. For whatever ungodly reason though, they decided to put in a 2.5mm audio jack for the wired mode... This is an absolutely trash form-factor that is known to fail ALOT and the jack on mine is doa. This may not even be a consideration for the majority of people, but if you are planning on using these as wired headphones, I really wouldn't recommend the gamble. The Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones WH1000XM2 are $50 cheeper and use 3.5mm which is where I will probably go next.

author: Kissa Samson Mafai
title: Still the best noise cancelling headphones
content:
I rate these higher than the Sonys 1000MX3  for three reasons:
1. They pair more than one device so switching from one device to the other is so swift. Only give away is that sometimes when using a computer and say you open your phone, it switches to the phone and you gotta give it some seconds or lock your phone if you want it to switch back to the computer.
2. They are way more durable than the Sonys, I've not seen ant sony user say they have used these for over three years without the headband ripping. The only thing to change on these is the ear cushions which rip after like a a year and half.
3. These offer more clarity with phone calls compared to the sonys.

author: Ken Scott
title: Not worth 1/4 of the money
content: I fully charged then and brought them on an international flight. What a waste of money. On "full" noise cancellation level I could hear mostly the engine noise of the plane. These are far worse than the previous Bose ear bud noise cancelling earphones. I heard the loud sound of the engine, babies crying, people talking. I had the noise cancelling level on "high" and it seemed they were barely doing their job. And they are so bulky that you cannot lean your head in any direction to get some shut eye on the plane. Then, on top of all that, they heat up your ears too much. You can't wait to pull them off.  Don't buy these.

author: Bill Hunt
title: Better than best.
content: I had a very early set of Bose Quiet Comfort headsets, they lasted about 20 years and were fantastic. These are even better. Light, compact, comfortable and best of all wireless. Battery life is amazing. I use them when flying and when mowing my lawn and sometimes just when relaxing listening to music.

author: Elaine Marean
title: Buy these !
content: Love them!

author: Donny
title: Works Great!
content: I have both this and the Beats. Quality is great. The bass, I would say, mirrors Beats, but the adjustable noise reduction is awesome! Takes a few minutes to get used to it the first time, but works very well and is really good on flights or riding on a trip, or even while mowing the yard. The battery has been working great so far. I don’t use it for more than 4 hours working around outside here and there for the past month and still didn’t drain it completely before I went ahead and charged it anyway.

author: daVid
title: Not thrilled
content: I purchased these to replace my aging but functional Bose AE2 headphones. In comparison, I absolutely hate the controls. It is very difficult to press the SMALL pause/play button that is nested between the volume up down buttons. They are a little heavier and less comfortable especially since I wear them for long stints at work. They do sound great and the noise canceling is nice. They appear to be well made. The case is stupid. Bottom line- I regret having made this purchase.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Christmas
content: This is a gift and I assume all will be well on Christmas Day.

author: Steve H
title: These mostly live up to their hype
content:
I used to discount Bluetooth headphones for TV watching because of latency. But these headphones convinced me that the latency problem has been mostly resolved with the recent versions of Bluetooth.

While these headphones live up to their hype, sound quality is one exception. When on my treadmill watching TV, I use these Bose because of the noise cancellation. But I also have a pair of Sennheiser RS 180 wireless headphones (not noise cancellation, replaced by Sennheiser RS 185). When just straight TV watching, I use the Sennheisers instead because of their superior more natural clean sound. That said, the sound quality of the Bose is still decent, just not Sennheiser quality.

author: Matti
title: Great Headphones but
content: Great headphones from Bose and the noise canceling is great. However, there is something missing with the sound quality... not sure if they focused on the noise canceling feature, which affected the sound quality

author: Shane
title: Fantastic.
content: When I first turned them on I was shocked at how well they wash out all background noises. It was almost like turning an off switch for everything near by. They won't cancel out high pitch noises like an intercom or a loud pitch dog yelp but it does muffle it well. The battery life is another huge plus when it comes to travelling. I have gone for 8 hours of flying plus a 2 hour layover while watching movies non stop and the battery only went to 60% after being fully charged. The sound quality is very clear and has some bass, no award winning bass here. I also use them in my car which can top out at 120 decibels and they do a very very good job at keeping that noise down while listening to music. They may crackle a tiny bit at wide open throttle and 120 decibels but I have never experienced a better pair of headphones.

author: FreshSocks
title: Perfect for traveling! Sound clear with good bass.
content: Great sound, good bluetooth distance, comfortable when on and around the neck. The noise cancelling works very well but does not cut out all outside noise. No issues with cabin pressure or anything of that sort. I choose these over the Sony because of comfort and sound.

author: ams
title: Blocks out the arena noise
content: Purchased for my son who attends all the Celtics games for his job.  Needed something that would block the noise and he said these were great for doing that.  Comfortable fit for him

author: Danny and David's Mom
title: Great sound
content: These were a gift for my son.  He loves the Alexa and noise cancelling features.

author: Lara G.
title: The best I have used yet
content: I bought these for two reasons -  Quieting airplane noise and voices while traveling as well as listening to my music and audio books while I work. These have the best noise reduction of any I have tried yet. I LOVE that they are wireless. The battery life is excellent. I would buy these again and again

author: Carl Drew
title: Awesome product. Love the quality of sound
content: Awesome product.  Love the quality of sound, noise-cancelling and the comfort!  Also great that they pair with 2 devices at the same time.  Love the optional timeout feature. With the setting I have them on, I basically never have to turn them off (in the optional setting, they will power down after 5 minutes, and a simple swipe of the right-side button, fires them up when I'm ready to turn them back on).  This means I can go days without charging, as they power down during any down time where I'm not using them.

author: Tammy
title: Problems with the connections
content: I purchased these headphones having heard nothing but good in the past.  I bought these in the hopes they would work well.  I connected them to my samsung galaxy x.  The sound is good, the noise cancellation is good and the volume control are good, but my major problem with these are every 2 minutes, the voice comes on like it disconnected from my phone and I have to restart the song that it's playing, physically on my phone, then it'll go for another few minutes and do the same thing.  What a pain. I did research and thought these were the best, I was wrong when you have to reconnect it every few minutes.  I don't know where the glitch is but its a big one.

author: Jimmy N Guerrero Jr.
title: Office and Home best headphones
content: These are great headphones, use them for home and office. Word of advice if you have a MacBook make sure and download the Bose app, to be able to sync your Bluetooth device...found that out after a lot of troubleshooting. Comfortable/Great sound/Easy to pack up and go with you.

author: Judd
title: 1. Horrible app 2. Audio cuts out 3. Action button is a disaster
content: Absolutely horrible. Bose are good when they're not Bluetooth. I literally have had 3 pairs (I know... burn me once...) and they've all been really horrible. I currently own 2 pair. I just couldn't believe they could be this bad and kept giving them a second and third chance. I assumed I was having bad luck. Not true. Same results on all of them. In fact, one has an extra special annoying problem, unique to itself, which I'll get to in a minute. For one, the "Action" button is a total catastrophe and the Bose app sucks hard. Regardless of whether I set this button to Google Assistant, Alexa or nose cancellation intensity... the headphones continuously ask me to connect to the Bose app. This isn't only from time to time, but amazingly and annoyingly extremely often. It's not just an initial set-up thing. No. That would make too much sense. This is constant. Also, I with my 2  pairs (so I always have one around the house, etc.... again...I admit I'm a moron for doing this and not returning them) they both have the dreaded, sporadic Bluetooth signal cut out. I would think for this price, that wouldn't happen. The $20 MPOW Bluetooth headphones I bought for the gym don't ever cut out using the same phone I use with Bose. Lastly, Bose gave me an extra special treat with 1 of the 2 headphones. This beauty won't just simply play as a commoner would expect. I have to first press play, second, press the amazing Action button (sarcasm), third, hear "you have no new messages", then finally press play on my phone in order for it to play. This headset also won't play if I use Google Assistant. It just sits there. My advice is to buy any other brand. I'm never buying Bose again. There are other brands now which have caught up with the noise cancelling feature. Bose is stuck in the 90's. The owners clearly are lazy and don't want to make improvements.

author: Blah Blah Blah
title: Pricey but worth it
content: Work awesome on a plane. Helpful in controlling office noises as well. Does not cancel all conversation but does reduce level. Add a little music at low level to complete the conversation damping.

author: Stephanie Stephenson
title: Great Noise Cancellation
content:
I got these a few months ago and so far so issues! I'm absolutely in love with them!

Due to some sensory processing problems, sounds can overwhelm me sometimes. I find these headphones do a great job at cancelling sound, even without music playing.

But also the music quality on this is absolutely fantastic! Amazing bass and sound quality. I'd buy them again for sure!

author: Dsspeaks
title: Excellent headphones
content: Excellent noise canceling during flying. Phenomenal sound. Easy to use. Very comfortable

author: Brian Batts
title: Works as expected for this price
content:
It is everything I had hoped for, which is:
1. Good noise cancelling
2. Good sound quality
3. Comfortable fit
4. Folds nicely, fitting in my laptop case
5. Charges quickly and holds its charge nicely
6. Looks pretty slick

author: Howard
title: Nice!
content: Work great, it's Bose!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Ear hurts, Poor ergo design, Awful voice call
content:
I will make myself simple here. Three problems :

1. Ear hurts with noise cancellation.
Literally, noise cancellation annoyingly hurts ears - like you're in airplane. Not just feeling muffled, but pressure cause pain. This gets a bit alleviated when music plays, but eventually so much fatigue to your ear. No no no.

2. Ear pads / housing doesn't rotate 90 degrees.
Depends on which direction. When I want to remove the headphone from my ears and just put around my neck, I want the ear pads to turn 90 degrees so that they touch my chest 100%, because the ear pads are too bulky - feels like a huge muffler around your neck. But it just rotates about 80 degrees or so. It does rotate 90 degrees the other way, e.g. ear pad facing outwards from your chest. But then the caps gets scratched by zippers or other metal parts on my jacket.

3. Awful phone call quality
Noise cancellation on mic just cancels background noise, not the voice frequency components. Otherwise, my voice will be cancelled as well. But that eventually ends up other vocal noise from nearby ppl, etc. are well heard by the other party. This is terrible for conference calls or phone calls.

Don't buy this.

author: Frank-O
title: I am very pleased. The noise canceling will feel like it takes ...
content: I've been using these for a few weeks now.  I am very pleased.  The noise canceling will feel like it takes the air out of your ear.  I've owned a number of bose headphones from Earbuds, to on the ear to now my most expensive pair.  I think it's worth the money.

author: Marcus O.
title: Poor connectivity, no help from support
content: Great noise cancelling, which is why I got them, but the headphones fail so completely at trying to keep two audio devices connected that I've spent my last molecule of patience. The fix I've found is forever unpairing whatever the other device is so that the audio stream doesn't turn choppy. The problem showed up sometime in the last year, is almost certainly a problem with firmware or the app they have that's managing the connections, and hasn't been fixed. The ear cups also deteriorated in about 6 months requiring replacement. I've had these a little over a year and Bose will do nothing; they want me to buy another pair. After having also used their sports headphones and their wired Quiet Comfort earbuds and having each fail within a year or two, I'm pretty much done with Bose. Very unhappy.

author: Mars
title: Brilliant
content:
I bought these to allow me to listen to streaming music while mowing the lawn, which they do brilliantly.  If you have never used a noise-cancelling headset before, you will be amazed.  When I switch them on, the mower noise just drops into the background.
A thoughtful feature is the ability to select several levels of noise-cancellation, or none.  If you want to talk with someone, pressing a button on an earcup allows you to hear normally, eliminating the need to take the headphones off.  It's a small thing, but it's the sort of extra touch that Bose is known for, and which makes their products so usable.
If you use them infrequently, you may find yourself fumbling with which button does what, but that's just a learning-curve thing.  I haven't tried the phone-answering feature yet.
As always, you get the top-quality materials and excellent build quality that will keep these headphones working and a pleasure to use for many years.  I expect that I would wear out 2-3 pairs of cheaper noise-cancelling headphones over the useful life of one Bose QC 35 II, so while Bose's purchase price is off-putting, I expect to more than recoup my investment long-term.

author: James W.
title: Fine overall but bluetooth unusable
content: Comfortable and good sound quality with adequate noise canceling, but has to be used with the wire because the bluetooth continuously skips, and sometimes adds some static.

author: Lloyd H.
title: Comfortable Fit
content: I could wear these for hours. I like the noise cancelling feature, also liked the $50 price drop.

author: Nikoli Kolesnikov
title: Excellent noise cancellation, premium sound, exceptional comfort!
content:
As a college student I spend around 15-20 hours in my college's library writing papers, studying, or making video calls. At this particular campus the HVAC system is very loud, making it hard to concentrate on my work. After researching about Bose and their high reputation in noise cancellation, I knew that I had to try this product out.

Once I received this pair of headphones, I was immediately blown away at the noise cancellation performance, and reminded of how much my ears ring. 95% of the sound I was exposed to during my study sessions were now gone, making my sessions much more productive than before.

In terms of sound quality, I have heard from Sony users that their product is superior in sound quality compared to bose, with much deeper bass. If that is your main concern, I would consider researching that product to determine if that fits your needs. However, Bose has tremendous bass and the highs and lows hit just fine for my liking!

For gaming, I use these mainly to chat in discord with friends, but the "in game" sounds are very similar to a High-end pair of Astro headphones, if that means anything. Overall, I rate this product 5 stars, as I am still impressed with the performance in noise cancellation, audio quality, battery life, and durable build quality.

author: Paulo from Santa Rosa
title: Superb headphones
content: This is my third pair of noise cancelling headphones, and my favorite by far. I especially like the ability to select high or low noise cancellation, depending on whether or not I need to hear some ambient sounds (like a flight attendant asking if I want a drink).

author: Peter K. Eriksson
title: Wireless assistant, too notch sound.
content: Excellent cans. Can't go wrong with Bose. The Google assistant is a great extra feature to make these worth the extra cost.

author: Susan Burnham
title: A must for the open concept offices!
content: These were comfortable, had great sound quality and noise cancellation.  My boss recommended them for our open concept office and they completely block out my office neighbors!

author: TV
title: Of course Bose!
content: you know the question

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing sound quality
content: My wife has been wanting a set of these for a year so I finally Buber one. She absolutely loves it!

author: Lex
title: Almost perfect
content: This is a very good product, comfortable to wear and very good at noise cancellation. Note that noise cancellation only works well if you are playing something through the headphones, i.e.  music, white noise, etc.  Without this the noise cancellation is not nearly as effective. That said, when you play something, you are in your own world. Highly recommended.

author: Vellanki
title: Extremely good
content: Wonderful product . No compromise.

author: Amanda
title: Does not actually cancel most noise
content:
I am so disappointmented. When I received this package today, I thought I was finally going to have the chance to get some sleep. I live in a room right next to a noisy person (and rude - phone calls right next to me at 2 a.m. kind of deal), and have neighbors with yappy dogs that they leave out for hours on end at times. I've tried various ear plugs, but those haven't been effective enough for blocking the noises, so I figured I'd try active noise-cancelling headphones. These do not work for that purpose. I have the noise cancelling function set on "high," but I can still hear the TV downstairs, footsteps nearby and chatting a few rooms away. It blocks has blocked out a very limited range of background road noise (noises like revving engines are still heard), but simply isn't doing what it claims to be able to do: cancel noise.

I'm desperate here - does anyone happen to have suggestions for headphones that actually cancel noise? I've been playing brown noise in the background when I try to sleep, but the constant auditory input in my life is driving me crazy and I want to be able to simply block out the noise. I just need some quiet time while I'm trying to rest. :(

author: Einat
title: Amazing noise cancellation
content: Headset is amazing! I bought it for the long hours on the plane. It cancels the noise beautifully!!! I highly recommend.

author: Ryan P. Whorton
title: Great purchase, a couple tiny criticisms
content:
These headphones are great! Crisp sound, lightweight design, easy controls. I like the action button on this model. I have a big head and these fit really well - a rarity in my experience with headphones.

Perhaps my expectations are too high but the noise cancellation is not 100% what I had hoped for. Let’s say 90%...high pitch noise is less affected, so you can still head some things while wearing them. Still, I went into a busy cafeteria and was shocked at how effective the technology is. I did some reading and it appears that this is a standard limitation for noise cancellation. So, overall, the QC 35iis are a great example of noise cancellation technology and I am very happy with them, but the tech is not the miracle that the marketing sometimes implies.

One other thing: I really don’t like buying $350 headphones to find that no power cable is included; only a usb charge cable is included. Way to cheap out on us, Bose.

author: Tito
title: Super comfortable, alright sound quality, however I do not recommend
content: I chose these headphones because, well...they are Bose. I had always heard that Bose made the best noise cancelling headphones. However, after further research I found that Sony makes a pair of headphones that are way better, and the same price.  I do not recommend these headphones over Sony's.

author: Rafael Bernal
title: Works with 2 gadgets at a time
content: The very scant text on Amazon just mentions iPhones and Android, and I really wanted mostly for my laptop. To my great surprise, it works equally as well on computers with Blue Tooth.  Also the noise suppressing feature is excelent.

author: Andy S.
title: Absolutely amazing
content: Definitely pricier than some other options but worth every cent. Don't go with a more stylish/poplar/hip brand just because you want to look cool. I tried that and they were not as good and hurt my ears. These are very comfortable and give off a very high quality sound.

author: M. Carty
title: Bose headphones do what they say they will do
content: This is an upgrade from my first Bose noise cancelling headphones which I have used for 10 years and now my daughter is using, so I felt comfortable buying a blue tooth set; so nice without cords and the sound is amazing! The battery charge has been great, better than I expected.

author: Jeramyn Feucht
title: These are better in every way
content:
I upgraded from the QC 25s. These are better in every way.
Pros
Sound better
no noise from cord rubbing on things
more comfortable
better noise cancelation
rechargeable battery
More compact case

Cons:
As an iOS user the google assistant button is a bit pointless (i can't get it to work without opening the app on my phone but by then why have a button)

author: M. Nelson
title: Great Bose Sound! Noise cancelling w/Bluetooth.
content: Christmas present for my daughter. These are top of the line phones. I have a pair at my job and love them. Great sound with Bluetooth! Connects to phone or laptop automatically with single setup of Bose App.

author: John S
title: Can even noise-cancel-out a chatty Marketing Department!!!
content:
These are amazing and Bose is great!  I purchased these headphones for their noise-cancellation abilities.  I am an application developer and wear them at work because I am easily distracted.  I don't even listen to music with them... they just cancel just about all background noise, including random chatter from the annoying marketing department.  I also use them for WebEx and Skype calls with clients.  The built-in microphone is great and the noise-cancellation is helpful during those calls as well.  Battery life is extremely good.  I can go an entire week without having to charge the headset.  It comes with an 1/8" cable that will allow you to listen to music even when the batteries are dead.  An added feature is that the bluetooth feature will allow you to connect to and hear audio from two sources at the same time.  This is great if you want to connect to your iPhone and laptop at the same time.

After a month of use, the headphones button would no longer work to pair to a new device.  It would still power on and off, just the pairing didn't function.  Bose support was difficult to deal with.  At first the support technician didn't think there was anything wrong with the headset.  After a frustrating conversation, he relented and sent me instructions for sending them back to the manufacturer.  This would mean that I would be without my precious headphones for at least two weeks.  The next day prior to dropping the headphones at UPS I came across The Bose Store at Tysons Corner Mall.  I had the headphones with me so I decided to speak to one of the employees there.  After a very brief conversation, and even though I purchased these through Amazon, he walks over to a display, gets me a brand new set of headphones and proceeds to exchange my defective ones for the new set.  No other questions asked.  He just said "We like to take care of our customers".  I wish customer support would have been as easy to deal with... but, things worked out.

author: G. Wolff
title: Best NC Headphones
content: I bought these as a gift for my wife for use especially when we travel on planes. She absolutely loves them and has had absolutely no complaints. It took some getting used to setting them up with the app, but once they were set up, things were good to go. Great Noise cancelling headphones!

author: SRC
title: Quality
content: You pay a bit more for these headphones but after having made the mistake of buying the cheaper ones and having them fail within 30 to 60 days these are a much better deal in the long run and sound great..

author: D. at LLRC
title: ONLY WORKS WITH SMART PHONES not flip phones or free from APPLE computers
content: I have a FLIP PHONE not a smart phone so the BOSE does not work with my phone.  The  Bose headset requires a SMART PHONE to use, or to be connected DIRECTLY to an Apple computer.  If you do not have a Smart Phone and do not want to spend $300.00 for a PLUG IN set of ear phones, then you don't need to buy IS BOSE head set.

author: CowBoy Billy
title: Bose Best
content: Nothing to dislike.  Great to travel on planes with; you’ll hardly know there is a screaming child behind you while you enjoy the best sound from that tiny movie screen.

author: Robert Ravona
title: Nice
content:
Pros : Well built, very good noice cancellation, sits well on the ears.
Cons: I would have expected a much better sound from such a high end piece.

author: t-bird
title: Excellent !!!
content: Excellent !!!

author: GunnerGat
title: Great product.
content: Used these on a flight to and from Hawai’i and I promise they are just as described. Really feel like you are alone as soon as you turn them on. It was hard to swallow the price tag but looking back now I’m not disappointed

author: Qrysta White
title: Disappointed behind so much Hype
content:
Couldn't handle high preamp settings that I prefer.
Couldn't handle the bass of Dru Hill, Tell Me
nor
The shrill highs of Candlelight by Zhavia

Super comfy on the ears. Soft as pillows so I so wanted these to work.
Wired sound is even worse.  No wireless listening during charge but it charges faster than any others I just bought.

Its Bose app is cute. Needs only a widget.  No paper manual, app is all. Setup is a breeze.

author: Kat W.
title: Awesome Headphones
content: Love these headphones!  Use them to work out and they are great!

author: Angela Bowden
title: These are beautiful.
content: What can I say, it's "Bose".  I have purchased several pair of Bose headphones and I really like the look and feel of these. Noise cancelling is the best especially on a crowded plane.  It's SO nice not to be tied to a cord.  I haven't tested the battery fully yet, but I plan to take them on a several hour plane ride soon.  Fingers crossed that the battery lasts as long as the other Bose headphones I have owned in the past.

author: Benmat
title: Great headset
content: Great product. Good sound. Easy to use. Wireless is great. Bose is best around. This was second set I’ve had. Lost the last one. I always go with bose. Best quality.

author: Allen Yessman
title: Better than Concert Hall Sound
content: The sound is unbeatable!  Better than concert hall.  Noise cancelling is second to none.  After purchasing this I found the same product much cheaper on another website, but you cannot beat the the fact that Amazon stands behind the products they sell.  I found "online" that there are other noise cancelling headphones that are cheaper and have better battery life, but there are is no better name in sound than Bose.  I also have a Bose sound system and because of the quality sound that has I felt very compelled to make this purchase as well. I am very satisfied with this purchase.

author: BMWRider
title: As good as any noise cancelling headset, better than most.
content: They seem almost perfect to me. I had a pair of QC 15’s. These are every bit as good or better with the addition of a rechargeable lithium battery and no pesky cord to get in your way.  I use them around the house while mowing the lawn or working in the shop.  The noise cancelling is nice when using power tools.  I also use them while traveling mostly by air.  I don’t like to use them in the car unless I am a passenger.  No complaints.

author: Jerome
title: BOSE vs SONY
content:
I Bought these noise cancelling headphones first before purchasing the Sony WH-1000X M3.  By the time the Sony head phones arrive I had used the Bose a few times but didn't use them heavily just in case I needed to return them.  So after reading reviews  about the Bose and Sony and Beats I decided to purchase the Sony head phones.  As I said by the time the Sony head phones arrive I was coming close to the 30 day return policy  for returning the Bose.  But I wanted to compare the two for myself.  Here are my findings.  The Bose by reputation know how produce a device the reproduces clear natural sound.  Sony, for the longest time has been making.... no, inventing products for us that in some cases are second to none.  So after using them for a week I have to say for myself the Sony Head phones came in #1.  Like the Bose I heard the clear sound,  but with the Sony's  I got a bit more bass.  I'm not concerned yet with all the buttons, whistles, and bells that the two give.  Rather the best sound possible using some not so good compressed music sources (Mp3).  I can only imagine up grading to uncompressed  recorded music will sound using the Sony's.
My only problem is I'm stuck with both units because due to a stay in the hospital I went over the 30 day return limit to sent back the BOSE Head phones.  PS. Look for review on the Sony head phones

author: Michelle
title: Fabulously awesomeness
content: Took these on a 20hr plane ride and let me tell you....Couldn’t hear screaming kids or that uncle yelling about more wine. There was no airplane roar or hearing other people’s loud earphones blaring questionable taste in music. Felt like I was in my own private space. I could shut off the noise canceling with just a push of a button and talk to the stewards without taking them off. Worth every penny!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best headphones ever
content: Excellent purchase, 100% recommended. The best headphones I’ve ever had, I have the gray ones, super chic ;)

author: Lynne
title: Bose headphones.
content:
omg, these are awesome.  I groom dogs and when I use these no sound of the drier.  Since I only do one dog at a time, no need to have ears open to listen for other dogs.
THese are a lovely sound, clear and I just love them.  Pricey but if I buy crap I wont use.  so bought the good ones.

author: CH
title: Could be better, but good enough
content: Stilll can hear conversations on a plane, yet drowns our engine noise. Must be a safety thing.. Pairs easily with IPhone and other Bluetooth. I watch downloaded videos on plane since I travel for work. These help focus on hearing videos and music. Sometimes I double up with smaller earbuds or earplugs underneath these. Might want to buy extra ear pads before they go out of stock. Or you’ll have to buy a whole new set in a couple years.

author: Dianna Andrews
title: NO noise canceling at all
content: These are by far the worst "noise cancelling" headphones I've ever tried. I own the Bose ear buds with noise cancelling but they are not wireless so I wanted to try these. They do not cancel out any noise at all other than having something on my ears. I'm so so disappointed with Bose and with this product. I'm returning it.

author: john schofield
title: Enjoying the music
content: I love this wireless headphone.  The sound is good and bass. Two thumbs up.

author: @youcantseeme
title: I wanted to try this as I heard it was more comfortable than the Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones WH1000XM2 The sony ...
content:
Ehhhhh
Its over $300 and doesn't do Apt X Codec for bluetooth audio or Apt X HD
It only does AAC I think?

If you want to use a standard 3.5 inch to 3.5-inch stereo cable to listen to an audio source, you can't--for some reason, this has a 2.5-inch input....in 2018.  Huh?

I wanted to try this as I heard it was more comfortable than the Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones WH1000XM2
The sony has a bunch of Bluetooth codecs Aptx Aptx HD AAC LDAC and includes a good 3.5 inch stereo cable if you want to use a wired input--plus it has better noise canceling and battery life than the bose QC 35

I checked a lot of reviews on youtube and online, nobody mentioned the lack of Apt X codecs.  For $350 it should do a better job.

author: A. Kaufman
title: Issue with some Android phones
content: Great Bose sound. ---But, Google Assistant feature will not work on Samsung J3 phone! If you are buying the Series II for this feature, it will not work; I have tried 3 sets of headphones and none would allow the Google Assistant button to work. The headphone message is "Open Google Assistant and try the button again."  Android Oreo also has Google Assistant problems with the Bose. As of 12/29/17, there is no solution for the problem. I suggest you find out in advance whether your phone will work with the Google Assistant feature. Check the Bose community forum about this issue.

author: Snowcoyote
title: Nice overall but could be better.
content: Don’t leave on any trip without them! The noise cancellation is amazing. The sound is really solid but it occasionally cuts out when listening to music a little louder. Didn’t think I’d run into that issue for the price I paid for these.

author: BC
title: So Awesome!
content: I love these headphones. I put them on and everything else goes away. If I happen to be interrupted with a phone call it comes right through the headphones perfectly.

author: J Clarke
title: Great headphones....however...
content: Music sounds great...talking on the phone is not so great for the people on the other end. They hear all my ambient sounds. It sounds good on my end though, but their complaining about my noise gets loud for me. I have less complaints using my cheap bluetooth headphones.

author: STRN725
title: Great buy for the price
content: I own Beats earphones (they are nice but hurt my ear) and I bought these for myself and for my boyfriend.  I love the sound and love how it cancels the noice.  I can not hear anything outside which is great.  My only issue with these headphones is that when I take them off, my hair gets stuck to where the closures are and it tends to pull my hair out.  Anyway to avoid that? other than that they are great for noice cancelling.

author: R. Marie Miller
title: Not a bit impressed! BOSE should be ashamed!
content: Wow, these headphones are a profound disappointment! They don’t connect easily to Apple products and the overall build quality is a step above garbage. The “wireless” aspect of these, in my experience, is reminiscent of 2002 technology. I never could get these headphones to connect. There is a wire included so users unlucky enough to have these headphones can connect to their devices. This wire is very short and extremely thin. Seriously BOSE, you couldn’t have included a decent wire or cable for this? Not what I was expecting for the price. These things don’t appear sturdy either.  And the sound is good, but it’s not amazing.  Honestly, I’ll never even consider buying a BOSE product again.

author: Matt
title: I own two of these... ran one ...
content: I own two of these... ran one of them over with a skid steer and when I told bose about it, they said no problem... ship them back and we'll send you a new pair completely free.  Sure enough, that's exactly what they did!

author: Michiganman
title: Great headphones
content: Very high quality headphones!

author: John A
title: Stop working just after limited warranty expires.
content: So here is a classic case of wait until the warranty runs out to see if the product has any quality. Bought the QC35 II December 2017 and have loved them - I've had some minor issues with glitchy sound every now and then but would usually be fixed by repairing. However, yesterday, turned on the headphones as normal - connected to my Macbook Pro - no sound. I thought - hmm thats weird - followed the troubleshooting guide, reset the headphones, repaired the bluetooth etc. Still no dice. I went through this process 3 times, tried another device and eventually gave up - I plugged them in to my computer. Worked fine though the cable was a touch sensitive. This morning - won't even produce sound with the cable connected. For a $350 product Bose is marketing a scam - and when you go to try and get support they have the audacity to try and sell you a 'discounted' new pair for $250. Shameful marketing practices and poor customer service. Very disappointed. In all honesty I cannot recommend these headphones.

author: Charlie
title: Works great
content: I bought these as a gift for my wife and she is thrilled with the performance.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Headphones!
content: They're Bose so you know they will be good! Sound quality is great and NC is very good. (I wear glasses and may not be getting a complete seal.) Connection to any device is easy with the app. The AR feature is fantastic and I hope Bose expands on this feature. The battery life is very good. When I received mine in July, they were 80% charged and I've only had to charge them twice and use them almost daily. Would recommend.

author: john
title: Awesome!
content: Great for airplane flights or just doing stuff around the house. Really nice noise cancelling quality and the sound is terrific! Compared them head to head with others for noise cancelling in the store before purchase and they were better by far. Phenomenal sound while using on phone conversations. They are a bit pricey but well worth it!

author: Pegasus227
title: If you want noise cancelling headphones and are willing to pay a premium these are the ones to buy
content: I love these headphones.  They are comfortable. block out the noise and have great sound quality. They cost much more than I wanted to spend, but I was tired of headphones that don't quite do the job, these do.  The battery life is excellent. If you can afford them, the get them, you won't be sorry you did.

author: Karina Dougherty
