title: These are great quality and perfect for watching movies or listening to ...
content: These are great quality and perfect for watching movies or listening to music on the plane! I bought the wired version years ago and it was time for an upgrade- I do not regret it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: I can finally focus!!!!
content:
If you are looking for noise cancellation above all else, as I was, these are the headphones to buy. I am a college student and these headphones have TRANSFORMED my studying. I can finally focus on my work rather than the countless disruptions around me. I am not a headphones person, but I barely use my air pods anymore because the BOSE are so comfortable and practical.
The price point is intimidating, and this really was an investment, but they are worth every penny.

author: Nancy
title: Great headphone
content: I bouth this for my granddaughter and she said they are the bomb. They are the best quality she has had . The noise cancel6is amazing .

author: Owen
title: Comfortable and Balanced
content: It is very comfortable to wear and has very balanced sound especially in the mid range.

author: Fabricio
title: Cable auxiliar malogrado, ruido de golpeteo en el audifono izquierdo
content: Cable auxiliar malogrado, ruido de golpeteo en el audifono izquierdo, para el costo del producto, podrían verificar estos detalles.

author: Allen
title: noise cancelling not as good as my sony wh 1000xm2 and the sound out ...
content: You know I think the biggest problem Bose is having right now is updating their headphones. I had the first QC 35 and when I got them the sound cancelling was outstanding. Then as the updates started rolling in the noise cancelling went south and the sound suffered. I didn't update this pair. And they seemed ok,, noise cancelling not as good as my sony wh 1000xm2 and the sound out of the Sonys are far superior in my opinion. The bose need to be turned up about 75% for good listening volume and sometimes the sound to me can be on the tinny side. The comfort and build of these are the best you can get right now and I have tried many headphones. The Sonys if adjusted right are very comfortable but make the ears a little warmer than the Bose.

author: Francisco Guerra
title: Bose Vs Sony
content:
I was tore between the Bose QuietComfort 35ii and the Sony WH1000XM2 so i ordered both to compared. I received the Sony first and used them for a couple of days off and on with one session being 2 hrs. The features of these are awesome! So easy to setup and use. The app was also easy and lots of features to adjust the headphones. The touch pad though sensitive, i got used to keeping my hand away from it except when needed and i really like the Pause feature and Vol. The noise cancellation is top notch and the best of the two. I could not hear anything outside the headphone and a muffle sound when my wife was talking to me. Sound is amazing though i thought it was a little bass heavy.  My initial feeling was it was definitely a keeper! But that changed after that 2 hr session. The headphone started to feel heavy and though i am not to sensitive to the use of head gear as i ride a motorcycle and spent many many years on a US Navy Flight Deck, the headphone were getting a bit warm and uncomfortable around the ears.
I received the Bose and was just as easy to set up. The app is not as feature rich as the Sony but has the basics required. Used the Bose for a 2 hr session also and though it was a bit warm also not as much as the Sony. It was not as heavy as the Sony. The sound on the Bose was not as detailed as the Sony but pretty close on all the genres of music i listen to.  I also noticed that the distance between the Bluetooth source and the headphones on the Bose is not as far as the Sony but plenty of distance. The Noise Cancellation is not as good as the Sony but it did muffle most sounds around though i was able to hear the floor fan and i could talk to my wife without taking the headphones off. The controls on the Bose seem primitive compared to the Sony but it works well and easy to use.
In the end, i ended up keeping the Bose as they were more comfortable to wear for extended times. If i was just looking for a headphone for short periods of use, I would definitely go with the Sony but I needed these headphones for use of extended times. The sound is solid and enjoyable and the Noise Cancellation feature is tolerable.
Once i get more use and utilize more of its features, i will update.

author: Kevin K.
title: Five Stars
content: Fantastic product. I love it.

author: Frances Bennatti
title: meant to be plugged into a device
content: I bought these just for noise cancellation but to get them to work I have to plug in a wire to fool them into thinking that they're attached to something, also the controls are confusing, but if you can get them to work the noise cancellation is pretty good, not as comfortable as some

author: Alphaemporium
title: Trashy Bluetooth but good sound quality
content: Trash - the point is to function via Bluetooth, but the iPhone keeps trying to connect w/ the “Low Energy” Bluetooth connection (these headphones have 2 Bluetooth sources). Very intrusive and cannot use my phone. Returning ASAP due to failure on bose’s end to fix this issue (on going, very common - just google search).

author: Kenneth J. Hughes
title: hurts the top of my head
content: I can comfortably wear my Plantronics Voyager Focus UC all day long, but after about a half hour, the top of my head hurts where the Bose Quiet Comfort (not) 35 Series II rests.

author: VoraciousBuyer
title: A step up from QC2
content: I upgraded my QC2 and bought these. More comfy around the ears and, of course, bluetooth/wireless connection is pretty great. I use mine for traveling mostly and they tune out close to 100% of background airplane humming.

author: Angela Soto
title: Awesome
content: I love it.  Battery life last for a week.  Kind of big on my head which I can't use it for running but its very good for lifting weights and talk on the phone.

author: Was Fast
title: No Surprise Here
content: Read reviews here on Amazon, that made me nervous on counterfeit headphones, but nothing to keep me from doing some research to find reliable seller. The headphones arrived and performed as expected out of the box-  I am a huge Bose fan. Anyone denying the physical or sound quality of Bose is fooling themselves, or has a weird shape to their head. The headphones have seen noise canceling time and no noise canceling time, and have performed as a top shelf pick. The headphones have been more than 25ft away from a music source and did not lose the signal, until I went upstairs and the opposite side of the house-  30’ish feet I would guess. Love not having to leash myself to an audio source.

author: Dominick Barber
title: Drown out the sound you don't want with the sound you do want!
content: Every since I bought my first pair of Bose QC headphones I was in love with them.  Back then, I was a traveling consultant, and the peace they brought me during the hustle and bustle of airport traffic was immeasurable.  Now that I don't travel so often anymore I use them when I am at the gym, they pump me up while I work out and drown out any distractions around me.  Awesome purchase, and they work perfectly.

author: P. Krupets
title: Couldn't remap buttons on headphones on PC
content: apparently I need to buy another device to do it. this is a first and last product I bought from Bose.

author: erika gil
title: Excelente
content: Gracias

author: doc 4x5
title: silence
content: Incredible noise cancelling

author: Roy Chappell  V
title: Best headphones I have ever purchased
content: Really enjoy the sound of these headphones and they are so easy to use. Love the smart capabilities integrated with my Google Assistant as well as the switching between devices so easily.

author: Júlio Lemes
title: Very comfortable, sound quality is good and the noise cancelling is excellent
content:
What I like most about the headset is how it fits my ears perfectly. I've had many headsets over the years but none felt as comfortable.
The sound quality, battery life and noise cancelling are excellent.
If I were to say one thing I wish was better, it's the bluetooth range, currently I can't go to the next room without losing connection to my laptop. I've tested the Sony XM2 before buying this one and the range was considerably higher, but the XM2 didn't fit my ears well.  It's is not a big deal since It's just a matter of pairing it with my cellphone and carrying it in my pocket.

author: Toni Kolb
title: Excellent quality
content: Got them for my wife for Christmas. She loves them.noise cancellation is great. Would definently rate these as the best headphones I have EVER purchased.

author: Bearwife
title: Worth the money
content: I am in love with these headphones, and very tempted to wear them everywhere.  They are super comfortable, and the sound is simply awesome.  I can't believe how effective they are at noise cancellation on airline flights.  I haven't tried the Alexa voice control, but I'm delighted with how fast they paired with my phone and iPad.  The profile is small when packed up, which is also very nice.  I switched over to Bose noise canceling headphones for travel (from good quality Sonys) years ago, and this is the best model yet.

author: Stephen C Harrington
title: IT'S A BOSE OVER YOUR EARS!!
content: Off, low, and high noise canceling works superbly.  Tone quality and frequency range on music is incredible.  Battery life as advertised.  COMFORTABLE to wear.

author: Brent H.
title: Love these. Not a day goes by without using them.
content: They cancel the noise on planes. The battery life is awesome. The sound is great. When I have them on, my wife gets mad because she can’t get my attention because they block out the sound so well.

author: Mike B.
title: Superb sound. Bluetooth range is poor.
content: I purchased these upon the recommendations of a leading consumer magazine. My use for them is primarily for listening to music. In the review of the consumer magazine, it stated the claimed Bluetooth range to be 30 feet, which is the typical limit for such devices. Apparently they did not test them for this, which I find disappointing. Some of the reviews here reflect my own experience, as I can barely walk out of the room while using them. At a distance of 10 to 15 feet, the Bluetooth connection drops out when I move my head slightly from side to side. Bose claims high sound quality at all listening levels, and for the most part, I would agree. I would guess  it would involve provision for equal-loudness contour adjustment, so at low volume,  low and high frequencies would be boosted slightly. At any rate, I have found listening at low volume using noise cancellation to be very good. I am not, however, impressed with the Bluetooth range. I have several MUCH cheaper headphones and earbuds that have better Bluetooth performance.

author: Professor Nishanth
title: Great product
content: I got this as a gift for a family member who has always gone above and beyond and they loved it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Complicated
content: All instruction were in German. Blue tooth is hard to set-up

author: Gary M.
title: Stopped pairing with my computer after 3 months
content: They were great at first then the Bluetooth signal just started dropping out randomly after a couple of months then one day it dropped and now my PC can no longer detect them.

author: Cristian Thompson
title: BEST ON THE MARKET
content: The overall comfort, design, sound quality, and weight make these headphones far superior to anything I have tried or owned. Highly recommend. The noise cancelation is great for flights or study sessions in the library. The sound quality is top notch as well.

author: sergey Bogdanov
title: Good product with wrong features and broken firmware
content:
First of all unpacked from the box the product did not work well:
1. it was loosing connection every time time when it was telling me about low battery.
2. working purely with Google assistant, actually crashing from time to time
3. no alexa configuration possibility

I was on the verge of sending it back, when I noticed a message in the setting area about loading a new firmware.  When loaded it fixed most of the issues. So, be aware.

As for design, I do not understand why the programming 'action' button looks like a nonsense. It allows to choose one of 3 features: noise cancellation or google assistant or alexa.  If I choose one assistance, there is no way to switch noise cancellation and vice versa. And how about Bixby or other assistants?  How can I change noise cancelling while using the button for an assistance?

So in general, good sound and good noise cancelling. Takes less spaces folded than my previous headset. But the delivery and interface need improvement.

author: hiuhkj
title: Great sound quality and noise cancellation
content: Great sound quality and the noise cancellation feature is great for focusing on work.  only issue i have is that they are a bit heavy and can hurt my external ears if not positioned just right over my ears.

author: Kimberly Ann
title: My daughter LOVES this!
content: I bought these for my daughter's birthday and she keeps bragging about how wonderful they are!

author: Rostam
title: 1-year review of Bose QC35ii
content:
Frustrated. After having these headphones for an entire year I'm just feel like I was completely ripped off.
The headphones have great audio quality and all the fantastic features that is mentioned above. However, these headphones have serious issues when it comes to the audio skipping when using the bluetooth wireless mode. It's not a fluke issue with my headphones, this is a consistent issue with these headphones. If you google "Bose QC35 skipping" you will see a multitude of message boards of people spanning for the past 4 years with these same issues. There is a rabbit hole of forums dedicated to shoddy bluetooth quality of these headphones. I was unaware of this before purchasing these headphones. These headphones are VERY expensive and for the price they should at the very least play CONSISTENT AUDIO! They worked fine for a 8 months. Then a I noticed many major audio issues. Sometimes the audio wouldn't sync with the video I was watching on youtube, phone call would have in and out connection, music would begin to skip. I was so busy at the time unfortunately I did not have time to remedy the issue. Now there is nothing I can do about it as my warranty is up. I really wanted to like these headphones. Please take this a warning, if you buy these headphones they may work great for the first 6 months- 1 year, maybe slightly longer. However, they take a huge turn for the worst after the warranty is up. If I had the money I would buy the Sony WH1000XM3. Many customers on the Bose message board got fed up with the customer service representatives giving them the run-around and bought the WH1000XM3, and came back months and years later saying how they still work just as great as the day they bought them. I just wish I would have known that prior to purchasing these headphones. Please take heed of this review.

author: Robert C.
title: Save your hearing!
content: A must have fro travel our using power equipment, you ears will thank you

author: Life's a Beach
title: Best wireless headphones I’ve ever bought!
content: I travel a lot domestically and internationally and will never travel without them.  Don’t have to recharge on my 8 hour Germany flights.  Completely voids out any cabin chatter and engine humming and work great during phone calls. Sound quality is amazing for any music genre you’re listening to.

author: Gil Velez
title: Incredible noise reduction
content: The noise reduction is incredible. It has a great bass response and it is extremely comfortable on the ears.

author: Nora L Rogers
title: Work great!
content: Husband loves it.  Best anniversary present ever.

author: Arthur Stieren
title: Portable Office Headset
content: I run around with this as my portable office headset. Works at the office well in drowning out what I need when I need it, is nice to have at home for continuing to listen to presentations while getting a drink from the kitchen a full two floors down without any audio interruptions, and enables remote work with zero issues. I can be in the middle of a hotel lobby and participate in a full meeting as easily as if it were a remote conference at home. Love it.

author: Barry Allen
title: Great product but too pricey for products worth
content: Well like always Bose made good headphones. They are versatile and lightweight, easily controlled and comfortable. But with that said, I have owned the Beats Studio and Skullcandy Crushers before. Both are very adequate and cheaper replacements. You are in fact paying for the Bose name with this product. Nothing wrong with them, but honestly I've heard other brands be barely different for a lot less money. The battery life is less than impressive, overall I'm not even a little impressed with this product. I've been a fan of Bose for well over two decades now. But this product kind of let me down. The noise cancellation is actually very well done though. Overall not a bad product, but it needs to be 120 bucks or less for it to be worth it

author: Nebu10us
title: Great headphones!
content: A little expensive but great quality.

author: Momwith2boys
title: My son loves these
content: These headphones have great sound and a nice look.  My son wears these all the time and is very happy with the quality and comfort of these headphones.

author: Kasondra Fehr
title: BOSE does it again!
content: Bose - Please keep these type of noise cancelling headphones!  I sleep with them due to a snoring spouse and travel on airplanes frequently.  New models have “swipe” controls on the ear cups which is problematic for those who sleep with them on their sides.  GREAT JOB!  I’ve owned all models and BOSE continues to deliver to my customer needs!!!!

author: Peepe
title: Glad I bought them
content: I'm pretty happy with these head phones, with noise cancelling on high and audible from my phone I can pass out anywhere. As strange as it sounds, the only thing I don't like about them is that they don't hug my noggin hard enough and can slip if you're not totally vertical.

author: Ian Leach
title: Solid build, great performance.
content: Bought these for my other half for Christmas and she absolutely loves them. Solid look and feel and the audio is great.

author: kaesechan
title: best pair with a few limitations
content:
good lord, these things are legit.
couple of good notes: the sound is fantastic. it's not HORRIBLE to wear glasses under these (honestly don't think it'll ever feel good to wear headphones and glasses). the bluetooth connect is easy.
couple of meh notes: cannot charge and listen to bluetooth at the same time. cannot hear yourself talk when using bluetooth calling. windows gets confused when you use an IP phone with the voice bluetooth at the same time as the stereo bluetooth for music.
however, still the best pair of headphones I've had.

author: Vince
title: Excellent, Wireless, Connect to Multiple Devices at Once
content:
It was time to ditch the cord. I swear by noise canceling headphones but wanted wireless. These Bose headphones are amazingly comfortable to wear. Sound quality if excellent, just what I've come to expect from Bose.
It's so freeing not to be tied by a cable to the device playing your audio or video.

Setting them up was seamless, with one important caveat: you have to download a Bose Connect app on -each- device you want to connect to it. This means, you MUST set up each device -before- you get on the plane. (Learned this the hard way.)
Once set up and you turn them on, a quiet voice says, "Connected with X's iPhone, connected with X's iPad." Yes, it can connect to both devices at once; no need to switch back and forth. I'm very impressed by this.
Buttons on the headphones give you control of the volume and between high or low levels of noise cancellation, or none at all.
Another big benefit: these are rechargeable. I don't have to take extra batteries with me when I travel. The headphones and accompanying connector cords all fit in one nice carrying case.

They even include a cable so you could use the headphones with a cord to plug it into a device. (Valuable when I didn't get my iPad set up before getting on the plane.) However, they left one important detail undisclosed; the plugs on this cable are not identical at both ends and the difference is easy to overlook One is 3.5 mm: this one goes into your device. The other end is 2.5 mm: this one goes into the headphone. Be sure to plug the smaller end into the headphones very snugly. It doesn't go all the way in at first attempt.

author: Annabelle Lozano
title: Es muy bueno para mi hijo esta encantado
content: Todo es increíble sonidos , bajos y especialmente la cancelación de sonidos

author: Stknick
title: Works great

They fold up really small. I do wish the USB charging cord were a tad bit longer... the 6 inches is not enough...

author: SBGAL
title: Wonderful!
content: Love these! Great quality, look good, and the sound is incredible. Truly noise cancelling - can't hear a thing other than the music. Highly recommend

The Beats sound was very base heavy, not balanced amd no noise cancellation at all.  These Bose are literally in a different league above Beats.  Only thing I wouls improve is if Bose gave a charging plug with them.  I only use Apple products and had to buy a generic Andriod plug to charge the headset, very surpised that Bose did not include a plug in the box!

author: Harry Kasanow
title: Spectacular Bose Does it Again!
content: Had the earliest wired kind for 2 decades, this one is far superior, wireless and pairs instantly

author: Amazon Customer

content: One of the best things I've ever bought. Bose will always be number 1 for me. The sound quality is super good. I really don't think there is a more comfortable headphone than this. Worth every dollar!

author: J. C. Evans, Jr.
title: Hearing aid comfortable
content:
Looking for headphones comfortable over my hearing aids.
Consumer Reports recommended these.  They work just fine.

author: Kevin

author: Devo

content:
I bought these for my husband to wear while commuting on the bus everyday to work. He is in love with them! BEST GIFT EVER!
Totally worth the money!

author: Sue Fowler
title: Headphones Do Not Work With New Generation 9 Kindle Fire
content:
I have two other Bose headphones that worked seamlessly with my Kindle fire tablets in the past and I would have loved to keep this new set if I could... unfortunately Amazon's gen 9 kindle tablets no longer allow Apps from Unknown Sources, to allow the Bose connect app to be download to the tablet.  Without the app, Bose will not allow connection.  Of course, the app is not available on Amazon but on Google Play which is blocked by the new "Unknown Source" requirement.

If you buy any headphones, there should not be a requirement to down an app first before you can use it.  Or at least put in the ad that they will not work with the new Generation 9 Kindles.

As long as Bose requires this download, I'm done with the company.

author: S. Rogen
title: Buy these!
content: These noise cancellation headphones are great. Would not hesitate to recommend them.

author: Nicole V.
title: Pricey but amazing!
content: So far these are amazing.  Pricey, but amazing.  I'd like to compare them against a $75 version of active cancellation headphones.

author: noknots
title: My first ones disappeared and I only used them at hospital
content: This is a replacement and we haven't got them out to charge nor my new iPod (they are being discontinued).  I spend 12 hours in the hospital getting an immune infusion, they put Benadryl in me so I'm groggy and with the QE head set it blocks out most of the noise so I rest a lot but it still lets to hear the nurses come in and I have the sound low.  I made special bags to carry my stuff and can't believe they disappeared.  I always leave in the pocket in the bag until next infusion and we searched the house inside and out and couldn't find them, called the hospital and I didn't leave them behind, suspicious house cleaner I think

author: Tayba L. Tahir
title: Great Service
content: Beautiful headset with excellent sound!

author: Mr&MrsV
title: The best choice vs. the comparable Sony headphones
content:
(FYI, I also posted a similar review on the Amazon page of the Sony WH1000XM2.)

I'll keep it short. I read the reviews of the Sony WH1000XM2 and the Bose QuietComfort 35 II and could not decide which to choose, so I bought both. I returned the Sony and kept the Bose. Here are the pros and cons:

Sony:
+ Crisper highs and deeper bass (I can't see how anyone says the Bose model sounds better)
+ Better song navigation with the figure gestures on side of right headpiece
- When making phone calls, those on the other end hear more of your background noise than on the Bose (I tested by calling from a land line to a family member who used my Sonys)
- Heavy on the head and hurts to wear for long periods (this was a deal breaker for me)
- Finger navigation feature is too sensitive sometimes - easy to skip/rewind songs by accident.

Bose
+ Great noise cancellation, especially with no music (better than Sony's)
+ Light weight and definitely more comfortable for long periods
+ Best for phone calls (those on other end don't hear much background noise)
- Sound is missing crispness at high and low ends; overall sounds are a bit muffled (it would be great to get Sony's sound on these speakers). If music quality is your deal breaker, buy the Sonys for sure.

In the end, I couldn't get over the uncomfortable aspect of the Sonys. I really preferred the Sony sound, but didn't see myself wearing the Sonys for long periods of time. My primary reason for buying these was muffling office and plane engine noise for long periods of time, therefore comfort was a deal breaker. It also helps that I can take conference calls on the Bose headsets and not worry about those on the other end hearing lots of background noise.

Both lose one star due to their respective shortcomings, but for my use the Bose was the winner. After owning them for about 5 months, I'm very happy I chose them. Really great product.

author: Robin Bobin
title: Good noise cancelling, not too many features
content:
Very decent noice cancelling, tried in an airplane and a bus, worked wery well. Also use it on noisy streets.
Before that I used Plantronics headset and can compare. Bose wins in terms of noise cancelling. Plantronics wins in terms of features ( it paused playing when I took them off and resumed when I put them back on my ears, was so comfortable when sb distracts you) I enjoy Bose model very much but miss that brilliant Plantronics feature.

author: tim
title: best headphones for travel
content: I travel a lot for business got these so I don't have to hear so much background noise for me they work perfect the sound is also great I'm no audiofile however I do listen to all types of music anywhere from old blues to hip hop so I think I have a good ear if you buy these you want be sorry

author: Stacy Homan
title: Came from a smokers home
content: I was disappointed about these headphones. The condition noted when I bought these was new, but when they arrived they smelled of cigarette smoke.  I feel they came from a smokers home.  I don't believe they were new, but previously owned. These were misrepresented.

author: susan wrenn
title: A must have!
content: A must have for a frequent flyer. I am able to sleep or enjoy music without being disturbed. The sound quality is great. Worth every penny!

author: Joao Poneis
title: Unpleasant glitches and early wear off
content:
I have a very unpleasant experience with this equipment. There are constant small glitches when playing from a laptop. While it works fine when playing from a smartphone, the limitation is annoying. There is a thread with more than 26 pages in Bose's support community discussing the issue.
Removing from the laptop and reinstalling worked for a while. Now it doesn't. I updated the firmware and followed all recommendations, but the problem persists.
For the very high price it charges you, Bose should provide a better support.
I do not recommend the purchase, with so many other similar options in the market.

Update:
I could make the headphones to work without glitches by disabling a couple of Bluetooth Services, namely ARfcomm, AudioWear, AudioWear Voice and Handsfree Telephony. It still presents glitches, but now it is less frequent.
However, now I have another issue. The earpads began to wear off. It is way too early for this to happen (I bought about 10 months ago). I again asked for support, but Bose is very inattentive.

author: Stoney
title: When all else fails read the INSTRUCTIONS
content:
I will certainly do that after my printer finishes printing the 34 page instruction booklet, which was NOT included in my package. I DID receive IMPORTANT SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS, printed in 30 languages, which everyone knows is tossed upon receipt. I, for one expect that for $349.00 one would receive a complete package from Bose. I searched every nook and cranny of the 8.5" x 6" x 2.5 box. Ain't there.
Bose needs to remember the SEVEN P's: Proper Prior Planning Prevents P*#s Poor Performance. The item is charging now. More to follow. Maybe!
since I conquered that

author: SD
title: Used headphones
content: I was sent used headphones. They had at least 3 prior owners, evidenced by 3 nicknames when paired with the app. The headphones do not work properly as well. Amazon censored my first review.

author: WV Peach
title: Super duper headphones!
content: Just got these yesterday and I LOVE them!  Aesthetically pleasing to look at, lightweight with no pressure on my ears, but most importantly, they work to block out noise.  I tested these around my two nephews (ages 13 and 8) during their Nerf Gun war, and was pleasantly surprised at the noise reduction.  I could still hear sounds, but it was extremely reduced to the point I could hear my inner thoughts.😊. Music quality sounds wonderful......but it’s Bose, so I’m not surprised.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It is not noise canceling
content: I can hear what the people talk with the headphones on and the noise cancelling is on

author: Amazon Customer
title: Silence in a noisy office!
content:
I got these because my co-workers are LOUD AF, and now it’s like I’m in my own office.  Without any music playing the noise canceling effect is jaw dropping.

I’m an operations analyst for one of the mega-techs and our operations bull pen area can reach deafening roars. Combined shouting / laughing in addition to high traffic and AC noise this place was becoming unbearable for someone that enjoys a quiet place to work.

I tried a $100 range cheaper alternative and only got a taste of what these offer.  Been wearing them every day for a week and done see them becoming uncomfortable ever.

Bluetooth pairing works with multiple devices like a dream. No issues quickly changing from phone to desktop.

No buyers remorse here!

author: Redcape
title: Best $399 I ever spent
content: Wow! These made my life better. Not just for music or loud planes - but noisy neighbors, dogs barking... want some peace... just put these on and make all the noise stop for a while!

author: PNB
title: Got almost everything but...a $1 plug
content: Bose needs to include a $1 plug that fits aircraft seats. Fortunately I had one from my old non-Bose headset but to pay a premium price and this is missing is very poor. Most people I know use their Bose when flying.

author: andre surles
title: Excellent! Works with PSVR too!
content:
This review focuses on using them for gaming, specifically for the PS4. They work great for everything else too but I wanted to focus on the gaming aspect because I hadn’t seen it covered.

I also purchased as set of PlayStation Gold wireless headphones, unfortunately they suffered from Bluetooth drop outs in wireless mode and didn’t fit well. (Just FYI usb 3.0 in conjunction with external hard drives creates electronic noise in the 2.4ghz spectrum which effects the wireless connectivity, including your router)

Anyway back to the Bose, these fit extremely well and are very comfortable even for people with extra large heads like myself. The wireless does NOT work with the PS4, however I don’t know about you but if I’m playing the PS4 then I’ve got a controller in my hand or a VR headset on...both of which have a 3.5mm jack.
Speaking of PSVR, these fit perfectly over the headset and because the PSVR requires a wired headset the PS Gold’s have zero advantage compared to the Bose.
Sound wise they are awesome and deliver a very immersive experience. Are they 3 times as good as the PS Gold? No. But they are notably richer and more nuanced and the fit is significantly better for me personally.

Note: If you are trying to use these with a mic for gaming you will need to pick up the android wired cable with Mic for the QC25’s.
Also the 2.5mm input on the headphones themselves requires a FIRM push, if you see metal on the plug tip then it’s not full inserted.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Box was damaged
content: I ordered this for my husband for Christmas box arrived damaged so I am hoping the product is ok.

author: Amos Cao
title: Great for big heads
content: I've got a big head and most headphones squeeze and give me a headache. These are very comfortable for large headed people.

author: Vic Robertson
title: Great for music
content: Great for music.  Do not buy these if you are a gamer.  There is significant lag that will ruin your game.

author: H RHINEHART
title: Lots of unnecessary noise. People trying to out talk each other
content: I work in a noisy office. Lots of unnecessary noise. People trying to out talk each other. Threw these own and what a blessing. I could concentrate on my work.

author: Sarah Gaskin
title: No longer dreading the office
content: Office noises are heavily distracting, and my "Skull Candy" brand headphones were not drowning out any of the noises. So I went out on a limb and purchased these, and I'm so happy that I did. They work very well, almost too well. Now whenever someone approaches me, I jump, because I cannot hear their footsteps or them saying my name. You have to tap me on the shoulder or wave a hand in front of my face to get my attention. It's great. 10/10 recommend.

author: sarah
title: Comfortable and good sound
content: Comfortable to wear and great sound quality. I like that the noise canceling function can be turned off if needed.

author: Wess
title: Comfy and quiet
content: Controls are tightly packed on headphone. Easy to push the wrong button. Otherwise I really like the lightness and comfort. Simple layout of controls is preferable to the Sony swipes for me.

author: Doug
title: Great product
content: Just a great product! It performs as good and better than description. Very comfortable on 11 hour flights.

author: will
title: wife loves them
content: Purchased for my wife she loves them all the way around.

author: Holly VanTilburg
title: Not quite sure they were worth the price
content: I wanted a pair of Bose since I 15 that was over ten years ago and though the sound still brings me to a place whew I feel all warm and fuzzy inside the quality is definitely not the same.

author: C.A. O.

content: Bought these after trying a set my daughter has.  Incredible sound and noise cancellation capability.  Easy set up with 3 devices including old 5s phone used as an ipod.  Hesitated because of cost, but in the end, well worth it imho.

author: Eric Brown

content: The headphones are comfortable to wear and have excellent sound.  I watch and listen to classical music, and the sound is accurate and full.  I had an older pair; these have controls on the phones themselves, and of course they are wireless and easy to pair on Bluetooth.

author: K11363
title: Great.
content: I received a new box, unopened. This is my first pair of noise cancelling headphones.  I may send them back because I think I'm one of those who are sensitive to the nc, I get a slight headache when the option is on. When the option is off the sound quality is horrible for headphones of this quality and price, no bass at all.

author: armyjackson
title: One of the best things I've ever purchased for myself
content:
I'm sitting here in a hotel on a worktrip at the loudest nost nerve-wracking hotel in Denver.  A few hours ago, I popped on these headphones and turned them on, and it changed everything.  Silence sweet silence. Bravo with this device.
Google assistant answers does everything I can think it could do and more and also answers the most obscure of questions which is a very nice added touch (How do I shield surf in Zelda? (and it was explained to me while I was playing)

Great purchase, I don't regret it.  Best headphones I've ever had and am now scared that I'll lose them or something will happen to them.

author: Amanda
title: Great for studying
content:
I bought these to use in the library for studying and for working around the house. Works well with music and the spoken word.
In the library:  The noise cancellation is great. Oftentimes that alone is good enough to let me fall into the level of concentration necessary for my studies. Otherwise, a rainfall white noise track on youtube does the trick and I can't hear ANYTHING around me.
Around the house:  Keeps the bluetooth connection very well for several feet or if my phone's in my back pocket. My house is very long, and I normally have to walk around a wall before it will start to cut out.

author: Jobe
title: Boise cancellation causes headaches
content: Great sound and build quality. I bought these headphones for noise cancellation as I travel a lot on planes. Unfortunately, it caused me headaches when I switched it on and even made me feel dizzy.

author: Andrew Wittenburg
title: The most comfortable pair of headphones I have ever worn.
content:
These headphones are extremely comfortable. They are light, and very open inside the earcups. I have average sized ears, and my ears don’t even come into contact with the interior of the earcups.

I will have to admit, the Sony’s have a +1 in audio quality. But the Bose are insanely comfy, and still have very good audio quality.

It depends what you are looking for, sound or comfort. I chose the comfort, and have absolutely no regrets.

author: Daniel
title: The best one
content: The best headphones!!

author: Newburymac
title: Great for Airline Travel
content: I bought these for noise canceling and using with iPad to watch movies while traveling on long cross-country flights. They easily pair with my iPad. Although I downloaded the Bose app, I haven't used it and can still have noise canceling and pairing with my iPad.

author: Dyson Jian
title: Better than 1000xm2 and tested
content: Now it's a myth that the 100mx2 is better than this since rating.com did a test and it's sound quality for bass mid and high outmatched the Sony's by alit

author: Fitness fanatic
title: Can't hold a bluetooth connection
content:
Update, so I reset them after the firmware update, and that fixed the problem. They work and sound much better. Added two stars. Still waiting to make sure the problem is really gone before I decide whether to keep them...

.....

So I just bought these a week ago, and the bluetooth connection constantly drops. It started every 5-10 min and now is basically every minute. Tried updating the firmware, but that actually made it worse. They don't even play for a minute now. They also don't sound any better than my $20 crappy earbuds, and they get a weird pop in the music in the limited time I can get them to play. Luckily, I still have the box at work. These are going back.
I'm pretty disappointed in these, considering how much they cost.

author: Nathaniel
title: They are better than you imagination can fathom
content:
The super-dopest... first, let me start by saying my neck is so much better taking my phone calls on these bad boys. No more of that ear to shoulder pinch we do with out phones that is so unergonomic. Who designed that and how did that become the global standard? Terrible.

Sound clarity is fantastic - treble and bass are very well balanced, as expected with Bose. Noise cancelling not the top of the line best, I'd say 90% out of 100%. Still pretty darn good. Don't usually realized how well it is working until you take them off.

Battery power, outstanding. Recharge time, blink of an eye.

Practically weightless for headphones this size, and no wires is the best. I thought I would be using them more at home, because they'd be bulky, but not bulky at all. Very lightweight and cozy, I take them on dog walks, errands around the neighborhood, on the train. I use them a lot more than anticipated.

Multiple capacity abilities - music, phone headset, noise cancelling and google voice (which I should utilize more often, it's like having a mic for a keyboard on your phone or tablet)  makes this Bose headset one of the better purchased I've made in a long time.

Seriously, they are super.
Seriously, they are dope.

Hence, they are the super-dopest.

author: Greg Castiglione
title: Still evaluating
content: The only thing I don't like is that I need to have my phone with me to turn on & off the noise cancelling setting. At night I use this with my TV and I have to guess what noise cancelling setting I have it set to. When I push the button of the left ear, it tells me to go to the app to change the setting. Not sure I like that.  Otherwise I would give it 5 stars. -Greg--

author: Amy
title: Great sound quality and amazing noise cancellation
content:
I purchased these and the Sony WH1000XM2 to compare the two. Cnet says they both have a "9" for sound quality. I would agree, they both sound excellent. The Bose won the test for its noise cancellation, performance talking to people on the phone, comfort on my head, and sound processing.

Phone performance:
I compared how the Bose and the Sony sounded when recording and playing back my voice with a fan running in the background. The Bose sounded like I was holding an old fashioned handset and talking in a quiet room - intimate and zero background noise. The Sony sounded like I was on speaker phone, and I could hear some background noise. (As a control I also recorded using neither and it sounded like I was on speaker but also I could hear more background noise.) This feature is important to me since I spend a lot of time on the phone and prefer my clients to not hear any background noise.

Sound quality
The Bose and Sony both have excellent sound quality for playing music. I personally prefer the sound the Sony produces. The Sony iphone app lets you choose your levels on an equalizer, and I like that. However, the Bose hears what type of music you're playing and automatically optimizes the sound, and it does a really good job. While I would prefer to be able to set the levels if I so choose, I also appreciate that Bose is making it all easy for me, so I can truly listen to my music on random and not have to fuss with levels. The Bose iphone app doesn't do very much at all. It does let you "find your headset" similar to the "find my phone" app, and it will apply firmware. (I'm hoping Bose will add an equalizer into its app in the future.)

Noise cancellation
The Sony occasionally made me aware that noise cancellation was going on (with a whitenoise effect). The Bose on the other hand just stops the noise. There is no delay, no white noise, just quiet and your music.

Controls
The Bose controls are intuitive to find and to use. I like that the on-off control is a switch to flip on and off (rather than a button to find). Also, you can use this button to switch between devices, for example between your phone and ipad and your TV amplifier. The right earcup has three small buttons in a row together, and they control a lot of things. Volume, pause, and skip, rewind, answer/decline calls, etc. The left earcup only has the google assistant button, which I programmed to instead control the amount of noise cancellation (high, low, off). Song playback sounds much better with noise cancellation on high, and I don't think that has to do with noise (I was in a quiet environment); the bass sounds enhanced with noise cancellation on for some reason. (In comparison, the Sony lets you swipe the earcup itself to control volume, pause, play, skip, etc. This seems great in theory, but in practice if I bumped  the earcup adjusting my glasses or whatever, the music would pause. I found the Sony to be somewhat buggy in that regard. It would stop playing at times and I had to pick up my phone to get the music re-started, which is annoying.) I found the Bose controls to be more intuitive and consistent. Also, when you switch them on a voice tells you how much battery you have left, which is handy.

Comfort
The Bose QuietComfort truly is comfortable. The earcups are soft, there is not a lot of clamping, and the top band is padded so it's less annoying on the top of the head.  (In comparison, the Sony do have more clamping which was uncomfortable over glasses.) I am a pilot and wear a similar headset, so I'm familiar with how headphones feel after a few hours. On-ear are not going to be as comfortable for long term wear as earbuds would be, but I was wiling to make that trade-off to get superior sound quality.

Style
The Bose are more streamlined to my head. the Sony are bulky and look geeky.

Conclusion
Even though the Sony produces superior sound, the litany of other features (superior noise cancellation, intuitive controls, comfort, style, & phone performance) won me over to the Bose.

author: Steve From USA
title: Comfortable wear for 8 hours straight
content: Quality item. Long battery. Comfortable wear for 8 hours straight. Great sound quality and bass. Bad reviews say poor quality music but I disagree stongly. Noise cancellation is not near as good as the older models I tried at Best Buy where you couldn’t hear people talking right to you. It also hurts your ears a bit on high. But I used low setting for 8 hours and overall really like the product.

author: acholder
title: A new standard for wireless headphones
content: Unbelievable. As a student, I needed a way to separate myself from the rest of the world when studying, and these definitely get the job done. The noise cancellation these headphones provide is top notch, the look of them are sexy, and their quality is unmatched. I highly recommend these.

author: Emre Neftci
title: Good noise cancelling with low-end sound and construction quality
content:
This is a disappointing product for the price. Although the noise cancellation is impressive, everything else with these headphones are average, at best. I'm used to good quality headphones (Sennheiser Momentum 2.0), and my music sounded so dull that I had to return them. Plus, the wired cable does not include a microphone, and the bluetooth handsfree mode is the only way to use the microphone otherwise, where sound quality is very low. The wired microphone can be purchased... why not just include it? Also, I did not need this level of noise cancelling: the low noise cancelling feature was enough.
In summary, it feels like Bose is simply betting on its ANC.

author: Joseph Bailey
title: Connections are BUGGY
content:
First the Pros:
- Sound Quality is second to none (compared to it's competitors)
- Comfort is great, I can wear these for hours on end and not get headaches like other headphones give me
- Very portable, not bulky at all

Next what I call the: "Meh"
- Battery life. I wasn't expecting a high capacity battery on these, but even in standby mode, the battery life is ok, not great.

Last, but most importantly the cons:
- The process of connecting these to multiple devices is as buggy as ever. I downloaded the bose connect app which helps marginally. I gleefully open the connect app to check for an update often, just because I have a fleeting glimmer of hope that they will release a fix for the frankly unacceptable quality of connection firmware on the headphones. They lose connection all the time, will show as connected to my devices and not play any audio. I thought maybe it was the device's fault, but nope, this happens often to many different kinds of devices.

- I recommend disabling the annoying voice that reads out everything that the headphones are doing. When someone in your contacts calls you, common sense would dictate that the voice would say the name of the person calling. NOPE. The voice reads who is calling one number at a time, even if they are in your contacts with a name. And of course as you are listening to music the voice completely hijacks the audio to inform you that you have connected/disconnected to/from another device. A short tone would be nice.

Bose, if you are reading this, FIGURE YOUR SOFTWARE OUT! You've got top of the line audio and noise cancellation, but these headphones have glaring flaws in the software/firmware.

author: Casey H.
title: 1000% worth the money!
content: I am in awe of these badboys! Truly remarkable! Took them overseas and couldn't believe how much they cut out engine noise! Would recommend them 1000%! Totally worth the money!

author: Wifireviewers
title: Best headphones ever owned.
content: The noise cancellation is second to none. The sound quality is great and the battery lasts quite a while and charges incredibly quickly from 0 to 100%.

author: davigor
title: comfortable and efficiently noise-cancelling, but a little glitchy in bluetooth
content:
Generally, I love these headphones.
I love the fit and the comfort level of these headphones. I am someone who often gets headaches from tight headphones and have even had to switch to earphones in the past because of this, but the light weight &adjustability of these Bose headphones enables me to wear them for at least a couple of hours a time before experiencing discomfort. Still, if you are someone with similar issues I'd recommend you try these on before buying if possible to see how the fit and pressure affects you.

I love the noise cancellation feature most -- in my opinion that is what makes this pair really worth it. Though the feature does come with a very slightly buzz or muffle, when turned on, the noise cancellation really does transport you to your own silent little world. If I can hardly hear the noise of crowds in midtown Times Square, you know that these will be effective in your library or airplane.

My main complaint would really be with the bluetooth feature.. I find that it is sometimes glitchy and a struggle to connect to bluetooth at first try. However, I personally have not had persistent issues with this as it will almost always connect on the second or third try.

What it comes down to is what you are looking for with these headphones. Generally, I think these headphones are worth the money if a silent ambiance is what you're really in it for.

author: jennifer lee
title: Noise cancellation does not work
content: Noise cancellation stop working after 1 year.  Piece of S***.  Amazon won't step up to take the issue on hand and refer the customer to Bose.  Going to start buy electronics from CostCo where you can return the purchase easily due to defect!

author: Ross
title: Indispensable para viajes largos
content: Dura todo tu día sin preocupaciones de batería, muy buena cancelación de ruido

author: Him
title: The Best headphones
content: Bose has always been my favorite. As always, I found the same thing with these headphones. Best in class noise cancellation and sound quality. So comfortable, that I am not tired wearing them even after hours of use.

author: Pat R
title: Would purchase again
content: Love this product. Noise cancelling works better than I would expect. Sound is great!

author: Igeaoux
title: Unparalleled noise canceling and deep sound
content: Phenomenal noise canceling. Awesome sound. Deep bass. All in all it’s a great headset for casual music or studio work and for airplane flight it is unparalleled. Just returned from a trip and the airplane noise is almost...and I mean almost eliminated. Issue: you sincerely cannot hear the flight attendant talk to you. Makes for some funny situations.

author: Jason
title: Just buy it!!!!!
content: Worth every penny!

author: Corey W.
title: Multiple Bluetooth connections doesn't work
content:
The specs says it can handle 2 Bluetooth connections at the same time. However, anytime I have both a computer and my phone connected at the same time, the audio really suffers if i try to just do anything with my phone. If Im watching something or listening to something on my computer and all I do is unlock my phone, the headphone audio degrades pretty much the entire time im messing with my phone. Even when Im not doing anything with audio on my phone, as in playing music or watching videos, and all im doing is surfing the news etc, the audio for the computer just becomes intolerable.

If only using 1 device at a time, these seem to do really well. But the multi-connection audio suffers quite badly.

author: Coquinas
title: Love these
content: I have an older pair of Bose noise-cancelling headphones and like them.  This one is much lighter in weight, fits better, and has more features.

author: Amazon Customer
title: This item comes with a case
content: Comfortable OVER the ear headphones. Sound quality and noise reduction 5 stars. Item description doesn't state an included case, which could have eliminated the hassle of ordering/returning an additional case.

author: Tony Anderson
title: Wonderful sound
content: I'm really into music and these are the best headphones I've ever had I tried them against Sony noise canceling and I prefer bose

author: Amazon Customer
title: I thought I loved my QuietComfort 15 pair
content: I used the Bose QuietComfort 15 with almost daily use for 6 years. They finally are beyond repair and purchased the QuietComfort 35 Series II. Boy, I did not know what I was missing! I thought I loved my QuietComfort 15 pair, but not as much as my new ones! They're significantly more comfortable, the sound quality is amazing, and the noise canceling is the best ever. These are hands-down worth the investment.

author: Super Scooter
title: Well Worth the Price Tag, But Can Get A Little Warm
content: Ordered these based on recommendations from a friend.  I've used some cheaper Bluetooth (non-noise cancelling) headphones in the past and you can definitely tell the difference in quality with these.  The Bose have instantaneous connection/recognition, great range, and great audio.  The noise cancelling is also top notch and is adjustable.  My only complaint is that they can sometimes get pretty warm, although I am pretty hot natured in general so that's probably mostly on me.

author: Masta
title: Awesome wireless headphones.
content: These things are amazing and im glad I own them. The battery life is just as expected. The audio quality is amazing and the noise canceling is flawless. Theyre extremely comfy as well. I havent had any problems with connecting them to my phone or loss of connectivity while im listening to music.

author: Maureen P Feeney
title: Easy to use with apple
content: Easy to use. Fabulous sound

author: Scotty V.
title: Wicked legit!
content: I travel a lot for work and use these on flights all the time. The sound quality is top notch! I never leave these home!

author: Sam
title: Best headphones I’ve ever heard
content: These headphones are so great I felt compelled to review them. They sound great, feel even better, and cancel noise incredibly well.  I have loved mine after a week or so of having them.  The only complaint that I have is that when the music isn’t loud, even if they are on highest noice cancelling setting, they don’t quite get all of the noise and you can hear a slight amount. But other than that fantastic and would recommend. If you have 350$ lying around buy these mamma jammas.

author: Bill Zimmerman
title: Great
content: Great for Gaming or just listening to Music. BOSE are an Industry Standard.

author: Richard Newby
title: Awsome sound where ever!
content: Works great on the airplane or doing chores around the house.

author: Katherine M
title: Awesome, but...
content: These headphones are beautiful. Perfect color, great sound and battery life, only one complaint — I dislike how the active noise cancellation is automatically turned on when you turn on the headphones and the only way to turn it off is through the app. Just a little cumbersome. Other than that, great product!

author: LONGJMPB
title: Great quality!
content: Bought as a gift for my daughter. She loves them and says how comfortable they are. If you want quality go for Bose!

author: Matthew Krowchun
title: Bluetooth connection stops working after a few weeks
content: These stopped connecting to my Iphone 7 after a few weeks.  I've got 5 other devices that connect perfectly to my phone.  I've tried all the fixes on the Bose Community.  Also noise cancellation doesn't seem to work when using the headphone wire.  Very disappointed.

author: Supah Cruzah
title: This would be a great headset...
content:
...if it wasn't so glitchy. This product is plagued by so many glitches.

The worst one is when I place a phone call, and all the outside noise is channeled though the speakers. This destroys the noise cancelling ability. Another glitch is when I am in a phone call on Discord and I end the call, all the sound from all other sources on the PC are still muted until I hard reboot the PC and re-pair the head set. The sound works fine if the Bluetooth feature is not being used and you are connected to the PC with the 3.5mm jack, however you lose the microphone feature in the headset.

The other glitch is when I am watching videos on the PC and again, all the outside noise is barfed into your ears at max volume! This is so frustrating! I cannot find any solution to this issue through Reddit, nor through youtube.

I have read through some of the other critical reviews and have seen that this may all be a botched firmware update. I will update when there is a fix for this.

But for now, STAY AWAY FROM THIS!

author: Eric
title: A must have for travel!
content: These are my new favorite headphones.  I bought these prior to a business trip to Europe which was going to have 20 plus hours of flights to help  drown out the drone of the airplane engines.  Not only did they drown out any ambient noise on the planes, during my entire trip I did not have to charge these headphones at all and I used them on every flight.  These not only met the challenge but exceeded my expectations.  While I was skeptical about the cost, they are worth every penny if you travel!

author: D Johnson
title: Great for New Yorkers
content: These changed my whole life. My life as a New Yorker had been incredibly improved by using these on my commute and to drown out daily noise.

author: Angela
title: Love them
content: Love them

author: Amazon Customer
title: Broken noise cancelling while using bluetooth(possibly fixed)
content:
If you want good noise cancelling while on bluetooth you're out of luck. For some reason it plays back the sounds around you into your ears. Type on your keyboard and it plays back the sounds it hears into your ears. And to top it off when you go to the bose support webpage to download the updater it 404s. I used to think bose was a high quality company when I had the qc25.

Update: The playback issue seems to be gone for now. I don't know if that'd just because I haven't used Discord with it for a while or not.
Still not pleased with how difficult they make it to revert the version of firmware. They're as comfortable as the qc25s but like others have mentioned the noise cancelling on the qc25 seems like it was better.

author: Elisabeth
title: This is the best traveling companion you can have
content: This is the best traveling companion you can have!  What a difference they make, makes flying so much more comfortable!  Highly recommend!

author: Elizabeth M.
title: amazing sound quality
content: I LOVE these! I had purchased some beats and returned them, and I'm so glad I did. The beats were uncomfortable and the noise cancellation was almost non-existent. With these Bose headphones, the surroundings are almost completely abolished :)

author: Amazon Customer
title: counterfeit/fake item from china
content: this was a poor excuse for the real bose headphones.  while they did a pretty good job of copying the original, you get what you pay for.  don't expect to find a significant discount from bose prices from any reputable reseller.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Perfection
content: My husband loves these Bose noise cancelling headphones. I bought them for him for our 41st Anniversary. They were the perfect gift.

author: Liz C.
title: ...comfy
content: These headphones are comfortable and the sound quality is amazing, the battery life is good but not as good as I had hoped for but they do charge fairly quickly.

author: Annie A.
title: sound quality
content: I opened these and immediately tested them out against my audio technica ath m50x's, which to my deep regret, found that their sound quality was beaten by the audio technica's and it was a clear winner by my perspective.

author: westielady
title: Very Comfortable Headphones!
content: I went to Best Buy and tried out various headphones and these were the best hands down! Extremely comfortable and fantastic noise cancellation. I was listening to music on You Tube last night and was in heaven! Buy these, you won’t be sorry. I did buy a nicer case through Amazon that I liked better for only $13.00.

author: Matthew Anderson
title: Total wizardry!
content:
These headphones are an amazing addition to my work day - once I put them on, all outside sound just disappears! (My first set of noise-cancelling headphones...)

Even mowing the lawn with these, I could actually hear my music and enjoy it, where other headphones were barely audible.

Very impressive. I don’t know how they do it, but I was amazed from day one... and even though they’re expensive, that peace and quiet is worth every penny.

author: Tt
title: Daddy blocked out mother daughter argument!
content: I purchased these for MY OH SO PATIENT AND HARD WORKING DADDY!! When i came to visit me and my mother had our scheduled argument,  i noticed my father was sitting quietly not even phased by our bickering...he looked up at me smiled and gave me the thumbs up ...lmao!!! 👍👍

author: James E. Fredrickson
title: Very good drowning out my riding lawnmower while mowing and listening ...
content: Very good drowning out my riding lawnmower while mowing and listening to music;  But unable to receive phone calls during this type of operation. The activity button is very hard to locate. The Boss App is very poor towards making any changes on headset. For the price I’m very disappointed with this product dude to the fact of not being able to receive phone calls, as explained above.

author: janel e young
title: Worth EVERY penny!  Seriously.
content:
Never did I ever think I would spend so much money on headphones. I also always previously though people looked goofy and/or pretentious with their enormous headphones. My earbuds are so sleek and convenient. Let me tell you, I was wrong.

Bought this to go on a weekend trip that required me to share a room with a large friend who snores terribly (but swears she doesn’t). Even on the plane, I knew I had made a great purchase but they blocked out the snoring probably 95%. What came through was very faint, almost like a very, very distant white noise machine (of what sound or why you’d want it, who knows). I am very sensitive to noise and a light sleeper in general so these headphones were just a remarkable experience when first turning them on.

I am not on the autism spectrum but, man, I can definitely see why individuals with certain sensitivities and degrees on that spectrum could benefit from wearing noise cancelling headphones. I feel like I’m on my own world where hardly anyone or anything can bug me. I rarely want to take them off when I get to work in the morning!

I now wear these every day on my 2.5 mi walking commute to work across DC. I listen to podcasts and the low noise cancelling feature is great for traffic bc it cancels out most of the blaring sirens, jake breaks and car horns but still allows you to hear them enough to be aware of your surroundings. You can also hear voices enough to tell if someone is talking to you or asking for directions. I just press pause to listen and then play to continue.

My only (very small) complaint is that unless you sleep on your back, they are not very comfortable to sleep with. I have pretty noisy upstairs and next door neighbors. Just a poorly constructed, small condo building with thin walls and objectively *awful* squeaky floorboards. The headphones cancel all that out but due to their bulkiness, it is uncomfortable to have them pressing against your ear/head when on your side or stomach. This is the only way I can sleep so I feel like I’m trading one thing for another in order to sleep well. Still, I’ll take this over that!

Thanks Bose!!!

author: Baldo
title: Happy plane and gym time
content: My wife loved these!! Great rose gold color ... not pink.  Obviously the sound and noise cancellation work amazing as this is a Bose product

author: Kim
title: Amazing!
content: Amazing! When you wear there on a plane it seems like the plane is not even on because of the noise cancellation!! This was a great gift for my fiancé (although I borrow them when I can for trips!).

author: Connell
title: Great headphones that are held back by software and battery life
content: Sound quality is good, as is comfort. Build quality is alright (too much plastic overall) but the biggest issue is with the actual software behind it. Constantly tries to connect to my laptop which is in sleep in my backpack across the room, repeats itself constantly to tell me its lost connection, "users macbook pro lost! users macbook pro lost!". I have experienced weird bugs where the audio becomes completely distorted and needs to be restarted at least once per day. Also recently shut off by itself with 60% battery left. Which leads me to the last issue, the battery. It needs to be recharged just about every single day and I have not gotten the 20 hour advertised charge lifecycle. Even 20 hours feels low for a product that cost $350.

author: Paula
title: simply great
content: just great

author: Tyler W.
title: If you're a student, these are a great buy
content: These headphones have been a lifesaver. While studying in public or at the library, their noise-cancelling function has been pretty great. While most reviews online suggest the Sony WH-1000XM3 for the best noise cancelling, I decided to go with Bose because of the comfort benefit over its competitors. Boy, am I happy about that. I typically get headaches when I have any headphones on for more than 20 minutes, but with the QuietComfort headphones I can leave these on for hours and not have an issue. Sound quality is fantastic. I've heard complaints from friends that the base doesn't perform as well as other headphones on the market, but I personally haven't had this issue. highly recommend

author: John R. Troy
title: Good Acoustics, but software/firmware not working well.
content:
At first, I was really excited for these headphones, as I heard Bose is the best and it was getting better reviews than the Sony.

The headphones fit the ears nice and snug, and the noise cancelling works wonders--a lot better than those $79.99 on-ear models.

However, the electronics don't seem to work well.  I can't get this to work with my Samsung Galaxy S8 Phone (Android Oreo update).  I've tried pairing several times and downloading new firmware, but it still won't connect.  Worse, the on-off switch appears to not work--it doesn't stay shut off!  It will turn on at random times and the battery gets drained.  The instructions didn't come in a booklet, you have to download the app.  Using it in corded mode seems to confuse the software.

I love the feel and the effects of the noise cancelling when it's on, but this just won't work.  I'll have to try once more this weekend and contact customer support but if that doesn't work, I'm going to return it.

author: iLoveShihTzus
title: Five Stars
content: Most comfortable headphones I've ever worn.

author: RQ
title: but they are much lighter and more comfortable over longer stretches (over 20-30 min)
content: Sound quality and noise cancellation is probably a half step lower than the Sony MDR-1000X, but they are much lighter and more comfortable over longer stretches (over 20-30 min). Perfect for traveling and airplanes.

author: Allen Titzer
title: Awesome sounds
content: My wife uses them to listen to her movies and music they are awesome the only way they could be better is they need a charger or a longer charging cord

author: Claudia R.
title: Great product
content: This was a gift for my son. He said they're awesome.

author: Dave Martz
title: Better everything than ever before
content: With better noise cancellation and all around sound quality these are worth the money. I’ve had other Bose headphones as well as Beats and these are BY FAR the best yet

author: Apotropaic Sphinx
title: Sound quality is great and the sound cancelling is magical
content:
I'm in the Air Force. I initially bought these just for long flights on TDY or deployment, but I use them all the time just walking around. Sound quality is great and the sound cancelling is magical.

The only issue is sometimes one ear will rumble if not fully charged. Also it can't really handle more than two devices at a time. Which I consider to be acceptable trade offs.

author: rudy kaldor
title: I only by Bose
content: You get what you pay for buy these.

author: Lord of Dorks
title: Be ready to have your socks clean knocked off
content: These headphones are worth every penny of their steep price tag. I have eyeballed the QuietComfort series for over 5 years and tried out less expensive ones from other brands, with meager success. Sometimes you have to get the real deal to get the full success. Well done Bose!

author: NY
title: Perfect product
content: I did a lot of research. This are definitely one of the best headphones. Perfect product!

author: Tyler
title: Best Headphone yet!
content: The battery life is insane! I use it daily now and it just works. :-)

author: Matthew D. Cowles
title: Comfortable enough to fall asleep wearing
content: There isn't much to say about these headphones that hasn't already been said in the 400-odd reviews that have already been posted. But they're so good that they deserve yet another five-star review. The sound reproduction is very good, the noise cancelling is amazing, the comfort is remarkable, and the wireless connectivity is excellent. I'm very sensitive to headphones that clamp tightly against the sides of your head. These headphones are comfortable enough to fall asleep wearing.

author: StanJez
title: Amazing
content: Amazing headset.  I loved this purchase.

author: Tofurious
title: Love love love
content: I love my headphones! Love! Totally worth every penny.  They look great, fit perfectly, are com for long periods of time, and are really great at noise canceling.  I have used it to connect to my fire tv, alexa, and my phone.  Love it!

author: Kaymazonian
title: Love them!!!
content: Excellent headphones. Bose has always been our go-to for quality sound. A little disappointed that the description said these were compatible with Alexa. They are not. I guess I’ll wrangle around with Google assistant.

author: Tara C.
title: Sounds good
content: bought for my husband and he loves them.

author: Marco
title: Five Stars
content: all around great quality! Super comfy on ears. Does tend to slide off easily so be careful.

author: William Wu
title: Great for travel and noisy study environments
content: I use this to study and it blocks out everything. Airplane rides are also more comfortable now

author: Sandra J. Buchinsky
title: Crystal clear reception!
content: The headset is very comfortable sound is excellent and performance probably the best in the market place!

author: Phil
title: Has 2.5mm audio port, not 3.5mm, audio cable has no microphone. Not worth it
content:
- This is contradicts to official spec on the web site. The cable included does not have microphone, so essentially wired use is just for listening not for talking.
- Can only connect to 2 devices max!
- The noise cancellation is average, not much better than others on the market.
- Phone call quality was very poor - my $35 ear buds do much better job with calls.
- Battery indication is inconsistent - first it says 100%, literally five minutes later it says 80%.
- Also when charging cable is plugged in Bluetooth turns off.

150 would be fair price for this. Not worth $350 at all. Planning to return it and try something else.

author: Zachary M Eldridge
title: Best headphones to own in 2019
content:
I am in love with these headphones!  I purchased a pair for myself and my wife and we have nothing but positive things to say about them.

These are comfortable to wear, have excellent battery life (20 hrs) and exhibit nothing less than phenomenal sound.  The noise cancellation is perfect for flights/drives/blocking out the world around you.

You dont simply listen to music with these headphones, you experience it.  Must have if you want to hear the music the way it was intended to be heard.

author: Amazonbyalex
title: Amazing sound and call quality. Google Assistant functionality is shaky. Battery life is OK.
content:
PROS: These are, by far, the best headphones I’ve ever owned. I previously owned Bose wired headphones and thoroughly enjoyed them for years. My music sounds amazing and calls come through clearly every time.

CONS: Quite expensive. Also, the Google Assistant functionality is a bit shaky as of now, but as the software progresses, I’m sure that will get better. Battery life is OK, but seemed to be better when I first bought the headphones.

author: Tiffany
title: Thumbs up
content: Can’t hear my kids it’s great

author: Virginia Booklover
title: Don't use if you're worried about someone sneaking up on you!!
content:
I purchased this to use at home as well as while commuting and travelling. At home, I've had to learn to leave one earcup off the ear - otherwise a family member can walk into the room behind me and prepare an entire meal without my even noticing. That's how well the noise reduction works in a quiet-ish environment.

I used an upcoming plane trip as the excuse to buy this, though I really wanted it for my daily commute on the subway.  It did the job nicely on the plane - the noise of the engines was reduced to a fairly dull roar, and I was able to enjoy my audiobook.

It makes a HUGE difference on the subway - before, I couldn't listen to a book or music without having to crank the volume of my earbuds to dangerous levels, and even then I missed words in almost every sentence. The noise reduction is sufficient that I can hear my audiobooks quite well without deafening myself.  I've played with the noise reduction levels to see how much it cuts out and it is substantial. I never want to commute again without these.

Why is it only 4 stars then? Well, I had hopes of using it with my Windows 7 computer, but it refused to pair. Googling it suggests this is a nearly-universal problem. I never did succeed in getting the two to talk. I now have a Windows 10 machine and it  is working much better. I did have one day where I had to reset the headset to get it to talk to both the laptop and my phone - not sure what the issue was, but basically it kept behaving as if I'd powered it off and on, then connecting VERY briefly to the phone.... then a minute later, repeating the cycle. The total reset seemed to solve that.

The sound quality seems fine. I don't listen to much music, and the times I do, I haven't noticed any issues with, say, the bass quality, so I didn't rate it for that  The battery life seems decent. It's heaver than an old-style headset, of course, but it's quite comfortable to wear for hours.

author: Digitally Enabled
title: Very Happy With My Choice 2019
content:
Read multiple reviews in my quest for wireless headphones.
Decided to put out the extra $ for the noise cancellation, around the ear headphones by Bose.
Very happy.
While I had not yet experienced noise cancellation, that Bose technology is simply outstanding.
Note, it does not cancel out all sound. It appears to focus on certain frequencies, such as road noise & air vents (the hi end freq). Pretty much anything that has a shhhhh or hissing sound....gone.
A jet flew over me on take-off (around 1,000 feet), and I could just barely hear it. Amazing.
As for me, the bass is deep, rich and smooth. Crisp and tight treble, with full rounded mids.
Wireless works flawlessly, and I can't say enough about the build and materials of the product. Well engineered!
Battery life is just as advertised. A coworker of mine uses these, not only for music, but also as a functional tool to eliminate undesired sound, such as jet engine noise while taking a flight, the road noise from public transportation, and to create near silence during sleep. This prompted me to Google "noise cancellation" to try an understand how it all works. Fascinating!

While it was at the top of my price point (actually well over it), I splurged on my personal audio enjoyment. The ear cups are super comfortable, almost like there is some sort of gel in them. I will agree with a few other reviews in regard to the inside of the ear cups getting a little warm with extended use. But not really a problem for me.
The battery does last longer if you connect the cord and drop the Bluetooth (for a direct connection) , plus it sounds a little better, although most people may not notice a difference. Conclusion: Full satisfaction from this user. The rich sound of this Bose is at stellar level. Enjoy.

author: Joel Carpenter
title: Wonderful sound
content: This product is amazing in sound quality and comfort.

author: israel n obrien
title: Song of Silence
content: These headphones are exactly what I hoped for! Muffled noises wonderfully.
