content: Very disappointed in the products volume level, because this is the most important feature of any headphones. You don"t need noise cancelling if the volume is "LOUD."

author: Jeffrey Wang
title: Top of the line for comfort
content:
I didn't buy these headphones through Amazon but I thought I would leave a review for these anyway.

When I was shopping for a quality pair of noise-cancelling headphones, it really came down to a few choices. Watching a lot of youtube reviews and reading a lot of online reviews, it narrowed down to choosing the Bose QC35 IIs and the Sony WH1000XM2. When it comes down to the best noise-cancelling and the best comfort, there were a lot of debates between the two. And, when choosing headphones, I think it's important to consider what you want in a pair of really expensive headphones.

For me, comfort was an absolute priority. A lot of headphones can give users wearer's fatigue and can become hot and uncomfortable after some time. When I'm using them to study or through plane rides, I wanted to make sure that whichever pair I bought would be the most comfortable.

In the end, I decided on Bose because of how light-weight they were. The Bose QC35 IIs are about 8.1oz (~230g) in weight and the Sony headphones are about 9.7oz (~275g). They might not seem like a huge difference, but that comparison is for you as a future consumer to make.

So far, wearing the QC35 IIs have given me the best wearing experience out of any of the headphones I've tried previously. I can go hours with them on without feeling much discomfort and because they are so light-weight, sometimes I forget that they're even on.

What's also great about these in particular is that these cover your entire ear. The plush for the L/R ears actually sits around your ears instead of sitting partly on your ears. When I tested the Sony headphones at Best Buy, the headphones sat partly on my ears and after ten minutes of testing them, I had the sense that they might become uncomfortable after some time. This was also one of the big reasons I chose to go with Bose instead Sony.

The active noise cancelling is one of the best on the market today and personal experience tells me that the ANC is amazing, but plenty of reviews have said that Sony either matches or beats Bose in the ANC department. Because I don't own a pair of the WH1000XM2, I can't really comment on which is better. The QC35 IIs, however, blocks out nearly all ambient noises and is a pleasure to use in noisy environments. Some have said that the ANC can give them headaches due to a cabin-like pressure attributed to the ANC. It took a day or so to adjust to the ANC and that "cabin-like pressure" and it doesn't bother me personally anymore, but so I would head to your local Best Buy or electronics store to test this for yourself. These headphones are a huge expenditure, so it's important to test whether or not this might apply to you.

Pros:
Incredibly lightweight and comfortable
Completely surrounds your ear instead of sitting partly on top of your ears
ANC is amazing that blocks out all ambient noises
20-hour battery life

Cons:
"Cabin-like pressure" that may cause headaches for some users
Sound quality may not be up to far for some audiophiles (some reviewers have noted that Sony has better sound quality)

TLDR:
If comfort is your top priority and you're not the biggest audiophile, I would absolutely recommend Bose.

author: Ann Grauer

author: Amazon Customer

PROs: Perfect-for-me levels of highs and lows. Noise cancellation is fantastic as long as you're not dealing with a high pitch. Easy sync with 2 devices, and easy to switch between diff ones. Buttons are great; I use the optional button to switch between level of noise cancellation which I love. I don't use Google Assistant or calling, so no opinion on that.

CONS: These are heavy. Not good for aerobics and can take some getting used to if you plan to wear them all day like me while you work.

I used them on a flight I took from Newark airport, to Dallas/Fort Worth, and once I sealed them around my ears, I couldn't even hear the jet engines. I felt their vibration, but heard nothing. And you can use them either wired, or blue tooth connected, AND you can answer, and talk on your cell through them. THE BEST headphones I have ever owned. They are pricey, and that would be the ONLY negative I could find about them, that's why I gave them 4 stars, instead of 5. But the BOSE brand can't be beat. I would just like them a little bit cheaper. EXCELLENT gift for the gadget weenie in your life......They will not be disappointed

author: Joseph Murphy
title: Failure out of box. Audio cuts out
content:
Received item on 10JAN2019

I've had nothing but positive experiences with Bose products over the past ten years or so. Unfortunately although the QC35 II has great noise canceling and cool features, the one thing it needed to do, which is play uninterrupted music, it failed at. Could not get through one song without 2-3 split second "cutouts". I reset the device, firmware was up-to-date, reconnected the device and found again that music playback was cutting out for a split second again. Tried a colleague's pair of QC32 II wireless headphones with my iPhone and did not experience the same issue.

Sounds like Bose has a batch of lemons. Might want to do more research than I did to see if Bose has resolved the issue. Returned the item same day I got it. Hopefully they'll get their act together and sort this issue out. I just don't have the patience for it.

author: KimVT
title: Alexa is NOT built in!
content:
I ordered the Bose QuietComfort 35 Series II with Alexa Control. It says it is built in... I thought that would mean that when I turn it on it would have Alexa on the headphones automatically. Alexa is not on the headphones.
  What I had to do...Download the Bose Connect App. on my phone. Then, Install the apps firmware. Sync my headphones to it. Then download the Alexa app onto my phone. Update it. Then sync my address book to Alexa app so I can make calls. It seems I need to have my phone with me and on every time I want to use Alexa....so it's not built in....You must download 2 separate apps on your phone in order to get this feature.
FYI- My first shipment of headphones I opened the Bose Connect App and all that appeared was the Google Assistant. So I called Amazon tech support who wanted to say it was defective. Well the second shipment arrived last night and so when I opened it up to find all the same issues I was greatly disappointed.
I also called Bose who gave me instructions that weren't quite right either. I believe, this issue is Amazon not Bose. There are no instructions on how to do all of this...we found a website- digitaltrends.com that gave a more complete set of instructions.
I want to be clear. My issue with the headphones is the Alexa feature. The noise cancellation is superb. I've used it today to listen to music and books- it is a wonderful listening experience. My 3 stars are more for the sound quality & lack of sound quality. And if Alexa was "built in" I'd give it 4 or maybe 5 stars.
  So Amazon you did not live up to my expectations for this purchase.

author: Kim Edgington

author: Anonymous Identity
title: Good Headphones
content:
They're great. It comes down to these or the Sony WH-1000xM3 (watch videos to compare the two)

Here is my analysis

Bose QC 35 II:

Pro's:

Good Sound quality
Good Noise canceling
Good aesthetical appeal
Decent Battery life
Comfortable****
Multi Point Bluetooth Pairing**

Cons:

-Sound Quality while amazing doesn't beat Sony's WH x1000M3
-Noise Cancellation is much better in Sony - first time ever but Sony did it
-Aesthetics better on Sony
-Battery life better on Sony
-Newer Bluetooth on Sony
-USB C Rapid charging technology for Sony
-Sony also gives you a much better carrying case with pockets for all the wires (this is a small thing but when you're paying close to $300 small things matter too)

With this review some may say why not buy the Sony's but the Sony's have their own set of issues: 1) You can not multi point connect with bluetooth. This is not the same thing as pairing. The Sony's can be paired with 8 devices and it will remember them so you do not have to configure it every time. However, if you're using your headphones with your laptop and you have a phone call coming in, you can't simply answer the phone call and expect to hear them and talk to them on your headphones. You will have to disconnect the bluetooth from the laptop and then activate the bluetooth on the phone - this may sound like a trivial thing but when you're working and you use your headphones all day this gets a bit annoying. 2) The Sony's get uncomfortable around your ears after a couple of hours and your ears feel sweaty and that doesn't happen with the Bose. 3) The Sony's have a touchpad on the right ear cup instead of buttons but when it's cold outside, the condensation creates a "phantom touch" therefore skipping your songs at time - so if you use your headphones outside and it gets cold in your area this is something to consider. 4) The voice quality via microphone (if you do a lot of phone calls) isn't the best for the Sony's.

Both are great but you need to evaluate your needs and wants and see what works for you - the price is similar for both. The Sony WH x1000M4 were supposed to come out at IFA this year in September but they did not and the new Bose Headphones do not really live up to their $400 cost or its predecessor the Bose QC 35 II. I hope this helped. There is unfortunately no real winner but you decide based off of this and watch videos and read other reviews as well

author: Javier

The Bluetooth is super quick to pair and hardly lags with video, if your seeking a perfect sync the wire is really easy to use. The noise cancellation works wonders especially if you are in a crowded place. I use these often on an active flightline and they do an excellent job.

author: WhenCatAm
title: the sound quality and noise dampening are very good and the battery also lasts quite well
content: The product feels heavy on the head, and though the band at the top is soft, it feels as if it's pressing down at the top. That said, the sound quality and noise dampening are very good and the battery also lasts quite well. The only way to control the noise reduction level is through the app. The set itself has a binary noise control option, not the intermediate level that the app allows. When using during phone calls, I am able to hear the other person talk very clearly, but the other person is unable to hear me talk, when I am in a noisy place. That would be another negative point.

author: Collin

author: BMS

After a recent 4.5 flight I was amazed at how much more energy I had getting off the plane than I usually do. Having the constant, loud whine of the plane really does wear your brain out.

These are also great for the office if you work in a cube environment or if you have an open floor plan where others' conversations get distracting. While these headphones are expensive they are certainly worth it and will probably cause your productivity at work to go up (just don't be rude and wear them all the time).

Sound listening quality is great - I love hearing my audible books on it while I work out and I am sure I will enjoy it when I travel overseas, but I doubt it will really block the plane noise like I hoped it would.  Buttons on the headset are ok, but I find myself feeling around a lot or taking them off to figure out where the button is.  This was a splurge for me, and I don't plan to return them, but I don't think I really needed them either.

author: Far
title: Awesome headphones....thank you Dr. Bose!
content:
To be completely open, I did NOT purchase the Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones from AMZ. one of the rare things. I originally received the Bose QC 35II  and later Sony 1000XM3 through a vine program to test and review. I tested both headphones and have used many other types of headphones, over the ear and inner ear.

I purchased another Bose QuietComfort QC 35II Wireless Bluetooth Headphone a couple of years later (long story). I am not an Audiophiles by any means but I like Music.! Recently, I read a "highly rated" review of the Sony 1000XM3, therefore I felt compelled to write a review of the Bose QuietComfort QC 35II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones.

I LOVE the overall comfort of the Bose QC 35II, literally all day comfort. I have worn these when using an elliptical, watching a movie while connected to a laptop, and listening to all kinds of music. Comfort is where the Sony 1000XM3 fell off for me, as did other over the ear headphones. The Sony headphones do sound good, ANC is subjective!

The build quality on the Bose is excellent, they don't feel cheap! The bass is not overbearing and heavy, however it does sound clean! Listening to the song "Purple Rain", I became immersed in the music...I could hear everything as it was meant. That has not happened with any other headphone or IEM. Sony ear-cups do not feel as solid and I don't think overall quality is the same.

I have tried the Sony 1000XM3, Plantronics FIT, Grado Labs SR-80, JBL, Apple OEM inner ear, Klipsch IEM, and a few other generic brands. The Bose QC 35II  remain my favorite for sound! The Plantronics are good for working out. The IEMs, such as Klipsch get full of ear-wax.

I have the headphones connected to the Echo, so I can push the speech button the headphone and ask Alexa to play a song. That is sweet!! There is also a multi-function button for Siri, which Bose does not advertise. Pairing to phone and laptop was a piece of cake, the headphones tell you which device it is connected to. The Bose App is basic but provides information on the headphones, firmware updates, and connection to Echo.

Sound is a personal thing, everyone experiences this differently. Therefore, headphones that work for me, may not work for you. I have used the following types of headphones:

Sony Sports Wired (going back to the 80's)
Panasonic (going back to the 80's)
Grado Labs - SR-80 Wired
Klipsch IEM Wired
Apple OEM wired
Plantronics FIT Bluetooth
Sony 1000XM3 BT
Bose QC2 BT

Sony is a conglomerate, multiple business units making different products. We all know that Sony is a legendary company!I Sony products are hit or miss. I  have been a little obsessed with Bose, not only the products but as a company. The Bose QC 35II are something that the company's founder - Dr. Amar Bose would have been proud of.  Bose as a company is an amazing story and the products that they produce are incredible. I am now thinking about their portable speaker offerings.

The only drawback that I can is the lack of an EQ in the app. However, many other manufacturers do not offer this.

author: FAiuJr
title: Love this product...
content: My wife loves this headphone. Can't beat the quality of the product.

author: David Petrario
title: Five Stars
content: They fit nice around your ears, light, comfortable and excellent sound

author: phil
title: Headphones
content: Great headphones

author: Bobby Briggs
title: I enjoy listening to my music anywhere and anytime without noise ...
content: Since buying my Bose headphones Q35, I enjoy listening to my music anywhere and anytime without noise interupting.

author: Peter
title: The solution to the open office plan paradigm
content:
Visibly signal to the people around you that you don't want to talk to him.
Actively cancel out people trying to talk to you.

Sneakily disable noise cancelling so you can listen in on people's conversations.
Winning.

author: rob
title: Recommend without reservation, with notes re tinnitus
content:
No brand comparison, only compared against $350.  I read a lot of these reviews, and also own and like other Bose gear.

Sound.  A recurring theme in these reviews is that the sound isn't bassy enough or rich enough or something.  Actually this was an encouragement to me, because I was just hoping for minimal color, and certainly no enhancement of bass (more on this below), just to hear what's there - in a wide range of styles of music.  I love the sound of these headphones, or lack of personality; the music sounds amazing, and as others have pointed out, you really do hear new detail in old music.  For example, the old hit Sultans of Swing sounded extraordinary; you know Mark Knopfler's lead would be gorgeous, but also a perfectly rendered P-bass and kick.  Similarly dipping back into early Police and enjoy amazing detail in the bass tone and bass/drums balance.  Too bassy in the EQ and you lose the insight into normal bass.  This also improves listening to classical and work music e.g. Tycho, Mercury Project, etc.

Comfort.  Very good. I fatigued after a couple of hours of wearing.  My not-small ear fits in the cup but seems to be very slightly touching some of the hard irregularly shaped structures inside.  I extended wear-time by making occasional headband adjustments.  The cushions and construction and button layout all seem fine.

Connectivity.  So far it works fine, pairing easily without some of the inexplicable Bluetooth wrestling matches I've had with gear over the years.  I've got it on an Android phone and a couple of Mac desktops.  I was listening to my work desktop and a call came in on the Android, and the "right thing happened".  I said to the caller "uh, can you hear me OK" and person said "uh, yeah fine".  I don't think this will replace my main conference headset.  But it works well enough so far.  The voice prompts are helpful.  I have not tried the included 3.5 <-> 2.5mm phone cable, but I'd expect it to work in the unlikely event (low battery) I'd want to wire up.  Range seems OK; I don't expect it to work if I wander far away from my desktop, and the mobile is in my pocket, so a non-issue there for me.  Note on the Mac: turn off the headphones as sound input (mic) if not needed; it changes the sound of the music output.

Noise cancellation.  Works really well - just what I wanted.  Having tinnitus, I was looking to lower the volume of my headphones to save what's left of my hearing and still have good listening.  Noise cancellation is a big help here.  In fact, the moment I put on the headphones with NC but no source, it was so quiet, I immediately went fuh, my tinnitus is loud!  Some of you will surely know what I'm talking about.  So, with NC you will notice yourself more, but it's still a matter of letting your mind's other focus put the ringing aside.  And try turning down the headphones, about equal to your ringing as a starting point.  I wish I had gotten these headphones a while ago!  And yes, the seemingly flat EQ is a great starting point for listeners with tinnitus, as boomy bass, even if it momentarily "drowns out" ringing, makes it worse over the course of a listening session, and of course over the long term.  Save what you have left.

Other stuff.  Comes with a nice case.  The battery life seems OK but very early days on that.  Noise cancellation mean you will probably not react to peripheral sound (e.g. spouse talking in next or even same room), and could possibly expose you to new risks such as missed alerts/alarms and people assuming incorrectly that you're aware of certain actions.  So use thoughtfully.

Complete recommendation, no deductions even considering high price.  5 stars.

author: silversmith
title: Bluetooth range limitations
content:
I use semi current Apple products, IPad Pro 10.9 & iPhone 8. I also have (for prior 2 years) the Samsung  Level (SL) (model EO-BN920) Bluetooth neck bracelet style ear buds.  Here are the differences.

1) Samsung Level (SL)  have a greater Bluetooth range
2) The SL is easier to answer the phone.  There are three buttons easily tactally identified to answer, volume up-down and pause.  Also the SL magnetic earbud sensing answers and hangers up / pauses content.  The Bose is hard to identify buttons especially when you install backwards.
3)The Bose negotiates BT connectivity to my devices better than SL. I am constantly reconnecting the SL  after I go out of range especially the iPhone.
4) The SL is better or more handy to wear. You can park the SL earbuds (magnetically connected)  so when the phone rings place them in your ears and your talking. The Bose are so large you are apt to place them down and are not as readily deployable.
5) The SL battery life is at least 1/3 longer than the Bose even on my 2 year olds SLs.
6) The Bose noise cancelling comes in handy when mowing or running noisy equipment. This is probably the most useful feature.
7) The SL cost 10x less.

Summary:
If I could only have one headset device I would chose the SL because it fits the majority of need. Nothing wrong with the Bose just my experience.  Hope that’s helpful.

author: Hulivili
title: Similar Sony headphones are much better
content: I bought these Bose headphones to my wife and similarly priced Sony wh1000xm3 to myself and the difference in sound / noise cancelling quality is like a night and day - Sony beats its Bose rivals in everything. Even the material quality of the Sony ones is feels much better and robust.

author: Happy In Hilo
title: Transformational!
content: I LOVE my new pair of Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones!  I purchased these in the Rose Gold color and appreciate that Bose offers a color apart from the usual black and silver.  I'm not up on all the features and intricacies of this technology, but what I can share is that there is a significant difference in what you're able to hear/not hear as soon as you put them on.  I put them on while the volume on my tv was in the 20-25 range and although the noise cancelling feature was on high, I was still able to clearly hear the speaking coming from the tv, just at a much lower volume--comparable to hearing a quiet conversation in the background and just enough to eliminate it as a distraction.  Once I started to play music, the sound from the tv was totally eliminated and I heard sounds, tones and acoustics I had never heard before--the clarity of the music and melody was much more apparent.  As I mentioned, transformational!  I can't wait to try them out on a long flight!

author: R. Thomas Bysshe
title: Best headphones - Comfortable, great sound and microphone, no connectivity issues, good battery life
content: Love these. Great background noise reduction (like on airplanes), but don't expect them to block out conversations around you.  Until I got these I used earbuds.  So my extreme pleasure with the comfort and sound quality may be related to the fact that they cover my whole ear and I'm just getting familiar with that experience. I use them most for phone calls I take on my iPhone. Everyone with whom I have spoken reports crystal clarity. And so far I have had no connectivity issues. Very pleased overall.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Comfortable and great sound quality. Disappointing range.
content: I have a pair of QC25s too. The QC35IIs have the same great comfort and sound quality ... as long as you stay close to the source. Using either my iPhone 8+, iPad (2018) or Gigabyte GB-BKI5HA-7200 computer; if I get more than 10ft away from the source, the sound breaks up. This is very disappointing as I was hoping I could walk around the room while enjoying my music or having a phone conversation. The manual states a 30ft maximum distance, but it's more like 10-12ft in my experience.

author: nasser
title: Amplified sound exaggerated
content: I did not like very loud amplification

author: Dan  Weatherford
title: Great
content: Ok

author: Jordan T
title: Google Assistant integration takes these over the top
content:
OVERALL OPINION:
These headphones are amazing!  I might have been perfectly satisfied with the first version of the QC35s, but I luckily stumbled on the second generation which includes the Google Assistant integration.  I initially thought it would be a small bonus, but I totally underestimated how powerful and convenient this could be.  It's more than just a trigger for voice commands.  It's a surprisingly flawless implementation that allows Google Assistant to turn you into much more productive multi-tasker.

GOOGLE ASSISTANT VOICE COMMANDS:
You start by connecting the headphones to your phone via the 'Bose Connect' app.  Now, all you have to do is press and hold the button on the left side and speak your voice command.  This is a lot easier and less tedious than having to precede every command with "OK Google", but this isn't even the best part of this integration.

GOOGLE ASSISTANT NOTIFICATIONS:
The best feature of the Google Assistant integration is the ability to receive voice notifications!  Whenever you receive a notification on your phone, it is automatically spoken to you on your headphones.  When text messages are received, not only can you have the message read to you with a single click of the left button, but you're also presented with an immediate opportunity to send a voice-to-text response by holding the left button while speaking.  This allows you to multitask like no other.  The Bose Connect app allows you to choose between temporarily pausing your audio during the notification (so you don't miss a second of that podcast you were listening to) or just reducing its volume while the notification is played.  You can double press the left button to shut Google Assistant up mid-notification if you ever wish to as well.  It's an excellent experience.

I tried smartwatches in the past, but they never seemed to deliver a convenience above and beyond what a phone could do on its own.  The hands-free and vision-free experience these headphones enable fills the void we all hoped smartwatches would.

CONNECTING TO TWO DEVICES:
Speaking of multitasking, these headphones can be connected to two devices at a time without the fumbling and confusion that comes along with other Bluetooth headphones offering similar functionality.  I’ve got mine connected to my Android phone and my Windows PC.  Start playing media from either device and it’s streamed right to your headphones.  To play from the opposite device, just pause the current media on the first device and then play the new media on the second device.  It’s that simple.  But to receive the notifications I mentioned, your current connection must be with your phone.

FIT, FORM, & FUNCTION:
Lastly, you might be wondering how these headphones perform as headphones.  The answer is great!  Check out all the reviews of the first generation for the details as I don’t think much has changed there.  They’re very comfortable, lightweight, and they don’t make your ears sweat or hurt over long periods of continual usage.  I explained the left button for interacting with Google Assistant in depth, but the media controls on the right are just as useful and intuitive.  Double-click the play/pause button to skip to the next track and triple-click it to go back a track.  The wireless range, the sound quality, and the battery life (20 hours) is all top notch for such a portable package.  I haven’t tested the mic quality during a call yet, but even if it’s not the greatest, this headset has already exceeded my expectations in so many ways - I couldn’t be happier with the design.

author: Christine M.
title: Wow!
content: The noise cancellation is out of this world.  I can’t hear a thing when wearing these (which on the flip side could be a bit worrisome in case you miss something going on around you).  Because of this I wouldn’t recommend wearing out in public.  They are incredibly comfy to wear as well!  I bought them to cancel out the occasional neighbor noise and it definitely does the trick.  Also enjoy listening to my music with them as well.

author: Ray Pitchford
title: I like them
content:
I bought two, these are the first noise canceling head phones i have ever purchased. we are very pleased how well they worked for our trip and now i will be flying with them back and forth to work.one charge has got me from alaska to dallas and back then a trip back up to work in the arctic. i will charege them before going home.
3 levels of noise canceling highest setting the best of course and played with the lower one only to put it back to the highest setting.
 The only issue if you want to call it that we experienced on both sets was upon landing in the plane we got some static sounds when we hit the ground. i dont believe that was an issue with the headphones themselves.
  we did not set up the Alexa crap when we set these up, honestly when i bought these i didnt read enough and didnt realize that was included in it.
 Setting them up was super simple even for me who is not very smart phone literate. just download the app and easy setup.

author: Ride725
title: Best Noise cancelling Bluetooth Headphones on the market!
content: Bought these for my dad. He had several other brands and these are the best ones he's ever used. The noise cancelling is amazing! Small travel case, great sound and battery life! AMAZING HEADPHONES! A MUST OWN for anyone who travels a lot.

author: John S. Baber
title: Oh my.... awesome !
content: I've always wanted a set of sound-cancelling headphones. I've been reading about them for years. OMG ! These blew me away ! And they do Bluetooth and phonecalls... Oh yes, I'd definitely recommend these to anyone.

author: Thomas F Woodard
title: Mostly excellent
content: Great headphones. Two minor complaints. On my head, they don't exert enough side pressure for a good seal, so noise leaks in. Also, they are sensitive to shock and will make a loud noise sometimes on a rough train track transition, for example.

author: Mark
title: Buyer beware: fake headphones being shipped
content:
I had the QC25 and decided to upgrade to the 35s. The product that was shipped to me was labeled as QC35 but the box it was shipped in had signs it had been tampered with. The headphones inside were not QC35s but a Chinese knockoff that didn't function. The biggest giveaway was that the charging cable was physically attached to one side of the headphones. It also didn't come with an owners manual or travel case. The Bluetooth didn't work either. I called Bose directly and they confirmed none of their headphones have a permanently mounted charging cable.

Figured I would let people know considering the item just went on sale and this happened to me last week 5/30/19

author: Claveman
title: A Quiet Peaceful World - At Last.
content:
Unbelievably happy with this product.  I cannot live without out my Bose QC 35 II's (even considering a second one to keep at work).  It is empowering to put these on and all the noise pollution just goes away.  I bought them for home and hadn't planned on taking them to my large open floor office.  I put them on and suddenly realized there was a very low and loud humm coming from the ceiling (air blowers I assume).  Now gone.  I sit there in my cubicle and feel sorry for everyone else because they don't have a pair of these.

I tried other brands, but they were simply not properly engineered.  Once you get the pairing "dialed in" it is seamless.  I have a Mac and iPhone but bought the new model (with Google voice button).  I use the button's alternate function of turning on/off noise cancellation -- just for fun to remind me how great this product works.  But remember.. this technology is not going to isolate voices - it is designed to remove motor noises (plane, furnace blower, road, engine, etc).

author: Henry D. Baust
title: These work great when I am mowing with my lawn tractor
content:
These work great when I am mowing with my lawn tractor.  I can just barely hear that the mower is running but the music sound great.
Originally bought the Sony noise canceling headphones but when it came in the unopened box, one of the ear pieces was already broken off. I returned them and bought the Bose.

author: Brother Gump
title: Great sound and background-noise cancellation
content:
To date, I have used these primarily for air travel.  For cancelling airplane/airport noise, they are simply amazing.  The sound quality is great as well.

For example, when I first got these headphones, I followed my habit of enabling my phone's equalizer to boost the high- and low-end frequencies, something I always did when I used ear buds to listen to music.  However, I was quite surprised to learn that no such equalization is needed for these Bose headphones - a flat equalizer curve produces the best sound, meaning that the speakers' response is incredibly uniform over the entire audio band.  This is no mean feat in such a small a pair of speakers.

The noise cancellation works so well that I don't have to turn up the volume in order to listen to music or to watch a video on my phone.  When I was still using earbuds, I had to have my phone's volume set to maximum in order to hear anything over the drone of the plane's engines.  I'm sure this couldn't have been good for my hearing.

I like them so much that I am ordering a pair for my wife for her birthday.  In addition, I am ordering an "A2DP" Bluetooth USB adapter for my desktop, so I can listen to music while working at my computer and yet "cut the cord" at the same time.

author: Craig Collins
title: Have had some Bluetooth issues but sound quality is excellent
content: The only issue with these headphones is the Bluetooth technology. I had Beats before these and while Bose just sounds better and has better noise cancellation, it is behind as far as Bluetooth goes. Wish they could combine the two into one headphone!

author: Nate
title: Fantastic!
content:
I LOVE THESE HEADPHONES!
I bought these and the equivalent Sony, and I liked these better. The sound quality is crystal clear. The Sonys were more bass heavy, which sounded a bit more processed. These sound like you’re listening to live instruments. Amazing.

author: Lirp
title: Great noise cancel
content: Way expensive

author: NKB
title: ... people who want the noise cancellation feature (which is great when you listen to music) to be ON during ...
content: Contrary to many people who want the noise cancellation feature (which is great when you listen to music) to be ON during phone conversations I absolutely dislike it in the recent firmware updates. It is disturbing not to be able to hear your own voice in a natural way and it's disturbing to others around because one tends to speak more loudly in such situations. Perhaps you can allow users to chose this via the software interface?

author: Amazon Customer
title: It keeps disconnecting on it's own even when it's fully charged. I just got this on Sunday
content: Dislike

author: fiveminutesmoreo
title: Very good sound
content: Very good sound quality and I am pleased with the comfort, but only four stars for three reasons: no charging adapter included - seriously at this price point? The "customizable" button can only be assigned to a few things. The last reason is the charging seems slow and then the power drops down to 70 percent very soon after you start using it. It is too soon to tell if it has a defective battery.

author: hockeyANDfootball
title: Bluetooth Connectivity is Awful
content:
Do NOT buy these. The headphones are an embarrassment at $300. I've used various $50 headphones that have 100 times the reliability of these Bose headphones when it comes to keeping a bluetooth connection. I initially bought both these and the Sony XM3s with the intention of comparing sound/fit/noise cancelling/etc. I haven't even tried out the XM3s yet (I'll update this after I do), but regardless, I will be returning the QC 35 II no matter what.

Here's how my hour of usage has gone. Opens box, connects headphones to phone in 30 seconds. Good start. Noise cancelling is great. Sound is good, but not too much better than some cheaper pairs of headphones I have. Then I proceed to walk 10 feet away from my phone and the connectivity starts to cut out. At 15 feet it disconnects completely. WTF is this? So I unpair headphones and restart everything. Maybe it was a fluke. Nope...the range on my pair of headphones is literally 10 feet. Pretty unbelievable.

I routinely use 3 other bluetooth devices with my phone and I've never experienced connectivity issues.

author: L.L.L.
title: Only one small complaint.
content: These are great and I always trust Bose, I have had several.  And the comfort factor is my biggest love.  My only complaint, probably silly to most, is for the big price tag I cannot understand why Bose cannot pair a pink headphone with a matching case with either white or pink cords, and same with the silver.  For the luxury factor it seems awfully cheap of Bose...

author: Nick
title: Excellent headphones. Audiophiles might want more but for me ...
content: Excellent headphones. Audiophiles might want more but for me - a medical student who likes to study in random places - it's perfect.

author: Schopenhawer D'Art
title: You cant walk too far from the playing gadget.
content: This is awfully good besides sometimes while my phone is in my pocket the Bluetooth keep cutting.

author: Marcos
title: Honest simple review.
content: I have loved Bose since my older brother bought them when I was young. As I got older I used many over the counter low end headphones. Thought the music was good. Then I bought my first Bose over ear headphones, and loved them. Then 4 years later they stopped working. Saw these and bought them. I was even more impressed. I often use them to fall asleep while my girlfriend watches tv. Or when I workout. They provide clear audio, and block out most background noise. I tried Beats and just did not enjoy them as much.

author: fencebuilder
title: Bose never disappoints
content: I wish it could switch from one Bluetooth source to another more easily...but the sound quality is off the chain....noise canceling is pretty darn good too

author: Boba Fret
title: Light, comfortable, and sound great
content: I've owned a LOT of headphones and try out headphones fairly often. I love AKG headphones for the sound quality but after a while they can physically start to wear on my ears. These are super comfortable and sound great. The noise cancelling is really nice. I tried the competing Sony pair and they just aren't comfortable at all for me.

author: robert clark
title: Music cuts out for half a second pretty often.
content: While playing music via bluetooth, I get half second gaps in the music. My previous headphones would do this to signify a message was received. I have stopped checking for messages because this does this all the time and there isn't a message. I have missed messages because I ignore this now. Besides that, my only complaint is that you cant have good sounding music with the noise cancelling turned off. It will play, but it sounds like crap. I will say that these are extremely comfortable and have no problem wearing them for many hours. Noise cancelling works really well on the vacuum cleaners at work. On some of the vacuums, all you can hear is the air.

author: Andrew Kunkel
title: Sounds fine when it is not stuttering which is almost always
content: They sound good and do a fine job of giving me a quiet place to work but do not try to connect them to Windows 10 and an Android phone at the same time.  When this is connected to both devices at the same time audio starts to stutter uncontrollably after a few minutes.  With each firmware update I hope it will be fixed but so far it has not.  I have several other Bluetooth headphones that work flawlessly connected to both devices.  You can see support questions about this all over the place and Bose has no solution except to blame one or both of the devices or just a canned response about how to delete and re-pair you devices.

author: Ryan Berger
title: Buyer Beware!!!!
content: I just purchased and received a pair of these headphones on Amazon.  What’s in the box you ask?  An auxiliary cable, a charging cable, and headphones.  What’s missing from the box?  An adapter to plug the headphones in and charge them.  So for $349, you get a nice shiny paperweight.  Thanks Bose!

author: Ryan
title: Range is the only downfall
content: Bass seems to fade after continued use. Noise is cancellation is pretty good. The range is not so good, I don’t even go 15-20ft and the sounds starts to cut out

author: Ronnie
title: Excellent headset for canceling out noises .
content: I receive my package before the delivery date and the package was and great condition . Since using the bose headset i have nothing but good praise for this item . I recently flew on a plane for 13 hours and used the bose headset watching the airlines movies and the sound and the  was excellent. The headset canceled out all of the noise in the cabin . The sound of the engines i could not hear when i had my bose headset on . I fell asleep with them on for 3 hours and did not hear any sound while sleep . i am using the bose headset to watch the game of thrones series and the sounds and noises are so clear and the bass and sound while using the headset is excellent .

author: Nathalie
title: I don’t travel without them!
content: I travel with them on an airplane and they work great!  Not disappointed with my purchase at all.

author: Joel S.
title: Fantastic sound quality!
content: Received as a gift from my wife so that I can listen to music or watch a movie on iPad when she is watching the tv. Fantastic sound quality. Almost a surround sound experience in a theater.

author: SeaGoat
title: Headphones
content: Was bought as a gift - and gotten great feedback. Never did get the protection plan I paid for, and having to figure out how to do the syncing without any instructions has been a challenge, but the recipient absolutely loves them.

author: Tommy Daniels
title: Still the best noise canceling headphones
content: Solid headphones. Might be overpriced based on the name but still the best value for your money.

author: Thorry - Mn
title: These  headphones with noise cancelling are the only way to fly.
content: Replaced old Bose headphones with these and I am not disappointed. Bose still has the world class sound.

author: Tracy K.
title: Expensive but worth it..
content:
Amazing product.
10/10 would recommend to anyone

author: R. L.
title: Great product
content: These work exactly as described! Excellent sound and noise cancellation!  My wife loves them!!!

author: Shawn Connell
title: These are the best pair of headphones I've ever bought
content:
These are the best pair of headphones I've ever bought. Noise cancelling is excellent. When I took them off the first time,  I was surprised by the loudness of all the ambient noise around me that I normally didn't notice. Sound quality is great.

One downside is a slight feeling of positive pressure in my ears like they're getting close to popping. It's easy to get used to though.

author: Jedimomof3
title: GREAT Headphones
content: Love the look, feel, and particularly amazing sound quality and noise cancellation of these headphones!

author: Dylon Eckerson
title: Could not recommend a product more
content: I bought these to help prevent permanent hearing loss because I use headphones all day long at work. The noise cancelling on these are unparalleled. I liked these so much that I bought a second pair!! I cannot recommend these more, trust me, it is worth the $350.

author: Anonymous
title: The best!
content: These noise cancelling headphones are so great - they have multiple settings for noise cancelation, they are so comfortable, they are wireless (also comes with wire). So so so great!! Bose always delivers!

author: Alex
title: Bought it for the comfort
content: I know by now the Sony's and Microsoft ANC headphones are out and the Sony's have better reviews. But I bought these because my family lives on the other side of the world and I plan to wear these the entire flight. 16 hours there and 13.5 hours back. The only time I took them off was when the plane landed. I'll need to make this trip once a year, so for this first year, it was worth it.

author: Charles Caldwell
title: Fantastic Noise Reduction
content: I have tried these and the Sony version. The noise reduction is better with the Bose.  The sound is slightly better on the Sony version.  The difference to me is the durability and battery life of the Bose.  I would highly recommend these headphones especially in crowded situations like airplane, airports, and crowds.

author: Larry Krantz
title: The moment I put these on ....they were great for me.
content:
My second Bose Headphones and the moment I put these on...they were great for me.  I read the reviews before I purchase on Amazon and then go with my heart.  Yes there were negative reviews but I went past those and found the positive ones.  So again I made a good choice.  Thank you Amazon for a great place to shop.

I wear headphones in my work and the comfort here and sound quality is excellent.  I have to wear a different headset for work.  Not as good.

I am use to the bose sound as I use SoundSticks at my computer.  Yes for me this sound is one I like and have enjoyed for years now.  Your taste in how you listen to music may be different from mine....Thats ok but you should try Bose before you make a decision.

author: Johnny
title: Sound Quality Not Up to Bose Standards
content: I purchased these a few days ago and was excited for them when they arrived.  Out of the box, looks were great and comfort level was off the charts.  I downloaded the app and sync between my phone and headset was not complicated at all.  But that was really all the app had to offer...lol  Noise cancelling was good...but what I had noticed was that i had to pump up the volume to about 70% in order to enjoy my music comfortably. Turns out it wasn't just me...there were frequent complaints about this.  Bose didn't really offer much of a solution on their message boards except to  reset the headphones.  I guess I could deal with putting the volume at 70%...no big deal.  After a few hours of listening to music...I guess after my excitement wore off, I noticed that the sound quality wasn't all that.  It was very flat sounding and there was no work around to change any settings. Definitely not how it sounded when I tried on a set at Best Buy. After contemplating for a few days...I decided to return them.  I was bummed as I really wanted a good pair of ANC headphones and I expected a lot more for $350.  I did some research and found out about the Sony wh-1000xm3 as a good alternative.  Tried those at the store too...just as good and if not better. Lets just say the Sony's where hot out of the wrapper and I am going to keep them.

author: Shankar Rathnam
title: Five Stars
content:
i dont understand how anyone can rate this product under 4. sound quality is best, set up was a breeze (download the app on your phone). i compared the sound on several pricey bluetooth headsets and this was a winner. yes, if you answer a phone call the ambient noise is audible and can be distracting, but big deal, get used to it. or dont use it to answer phone calls. I read several negative reviews for this product because of this reason, if you are looking for a phone headset get one that is meant to be. do not trash a perfectly great product which is to listen to music etc etc. i fly a lot and noise cancellation is very important to me. this head set is awesome on the plane. cuts off everything.
battery life is great too.

AWESOME PRODUCT EVER

author: Jan Z.
title: Plane travelers need these!
content: These are terrific for long flights!  Wish I had bought them years ago!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent
content: Perfect for my workout

author: Laura Musselman
title: Life-saving airplane headphones
content: These headphones are a life-saver on flights, especially long transcontinental flights.  The battery life is incredible and the headphones are comfortable enough to sleep in.  The noise-cancelling feature works very well; it really blocks out background sounds, although voices (like pilot announcements) still make it through.  For better noise-cancelling, I recommend having music playing in the headphones as well.

author: Bryan
title: Worth the money
content: All around great headphones I use them for long hours and they don’t get uncomfortable. The sound canceling is great I can turn it on and not hear my girlfriend if she is being annoying or going on a rant about something that is not even important

author: Giovanni Stefanoni Merlo
title: Bose has gone downhill
content: Audio quality is great. Such a shame that firmware update 4.5.2 has ruined Noise Cancelation completely. Look it up, everyone's run into this problem. Do not purchase these headphone. Go for Sony's alternative and save yourself the trouble of dealing with the always terrible Bose support team.

author: Frank Sr.
title: Great headphones glad I spent the money.
content: Very Nice.  Everything about these headphones is great. Used the blue tooth connect with my ipod which works great. No outside noise.

author: Cam
title: Amazing headphones and really a value (believe it or not) compared to another brand.
content:
I was not sure what direction I wanted to go with travel headphones so I tried a couple of different ones. I tried these Bose QuietComfort 35 II, the QuietComfort 20 in ear, and the Sennheiser HD1. The in-ear are not for me just because of the shape and size of my ears. :( I liked them and for what they were the noise cancellation was pretty good. With the HD1 and the QC 35 the biggest difference is price. I would say the HD1 was a bit louder and I could hear some "cooler" things that I couldn't hear with any other headset, but the biggest problem with it was there was an obvious defect in the unit I received. I sent them back. But to the point of this review.

The QuietComfort 35 are scary good. The sound quality is amazing. Even the bass was great given that Bose doesn't have the biggest reputation for bass in their headphones. The noise cancellation is especially scary. It is amazing the technology that is able to allow for so much around a person to be blocked. I absolutely love it when flying. A little darkness, shut eye and I am totally zoned out. I feel like I am in an Epsom salt spa with complete silence other than the music I am listening to. They are truly unbelievable and I would recommend them even without the Google Assistant integration. To that point, Google Assistant works very well. I have a Pixel 2 phone so it works especially well with the Bose headphones. I can text, listen to texts, and ask all sorts of questions. The greatest part is I can talk in a normal voice and hear myself fine through the headphones to ensure that I indeed do NOT start yelling because of the noise cancellation. Bose thinks of nearly everything. great headphones!

author: Laura
title: Impressed
content:
Had these for a little over a year now with frequent use. Excellent noise cancelling in office and airplane. Great sound quality. Definitely worth the money (beats are around the same price-point, but no where near as nice as
bose)

author: ZoidbergMD
title: Worth every dollar!
content: I have owned these for one year now and I can say it is one of the best purchases I have ever made. I have no idea how I used to travel on airplanes without these. I love the noise cancellation, on top of the excellent sound quality, durable construction, and battery life. These are certainly not cheap but they are worth the money and in this day and age I feel like it is rare to get something worth the money, but you really do get what you pay for with these.

author: Theodore Lee
title: Fantastic headphones! I am very sensitive to noise so ...
content: Fantastic headphones!  I am very sensitive to noise so the noise cancellation is my primary need.  I don't have much to compare to since these are my first ones, but they really do a great job of blocking out noise so I can concentrate.  They do get a bit warm and they are not the most comfortable, but I don't think there's a way around that.  I would definitely buy again!

author: Mr. L. O. Branyan
title: Very comfortable
content: Very well made product which you would expect for the price!! Comfortable to wear and comes with a cable to connect devices that don't use blue tooth. Works well with Amazon Kindle for Audible books. Happy customer.

author: Matthew o.
title: Buy anything else for this price!
content:
I never write reviews but I'm pissed!!!

I am a long customer of Bose. I've spent a lot of money with them and these are by far the most disappointing product I have ever received from them. The bluetooth cuts out constantly, like all the time. The music streaming is super low quality. For 350 bucks, not supporting a high quality bluetooth codec like AptX is ridiculous. Why buy them at all if they sound terrible? aside from the sound, the noise cancelling is good but puts a large amount of pressure on your ears, the high setting is pretty noticeable.

did you know you cant use these without an app? you have to, and its a terrible app. Sometimes it never loaded at all. the google assistant never really worked either. it just tells you if you have notifications but it never let me complete setup and I never received full functionality.

For 350 plus tax, Its not even remotely worth it... I bought the new nuraphones instead, you should check those out for 20 bucks more, they are incredible. Don't waste your money on these headphones....this is not like Bose, they are usually great products, but not this time.

author: Jess
title: Five Stars
content: Ohhhh very good headphones. Highly highly recommended

author: Cointelbro
title: Is a nightmare to keep paired
content: I've owned about a dozen bluetooth audio devices over the past 5 years, and this is my first problem. I have two iOS and one MacOS device, all less than two years old. It's impossible to keep these connected. They frequently drop connections, and are not recognized by my devices (about half the time) when I try to reconnect them. Save yourself the trouble and buy the other brand.

author: Jonathan A Rae
title: Worth Every Peny
content: This item shipped very fast. I ordered this on a Sunday and it arrived two days later. The bass is solid and the highs are sweet. The headset is very light and it charges fast. You can have it connected to both your phone and your computer at the same time. The noise cancellation is incredible. I have some really noisy coworkers at the office. When I put these on i can work in peace. I've never had a quality headset like this before.

author: Leticia Arvizu
title: Outstanding Quality & Sound
content: Love my Bose !  They are comfortable, convenient and the sound is superb !  All other sounds are completely blocked out, it's incredible. The Wireless feature is great, and you also have the option of using it with the wire as well. I highly recommend for watching movies and listening to music !!  Great product !

author: jamie wankier
title: Noise cancellation is the best on the market
content: These headphones are easily the best pair I’ve ever owned. To say they are the best on the market is a stretch, but if you are a regular consumer who isn’t interested in the highest quality of sound than these are for you. Compared to Sony and Beats the noise cancellation is superb. The battery life last me about 4 days in between charges (about 4 hours of usage per day). They are also extremely durable and do not feel the slightest bit flimsy when handling.

author: mkr
title: Comfort, awesome noise cancellation & some more comfort
content:
This is undoubtedly one of the most comfortable over ear headphones. The noise cancellation is top of the line, although Sony XM2 is quite there too. I have used both, but keep coming back to this every time I have to stream a movie, you tube videos or use at work for extended periods of time. I know this is no audiophile equipment, and it is not quite comparable to the Sony XM2 in sound, but the overall usage experience is very satisfying. Bose is still the gold standard in noise cancellation and comfort.
In terms of cons,  the app needs to catch up and introduce some new features. The addition of different noise cancellation levels is good but not enough. The Google assistant integration feels gimmicky, and I rarely use it. But I do appreciate Bose support releasing regular software updates to improve the overall experience.

author: Lanena
title: Bose the only one
content: I love the quality of these Bose they are the best.

author: Neto Pinho
title: Excellent
content: Excellent

author: S $ M
title: Very disapointed with the range performance
content: I've used bluetooth headphones for the last 15 years and they all head more then advertised range, these have less then advertised and basically they are only good for close proximity, like sitting in the plane and watching your movie. Very disappointed at this price range. They have been returned as fast as I got them. They wasted my time. Thank you Bose.

author: Sandra  Gogal
title: Five Stars
content: These headphones are great but they didn't work withbour TV so sent them back for that reason only.

author: Tim Vinson
title: Cuts in and out
content: I like the sound quality, but it constantly cuts in and out. Very difficult to enjoy music. And there doesn't seem to be any kind of a fix. Not worth the big bucks.

author: Joshie
title: Best in its range wireless ANC headphones to date. Sony XM2 a close 2nd
content: Very comfortable and to me I prefer the sound quality on this better than the Sony XM2. Sony is more balanced on all fronts and has more app features and handy tricks. However I don't think I regret choosing this after testing the Sony.

author: Jtel87
title: It's a Bose
content:
It's a Bose with Bose quality for common people like that doesn't have time to try out other competitor brands. I'm sure there other brand that offer better sound quality and possibly cancellation.
The only problem I see with Bose is the price point

author: miguel vergara martinez
title: Simplemente geniales
content: Rápida conexión a múltiples dispositivos (tengo 3 configurados, se pueden usar 2 a la vez). Aplicación muy útil. Botones de fácil acceso

author: Silent Jay
title: Life Changer For Coping With Big City Noise
content:
I've had these for a few days and they are a lifesaver.  I live in New York City and work from home near a busy road.  There is noise all around me - heating, refrigerator fan, light fixtures, traffic, incessant honking and sirens, neighbors playing music loudly.  After the first time I tried them and turned them off, I thought, wow why is my room so loud all of a sudden, what is that?  It turns out it was just the everyday noise I've been surrounded by.  That's how incredibly silent my world becomes when I put these on.

Granted, like other reviewers have mentioned, the world won't actually become completely silent, but it'll get as close as you can to it.  For me, as someone who has a case of misophonia, these do such a great job that I can focus on my work so much better.  They make a world of difference.  Sometimes I just leave them on without music.

Bonus points for the Bluetooth connectivity and the mic.  I now take all my work phone calls on this.  I have connections to my work laptop, my work cell phone, and my personal cell phone.  I can stream music to it, pause, take a call, and resume my music.  I've been told the receiving end hears me very clearly.

Yes, $350 is a lot of money.  I originally had no intention to get these; i wasn't considering them at all.  I was looking at the QC 25s (wired).  But after spending time reading reviews and making the decision that this was something necessary because the noise was impacting my concentration on work, I pulled the trigger.  Going wireless is sooo much better than being chained down to my phone or computer.

Definitely a worthy investment if you experience similar conditions as me or simply enjoy silence!

author: Clevor
title: Pretty much had it with the cheaply made Bose
content:
If you think this headphone is superior to the Sony WH-1000xm2, you must be deaf, dumb, and blind. Tried both back-to-back and the Bose seems like a flimsy toy, with half a dozen screws visible. The Sony is beefier, with plusher ear cushions, and just more classy looking as no bolts or screws are visible. The headphone cable is twice as thick as the thin, cheap-looking cable that comes with the Bose. Even the marketing of the Sony product is superior, with a thicker cardboard box and nicer advertising graphics.
The Sony isn't as comfortable because it fits tighter than the Bose, with massive earcup cushions compared to the Bose. The Sony headphone is larger and feels more solid but can fold up about as compact as the Bose due to one headphone being able to swivel. I found the Bluetooth was quicker and more consistent in hooking up with my laptop. The Sony is quite irresistible due to it's high-tech features and quality build.
In regards to the noise cancellation, they are close but the Sony has a slight edge. What I really like about the Sony is being able to undo the noise cancellation by placing your hand over the right headphone.
What it is comes down to is musical preference. The Sony is detailed and neutral to the point of being clinical whereas the Bose has it's signature warmish sound. The Sony is more accurate while the Bose is using some sort of equalizer to alter the sound, similar to the Maxx Audio Pro software in Dell laptops. Well, I guess it has the 'Bose' sound.
I might add that all the Bose QC headphones I've owned crapped out within 3-5 years, so I kept buying new ones at a 50% discount from Bose. My last pair died on me on an airline trip to Japan, so I had no headphones on the 7 hour trip to Japan and the 8 hour trip back  - I WAS NOT A HAPPY CAMPER! That is why I tried the Sony and quit Bose. Both are the same price.

Note: As a frame of reference, I am an audiophile and the headphones I own are: Sennheiser PCX250, Audio Technica ATH-ANC7 (both are noise cancellation), AKG K701, Beyerdynamic T1, and the headphones I use on my 300B tube amp are $4,000 Focal Utopias.

author: Bob
title: noise reduction better than expected
content: These have been used next to a railroad and on a 10 hour flight. I had no difficulty understanding the course I was listening to. I have significantly impaired hearing.

author: David
title: Bose made me a believe w this Bluetooth headset!
content:
Omg. Used to think boss were overpriced, but these are awesome. The sound is great, but the killer feature is how easily this connects w my iPhone over Bluetooth via the Bose connect app! It just works! Normally Bluetooth stuff sucks - but not this!
Add great sound, super comfort (my glasses don’t pinch after hours of use!) and a super battery - I’m a convert!

Ironically the noise cancellation which is good, is even what I’m most pumped about with this! The end to end quality is superb!

author: Hadrien Dykiel
title: Nice headphones with too many quirks
content:
These headphones are certainly nice, but have too many quirky issues for their high price point:

Issue #1 - noice cancelling crackles during airplane takeoff. Given Bose sells aviation headsets, this is something they should have figured out how to do but for reason the roar of the airplane engines is too high for the headphones noise cancellation system to handle.

Issue #2 - audio will cut out out of the blue when connected to multiple devices. For example, if you are connected to your computer's bluetooth for a very important Zoom or Webex meeting and you forgot to turn off your phone's bluetooth, you will lose your computer audio at some point during the call, quite unexpectedly. You will then be left to fumble your phone to try and disconnect the phone bluetooth connection and get your computer audio working again, all while the other people on the line are wondering why you're no longer responding.

Issue #3 - After about 6 months of using these headphones, the right side no longer plays any sound while connected to computer audio. Thankfully, this is something Bose support offered to fix at no charge, however they seem to be unable to send me the return shipping label so I do not know if this will get resolved or not.

To recap, these headphones emit high quality Bose-like sound but I cannot recommend them because of various usability issues which appear to have been overlooked when designing these.

author: S. Buehler
title: Noise Cancelling Could Be Better
content: I really expected better sound cancelling for this brand, it cancels maybe 90%  Being on long haul flights noise levels are still noticeable especially with people talking in the row behind or a child crying.  Not as impressed as I had hoped to be at this price point.  I do love the Bluetooth connectivity to my Apple products.  Watching downloaded content is much nicer without a cable and the battery life long lasting as well.

author: David D
title: Buy the best and they will impress and last!
content: I read reviews and looked up specs on lots of brands of headphones.  All kept coming back to comparing to these.  I work in a very noisy open office environment and needed isolation.  I have used them daily now for over 8 months, with my phone connected on my favorite radio station at very low volume, and would never settle for less.  The radio in my car is now at lower volume, my TV is turned down more, as it had really helped with nerve deafness by exposure.

author: cynthia b. alvord
title: Great
content: Great

author: LR Johnson
title: Good but no longer the Best!!
content: The QC 35 II have good noise cancellation and are extremely comfortable, but with the typical Bose sound. I feel like the Sony WH-1000MX3's have comparable sound quality with better noise cancellation, and were overall the better buy.

author: FBL322
title: Wonderful!
content: They’re fabulous. I also have beats wireless, which are very nice, but the noise canceling feature on these win out. Great sound even with a perforated eardrum!

author: GPN Fan
title: The sounds of Bose
content:
I purchased these headphones to replace an older Bose set. The others worked fine, but I wanted the updated features.  I have Bose in the car, in the den, the bedroom, in the office. Everywhere is Bose in my house.
I fly weekly for a total of 4 flights a week. A sturdy and good sounding set of head phones is essential. The case is great protection.
The sound is balanced with the clear sound I expected. They are not heavy and stay on my ears without being weighted down. I also use them in the office when the team gets too loud. You can still know when someone speaks to you if music is not playing. But I don’t have to have music blaring in my ears to drown them out either.
I have the silver grey ones and they look great.
Yes a little expensive. But you definitely get what you pay for.  I have zero regrets in this purchase!

author: Jbebe
title: Worth every penny
content: Really Good Headphones. I use them on my commute to work on the train and bus and they are great. It cancels most of the noise on the outside and you don't need to blow your ears with low music, you can still listen at a medium volume with good sound quality. They are pretty sturdy, I won't suggest you throw them under the bus and hope nothing happens but seem very durable. i have not use the google assistant yet but it seems like a nice little feature.

author: Terry A.
title: These are awesome. I had neighbors driving me crazy with renovation ...
content: These are awesome. I had neighbors driving me crazy with renovation work. I put them on and all the noise went away. I didn't have to blow it my eardrums to drown out the outside world. I absolutely love them.

author: EZ Rider
title: Great
content: Great headphones and noise cancelling.

author: Mehmet
title: Great for a noisy office!
content:
I've bought those headphones to use it while working in a very noisy open office environment. Here are my comments:
+ Noise cancelling works great while in the office. Especially if you are also listening to music, you don't hear anything from outside.
+ Sound quality is enough for me. If you are looking for great bass or depth in sound, you may want to look at other options.
+ Easy to connect with laptop and phone.
+ Comes with a hard-case, which is a life-saver in a busy hand bag.
- It makes your ear sweat after 30-40 minutes. You have to give 10 mins break after each 30 mins.
- Especially during first few weeks, it causes pressure on top of your head. Despite I'm sensitive on this topic, I don't feel it anymore after ca. 1 month in use.
- You feel the quality of the material, but it also feels so fragile. I'm afraid of breaking it during folding. Still nothing happened yet.

author: Connie Breedlove
title: Must have!
content: Great for screaming children on flights.  ; )

author: Lucas
title: Great headphones
content: These headphones are fantastic! the only critique I had with them is when I am flying and I have the noise cancellation up all the way, it is hard for my ears to pop. I have to lower the cancellation or pull them off my ears to let my ears pop.

author: Rocco F. Scanniello
title: Bose at it’s best
content: Bose at it’s best. It,s exceptionally quiet. I didn’t even hear a baby crying in the next row and enjoyed my movie

author: Christopher W Sims
title: Bluetooth weakness
content: This headset had a wonderful sound, it was incredibly comfortable, but I ended up having to return it as it had problems using it's Bluetooth in conjunction with stereo audio. I ended up replacing it with an Arctis SteelSeries Wireless Pro set. I had to do this because while I sounded great on conference calls and could listen to music and mix that audio, the moment I tried to play any sort of game that used the default audio or still have a chat client running would trigger the bluetooth recording/mic and cause sound distortions. I needed a headset for all size, this one is more one size fits most.

author: Higgins
title: Good but for price expected better
content:
Overall like these headphones. However, I use them just as much for simple noise cancellation as I do for playing music. Overall they are SUPER comfortable and battery life is decent. I also like the ability to share music with others who have nose through the app.

However, the noise cancellation itself I would expect to be MUCH BETTER for headphones this price. This was my main reason for splurging and is a little bit of a let down. Also, sometimes I have difficulty connecting to PCs. Finally, trying to take a call is impossible. Sound is awful if you can even get the speaker to work. Had for 6 months and I am still unsuccessful in taking a single call.

author: mat
title: Perfection
content: These are perfect in every way

author: James Chong
title: Very Good Headphones for the Price
content: I like how you can change the amount of noise cancellation, the battery lasts for a long time, and its sound quality is very good. However I would like if the voice that reads the battery and if the headphones are disconnected or connected to be softer.

author: Peter Brink
title: They do a good job of eliminating some sounds in the background
content: I thought these eliminated all sound other than what you can hear through them. They do not! They do a good job of eliminating some sounds in the background. I could still hear my dog barking. My wife cherping at me. I want this for or expected baby crying. Bose please make something that blocks it all! For head phones and eliminating a good amount of background noise they do rock! Sound awesome! Connect easily! And are super comfortable! Just don’t block out all noise which I though that’s what “noise canceling would do” I have a lot of nose products they do make the best for the money! Sound bars, speakers, my car stereo are all Awesome products as well.

author: Russcass
title: Great sounding, cheap feel.
content: My first Bose.  You definitely get better sound, comfort and the noise canceling is great!  That said the headphones literally feel like they were made using the same plastic body that my $25 pair was.  I was blown away that arguably the best sound company would make a fantastic set of headphones with such a cheap feel to it.  Bose needs to look at the User Experience holistically.

author: Samuel James Serrano
title: Five Stars
content: These things are perfect in every way. If I could marry them, there'd be protests, but I'd do it.

author: Linda H
title: The best noise-cancelling headphones I’ve ever had
content: I don’t like to listen to anything while I work, especially my co-workers. These headphones work so well that I am startled when someone approaches me. I have used them for more than 5 hours each day for the last 11 days and the battery is still 80% charged. Having them connected to my cell phone is another great feature. While a little pricey, they are worth it for the increase in productivity they give me.

author: ImpecuniousOne
title: Heavy and hot
content: Very heavy and extremely hot when wearing for a long time had problems psiring

author: Ram Bracha
title: Best Headphones
content: Best headphones I've ever had. I had the first wired edition of the QuietComfort and I couldn't get enough of them. The sound quality is awesome. I love it how it's a regular audio plug and not a USB (I want something that would go with my iPhone as well as my PC). The Bluetooth connection is fair, I think that still using the wire is better. The second edition has such soft cushions it's unbelievable and the noise cancellation is in a level that only Bose knows how to do.

author: David Gunter
title: The Best thing out there!
content: I got as Christmas present, one of the best gifts ever.  It's BOSE so ya know the sound is second to none.  Fast EZ transaction.

author: rose
title: love it
content: one of the best I have ever tried.Bose is number one

author: Josue
title: Worth the money
content: The headphones are comfortable. I have gone 8hrs without feeling fatigued wearing these. The cups are plush. I don't feel these headphones lean to a particular genre of music; a good thing! They sound well with rock, hip-hop, and lo-fi

author: Amazon Customer
title: Quality sound and comfort
content: These are light weight and comfortable! The ear pads fit nicely around my ears. The outside world practically disappears !

author: Benel Hirmez
title: Very well put together with clear sound and decent bass.
content: Nothing bad to say about them. They’re loud, even though they don’t feel like it at first. Sound is very clear with decent bass. Noise cancelling works well at medium to high volume. At low volume, there’s a lot of the noise cancelling ‘static’. It does block out the vast majority of outside noise. Noise leakage is at very low as well, especially if not wearing glasses so you get a better seal.

author: OrlandoStudent
title: Love these
content: I got these to replace my Q25 which started losing some of the black coating on the cushions. These wireless Bose are even  more comfortable with even better sound. I prefer the old case, as the headphones fit right in rather than needing to be collapsed down every time, but the quality of the headphones more than makes up for the inconvenience of the case.

author: A. Martin
title: Great headphones, but possible to get used instead of new.
content:
The headphones themselves are great - easily connected to my phone, downloaded the app for some customization, music and phone calls sound great, and the noise cancellation is very good. Can't recommend them more.

Now, that being said, I was shipped a pair of returned headphones when I ordered new. They had already been connected to "Eric's" iPhone and they had already been named "Eric's Bose" as shown in my Bluetooth device list and the app. I worked with Amazon support and they were able to throughly test the functions of the headphones to make sure all the buttons worked and such, and offered that I could either return these for new or keep and they would refund some of the cost. Headphones looked new, no wear/tear or markings, and everything worked as it should, so I kept the headphones and had some of the price refunded. Customer service worked well, but the used headphones should not have been put back in stock with the new ones.

author: Risal Bhagwansingh
title: Excellent
content: Amazing product. The battery life is great, lasts for days, charges quickly. The noise cancelling is incredible, drowns out all background noise from the road, even when no audio is playing.

author: Ken in Boston
title: Love these quiet, beautiful sounding headphones.
content: I love the bluetooth function, and that they can pair simultaneously with 2 devices (have had no problem with this). They really do have beautiful sound, and NC function is great. The cable for use with airplane screens is essential, and easily replaced if lost (no need to buy the expensive cable from Bose, they are readily available online). They are large, and if I'm wearing them around my neck (ie, not using them while walking thru airport or taking a break on plane) they can feel a bit annoying or cumbersome. But that same size covers the ears beautifully. Battery is great. No complaints.

author: Gary Johnson
title: Beautiful product
content: These things are a life saver. Awesome for planes, and even normal usage. Noise canceling is amazing. They last soooooo long, even in Bluetooth mode. Worth the money 3x over

author: Larry Cornett
title: Most comfortable over-ear headphones I've owned
content:
I bought the Bose QuietComfort headphones just in time for a long international flight (over 15 hours). I couldn't be happier with them. They are the most comfortable over-ear headphones I've owned. They're light and cushy enough to rest over my ear and not crush the cartilage. I wore them for hours with no discomfort.

The battery life is excellent and they're easy to recharge. The noise canceling is pretty amazing. It provides 3 levels of cancellation and you don't realize how much it is doing until you switch it off. You'll still hear some minor background noise (like the sound of the jet engines), but it is very quiet and not noticeable when music is playing.

The sound quality is very good. The Bluetooth connects seamlessly to multiple devices, both my phone and laptop. I have also been using them for phone calls and the microphone works well. The noise canceling makes phone calls much clearer than my AirPods.

author: Soumil Shah
title: Silent flights!
content: They are a dream during flights! The sound quality is pretty decent too (as far as an amateur listener like me can discern). So far, the battery has performed well too - despite taking these headphones to some really cold places (up to -8 deg C)!

author: DJC
title: Very comfortable
content:
I bought these after breaking my existing pair. Easy to pair with my phone and smart watch but when I want to pair it with Alexa, it always takes several tries.

Noise cancellation is good as is the sound quality. Very comfortable. Comes with a semi-ridgid case and audio cable which I haven't used.

author: Yohan
title: Good but not as good as the Sony WH
content: I purchased both the Bose Quiet comfort and the Sony WH's to compare the two. Bose is great, the build quality is solid, its lightweight and the sound quality is decent. What surprised me though is the fact that the Sony Wh did a  much better job at canceling sound than the Bose headphones, the sound quality was also better on the Sony's.
