The bose headphones had a more comfortable feel but aside from that I would advise anyone not to buy this headphone and instead buy the Sony Wh.

author: Jose Rosario LLC
title: Calls are not the best
content: As a truck driver this is great buy. I can nearly hear noice from engine. Great battery life awesome sound (me and my wife hear rain noice on calls) I hope this can be fixed with software updates. Alexa need to be program not a easy as I was thinking. But it will work with whatever you personal assistant you like best (Google/Siri/Alexa/Cortana) not sure about bixbe but how really used that anyways 🤔😉 in short they are the best for reason. I hope they improve on calls.

author: Donna Harper
title: Bose is always the best
content: Perfect gift for my husband

author: Amazon Customer
title: a bit pricey
content: great sound quality and noise cancellation, and very comfortable to wear for hours.

author: Susan M.
title: Pleased with this model so far
content:
After a lot of research and comparison with Sony’s WH-1000XM3 headset, I decided to purchase this Bose model. I have been wearing them for about a week and am happy with the results.

When I am in the office, the noise cancellation at max level does a nice job of silencing almost everything. I can still hear voices but they are drastically muted. The building HVAC sounds completely disappear and I’ve been startled by a co-worker a few times because I didn’t hear them approach my desk when my back was turned.

I work from home twice a week and have been able to completely tune out my husband who plays video games and chats with his friends rather loudly (he plays in the basement under my office). He also snuck up on me when I was wearing them and scared the crap out of me 😆

The sound quality is good - I’ve had multiple conference calls and have experienced no issues. Most of the time, I wear them (without any audio) simply to block out background noise. Seems kind of silly to spend so much money for that sole reason but they really do an excellent job at noise cancellation.

I recommend purchasing the extended warranty - I had issues with Bose earbuds a few years ago so I don’t completely trust the lasting quality of their products.

The only minor thing I don’t care for is the light colored headband cushion and fabric material. I considered this before purchasing the rose gold color and obviously, it wasn't enough of a deterrent for me to choose the black model. It is a comfortable band but I can see it getting dirty quickly. Especially for people who dye their hair (I dye my hair black).

author: D. Cap
title: LOVED them until they made me sick
content: If you’re looking for the BEST noise canceling headphones with all the comfort you’d expect from $350, then this is where you stop and buy. However, if you’ve ever been prone to car sickness, Disneyland rides or any type of motion illness, I would pause before buying these. Basically there is a thing where the noise canceling feature sends a frequency  that messes with your inner ear/balance, the same thing that is triggered when you get motion sickness. I enjoyed these bad boys for 3 days, and then experienced severe dizziness and nausea for hours after wearing them. I thought it was from the travel (I bought them for flying) but then I wore them for day 2 and 3 while sitting at a desk and still got severely dizzy. Unfortunately I have to return them, but if I didn’t get the spins, they would be my favorite set of headphones.

author: emmy10
title: I love the creator/creators of these headphones
content: I can tell you that if you work with folks close to you, you will need these.  I was needing something to take away noise and listen to my favs.  These are the best in cancelling out all unwanted voices, constant coughing and other body noises humans make.  The best money I have spent.  Thank you BOSE for saving my sanity.

author: Kel
title: Worth it
content:
Best bluetooth headphones ever!

Couple of cons I found;
- need firmware updated
- has connectivity issues when paired with the multiple devices

author: Peter Lusardi
title: awful to configure to desktop computer
content:
Basically no directions - only safety.  Need to download multiple apps. No illustrated directions.  Had to go to 3rd party website to get one of the apps to make it work.
Headphones have multiple buttons, but no illustration with the directions to identify.  Only "Do not use for Aviation Communication"  Well, no sh*t!!

author: J. S.
title: Comfort and Great Sound
content: I got these as a birthday gift from my husband and LOVE them. Took them on an international trip and they made all the difference. Very soft cushioning and excellent noise canceling quality. I will never fly without them again.

author: W. L.
title: best yet
content: I have been a long time user of Bose noise cancellation headphones and this one is the best by far. Better noise cancellation, wireless, great battery life. Plus google assistant button!

author: wertyu
title: Limited
content: It's good to mask the motor noise in a plane. Doesn't cover much of anything else.

author: C. Hall
title: Syncs with my phone!
content: Love google assist!  Syncs with my phone and everything. Noise cancelling is outstanding on the plane. 5 stars!!

author: Sharron Denice
title: Now THESE are noise cancelling headphones!!!!
content: Yessss honey!!! This is what I had been looking for, didn't want to pay the hefty price but it was worth it!! I put those headphones on and it was like placing suction cups over my ears! I had tried Corwin first but it can't compare to Bose! Hands down the best in sound EVER is Bose!!

author: Adam
title: Good for audiophiles, better for misanthropes
content:
For portable headphones, the sound quality is quite good. The noise cancellation let me walk the streets of NY while still able to listen to a podcast, regardless of the wind, which I wasn't able to do with earbuds or such.

Sometimes it seems to me that it won't readily connect to my phone via bluetooth. Turning bluetooth off and on seems to address it. I can't be sure if this is a  phone issue or a headphone issue.

Also, if you use it for phone calls, the noise cancellation works for the wearer, not for the person on the other end of the call.

author: Melissa C Norman
title: Worth every penny!
content:
I was very hesitant to spend this much on headphones, but after a round trip flight to China, these were an absolute lifesaver.

They are extremely comfortable- even after having them on for 14 hours.

The noise cancelling blocks most of the noise. I could still tell when the kid behind me started crying, but nowhere near as bad as it would have been without the headphones. I just turned the volume up a bit.

author: Liang
title: I like it
content: Best headphones ever. Now I can enjoy my music and audio books without any interruptions

author: Mike
title: Just threw them in the trash
content: Worthless garbage.  Uncomfortable.  After 6 months, they couldn't even maintain a connection to my iPad for more than 3 minutes.  Sound quality was good when they worked.  Battery life was fine.  Quality was apparently sub-par.  Price was ridiculous.  I'm done with Bose overpriced junk.

author: Charles Spargur
title: Everything I Expected
content: A great technical product Noise cancelling was outstanding.  The audio was crystal clear, typical of BOSE quality.

author: Maikol
title: Good sound, noise cancellation is great, but it has some defects
content:
I bought it one year ago and by now those are the problems that I faced:
 1. The earpads began to wear off too fast, you can appreciate the images.
 2. Small glitches when playing from a laptop.
Besides those problems, the headphones work well good comfort, sound and noise cancellation.

author: Andy
title: Perfection
content: Battery last much longer than I expected. Syncs up with paired phone that already has Bluetooth on immediately. Syncs well with controls, and even pauses phone music/video when turning off headphones. Noise-cancelling and wireless is the way to go! Plus, the sound is rich and beautiful. 5/5.

author: Buzz Avery
title: Likely as good as you can possible find in this genre.
content: It's tough to give any product in this genre 5 stars since canceling noise with over-heating ears is nearly impossible.  This now has bluetooth to go wireless which means faster lost of battery, so recharging is a constant need.  They are light weight.

author: Elizabeth Rovere
title: Excellent product
content: Bose is the best

author: dcdcdc
title: The noise canceling is unbelievable
content: The noise canceling is unbelievable. I was skeptic and ready to return because of the price point but I am absolutely amazed. I am keeping these and will be recommending this Bose product to anyone interested. Anything I tried in the past seems like a joke. This is serious.

author: TruthInReview
title: Great sound, great noise canceling
content: Love them, great to eliminate distractions at work. Sound quality impressive for noise canceling headphones

author: Fawad
title: Wonderful headphones
content: Wonderful headphones with impeccable noise cancellation. Sounds at par with the best out-there..

author: tktroma
title: Noise Canceling and Great Sound Quality
content: Bought these in November 2018. After deciding they were too expensive even at super good sale price, was going to return them. All I can say is thank goodness I never got around to doing it. Used them for the first time for a trip cross country from San Diego to Washington DC.  Noise cancellation: the headphones were amazing, I love them!  Watched episode after episode of The Umbrella Academy.  Babies crying? No problem. Loud annoying speakers a few rows back? No problem.  Cabin crewmembers asking if I wanted a drink?  They had to touch me on the shoulder to get my attention.  Still no problem!  I will never fly again without TV these headphones, never! Best travel equipment I have ever purchased. Worth every penny.

author: Martin Quevedo
title: overall top quality headphones
content:
The noice canceling feature is really nice. Although, since it is considered the best of all, I expected more. I set the noice canceling to high and I can still hear the music around. But I have to say, music is very loud (in the gym).
Another thing I notice is that when I am not playing music but noice canceling is on, i feel some discomfort in my ears, as if there was extra pressure. But noice is cancel effectively (almost)

The material used for this headphone is really great. Just all of it.

What I am not happy with is that it does not fit very well. I had another pair of headphones before (cheap ones) and they wont move during gym activities. But these move. I have to re-position them all the time.

Some thing else particularly annoying is that when i am walking or running I can hear my foot hitting the ground (very loud). This didnt happen with my previous cheap pair of headphones.

author: An Avid Reader
title: Fantastic product!
content: These headphones are much improved from the ones I bought many years ago. They are light weight with great sound. I love them.

author: Cal Stuart
title: Well worth the price
content: I work in an open-plan office and my co-workers tend to generate a lot of noise. Thanks to this headset, I can get my work done in peace. This was priceless to me.

author: Bruce R. Jankowski
title: quality
content: sound is incredible

author: ILgar
title: Bose QC 35 2
content: Amazing BOSE Headphone!!! Used it on the helicopter deck, offshore rig and noise cancelling is really super. i just enjoy my music and no other noises!!! Highly recommended!!!

author: Traveling Fool.
title: Excellent for Open Work Environments
content:
Ah, the curse of the open work environment.  Touted as genius for creating highly efficient teams.  That is, if you can get any work done with the constant high volume conversations around you.  These headphones are the solution.  Not a 100%, but a very decent 90% of the voices are eliminated and the rest are low enough volume that I can ignore them.  And, I'm a big fan of acoustics and bass.  Cabaret Bachata, etc.  Excellent!!

My last headphones were at the $80 price point and had a 4.5 star rating, but completely failed in the noise cancellation department.  These headphones are well worth the money.

author: Boston Canuck
title: Everything promised and more
content: I bought these for use in noisy environments - airplane travel, noisy work environment. They deliver great noise cancellation and excellent sound quality. The headphones come with a strong carrying case and a chord to connect them to the devices/outlets that don't have Bluetooth. Very comfortable over the ears. Glad I bought them. Worth the money and more. Now I can fly without having to deal with annoying airplane noise.

author: squanch
title: Best High end NC headphones you can buy
content:
I was torn between this or the Sony. Since I previously had the wired QC15, I decided to upgrade to this.
This is the most comfortable headphones I have ever worn. I wore for 14 hours straight and no pain on my ears. Even though the advertised battery life is shorter than the Sony's, it was still good and lasted me awhile. Noise cancelling is awesome. With 3 levels of noise-cancellation (including off), you can switch with a button to what suits your needs. However, the best feature is being able to seamlessly connect with two devices at once.

author: Tamara Johnson
title: Great sound quality and excellent battery life
content: I love these headphones. I take them to work, and listen when I am doing tasks that are complex and I don't want to be disturbed. They really help me concentrate and they just block out all the distractions. I am looking forward to taking them on a plane flight. I expect they will make flying much more pleasant.

author: Always looking to mimic life more closely
title: ... the old version of these years ago and he LOVED them, but the ports all broke
content: I bought my son the old version of these years ago and he LOVED them, but the ports all broke.  Honestly, he had them on all the time so I feel like we got our money’s worth plus some.  So I bought him these which are a big step up.  I’m not sure he sees the difference, he hasn’t bragged but he uses them constantly and it appears the ports are better designed.

author: Peter Ferris
title: Bose Is The Best
content: I compared to the Sony's before I made the purchase.  For me, for what I like, the Bose were superior in noise cancellation and accurate fidelity.  Yes, they're not necessarily cheap... but think of them as "cheaper than therapy"!  When you have to take that jet from Vegas to Tulsa and there's lots of jet whine and a misbehaving brat screeching their head off 3 rows back, there's NOTHING better than Bose QC-35 II. Can't recommend 'em enough.  I get at least the advertised 20 hours per charge out them, and you can always use a cable in an emergency! These things rock so hard!  I'd rather lose my phone than these babies!  I LOVE LOVE LOVE these! Highly recommend.

author: lwojdyla
title: Incredible for commuters!
content: These headphones are amazing at eliminating background noise. If you commute on the train/bus or if you fly a lot then these are a must have, if you value silence and your ears. Expect around 80% of noise reduction on your commutes. They are especially effective against background noise (such as aircraft engine/train/bus/or city noise). Sound quality is incredible too. Build quality is great. They are expensive but for sure worth the price tag. Save your hearing and get one of these for your noisy commutes! They also have a built-in in microphone and are pretty good for having Bluetooth calls too!

author: Laurentiff
title: The absolute best
content:
Let me start by saying I was insanely reluctant to purchase these headphones for a few reasons: A)  I travel 80% for my job. I basically live on Delta. Throughout the year I have made some really stupid headphone purchases on a whim, being a complete newbie to the headphone game. Right before purchasing these I had purchased Beats Solo 3, again on a whim, during Amazon prime day.  After wearing them several times, painfully so, I realized that I had wasted $150 on headphones and I had to buckle down and do some research B) these are expensive… &*^%ing expensive.  This was a big decision.

All that said - holy crap these things are amazing!  I can literally wear them, and have worn them, all day with zero discomfort. To put that into perspective, after about 30 minutes - to an hour with my other headphones, my ears would start to hurt due to the pressure and poor product  ergonomics.  Not these - they are amazeballs.

The noise canceling is also by far superior to anything I’ve tried.  I recently took a last-minute flight and got stuck in the middle seat in between two men that were well over 6’2 and chatting each other throughout the flight.  FML.  BUT - I seriously could not hear a word coming from them.  One guy even had to tap my shoulder to get my attention when the flight attendant came around. These things seriously rock.

The price point sucks but it’s worth it in the end.

author: Susanabanana
title: The BEST headphones...
content: I’m a Bose fan.  I have Bose in my cars, in my house, in my garage, I have older wired over the ear headphones - and love them all....but THESE...these are my favorite yet.  When on a plane, you’re like “what plane?”  When you’re in a car (not driving, but being driven) these headphones make you forget the sound of L.A. and N.Y. traffic.  When I don’t want to hear my husband, they shut him out (not “up” tho...cuz he keeps talking).  And when you just plain wanna lounge and rock the hell out, they provide perfect balance and sound quality.  Comfortable and easily cover your ears completely.  These are perfect... I didn’t expect anything less...

author: Jackson Roykirk
title: Excellent product
content: Really like these headphones.  Bought them for travel on airplanes.  Noise reduction freak'n excellent.  All the noise is cut out but yet I can hear the announcements.  Use them to watch TV also.  The only down side to these things is for Apple products, you can only have two devices enabled to be connected to them.  So if I want to use my iPad, iPhone, and Apple TV, one of these I have to disable and then when traveling switch to the devices I have with me; this (feature) is active no matter what device you are using to connect to the headphones.  So for the iPhone and the iPad, you need a Bose app to configure the headphones.  The app is the same for each device.  Each app will only allow you to connect to two devices and they are the same for each device if this makes sense.  This must be a limitation of the headphones and I can't figure out why there would be such a limitation.

author: BooksbyJohn
title: They are extremely comfortable.
content:
Excellent noise cancelling and feel good on the head. Much more comfortable than the Sonys.
A+

author: Roge213
title: So nice, I bought them twice 😄
content:
Wow! This thing AMAZING!! For years I have been resisting the urge to buy noise cancelling headphones because I thought they were just a fad. The latest gizmo. Also, Bose was pretty much the only game in town, and the price was outrageously high.
  Because my wife and I do our fair share of traveling, I felt it was about time to seriously reconsider my thoughts about anc headphones. After watching countless YouTube videos and reading a few reviews online about the different models of anc headphones available today, I decided to take a chance and go with the Bose Quietcomfort 35 II.
  I bought 2 pairs. One black (mine), and one silver (wife's). I was instantly impressed with the sound quality and the effectiveness of the noise cancelling feature. Sounds are full and balanced; nothing really overwhelming (no over the top bass). And oh so comfortable. Just make sure you adjust the headband to fit your head properly. I've worn them for 8-10 hours continually for the past few days, and they never hurt my head or ears. My wife loves her Bose headphones too, and she's very picky about everything I give her. I can vacuum the house, use power tools, make as much noise as I want, and she's no longer bothered.
  The pressure other reviewers feel in their ears are true for me as well. But I just yawn or do any of the usual things a person does to relieve that airline cabin pressure in the ears. Eventually my ears become acclimated and I don't feel the pressure anymore. I set the smart button on the left ear cup to control the noise cancellation level because I can call up my Google Assistant by holding down the play/pause button on the right ear cup. So I don't need two buttons for that feature.
  All in all, we love our new anc headphones. We use them almost everyday to listen to music, watch TV, or just to block out any annoying ambient noises. We have an upcoming trip in a couple of weeks and I can hardly wait to try them on the flight. Glad I finally got these.
  Almost forgot to mention this. The shipping was super fast. Ordered it on a Tuesday, and it arrived on my doorstep the very next day. That's another reason for me to love these things. Thanks Amazon!

author: Jeff Woolums
title: Thoroughly enjoy my Bose quietcomfort 35 headset.
content: Love the playback and Bluetooth flexibility.

author: A. J. Poulin
title: These things are insane.  I will never fly without them.
content: Had a flight to Boston with a crying baby three aisles back.  I actually didn't even know until we landed and I had taken my headphones off.  I'm not kidding.  Freaking lifesaver.

author: Yuriy
title: Good, not great
content: When music is playing it sounds good, but when paused get annoying white noise. Thought you get Bose precisely to avoid that white noise?

author: Eric Patat
title: A great option for flights
content: These do what they’re advertised to do. A little heavy and they fold a little clunky too. Wish they were usb-c charging.

author: IanM
title: Some initial issues but Amazon came through!
content:
The first set that I got had some dried hot glue or something on the ear cup.  I called Amazon and they transferred me to the Bose customer support.  As you would probably not expect with a "straight out the box" purchase they wanted me to send them to them let them do whatever then wait to get my headphones back.  Nope.  I bought these and I want to play with them.  Hung up, called Amazon back, told them what had happened, had a new pair the next day!

TLDR - Bose customer support is blah and Amazon is Yay!

The headphones themselves are fantastic.  Not too tight (and I have a big head) and the cups are very comfortable.  The sound is crisp as any headset I have ever owned.  I've never owned noise-cancelling headphones so I can only say that I really like the feature.

Recommended purchase.  I am buying my wife a pair.

author: Steven
title: Your new travel buddy
content: A must have for any traveler. Airplane noise will never be an issue again. Battery life is very good as well.

author: Tom A.
title: Worth every cent
content: I have headaches from lost of stimulus. These headphones allow me to shut everything out.

author: old enough to know better
title: Wow!
content: So, I thought I lost my Sennheiser PXC 550s, which I had had for several years.  I spent several days doing research and agonizing over whether to choose Bose or Sony.  Although I am not certain that I made the right choice yet, I can tell you that these are awesome sounding headphones and blow away my Sennheiser PXC 550s, which I have since found and which have been retired.

author: Megan G.
title: Treat yourself!
content: I travel a lot for work and got these as a birthday present to myself, I was hesitant to spend so much on headphones. Not only are they comfortable and have excellent sound quality, the tech actually works! I didnt know how much I would love sound cancellation until I used them (no music) at an airport working during a long delay. Not only that, the dual device connection works like a dream. Once I got my devices connected, I hardly have to think about it. I can listen to music from my phone, and a Skype call comes in on my PC and it switches right over. Things like this to me demonstrate that the tech is what makes these headphones worth spending the money on. You just can't expect this type of design and quality for $50.

author: M.D. Austin
title: More Cheaply Made Than They Could Be. You Could Shop Around.
content:
Update 10-13-19: I take very good care of these and use them daily. $350 price / 20 months use at this writing = $19 monthly cost. Yet Bose had to replace the 1st pair at seven months and that interrupted their use for 17 days. You'll need a back-up pair of something if you use them every day.

These Bose QC 35 II headphones continue to be very good for listening to music:  They've very good sound fidelity and the noise cancellation is very good. Yet they're quite poor for voice conversations:  Their regular sound dropouts which interrupt the conversations, their poor microphone placement, and their frequent issues with device pairing and device selection make them only a back-up choice to my wired earbuds. I've been using them on a two year old iPhone 7, a four year old Windows 8 laptop, and a one year old, fairly high-powered Windows 10 desktop. My long experience with Bose earbuds and headphones which I started in 2013 recently encouraged me to shop for a different manufacturer for home audio. I ended up with Sonos' to play Spotify at home. I've declined using cloud services for voice commands.

Update 11-19-18: I now have new Bose QC 35 II headphones sent under warranty, which replace those purchased seven months ago in February. For a $350 device to be replaced at the manufacturer's cost is a reasonable thing. But a seven-month life for these headphones suggests I'll reserve my further observations about them for later.

It took Bose 17 days to replace the broken ones which inexplicably quit working without warning, and without abuse. The new headphones work but pairing was at first very fiddly:  In order to get the headphones to connect to both a new computer and new-enough smartphone, each of those devices had to be powered off while the other was paired. I made two separate phone calls to Bose tech support to achieve proper pairing.

I use these every day for telephone calls and personal listening. These are still the most comfortable headphones I've found, and the sound fidelity and noise-cancellation are pretty good for what they cost.

Now that these headphones are paired with a brand new computer, and with a new-enough iPhone, the headphones are keeping their connection to both devices. And the headphones can play from either one or the other device without undue attention. This is as I'd expect from a product costing $350.

Update 11-7-18: Without being abused, these headphones instantly and mysteriously stopped being able to connect to either a new desktop or new smartphone. After telephoning them, Bose told me they'd ship me a brand new pair at no cost, to replace them once they receive my broken ones via their prepaid shipping. This is not a poor deal. Nor is it a great one. Because meanwhile I must use a replacement pair. My temporary replacements won't be Bose, and I'm glad of that.

Update 6-24-18:  To add to what's below this paragraph, there are currently no more sound drop-outs (silent gaps in phone conversations) as described before. Just recently in noisy environments (like cafes) the people I'm telephoning have observed that they can't hear me on the calls *and* also that there's so much in the background that all they can hear is that noise. This problem seems to be solved by wiring the headset to my iPhone 7 Plus with the Apple Lightning to 3.5 mm adapter cable. I've now been using these QuietComfort 35 Series II headphones periodically for around four months for both audiobooks and music. I find them to be good for $350 but not exceptional. I do enjoy the noise cancelling in public environments because the noise attenuation promotes sanity and focus on audiobooks or music. And these are the most comfortable headphones I've used compared to a $280 Sony pair and two separate Avantree pairs.

Older review content below this paragraph. Read that too:

Frequent sound drop-outs  --  short, two-second periods of silence  --  during both music and telephone calls. This requires that I now open a product support case with Bose for headphones which are two months old.

They're very comfortable. They paired easily with a 2010 iMac running El Capitan 10.11.6. They sound as all the many reviews I read said they would: not as clear as a few other makes in the same price range like Sony or Sennheiser. Or maybe even other, wired Bose headphones. Yet the better noise cancelling would be an acceptable tradeoff for me for long airline flights. Their receiving range is 25 feet shorter than the Sony H.ear on Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones model MDR100ABN/L, and the Sonys have noticeably better sound fidelity. But I couldn't wear the Sonys for more than 40 minutes without them feeling over-tight and uncomfortable.

The noise cancellation on this over-the-ear headphones seems better than my Bose QuietComfort 20i wired earbuds. But those wired earbuds also have much better sound fidelity and I use them all the time for voice conversations:  the earbuds have an in-line microphone which works much better and sounds much better than the more distant microphones of Bose QuietComfort 35 Series II wireless headphones. The wired earbuds also don't have sound drop-outs and instead have contiguous sound signal.

But, also, where we live in our woods, these Bose QuietComfort 35 Series II headphones have unacceptable, low-level interference from an unknown source via both the 2010 Mac and via my 2017 iPhone 7 Plus. There are low-level, audible voice conversations from others to be heard in the background. In starting my research on this I see that Bluetooth runs on the same frequency as 2.4 GHz. Since the homes where we live are low-density, and we live in a wood, I would now have to investigate a source for the interference on these. But for a product which costs $350 new, that's unacceptable. Time will tell whether I keep them.

On an older but still very well-functioning Windows 7 PC I've successfully paired these Bose headphones to a Kokkia Bluetooth transmitter iSplitter. Now testing both of them.

author: S. S. Smith
title: Terrible built-in microphone - almost unusable
content: Sound quality and noise cancellation are both great.  However, you cannot use these headphones while making a call - the built-in microphone is erratic, and will vary between picking up every noise within a few hundred feet, to not picking up any sound at all.  If you ever need to make calls while using headphones, do not purchase these.

author: jeteypete
title: Use these everyday
content: I use these headphones everyday. Great for noise cancelling, taking calls, etc. They are a bit big and don't love the sound, also have had some pairing / software issues.

author: Dan
title: Great sound. Crappy Bluetooth.
content: Great sound quality (I’m partially deaf so take that with a grain of salt). Bluetooth is very unreliable compared to previous model (hence the missing start). You can do better Bose.

author: Debbie S.
title: Just good speakers and noise cancelers. I am not a gamer so can't comment
content: These are Bose and always seem so superior to other speakers in a quiet, luxurious way. Crystal clear sound that you can get lost in. Love them. If you ever thought about getting them, don't hesitate. Worth it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bought these a while back, been using them ever since and felt obligated to give 5 stars
content: Great headphones, use these at the gym and while studying. The noise canceling is the best I've personally experienced, though whoever buys them should still be mindful that they primarily rely on active noise cancelling. Only downside is that they require the QC 25 android cable to work with a PS4, but I'm not sure whether Bose or Sony is to blame for that one. 5/5

author: Amy S. Trapp
title: Hard to beat headphones.
content: Own a pair and bought a pair for my 27year-old daughter. Now we both love them!

author: Iain Sloan
title: I started working in a cube farm and the noise and distractions were driving me nuts.
content: I tried these Bose Quiet Comfort 35 Series II head phones in a store one day and was amazed by the amount of sound it took away.  The noise, the music all gone. This was a big well known grocery store chain.  Silenced....  Didn't think about it again until I got my new job and it was driving me to distraction. I decided this was the only way to fix it.  Got these. I carry them in my work back pack all the time.  First thing out of my bag every day. Battery lasts long.  Sound quality, both speech and music is great. Don't suffer Cubeland, get these and rediscover peace and quiet.

author: Axesever
title: Wow
content: Most amazing headphones ever. Comfortable, charge lasts forever, noise-cancellation is top notch, worth the buy!

author: Alex
title: Do not buy if using with Windows
content: Paid 300 dollars for headphones that randomly cut out for seconds at a time for literally no reason. I can be sitting absolutely still and it happens. Been wrestling with these for a long time and it’s driving me crazy, literally every troubleshooting advice i’ve read has been useless. I’ve given up

author: Pradeep Ramachandra
title: Not good for Noise cancellation.
content: This is not a good headphone for Noise cancellation. I can hear other people talk. I was expecting silence. But I like the sound quality.

author: MadKhemist
title: Trust me they are worth the money
content:
I have the series I and I love them so much that I had to give a pair to my partner for Christmas. There is no guessing when you use these headphones, voice whispers in your ear the charge level and which of your Bluetooth devices are connected.

The Series II has some neat extras that are not in the Series I, a Google button is the most useful. When you first turn them on you will be instructed to download the Bose+ app, you can move on without it but you really do want it. It allows you to give the headphones a name and other fun things that make your listening experience that much more enjoyable. I think I'm going to secretly swap his for my older (2 years) set.

author: Oscar Moseley III
title: Bose QC 35IIs ARE the standard
content: The reason why so many others compare themselves to the Bose QC 35II is because these are the best all around headphones available.  For me, these headphones balance  1)  sound, 2) bluetooth performance, 3) long battery life, 4)superb noise cancelling  and 5) comfort.  Are they expensive?  Yes.  Are they worth it?  To me, absolutely yes!

author: P. Ericksen
title: The only thing I found surprising is that while the ...
content: The only thing I found surprising is that while the headphones are charging, it won't transmit to the phone so you can't see the battery level... and you also cannot be listening and recharging simultaneously.

author: Eduardo Urias
title: the most comfortable headphones I have ever had the pleasure to use
content:
These are, by far, the most comfortable headphones I have ever had the pleasure to use.

They are a bit expensive, but the quality and noise cancelling are top-notch. The only issues I have seen so far are related to the Bluetooth connection since it can only have 2 active pairings at a time. So if you have your laptop, smartphone, tablet, etc it can get tricky. However, these issues are common in the world of Bluetooth so I wouldn't put the entire blame on this great product.

author: Phil
title: Great sound quality & value.
content: Second pair of Bose noise cancellation headphones. Last pair lasted 14 years. Rear quality & value.

author: Rob V.
title: Best I’ve ever experienced
content: These headphones are awesome. I cannot hear my girlfriend snoring and I can also make phone calls with them without any additional devices. I am blown away at all that these headphones can do and the sound is amazing. Sometimes I think the sounds from the headphones are actually noises in my room until I take them off and realize it was the headphones that sound so realistic, not from outside them. Lol

author: J. & L. F.
title: They work well. This is the first pair, ...
content: They work well. This is the first pair, and only pair, of NC headphones that I've ever used or owned. They are lightweight, don't crush my head/ears, and have decent tone quality. The only problem that I've had with them was that they would not pair with my Dell XPS 15. I don't know if that's a Windows 10 issue or a BOSE issue, so I left the 5th star.

author: philip b
title: so far so good. Great noise cancelation
content: so far so good. Great noise cancelation. Would love to have a cover for these in order to wear out cutting grass. Comfortable and light weight.

author: DQT
title: Bose QC II - Great Product
content: I still have the original Bose QC I and it has held up very well. My wife uses I for her travels. It is excellent. I purchased this one and the blue tooth is easy to use with the app you down load. You can link it to only two devices. So you'll have to remove one if you have an iPad, laptop, and iPhone, etc. The noise cancelling is excellent and it is great upgrade if you are considering moving from QC 1 to QC 2.

author: Amazon Customer ks
title: Excels at Noise Cancellation
content: I bought these for noise cancellation and they live up to expectation and then some. They do a great job of eliminating low noise such as motors and even work for high pitched electronic noise. I don't use them too much for music; mostly for spoken programming such as news, pod casts and movies. Sound is clear and accurate. Earphones are comfortable; not too tight but good fit around the ears. Well worth the money.

author: James T Kentfield
title: The standard for noise canceling headphones
content:
After trying a few other headphones, I replaced a stolen pair of Bose 35 headphones. They may not have audiophile quality, but they sound adequate enough for business travel. The real differentiators are: build quality, fit, finish, comfort, and reliability. It also is nice to have fantastic battery life.

I won’t try another brand again for travel headphones, but I might just have to get a different pair for critical audiophile requirements.

author: James Hart
title: Worth Every Dollar
content: I fly international at least once a year. I finally decided to make an “investment” in noise canceling headphones. Flew Philly to Jamaica and what a pleasure!! No engine drone, no bothersome noise from passengers; in a word Awesome. Only wish I had these two years ago on a flight to Rome, two year old in row behind me cried incessantly. Back then I thought headphones were a luxury item, now I consider them essential.

author: qm
title: sound was ok, and they didnt get very loud ...
content: sound was ok ,and they didnt get very loud  ,not what i expected from Bose.

author: E Matthews
title: great noise cancelling
content: I bought these for a flight. they cancel almost all the noise, especially when you are playing music. they are great. the inly complaint is that the case's zipper was cheap and broken.

author: Pete
title: Expensive price for cheap construction
content: Great sound etc, low review is because they have a broken piece after only a year that causes a clicking sound in the left ear. Very disappointing for a premium product at this price point.

author: val
title: awesome product
content: perfect quality. highly recommended

author: Sean Sanders
title: Smart tech
content: Excellent at noise cancellation, with crisp audio playback. I like that I can connect 2 devices at the same time, with the headphones being smart enough to pause the song I’m streaming from my laptop when I get a call in my iPhone. Only giving 4-stars because I think the price for these is ridiculously high. I got mine because I won an Amazon gift card.

author: Cesar Inzunza
title: Great Product
content: Great Product. Highly recommend!!

author: Hugo Furst
title: Buy Bose - Buy The Best
content:
Bose has never failed to exceed my expectations in customer performance.  I can't wait to try out my Quiet Comfort 35s on a long flight.
Update:  Took the long flight - 14 hours out, 12 hours back.  This product does best those two things you want most: cancel ambient noise (the sound of the airliner DISAPPEARED) and the music was awesome.  I humbly retract my petty criticisms.  It costs, but then again, it delivers all it promises.

author: Richard Fox
title: They are Comfortable & Adaptable
content: These worked well on a long airplane ride.  Good sound quality, Comfortable to wear, Bluetooth works well and they also work in wired mode to listen to airplane movies or entertainment.  Used them for 2 movies and additional music channels and the battery was still going strong after almost 6 hours.

author: Erich B Fabrikant
title: Five Stars
content: Quality head phones and worth the price!

author: MikeMac
title: This thing ROXX
content: BEST noise cancelling headset on the market!

author: Mr. White
title: Well-known Firmware Bugs Yet to be Solved
content:
I'm writing this because of problems with the control button firmware on the left side earpiece. In normal operation, the left button can be programmed to function as either 1. instant access to the Google Assistant (big marketing point by Bo$e) OR 2. to choose one of four levels of noise cancellation.
BUT, at least with Android 7&8, if you choose to program the button for Google Assistant, firmware disables the stop/pause function of the button on the right side earpiece. So you have a choice; you can have GA or stop/pause, but not both.
This is a known bug with Bo$e and can be found in the forums for months.  It has been >6 months since release and Bo$e has yet to fix this issue.
This is my 3rd generation Bo$e NC headset. It is the most comfortable and most feature-laden of all. NC, sound quality, & mic are all good. Hardware seems of quality design and materials. Because of the bug, I'm rating it mediocre.

author: Vanima
title: Don't buy anything else
content: This is my second set of Bose noise cancellation headphones. My first pair were bought almost a decade ago and they finally just wore out. Plus I wanted the wireless and rechargable features. Have been using them about a week now and am very pleased with the purchase. I get amazing sound quality with no lag or loss of sound between wired or wireless. In full noise cancellation mode using wireless my battery life is 10+ hours with only about half an hour recharge time. The quality that I get with the audio is something only a person who has owned a set of Bose headphones can understand. It is crystal clear and full range. The only other headphones that have come close to the quality was a set of Turtle Beach gaming headphones that I used on my computer. No Sony, Audiovox, or other headphones that I have tried have ever come close to the sound quality and nothing has ever come close to the full noise cancellation of Bose.

author: Soo S Chang
title: Great product!!
content: mostly used when flying, and this is a life changer. I can still hear crying baby next to me but it doesn't bother AT ALL.  It covers about 90% of plane engine noise... great battery life too!!  BEST PURCHASE OF 2018

author: kk
title: Love these
content: Bose says it all.

author: Mark C.
title: Live in Your Own World
content:
These headphones are fantastic for anyone trying to drown out their surroundings. I got them specifically to use at work for the times I am needing to tune out the officer chatter and get into the right headspace to be productive! 100% you won’t regret this purchase.
I tried skimping by with a cheaper set of noise canceling earbuds and it’s truly not even comparable.
Get these, get into a productive headspace, and live in your own world, if only temporarily!

author: D. B. Andes
title: Noise cancelling is incredible. Sound is rich. very comfortable.
content: These are freaking unbelievable!  I drive a 2008 Ford E-150 van with 320,000 miles on it, the van is full of tools and networking equipment.  Very loud road noise and countless rattles.  I put these headphones on and connect to  BOTH my phones.  I can not hear any noises even when the music stops.  When I take the headphones off the noise is deafening.  The phone call quality is very good, the music is tight and crisp the bass is rock solid.  I use these headphone up to 4 hours at a time and they are very comfortable.  Battery is great.  Reviews said the blue tooth connection was finicky, it took a little while to figure it out but I have no trouble switching from my phones, laptops or computers.  I did not want to drop $349.00 on headphones but they are worth it.  Great Purchase

author: SBK
title: The Best of the Best
content: I needed a good hi-fidelity headset for the calls I make for work.  I have international meetings and didn't find any headsets with both great sound and excellent microphone until I purchased the Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) Wireless Headphones, Noise Cancelling.  Yes they are expensive, but sometimes you get what you pay for.  They are extremely comfortable to wear for long periods.  They last 8 hours on one charge and quickly recharge.  The only observation I have which is not a criticism, is that the Noise Cancelling is so effective that family and colleagues need to physically get my attention because I can't hear any outside noise.  The Bose are great for music and fantastic as a headset.  They connect to my iphone, ipad and PC.

author: Michael Banka
title: Great gift idea
content: This was a gift for my daughter. She loves it

author: Wade Fisher
title: Great sound great noise canceling very good app
content: Bose did this one really well.  I had my last pair that was not blue tooth for 10 years.  They still worked.  I just wanted to go wireless.

author: Gene Holland
title: Comfortable and Solid Sound
content: I can't travel without it! My hearing has improved from having these on many times a day. You do not have to crank your volume high to hear your music with back ground noise. Super comfortable and solid sound! The main reason I invested in bose is for sound quality!

author: US Consumer
title: Earplugs work just as well
content: If all you’re wanting is to block out noise, earplugs work just as well, if not better.

author: Ruby
title: Awesome listening experience
content: Great pair of noise canceling headphones by Bose. The Quiet comfort 35 (series II) are the best and no other can compare. Sure,a bit pricey but if you’re looking to have a non interrupted quiet time while listening to your favorite music or enjoying a good movie from your favorite device this headphones are worth it. Downloading the Bose Connect app adds to the listening experience like never before with more options to choose from to optimize and personalize your Q35 headphones. So,for on the go or just listening at home at your own leisure this noise cancellation headphones will deliver a unique experience second to none.

author: Shawn Johnson
title: Good headphones but maybe not $300
content: Overall pretty good headphones. They have the normal stuff you expect from boss; comfortable, durable, etc. There are only a few small things that annoy me with them. A. They’re not $350 worth and should definitely be less. B. They revert to high noise cancelling every time you turn on the headphones but this is made a little better by the fact that you can turn off the voiceover in the app. And C. They sometimes won’t connect to my phone when I first try to connect them. It will make the beep as if it connected but then nothing will happen and I have to play with it for a little bit to get it to connect. But I suspect that it’s because it’s also trying to connect to my PC which I also use it for. Despite these minor flaws, there are plenty of good things, like a great carrying case, amazing battery life, good range, quick charge time, can connect to multiple devices at once, and have amazing noise cancelling (which you’d expect). Also worth noting that the microphone sucks but I never use it so I don’t really care, it’s often better to just disconnect them if you need to take a phone call.

author: George G. McDonald
title: Bose QC35-II noise cancelling earphones are a winner
content: This replaces a 4 year old (I think) QC35 where the battery died. It provides excellent noise cancellation, fine sound quality & a thoroughly agreeable way to have a phone conversation. I often use it just for the noise cancellation. New features I like are an adjustable timed shutdown to avoid draining the battery when you forget to switch off when stowing it. Other features I like are the ability to play Bluetooth audio without noise cancellation and the second reduced level of noise cancellation. Those features are accessed with the Bose app on my iPhone. I was highly pleased with my old QC35 and even more pleased with my new QC35-II. It’s a quality product which I highly recommend.

author: Pieter Du Toit
title: Open office
content:
I have large ears, and these are comfortable enough to wear all day without strain.
These headphones help me concentrate in a noisy open office.
They do not completely  block out all sounds, but it's still pretty good at reducing distractions.

author: Robert M.
title: A little let down...
content:
I love the way they sound but was very let down to find out that they do not support aptX-Low Latency codec.

I had planned to use them for late nite TV and there is very noticeable lag on the audio.

I tried the BOSE website to look around for future updates or work arounds but found none (really surprising for top line headphones and the price).

author: Anarchist8
title: Best headphones ive ever owned.
content: So I have been wanting some Bose headphones for a long time and finally could afford them.  They are the best sounding and most comfortable headphones I have ever owned.

author: RB
title: Connection with Mac mini drops within 10 feet on moving the head
content: While using this headphone with Mac Mini, the bluetooth connection drops within 10 feet by just rotating head or on abrupt shaking of head.

author: A
title: Noise cancelling & bluetooth don't work while charging
content: Quality product, but ridiculous that the noise cancelling and maybe bluetooth doesn't work when charging the headphones. This is like being unable to use your smartphone or laptop when it's charging...just ridiculous design, especially for a product this expensive.

author: eljeffe
title: Great for flying!
content: Love these headphones!! Between the sound quality and the noise canceling I heard nothing but my music and movies on a cross country trip. Haven't tested battery life yet but hope I don't need to. Great buy!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great!
content: Amazing product!  No complaints!!

author: Marty W.
title: Perfect!
content: These are on my head when I go to bed to cancel noise and play my rain sound for meditation/sleep.  Awesome headphones, worth the money.

author: ray
title: Bluetooth is awful. I want my money back
content:
I love the sound of Bose.  I have two pairs of the sport Bluetooth earphones. I have had two Quiet Comfirt wired headphones. Sadly, this more expensive headset isn’t worth it. I’d love to have my money back.

 About every 30-45 min, the headphones remain on but lose the signal. I’m within arms reach of my laptop, yet this has happened repeatedly. If two devices are on, they get confused and drop signal, or I’m stuck on the wrong device. I’m forced to turn off all other Bluetooth devices. Keep in mind, my earphones don’t have this problem.  For the first time on Bose and on Amazon, I DON’T recommend this product.

author: Rob569
title: Great sound, terrible battery
content: The sound quality and noise cancellation on these headphones is amazing. The battery life is terrible. I bought them in August and it’s October and the battery doesn’t last a full day of traveling. I’m going back to beats. They don’t sound as good but the battery lasts at least a few weeks of traveling.

author: Starbuck
title: Highly recommend
content: I love them so much I bought a second pair for my husband. We've had no issues with connecting to, or staying connected to competing bluetooth devices in the house. These headphones were also a game changer on a recent transatlantic flight.

author: Collin
title: Great battery life and sound quality
content: Battery more than lasted 12 hours of travel. Sound quality is excellent and noise cancelling is pretty good. There's an app that allows you to change the level of noise cancelling too.

author: noway
title: DEFINITELY NOT FOR OFFICE USE
content: Not noise cancelling! I ordered this so that I can work peacefully in an open office. When the headphones were on, I could hear every single word the guy next to me was saying while he is on the phone. Just cancels out background noise which is not what i was looking for. Also, everyone can hear the music you are listening to - not cool for such an expensive set of headphones. I returned it and the return process was seamless.

author: Jackie Wayne
title: AWESOME
content: Best product on the market. You can wear these to go to sleep...and wif you sleep on your side, it cushions in your ear! Still comfortable! Was worried about needing to be delicate (especially for the price), but they are built for versatility

author: LucyDawn
title: Worth every penny!
content: I purchased these due to health issues.  I suffer from Multiple Sclerosis which affects your central nervous system. Constant sounds (leaf blowers, jack hammering, nail guns, skill saws, tree trimmers) have been in daily abundance  by my home these past few weeks and sadly caused my M.S. to flair up, and my Optic Neuritis to return. With the loss of my vision I am stranded and unable to do much of anything, but once I put these headphones on, click on my audio book app,  all of those annoying sounds disappear.  Like I said "worth every penny!"  The headphones sit a little low over my ears, so I added a bit of padding to the top and now they sit perfectly.

author: Taylor
title: Outstanding comfort, excellent sound quality, no brainer.
content: Amazing headphones. It'll take a beast of a product to sway my ears and eardrums to have anything other than the Bose qc 35 ii 's on them.

author: Brenda J VanDyke
title: These were a Christmas gift for our son, for ...
content:
These were a Christmas gift for our son, for which he asked.  He was thrilled to receive them as he had some before and wanted another pair so he could use his old ones for mowing his enormous lawn this summer, with a noisy lawn tractor!
He is a true Bose fan!

author: Scott S.
title: If you want personal quiet in a crowded space.
content: Love them. The block out 98% of the noise at the gym and about the same at the blood bank, both very noisy places. I’m able to listen to what I want at my own volume choice. Worth the price.

author: Donny
title: No real support for wired mode
content: Bose Connect App is required to tune any of the settings on the headset, but the app requires too many permissions including location data. Sadly, the only way to adjust Noise Canceling is through the App or with the Action Button. However, in wired mode, both the app and action button are disabled! Also, I hate that the device uses a 2.5 mm headset jack - this means I need a dongle or a special cable that can interface both a 2.5 and 3.5 mm jack (the included wire is too short for me to use comfortably). I wanted to like this headset, it just has too many problems.

author: Diana
title: Love my phones!
content: Absolutely love the headphones for all obvious reasons. The sound clarity is phenomenal. Love the ability to extend use to Alexa enabled apps. Costly but now I’m spoiled. Have had three other types. The comfort is unparalleled, quality great. Would buy again.

author: Pattdene
title: Five Stars
content: A product that delivers on its promises!

author: gloria brown
title: I recommend this over All of the cancellation
content: I recommend this over All of the cancellation !!! I love the features it has such wonderful listen/talk time ..gives me notifications..I love Bose and this is my third one and this one is by far the best one..there will always be something more they will change ..but I’m ready ..true happy customer $$$$

author: J. Gorin
title: Noise canceling is amazing
content: Don’t forget to buy a double prong adapter for airplanes - I did.

author: Olivia Epstein
title: great quality and sound
content: great quality and sound, I wish they were a tad louder but maybe Bose is doing my ears a favor?

author: RJB
title: A real winner.
content:
Comfort, mutes outside noise and easy to use.
Comes with a handy storage case.
Nothing to dislike although somewhat pricey.

author: Donald S.
title: The best!!!
content: Bought these pending an international vacation and knowing I'd be on an airplane for hours.  Took them with me, listened to an entire book and was worried they'd go dead part way through.  No way, they were still 70% charged.  I listened to the book, watched 2 movies and a tone of music and I never recharged them.  They just kept on working.  They're so quiet to outside noise.  Love them, can't recommend them enough and if you travel or are around others where the noise is bothersome, they're the only way to go.  Well worth the money and they're quality in their design, materials and comfort!!!

author: D
title: Bose
content: Great headphones

author: jonathan batista
title: Best out there
content: These are by far the best headphones in the market. You cannot compare them to any other the only downside is that they ask you really hot

author: FREROW
title: Falling Apart - foam showing in both ear pieces
content: Purchased in April and already the foam is coming out of both of the ear cuffs.  This is totally unacceptable for the price paid for this item.  I hang the headphones up each time, ie they are not thrown around or abused in any way.

author: Cornelious
title: Low Quality Bluetooth
content: Bluetooth connection pulsates with Samsung 4k tv.

author: LLLynn2020
title: Fantastic Quality - Great noise cancelling
content:
I originally bought the Bose for my husband and a cheaper brand (with great reviews) for myself.  After messing with the $99 ones for a year, I finally gave up and bought the Bose for myself.  The switch on the cheaper pair never worked right, but I had chalked it up to me not knowing how to use it well.  That was not the case.  The switch is defective.  The quality of the speakers is great, but the noise cancelling is much MUCH better on the Bose.  And the switches all work.

My only complaint: some of the functionality is lost on an airplane when you have to switch out of bluetooth mode to airplane mode.  I don't know why it couldn't all work when you are plugged into the device.

author: Bebot Sente
title: 3 Options for Noise Cancellation
content: I like the 3 options on noise cancellation on the Bose app. The high gives me almost 100% noise cancellation while the mid or low lets me hear what's going on around me.

author: Destinee
title: Bose is trustworthy
content: The sound quality is great but I was expecting something more. The fact you can pair two devices at once is truly a game-changer. Noise canceling is top notch. Lightweight. Comfortable.

author: Julia
title: Perfect sound, clear beautiful high and low, light and comfortable, secure fit for exercise, even great for calls
content:
I narrowed down my hunt reading various headphone review sites to upgrade my exercise music experience to three higher end headphones and couldn't narrow it further so decided to get all three to find out in side by side comparisons which would be the best for me.

[1] Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) Wireless Headphones, Noise Cancelling ($349.00)

[2] Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones WH1000XM2: Over Ear Wireless Bluetooth ($348.00)

[3] Beats Studio3 Wireless Headphones ($298.99)

I put on the Beats and the heaviness and fit gave me the sense of an impending headache the instant I put them on. That, and the sound was empty and flat compared with either Sony or Bose. What was most surprising to me was they didn't have strong bass, which I had thought they were known for.

I put on the Sony and they were bigger but somewhat better fitting, not a lot lighter, but with more of a clear and full range from high to low.

I put on the Bose and it was surprisingly and significantly lighter and better fitting than either of the others and the sound was basically perfect. Good bass, full range of highs and lows.  I have to admit that I had to switch back and forth between the Sony and the Bose about 10 times to determine if I *really* preferred the Bose to the Sony, and they were actually pretty darn close. The final element that tilted the scales in favor of Bose was they were so much lighter and better fitting, which was paramount for me since I'd be using them for exercise, so I took a 1/10th of a point of the Sony. If I was the type of person who uses headphones for sitting around enjoying music, the weight and fit would be less important and the music quality would be almost everything, and then I'd probably have to switch between the Bose and Sony another 10-20 times to figure out what the difference is and what I prefer. It's subtle; equal but different. It may come down to a matter of individual preference and the type of music you listen to.

In addition to all of the above, as I've continued to use the Bose for 'everything' - I was most surprised when on a whim I decided to see if I could place a call with them; and my two initial callers both exclaimed that this was the BEST and clearest sound talking to me they had yet experienced (For years I've tried their patience through testing calls with 10-15 different best rated wired and wireless headpieces, ear buds et al).  The rave reviews of the recipients of my calls carried from inside to outside walking the streets of NYC with all the usual sirens and traffic noise.

But most important of all, I can listen to my music in full head-filling gorgeous energizing glory when I'm exercising.

Final score:
Bose 5 stars
Sony 4.9 stars
Beats 3 stars

author: Carrie
title: Serenity Now
content: These puppies saved me on a 30 hour flight journey to Bali. I had been eyeing Bose for 3 years but couldn’t justify the money on my budget. Just buy them. Your peace is worth it. They block a TON of noise and the quality of sound is amazing. Wish I had done it sooner!  Also I was surprised at how long the battery lasted, and wasn’t expecting them to sort of fold up into their case, which I really like for travel. I got the silver and they’re so pretty and sleek. Definitely recommend.

author: KARTIKEYA SHARMA
title: Quality sound! Loving it.
content: Very light. Love the fact that it can be connected to 2 devices at the same time. Hours of listening music in minutes of charging. Well built !! Bose connect could be improved. Used it for quite a long time.

author: Donald E. Lewis
title: Expensive but they have changed my audio book experience
content: A tad expensive but I can now listen to audio books easily without background noise. These best air pods by a mile. I use mine every day.

author: Clarence Darrow
title: Quiet with Great Sound Quality and Comfort
content: these really come in handy on long flights.

author: Dmason
title: Great headphones, awful Bluetooth range
content:
These headphones check every mark. Noise cancellation is great, comfort and design are too notch, and battery life is beyond expectations.

However, the range on the Bluetooth is the worst I've ever encountered on any device. If I get more than 5 feet away from my phone, the sound drops in and out.

Hopefully this is something they can fix with a firmware update.

I plan on picking up pair of the new Sony's to see how they compare.

author: Shaun Wumkes
title: Definitely buy
content: Very cool, easy to set up and very comfortable.  Great sound, definitely getting what you pay for.

author: Elynest
title: Love them
content: Love them

author: Amazon Customer
title: great quality great sound!
content: definitely came as advertised, well made, and classic bose sound, battery life is a solid 20 hours!

author: Anonymous Bosch
title: Very effective for blocking out bass sounds like truck engines or air conditioners
content: Impressive battery life, solid bluetooth connection for two devices, expensive but not THAT expensive. Very effective for blocking out bass sounds like truck engines or air conditioners. Somewhat less effective with higher pitched noises like rustling candy wrappers or loud chatter. I have the in-ear QC earbuds too, and these are much more effective. Overall not a bad value considering the quality, I imagine these will last for ten years.

author: Aaron Dragushan
title: Good but alerts can't be adjusted and are very loud
content: Great sound. Feels nice on my head. Frustratingly, seems that there is no way to adjust the volume for any of your phones alerts that come through.  They are REALLY loud.  Like, almost painful and certainly surprising.  If your headphones are set to volume 4 (arbitrary number as an example) and things go pop in your ears at volume 9, that's not good.

author: Vandy Starkweather
title: Quality and well worth the money.
content: These headphones are fantastic! I use them while driving a tractor, and with noise cancellation I can hardly hear the tractor. Phone calls are very clear talk and receive. I used them with an iPhone X.  First time I used them out on the tractor for 4 1/2 hours and took 3 phone calls, still had 80% battery remaining.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Expensive but worth it
content: I work in an office environment with about 8 people within a 20 ft circle around me and unless they're being really loud, this blocks 95% of their conversations. Drop in a little music and you'll never hear them.

author: Seale
title: amazing
content: comfortable, amazing sound, worth the cost... can't even compare to headphones/ear buds.  Sorry I didn't get these sooner.

author: Alexei Isac
title: Average quality for a Bose
content:
Having owned Bose products since the AM7 back in the 90s, I was expecting a higher quality product for the $$ I paid.
I am deeply disappointed in the sound quality. I wish I had bought the  equivalent Sony as the noise cancelling and quality is much better on it.

The main issue I have with this is, the quality drastically goes down in non-bluetooth wired mode.

author: lynn
title: Disappointed :(
content: What a disappointment. My 30 dollar ear buds have better sound. I was hoping I would feel engulfed in the music, but not at all. Their ok, but not worth the price tag. Bummed

author: Apples
title: Not Suitable for PC - Windows 10 listening through bluetooth
content:
While the sound quality and noise cancelling is great when connected to a mobile device or phone, these headphones work terribly with a Windows 10 PCs via bluetooth.  There are endless support threads detailing this specific issue.

Even with drivers updated, following the suggestions from Bose support, and testing various different bluetooth receivers and drivers, these headphones would consistently cut out for 1-2 seconds, and at a frequent interval.

author: R. Rhodes
title: Bose doese it again
content: Great as any Bose speaker

author: Ben Evans
title: Amazing of course
content: I had been thinking about getting these for years. Finally pulled the trigger and I don’t know how I lived without them.

author: lm
title: Amazing! Love them!
content: Amazing! Absolutely love these things! Especially amazing on planes!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love it
content: Excellent for all things except functioning as a mic.

author: Aris
title: Best active noise-cancelling on-ear headphones money can buy
content:
I am a headphones and Hi-Fi enthusiast or audiophile if you will. This review is for casual and audiophile users.

Sound:
Very good sound 4/5 stars. Extended tight bass (that can be dialled down via the app at will), good definition, good musicality. Voices and single instruments don't sound "real" but music comes out with great enjoyment and overall rhythm and warm pleasant tones. You can listen to music for hours in these. They never sound like "you're really there at a live venue" - like better and more expensive headphones do - but 99% of people don't care and won't notice. You buy these headphones because they do everything rather well, and have active noise cancelling. Tip: If you really want the best sounding headphones around this price and you MUST have noise cancelling check-out the Shure 535 in-ear headphones which have far superior sound in every way and better (alas passive) noise-cancelling. Bottom line: these headphones are best value, just before diminishing returns where more money buys you fine improvements, whereas less money buys you significantly worst headphones.

My experience: Music and Hi-Fi fanatic for 20 years. Own multiple DAC's all the way up to $2000 devices, multiple $500+ headphones which I used to compare these headphones against streaming both Spotify as well as lossless Tidal.

Comfort:
These truly are the most comfortable over-ear headphones you can buy. They are light, fit beautifully with materials that feel soft and welcome to your head. Hours of easy listening await you. If comfort and noise cancelling is a priority for you look no further.

Noise Cancelling:
Myth buster first: You don't need active noise-cancelling. Passive in-ear headphones have better passive noise cancelling. The reason why you buy active noise-cancelling is either because you prefer to have on-ear rather than in-ear headphones, OR because you like to turn the noise-cancelling off some times. If you don't mind smaller and more travel-friendly in-ear headphones and don't mind having passive noise-cancelling on at all times. Do try a pair of Shure 535's before committing to on-ear headphones. All that said, Noise-cancelling on the bose is Very good 8/10.

Other:
Battery, connectivity, features, functionality are all top notch. You will not find better.

Overall I give these 5/5 stars not because they are the best headphones in the world - they are not. But they are the best on-ear noise-cancelling headphones in the world, and if you don't care for "astoundingly clear audiophile grade sound" - these are best value for the price.

Should you buy them? Yes. You will not regret it. You either know what professional and audiophile headphones and DACs sound like, in which case you wouldn't be looking at these headphones OR you don't know that you need better headphones yet, so these are the best headphones you can currently appreciate, and a great way to step into the world of great sound.

author: SkyeBlu
title: Wireless technology won’t disappoint
content: We’ve had the wired version for years. Technology has improved. The sound is crisp and full. Close your eyes and be immersed in sound. Perfect for air travel. No cord to get tangled up in.

author: G. Porat
title: Bluetooth Not Connecting is a common problem for lots of people
content:
I thought, “geez, I must be doing something wrong” because they connected the first day to my iPhoneX and then never again. Looks like there a loads of others having the same problem with these Series II headphones - internet chats/forums where nobody is finding a solution. Way too expensive for this to be a flawed product. The day they connected they sounded great, but dead in the water and not able to use them.
Update from previous one star review - Amazon did replace them and the second set connects well and sound good - just a bummer this is happening to a lot of people at this price. Still a bit fearful the problem will re-occur some day.

author: Daniel C.
title: It works great on the plane
content: We got 3 of the Bose wireless headphones in the past 3 years. We take long plane trip to Asia every year. It works great on the plane, both for noise cancellation and for music . My father works in the engineering lab, the headphone cancels the noise there well. Eventually, we got this one as a gift for my cousin in China.

author: BCraw9
title: As good as it gets!
content: Pure Bliss.  Great battery life and quick charging.  Auto shut off in case you forget.  Sound quality is amazing.  Comfort is off the charts.  They collapse tightly and fit nicely into a case that's easy to travel with.

author: Creedan
title: Love it!
content: No complaints. Must have for anyone who travels on a plane.

author: Joseph Tress
title: No problems
content: No problems

author: Em
title: Best headphones I’ve ever owned
content: Hands down the best headphones I’ve ever owned. I was hesitant to spend this much money on a pair of headphones, but it checked off everything I was looking for: noise cancelling, over-ear fit, good audio quality, an audio jack so I can use them with non-Bluetooth devices, and supremely comfortable so I can listen for hours on end and not notice them on my ears. They are perfect for staying immersed in the sound of whatever you’re listening to, so you can tune out outside noise. I like that you can pair them with more than once device, so I ca easily switch as I move around the house or transition from the car to my phone or laptop. They also charge very quickly and each charge lasts me several days of heavy listening, or a week or more with casual listening.

author: P. McMillan
title: Quality
content: I did a lot of research on noise cancelling earphones because the really good ones are so expensive.  I finally decided to go with Bose because I knew they were good quality and have top notch technology.  I could not be more thrilled.  I absolutely love these earphones.  They are comfortable and do an amazing job.  Of course, they are not going to block out noise 100%, no earphones are at that point yet, but I would say at least 80% when there is no music and 95% when there is.  They also do a great job of holding a charge.  You really do get what you pay for, and these are worth every penny!

author: Steven M. Brodsky
title: Make my ears hurt
content: Maybe it's me but these things really start to hurt my ears after about 2 hours of wear.  I bought them for a long flight and 2 hours in my ears were killing me.  I had to switch to my Air Pods.  The noise cancellation was just okay; nothing special.  I think you are just paying for the Bose name.  Save your money and try something else.

author: William R. Langston
title: A good product.
content: I have owned a pair of the first noise-cancelling head phones Bose marketed for decades. Years ago I flew to India (East Asia) and Europe more or less regularly. That alone explains the need for, and use of, the headphones. This latest iteration is usable as the original ones. I can only hope they last as long.

author: Amazon Customer
title: me like
content: yay

author: R Foster
title: Very comfortable, I have a hard time finding earphones that ...
content: Very comfortable, I have a hard time finding earphones that are big enough to really be comfortable.  Used them for the first time on a plane trip this past weekend.  I put them on before take off and asked my husband why they shut the engine off - then realized the noise canceling worked that well.  VERY pleased with my purchase.

author: Otto
title: What jet engines?
content: Treat yourself. If you spend any amount of time in an aircraft you need these.

author: joe
title: First time going with Bose and wow!
content:
The noise cancellation is outstanding! I can have 3 large fans set to high and these will completely cancel them out. I can't wait to try these on an airplane! The sound quality is the best I've experienced so far in my life. My "top of the line" gaming headset is a bit of a let down compared to these. I bought a Bluetooth dongle just so I could use these with my computer, yeah I my MB doesn't have BT.

They breath well and don't make your head/ears hot or sweaty. I think I have larger ears but these fit just fine. I do have to adjust about every hour or so because they press on my Tragus but that's it. They are nice and light weight.

I am still looking but haven't found anything better than these. I do recommend them!

author: Joe E.
title: Poor performance. Loud and annoying crackling noise when airplane takes-off or lands.
content: First time I used my new headset on a flight this week.  I settled in my seat and set the headset's noise cancelling level to high, connected to my phone and began listing to music.  Everything was good.  However I about jumped out of my seat once the jet engines revved up for takeoff. There was a loud, pronounced, and annoying crackling noise in both sides of the headset that lasted until we were airborne.  The same thing happened after touchdown when the jet engine's reverse thrusters kicked-in.  It seems the noise cancelling capabilities were overwhelmed and couldn't handle level of noise produced by the jet engines during take-off and landing.  I never experienced this problem with my old Bose Quiet Comfort 25 headset.  Also, they performed very poorly cancelling out voice conversations around me, a baby crying behind me, and the flight attendant's intercom announcement.  My old Bose QuietComfort 25 were excellent at cancelling out all these sounds.  After the flight, I searched on Bose's web site and found that mine was not an isolated experience.  Others shared similar experiences with their headsets and were equally disappointed. Bose tech support posted replies to the complaints stating that is was normal.  Needless to say I'm very disappointment with the performance of the QuietComfort 35 (Series II) and will be returning them for a refund.  I've read good things about Sony's latest noise cancelling headset and will give them a try.  Bose needs to address these performance issues or risk losing more customers.

author: I_Am_Jane_Doe
title: Buy them! You’ll be happy with your purchase.
content: I’m so in love with them! I never thought of how much noise is around me until I don’t hear it any more. Noise reduction is amazing. Very comfortable. Best birthday gift to myself!

author: cndirector1
title: Excellent Quality
content: Love these headphones! Wireless is fantastic.

author: Nigel Bennett
title: Comfortable. Significant improvement on the earlier version
content: Works well.  Comfortable.  Significant improvement on the earlier version.  Rather frustrating that it came with a booklet of largely self evident safety warnings but you had to search online for any instructions on set up.

author: Just another guy
title: Bose noise cancelling headphones
content: I got these as replacements for my old Bose headphones. Just as good as the old ones and now with a USB charging, one less charger I have to lug around.

author: R. Grande
title: Quietly Comfortable!
content: My son loves these - very comfortable, great sound and when flying as they can completely block out engine noise but can be adjusted to allow some surroundings to filter through when needed.  Still learning how to take advantage of Google features.  Highly recommended.

author: Gabeeon
title: Bose Quality
content: One word: Quality!  Love this headphone. I cant travel without it!
