author: Andreas Muck
title: AMAZING noise cancelling
content:
I just want to mention one thing about these headphone. The noise canceling is out of this world!! After being disappointed by a Chinese brand headphone Indecided to try the top of the league and I am impressed every day! Today I was listening to some music with noise cancelling turned to high and my son started playing the drums in the other room. I couldn’t believe it that I DIDN’T EVEN NOTICE IT! I just felt the vibration in my desk and only when I turned the music off I knew where it was coming from.

There are tons of other awesome details about these headphones, but I just wanted to mention the noise canceling, because it’s really amazing!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great sound and comfy
content: Nice headphones has a great sound, the noise cancellation is great i like how i can't hear anything but my music. Best headphones i have had so far better than beats headphones to me. They also are comfortable especially at the gym

author: Michael
title: Five Stars
content: Worth every penny

author: Ronald Fisher
title: Great on airplanes--perfect for that
content: Great on airplanes--perfect for that! Little hot, little heavy, but well worth it. Audio quality seems very good, but I'm not an audiophile.Fold into very compact space so I can easily keep in small backpack compartment.

author: Stephen Hauseur
title: Great headphones, but pricey
content: Got this for my wife’s Birthday and she loves them. Just wish I could pair them to the Onkyo receiver. Works great on iPad even without the app.

author: anelab
title: Not up to the Series 1 quality
content: These are supposed to be the gold standard of wireless noise canceling headphones. The wired version I gave my son actually canceled noise. On my first flight with them they merely dulled the external jet engine noise. Not a pleasure to wear. The comfort does not match the series 1 either. You know you are wearing them. They cramp the ears.

author: techsuprmomma
title: I'm all about that bass...
content: Finally!  I can stay focused and not have to listen to annoying co-workers eat chips like cows or talk to themselves excessively. I love how I can also have them connect to multiple devices and how it announces notifications on my phone and computers and also lets me know the battery levels.  The color is awesome as well!  Now lurkers will see them and try to get my attention before speaking lol.  Love these!  Great sound quality and they are comfortable as well.

author: Michelle Delacy
title: Make sure to check return window and product function
content: Only one side receives audio.  Bought these for a trip and found out on the airplane. Amazon only offers one month return window - wish I would’ve checked these before my trip. Now I have to try to work with the manufacturer. Who only offers a one-month return window on such an expensive purchase? I don’t even want to return them I just want to exchange for a set that works.

author: Anna P
title: High quality and worth the price!
content: Worth the price! Bought these for my fiancé after he lost his old pair of Bose headphones which were about 10 years older than this pair. He was happy to upgrade and thanks me every time he uses these! Great noise cancellation and amazing sound quality.

author: Seth Junot
title: Five Stars
content: Great for phone and conference calls, listening to music, and silencing the terrible hum of an airplane engine.

author: james d
title: Nice to be wireless
content: I've has wired bose nc headphones forever. The freedom of wireless is nice, especially on airplanes. One gripe, though: Every time you turn it on you have to endure the auto voice reading off connection and battery info. I use my headphones in the morning a lot when there's noise and I really don't like having to hear that voice.

author: Jason B.
title: I love fricking bose so much dude.
content:
I wanted to use these headphones for a few days before I left a review.  I didn't pay $349.99.  I had amazon credit so I actually spent about 180.  Are they worth $350?  who knows.  But they're deff worth the price I paid for them.  When I first got them I had to download the bose connect app.  After the initial download, it updated firmware- I'm guessing to get the Alexa feature on the app.  I've had them for 4 or so days now.  I was just about to leave a bad review until I finally realized what I was doing wrong.  Turns out the action button is on the left side.  So this whole time I thought Alexa wasn't working and it was just google assistant.  So remember the action button for alexa etc is on the left ear, folks.  Now.... I won't leave the house with these headphones... too expensive.  Neighbor was getting upset that my music was too loud one night.  So I needed a solution.  These bose headphones was it.  So here I am typing this while wearing the bose headphones with noise cancellation on.  I can't hear my fingers type/click on my keyboard.  I feel like i'm in an airbubble with nothing but music.  It's futuristic af.  I wan't to say they could be a little louder, but being in bands all my life around music pretty much shot my hearing anyways, so they're just fine.  They're comfortable af.  Ears don't hurt. Just what I wanted, over the ear.  I swear to God i was just about to write a bad review about the alexa feature not working after spending days without itworking, come to find out there's a dang button on the left! LOL,  so go ahead and buy em.  As a bose fan, I give them a 5.  price wise, you get what you pay for.  bluetooth is simple.  i don't know what nfc is, but it has that.  i'm able to have my desktop computer pair with my phone at the same time, so that's rad.  I can go from youtube videos on my computer to telephone calls on my phone with a hit of a button. Smart!  I still can't get over this noise cancellation.  I really do feel like I'm sucked in a box with nothing but music playing.  Can't hear nothing from the outside.  I've only charged this once and on my 4th day at 80%. with volume pretty high and noise cancellation on.  App is easy to use.  At least buy em, and if you don't like em.  return em.  You got 30 days and Amazon is good for it.  i love amazon so much.  Merry Christmas, folks!

UPDATE: BEST HEADPHONES EVER!  BEST THING I'VE EVER BOUGHT ON AMAZON IN THE PAST 2 YEARS! USE THEM EVERY DAY WHEN I GET OFF WORK.  NEIGHBORS ARE HAPPY!  SO GOOD! BUY THEM! 7/14/19

author: Jon Brewer
title: Just as good as the QC25's, but connecting to laptop was a bit of a pain.
content:
Lost my QC25's on a flight, so decided to upgrade to the wireless cans this round. Sounds and feels just as good as the 25's I had before, and the wireless feature is very nice. Battery life is more than adequate and can handle nearly a week of conference calls, music, or just silencing out airplane drone.

Two small quibbles I do have, though: First, getting the headset connected properly to my Dell laptop (Win 10) was a total pain. It didn't want to work for about 24 hrs, then only connected audio (no mic) for another 24, then miraculously the whole thing started working perfectly. I do have some issues where it will cut out sound from one application (say Skype) when another butts in (say and email notification). Second, there is no button to adjust the noise cancelling feature...it's all housed in the app. 90% of the time, this if fine, but today my phone was missing somewhere in the house, and I was connected on a call on my laptop. Made it impossible to adjust the noise cancellation.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Super comfortable and perfect noise cancellation
content:
Got them for work because I like to solve everything and need to concentrate. They work perfect!

You can have them around your neck and still hear the music if you want or there are varying levels of noise cancelation. You can be totally zoned if you want.

Easy to play music all day on. They’ll outlast a phone easy.

author: Jonathan Klohn
title: Sound quality excellent!
content: The battery life is really good. Sound quality is excellent. Very comfortable.

author: Steve
title: Unwanted Noise Extinguisher!
content: This item is phenomenal! I used it on a recent flight and listened to classical music, no engine nose, no crying babies, no conversations, just brilliantly clear stereophonic Mozart! I also use when riding lawn mower. Engine nose is but a muffle and is extinguished by turning up the headphone volume. The unit is pricey but not unreasonable. Received in 48hrs with Prime.  Can recommend without reservation.

author: Bushido
title: My wife loves them. She described them as "Amazing" ...
content: My wife loves them. She described them as "Amazing". I tried them myself and what can I say...it's you & your music against the world !

author: BDA
title: Great
content: These made me like Bose.  Light weight, comfortable, great noise cancelling

author: Tina
title: A bit expensive for sound quality
content: It blocks out low frequency noise like a plane engine but I could still hear a baby crying in the background. The sound is good for music when listening via Bluetooth but the sound is only ok for movies and shows with the cable. With the rumble of the plane engine, it almost wasn't loud enough to hear the dialogue. I had to turn the volume on my tablet up all the way.

author: Pnkamal
title: Great sound
content: As expected

author: WA engineerd
title: Great sound and noise cancellation, like it paired with better with external mic for calls
content: I think the sound quality and noise cancellation is great with the Quietcomfort 35 ii.  During the summer, I usually have an AC unit or a fan going in my office, so I wanted great noise cancellation, and these definitely deliver;; I can hardly hear any ambient noise when they're on.  They are very comfortable to wear too.  For the price, I wasn't real happy with the sound quality from the internal mic though.  It's not bad, but it's not great.  I'm not sure if it's a wired vs. Bluetooth connection thing (I've generally heard that wired connections produce better mic sound quality).  I bought these mainly to use for work, and I spend a couple hours on the phone everyday.  I did some audio tests between its internal mic and my wired Apple Earpods, and I honestly think the mic in my wired Earpods sounds a little better.  I researched headset-type boom mics and found good reviews for the V-Moda BoomPro mic.  The Quietcomfort 35 ii has a 2.5mm audio port (the user manual incorrectly says 3.5 mm), and the BoomPro mic has a 3.5mm jack.  I found a 2.5mm male by 3.5mm female adapter from SFCable, and it works great to connect the two.  I much prefer the sound quality from the BoomPro mic over the internal headset mic, but for most folks, I think you'll be OK with the internal mic. Overall, I am happy with these headphones, and I really like them paired with the V-Moda BoomPro mic for phone calls.

author: Cat dad
title: Lightweight, and beautiful.
content:
Bought these headphones to replace my last pair of noise-canceling headphones (TurtleBeach i30).  They come with a sturdy carry case which is a bonus in my opinion since I do travel a bit.

Build - Lightweight, and sturdy.  Felt good on the ears with an extended music listening session.  I also like the simplicity of the design as well.

I’m no audiophile, but the sound quality is wonderful.  Bass is solid without being overwhelming too.

Noise cancellation - I know these aren’t supposed to be used for canceling out a battery powered lawn mower hum, but they out preformed the i30 on that feat.  As for what they’re supposed to cancel out, ambient noise and people talking?  They’re far superior too, don’t expect them to mute the whole world though.

Bluetooth pairing with my phone was extremely simple too, and it’s app is streamlined too.

Haven’t set up the headphones with Alexa yet, and will update this section when I do.

author: LUMBAN
title: It fit comfortably around the ear
content: I just used this during 13 hours flight from US to Japan and it worked very well. It fit comfortably around the ear, and as expected the noise cancellation of Bose reduces the plane noise to acceptable level.

author: Mohit Mirani
title: The best with Bose
content:
I am delighted to have this. Each and every beat is audible and is a treat for music lovers.
Pros :
1. Great Build
2. Comfortable Ear Buds
3. Support Cushion on the top band
4. Comes with Charger and Audio cable
5. The battery life is really very good.
6. The controls are simple to use.
7. It comes with a case (Bose) (That's the  best part, I need to require to buy a case for the same)
Cons:
None Yet :)

author: bu
title: I love these headphones
content: I have owned many professional and prosumer studio headphones (Sony MDR-7509HD, Sennheiser HD380 and Shure SRH440). I edit audio and video on my computer all the time, so I'm often critical of the sound quality I'm monitoring. Here's my honest opinion on these headphones. The bass is exaggerated when playing music at low to mid volumes (the bass is less exaggerated at higher volumes). If you are used to the "Bose" sound, this isn't that big a deal, but I would stay away from these headphones if you are being paid to do post production work. That being said, I love these headphones!! The noise cancellation feature is amazing. I live in a complex where daytime noise (landscapers, cars...) is noticeable. These Bose headphones remove most of the ambient noise and the Bluetooth range allows me to listen to music in the living room while my computer is on the other side of a wall in my home office. The battery life is easily 12 hours if you don't crank up the volume. Not sure about the battery life listening to music with the volume turned up. Don't like being forced to download a Google app to experience all of the features though.

author: travis
title: They play my Motörhead plenty loud.
content: Wow is what my wife and I both said when we turned them on. I use them daily as a mechanic in a Harley-Davidson service department. So to me they are more noise reduction not noise cancelling. They work pretty good listening to talk radio. And work best when listening to music. Very comfortable to wear.

author: acujules
title: noise cancellation is not good
content: I had high expectations for the noise cancellation on these headphones, given that they are the most highly rated on the market, but they got a big fat FAIL from us. With the noise cancellation on High, the ambient noise disappears, but you can still hear talking, snoring, and keyboard typing. What's up with that? With the music on, the talking and sounds are diminished a bit more, but you shouldn't have to have music playing to make the noise cancellation work. We just bought the Beats Studio 3 for our son for his birthday, and the noise cancellation on them is outstanding. You cannot hear anything when they are on. We are returning these and ordering the Beats Studio 3.

author: db
title: Great product, but does not beat out Sony
content:
After weeks of research and comparison, I bought a pair of Sony WH1000XM3.  A week later, my wife surprised me with  a pair of Bose QC 35s (forgetting that I had already purchased the Sony's).  I opened the Bose QC in order to test them, figuring I would keep the better of the two and sell the others.

The reviews I had read were pretty much even between the two.  Nothing really gave me confidence that one was better for my uses or my preferences than the other.  Now after having both, I can say that I strongly prefer and recommend the Sony over the Bose.

First and foremost - the sound out of the Sony WH1000XM3 is not only better, but you can customize it using the app.
 Tweak everything about the sound in the app.  This is, to me the biggest point because the Bose QC 35's are surprisingly lacking in bass.  I own a pair of Bose SoundSports which are great for working out, with great bass right out of the box - which is why I was so surprised that the QC would pack less of a punch than their in-ear buds.  The Sony WH1000XM3 out of the box sounds good, but the ability to customize the sound through the equalizer in the app is a huge advantage over the Bose QC 35s.

The touch controls on the Sony are great as well.  Intuitive and responsive.  The controls on the Bose are straight forward and work fine, but I do like the ability to just reach up and swipe, tap, or put my hand over the ear cup to hear the ambient sounds as opposed to finding the right button (first world problem, I know, but it is a great feature).

The noise canceling is indistinguishable to me.  Both work great.  I could not tell a difference as I switched between the two of them while watching TV, or observing the kids while arguing.  I wore the Sony for a 2.5 hour flight with no fatigue or discomfort at all.  Not sure about the Bose, but I don't think they would cause any issues or discomfort - they feel pretty much the same on the head/ears.

A couple additional small wins for Sony:
The fact that the case comes with small sectioned off areas separated by cloth for your 3.5mm jack and USB.  Bose does not have this, which means you can use the pocket on the cover (one inside and one outside) but if you use the one inside the cords are pressed into the ear cups.
Sony uses USB-C.  No guessing which side is up when plugging into the headphones to charge.
Sony comes with an Airplane jack adapter.  Even though most airlines use the single prong input now, it's nice to have, just in case.

If Bose had an equalizer, the sound could most likely be made to be equal, if not better than the Sony.  But the equalizer feature on the Sony WH1000XM3 enables me to really dial in the sound, leaving the Bose sounding flat in comparison.  That alone puts them over the top for me.  The additional features alone would not be enough for me to accept inferior quality, but I don't have to.  All it together puts Sony way out ahead in my opinion.

author: Connie
title: Best in every category
content:
you will not regret buying these ! I sleep kn them (not recommended but that’s how comfortable they are) my day begins and ends with them on and the pairing and functionality is a breeze. 5 stars all the way.

If you can get two pair get two , one for home one for travel.

author: Shawn Swaithes
title: Five Stars
content: So comfortable. If you travel often these are perfect

author: Amber Girl
title: Saving my sanity (and hearing!) at work, one day at a time
content: I no longer have to listen at high volume to drown out people's conversations. I even took them on a flight and was able to sleep during the flight with quiet music. The band is sturdy, it folds neatly into the case, and has padding where it rests on my head. Can wear this comfortably for hours and it doesn't hurt. The range is decent. Unlike other headsets, this one doesn't ping you every time the battery level changes. You are notified of percent available when turned on and only when power is nearly drained. Pairing was easy and painless. Very happy!!

author: Miles M.
title: Not BOSE Performance that I was expecting
content: Very bummed about the quality of these headphones. I mainly use these with Bluetooth to my iPhone. The static/crackling sound is terrible and Any volume level under 80% is way too low. I’m not sure if I got a defective product I’ll have to try and exchange these and see if I have the same problems

author: Victor Hache
title: The level of comfort these provide compensates every other possible flaw
content:
I was not sure on which noise cancelling headphones to get between these and the new Sony WH-1000XM3 for me and my wife and all reviews were very vague (e.g. "which ones should you get?, well, it depends, if you like this or that buy Bose, but if you like other thinks like Sony. Useless!!). So I bought one of each and have had the chance to use them both and compare for more than a month already on a daily basis.

I must say  I was intending to like the Sony's more for their marketing gimmicks like "4x better noise cancelling and all day comfort", but I found Bose's noise cancelling still good enough vs the Sony and the level of comfort on the Bose has not real point of comparison. They are just very enjoyable to wear for long hours, while the Sony tend to warm up the ears and feel heavy after a few hours.

If you are still undecided between Sony and Bose like I was, I really recommend going for the Bose QC35ii.

author: James Avett
title: love it
content: i recently bought 4 bluetooth headphones for me and my boys.  my wife wanted a pair and I thought I would splurge and buy these, mainly because she likes rose gold and I have had good experiences with bose.  i got these today and my wife is out of town.  man, I've been on these for 4 hours and I can't even tell they are on.  light, great sound,  comfortable.  love, love them.  when my cheap pair breaks,  i am buying one for me.  worth every penny.

author: mdo_01
title: Solid excellence I have come to expect from Bose
content: I have used a set of QC 25's for years.  I love the comfort.  I love the audio quality.  I love the noise cancelation function as compared to some others I have checked out.  (Not extensive research by any means....)  Would be 5 stars but for one thing.  The cable that came with it is flimsy compared to the QC25's cable.  I know it's less important since we have bluetooth functionality.  I play a digital piano using headphones.  The delay with the bluetooth is enough to force me to use the cable.  (As it happens, I have a spare good one.)  It's just not up to the quality that I expect (and PAY FOR) with Bose.

author: George Carter
title: Great for noisy planes
content: I travel in airplanes a lot and these are the trick for quiet travel. You can really tell a difference when you are watching a movie. The plane noise is not heard.

author: Andreas
title: Mom, dad, thank you so much
content:
My parents surprised me with these headphones as a gift for finishing the school year as I did very well. Both my parents had a pair for work and other purposes and have been using them nonstop for the passed year; needless to say, it was time for me to have one as well.
There are very few gifts that parents can give that bring absolute joy to their kids. I mean it is hard enough for them to find gifts that they can be sure their kids will truly enjoy and fit their style. Anyway, as I placed these comfortably - very comfortably - over my head and turned them on, my jaw actually dropped. I had never heard of this level of noise canceling (haha see what I did there). I continuously took them on and off my head for the same insane affect.
After about a week and a half of using, I felt compelled to leave a review for these amazing headphones. Truly 10/10 for all use cases: music, noise canceling, plane flights, and all day everyday usage.
So much gratitude to my parents for purchasing these for me (hint hint to all the parents out there).

author: Edward
title: Tried it out on an International flight - great sound and really eliminates the airplane loud noise
content: Tried it out on an International flight - great sound and really eliminates the airplane loud noise.  You will need to buy the 2 prong adapter for some airplanes.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Overpriced, typical Bose. Bad for gaming
content: DO NOT BUY FOR GAMING. Has a half second or so latency (lag/delay) with Windows 10 which is easy to notice, and CANNOT BE IMPROVED BY ANY MEANS because of these headphones’ chipset. Good headphones for music, but for the price You can do better. Fine active noise canceling, a lot like my $60 mpow set’s ANC to be honest. Waste of money, returned.

author: N. Baliga
title: Excellent sound and extremely comfortable
content:
Excellent set of headphones.

Noise cancellation is really good. Have used it on a few cross country flights and I can tell that I arrived much more relaxed without all the plane humming noise ringing in my head.

Sound quality is really good. I thought my Jaybird in-ear X3's were good but this sets a different audio standard.

I use it for podcasts, lots of music, and watching shows in bed from my tablet.

Main differentiator IMO is comfort. Ive tried other over ears in stores and this one is so light and comfortable that I can easily wear for hours without feeling any strain or discomfort.

author: Ogden Carter
title: You get what you pay for
content: Bought for wife Christmas. She absolutely loves them.

author: nog642
title: Worthwhile purchase
content:
I've had these for about 8 months now, and they're pretty good. Headphones are the most worthwhile purchase I've made in a while, although whether other headphones would also have been just as good is not a question I can answer.

The battery is very impressive. They will last all day starting with a full charge, and the charging speed is very impressive. a few minutes minutes and it's got enough charge to last several hours.

The noise cancellation is not perfect, I can still very much hear sounds going on outside, but it works in that I've never been in a situation where I couldn't hear the audio I was playing through the headphones because the background noise was drowning it out. At first, when I used the noise cancellation, I felt an uncomfortable pressure on my ears, but after using the headphones for a while it stopped really being uncomfortable.

The carrying case is rather compact for these bulky headphones, which is nice because it makes them more portable.

Here are some other minor complaints I have:
- The bluetooth can sometimes be a bit glitchy, but no so much so that it's ever prevented me from using the headphones—usually just a small inconvenient delay.
- The headphones aren't that nice to wear around your neck. What I would prefer would be that both the ear cups would rotate (the right one counterclockwise and the left one clockwise) so the part that faces your ear now faces your chest. But the cups don't rotate that way, they rotate the other way (the right one clockwise and the left one counterclockwise) so the part that faces your ear faces away from your chest. It's just slightly less comfortable that way.
- The battery percentage that is reported is not at all linear. It will take very long to get from 100% to 70% but then not very long to go from 70% to 0%.

author: AlisonA
title: Excellent
content: There were a surprise Mother's Day gift, and I LOVE them! Airplane travel is so much more comfortable with the noise drowned out, and music is so much more enjoyable with the sound quality for which Bose is famous. The bluetooth connectivity is a nice upgrade, too, allowing me to move around the house a bit while listening to podcasts, web conference calls, etc.

author: Orangeman
title: Tough Choice Between The Bose QC 35 and the Sony 1000XM2
content:
After doing a lot of research, it ultimately came down to the Bose QC 35 and Sony 1000XM2.  I tried them both for several days but in the end, the Bose QC 35 was my choice, which wasn't an easy one to make.  You can't go wrong with either pair as they are both very nice headphones.  The final decision for me was whether I wanted a little better quality (Sony) or better fit/comfort (Bose).  I chose comfort and the Bose 1000XM2.  Here are some other things I noticed...

SOUND QUALITY:
No question at all, the Sony 1000Xm2 are better sounding headphones.  Don't get me wrong, the Bose are still very good.  However, I really liked and preferred the bass response of the Sony over the Bose.  Bose are the brighter sounding headphones but the biggest difference was how they sound with bass, which Sony does better.

FIT / COMFORT:
The Bose gets the edge on fit/comfort.  They are VERY comfortable and light!  The Sony 1000xm2 are fine but they fit a bit more snug than Bose.  At first, I actually preferred the Sony fit.  However, after having them on for an hour or longer, that's where I noticed the biggest difference... ear fatigue.  Much less ear fatigue with the Bose.  That all being said, what is more comfortable to me might be less comfortable to you.  You just have to try them on, ideally for extended periods of time.  I bought these particularly when I fly where I plan to wear them for hours at a time.  Even though I prefer the sound quality of the Sony, I just couldn't get over the incredibly comfortable fit of the Bose.

BLUETOOTH CONNECTIVITY:
Both do a fine job here but the Bose were the more reliable in establishing a connection without having to fiddle around with settings.  When comparing the Sony and the Bose, I often went back and forth trying when trying out the headphones.  Every time that I went back to the Bose, it was fast and easy.  With the Sony pair, I had to go into my Bluetooth settings a few times in order to get a connection.  It really wasn't a big deal but the Bose gets the edge here because it is painless and works more reliably.

DURABILITY:
I won't give either pair the edge here because I only had them for a week BUT do keep in mind that the Sony 1000xm1 had issues with the headband cracking.  Because Sony hasn't clearly stated whether they resolved the issue with the xm2's, it's anyone's guess.  This alone probably wouldn't keep me from going with the XM2's but it is something to consider.

CONTROLS:
I like them both and consider this a toss up.  With the Sony pair, you just swipe the headphones to control the music and volume while the Bose has hard buttons.  At first, I definitely preferred the hard buttons that are on the Bose.  However, after getting used to swiping on the Sony's, I found it easy enough to do.  Which do I prefer?  Probably the hard buttons because they are a bit more reliable than the swiping.  This is very subjective though and I could see some preferring the swiping while others preferring the hard buttons.  It just depends on what you like.  For me, I found both to work fine.  The Sony does have a feature where you can put you hand over the right headphone and it will allow you to hear outside noise without having to take them off.  Cool feature?  Maybe for some but for me, I didn't see any use for it.  If someone approaches me while wearing big headphones like these, I'm going to take them off my head rather than keeping them on with my hand cupping the right headphone.  It just seems a bit rude not to do so.

FEATURES:
They both have their pluses and minuses here.  It really depends on what is most important to you.  I really like how the Sony 1000XM2 allows you to customize the sound (including equalizer).  It also has the ability to modify you settings depending on where you are listening to them by simply pressing a button.  I don't really no what impact that has though because I only tried this a couple of times.  The fact of the matter is that Sony provides a bit more customization which I like!  The Bose has google assistant which I found to be a cool feature.  I could live without this but it is a nice feature.  The feature that I found VERY useful on the Bose is the ability to play text messages through the headphones.  I was on a flight recently where we were waiting for our turn to take off.  While listening to my music, I was notified that I had a text message.  Instead of having to reach for my phone (Sony) the Bose pair allowed me to just push the action button to hear the text.  I found this awesome.  Sony does not have this feature.  What headphones gets the edge?  For me, it's another toss up.  I really like the customization of the Sony but the Bose are very cool with being able to read my text messages (and google assistant).

LOOKS:
They both look great!  I had the gold/beige Sony's and the silver Bose.  I might give a slight edge to Bose as I like the silver look and the Bose logo on each headphone.  However, this is very subjective.

SUMMARY:
This is one of those times where you just can't go wrong with either pair.  They both have their pros and cons but in the end, for me, I prefer the Bose QC 35 by a very small margin.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bose quality and comfort! Worth every penny
content: Perfect! Comfortable, easy to pair. Superior sound quality. Hear your old favorite songs with detail you never knew existed. Makes air travel enjoyable again!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very Comfortable
content: So comfortable. Especially after comparing with what I thought was peak comfort (DT 770s). The QC35s encompass my entire ear perfectly. There is little to no compression on my ears and the ear pads feel soft around the skin the ear pads rest upon. Compared to my dt770s, the DT770s Press against the top of my ears. The way the QC35 pads are angled couture to the shape of my ear. My Dt770s while the pads are bigger, are circular and dont form to my ear shape so they are always pressing on some part no matter the adjustment. As far as sound goes the dt770s (5mm jack into a magni sound block) blow the QC35 out of the water but the QC35 still sound great being wireless. Overall I'd say I have a good balance between sound and functionality between the two, depending whether i want to consume media or music.

author: Rosalind
title: Great Headphones!
content: These are the headphones you want to go for if you're interested in something with a great deal of bass (Beats for bass). These have an even sound to them. The noise cancellation is AMAZING to say the least, and the overall quality is great. I was able to turn the bass up on my phone so they sound great with the bass, but the music is so clear and sounds just so good. The build of the headphones are also great. I bought the SoundTrue wired headphones about 4 years ago, and those were also built wonderfully. I'm not a die-hard Bose fan, but I will say that the quality of their headphones is superb. I hope to see their continued success!

author: Scott L
title: Great headphones
content: Awesome sound and battery life.  My only complaint is that they fade out with my older work laptop.  I know the quality of the Bluetooth has improved significantly, so it is probably an issue with this laptop, but it is annoying.

author: Nishan Hovsepian
title: Glad I got these
content: A bit pricey but well worth it. Just putting them on reduces noise and when you turn it on it almost clears your head. You can still hear thing but its very minimal. Sound and base is amazing. Battery is long lasting and quick charging. Don't know remember how long it lasts but made it trough a five hour flight easy. This was a great buy!

author: jswest
title: My comparison: Bose vs Sony
content:
OK, my personal comparison of the Sony WH-1000Xm2 and the Bose is complete. After reading all the reviews, the Sony seemed to win out, but with Amazon's generous return policy, I purchased both and did a several hour comparison yesterday. Both are great, but here's what pushed me over the edge for Bose.

1. Sound. I am not an audiophile so the terms I use in this section to describe what I experienced may be technically incorrect terms, so bear with me. The Bose sound is amazing. It is crisp and clean and full. I can hear so much more in the same music I have been listening to for years. It's hard to explain but the Sony seemed compressed while the Bose feels full. The highs are better on the Bose and the there is separation in the music. The bass on the Sony seems louder, but not crisp and clean like it does on the Bose. The Sony sound is very good but compressed and almost muddy compared to the Bose. I know reviews say the Sony sounds better, but I just don't hear it that way. I found myself cutting my Sony tests short so I could go back to the Bose.

2. Comfort. The Bose is lighter and more comfortable for me. The Sony felt heavy in comparison.

Every other feature became unimportant to me after hearing the sound and feeling the comfort. Both eliminated noise and did everything else fine.

Nothing against the Sony WH-1000Xm2 - it is an excellent product, but for me I'm keeping the Bose and sending back the Sony's.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Noise cancellation is great
content: Great headphones they are everything I expected and live up to all the great reviews.

author: KL Ward
title: Headphones are comfortable
content: The headphones are comfortable and my ears didn’t get hot. I recommend Bose.

author: Debbie Snow
title: Love them
content: Love them but the noise cancelling isn’t as good as the wired ones.

author: Bowen
title: Great pair of headphones
content: Great pair of headphones! I upgraded form the QC 25s and it was worth the extra bit of money. Noise-canceling on-point and audio still holds up well compared to the wired model.

author: CookiesGalore
title: Worth the price
content: I bit the bullet and bought this headphone initially because I work from home, and there was a month-long construction outside.  It amazes me to this day how well the noise cancelling works.  I could hear some noise--especially ones that boomed (more because of the physical vibration of those sounds), but it cancelled out 70% of it, which was enough for me.  The construction is over now, but I use it everyday still because it's so comfortable, and easy to use.  The battery life lasts well throughout the day.

author: roxie schliesmann
title: love these
content: perfect condition and great sound, would buy again

author: AD
title: Best headphones for flying
content: Best headphones to fly with hands down. Better than the V1 because you can turn off NC to save battery.

author: Nanny
title: Headset is so great.
content: Concerned about quality of music with bluetooth but a none issue........Love this set of Headphones! Use when mowing pastures ........nothing but my music.

author: melissa miller
title: will brake in under a year no matter the care
content:
Cons - they stopped connecting to Bluetooth for no reason for about 2 weeks then started working again.

Using them every day for 8 months sound stopped working on right side apparently it's pretty common.

Can't use them in high wind or in car with windows down .

Short Bluetooth range 15ft

Pro's- they sound great

Very comfortable I often forget that they are on

Sound canceling is very good I've mowed the lawn with them

Battery life good charge quick.

I Don't recommend buying them unless you're not going to use them that much or you can replace them annually.

author: Tautvydas J.
title: Good noice cancellation
content:
I found it boringly good. Owned it for 1.5 month had no problem so far. I am satisfied with build quality - plastics feels nice and no cracking sound can be heard when in use.
Very useful when travelling - removes noice during a flight
Great in office

Sound lacks bass, but if you turn off noice cancellation, it gets much better.
Important thing to note - you cannot use it when it is being charged. Bluetooth will not turn on during that period. Of course you can connect using cable instead, but that would not solve problem completely as buzzing in background can be heard all the time when charging is in place.

author: kiasar
title: Amazing quality, amazing NC, just amazing
content:
I loved the quality, works like a charm, whether it’s on the noisy Bart, or if I am at home next to the loud kids, battery is amazing and hasn’t let
Me down yetn

author: Terkel Gjervig
title: Best headphoens
content: I'm very sensitive to noise and I've been using Bose for many years. They never let me down.

author: Daniel L. Fritts
title: Perfect for a plane ride
content: Travel a lot so thought I would spend a lot of money and take a chance. Because noise canceling works best with a constant sound pattern these are perfect for a plane. The background hum just disappears. Highly recommend these, although I’ve heard the Sony equivalent are just as good and a little cheaper.

author: Layla
title: Great Replacement for 15 Year Old Bose
content:
As a replacement for my older Bose this set has excellent sound and noise canceling.
I use these mainly for air travel. The color is easy to spot if I take them off. They held a charge for my 14 hour flight and extra battery life remained.
I only hope they last 15 years like my previous headset!

author: JSP
title: Love 'em
content: I love these headphones. The sound is excellent and the noise cancellation works well. They run a long time on one charge.

author: Scott
title: Great Sound, Full experience, 100% Comfortable.
content: Really happy. The sound is so clear. Really nice balance. with the noise cancellation you get engrossed in the sound. I keep finding myself impressed with the experience. Find myself wearing these all the time now. Very comfortable, can wear for hours. I don't normally write reviews, but rarely this impressed with a purchase. Nice job Bose. One of the rare times when you buy top line product, that you get top line quality. Love the way the sound travels across and around the space. It adds to my viewing experience. Love it

author: joseph martin
title: Very good headphones
content: Best headphones I have every owned. Sound quality is great though some may want more base I prefer a more well rounded sound. These are the first pair of noise cancelling headphones I have owned. The noise cancelling works well but not as good as I expected. Maybe after all the great reviews I read my expectations were just too high. None the lest great sound, very comfortable, good connectivity, and good battery life so I am very happy with my purchase.

author: Vincent
title: I think they are the best
content: I tried the Sonys, and they are excellent.. thought he bright a bit too hard on my ears.. too much.

author: Chopster
title: Four Stars
content: Excellent sound, excellent comfort. But man the bluetooth range is terrible.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Improved with Age
content: My previous pair of a Bose headset was a QC15.  They have only improved over the past several years. The sound quality is excellent. I love the Bluetooth connectivity and the rechargeable batteries.

author: Smitty
title: Works great
content: These are great for the airplane

author: Amazon Customer
title: I love these.
content: I love everything about them. Best purchase I have made in a long time.  I am very thankful I doled out the extra money for these ones.  Worth every penny.

author: Lawrence Schupp
title: Looks very good
content:
GREAT PRODUCT
easy to use
My wife liked it so much, I purchased a pair for myself

author: Linda Olson
title: Great Bluetooth Headphones!
content: I had the Bose QC3 headphones, and they've been good; however, I'd heard so much about the QC35II that I decided to give them a try. Love the bluetooth capability, and the comfort level is much greater (particularly due to the extra padding on the band. The QC35II definitely does a better job of noise canceling, and the battery lives up to its reputation. I flew for over 4 hours, yet, on my return flight, it still showed 100% charge! My only complaint is the charging cable is quite short - inconveniently short. The battery is embedded in the device (not removable), whereas in my QC3, that battery was removable for charing, with a backup battery, so you could always have a working battery. I actually prefer that method, although the QC3 batteries drain faster than the current one. Love the ability to adjust the level of noise canceling and sound volume right on the headset. Well worth the purchase.

author: Arthur Zatarain
title: Excellent product, but wired users may not like the 2.5 mm audio jack.
content: I selected the Bose 35ii after extensive research and am very pleased with comfort, audio quality, and performance. A key aspect of my selection was the wired connection that I often need, as with in-flight entertainment systems. (I would have bought the Bose 30 earbud design but, amazingly, it lacks a wired connection). My only disappointment with the 35ii is that the audio jack is not the standard 3.5 mm (1/8 inch) style that we have known and loved for about 50 years. Instead, the phones have a 2.5 mm jack. I did not see this noted in any of the many reviews that I read---they all mention a standard audio connection. The phones come with a cable that plugs into the 2.5 mm jack and provides a standard 3.5 mm plug on the other end. But for the life of me I cannot even guess why a 3.5 mm wasn't used on the phones themselves so that any standard cable could be used. So if wired connection is important to you be advised that you may wantto buy an additional (more robust and longer) adapter cable, and I do see some on Amazon. Apparently the smaller jack is used on other headphones as well.  But why? Makes no sense to me.

author: HS
title: Noise Cancellation and Sound quality was bad for the price
content:
1)Sound quality wasn't as good as I expected I find myself using my $7.00 earbuds more than this. For the price
that isn't good.

2)Noise cancelling is bad. I can hear everything from conversations to my dog snoring. There are 3 modes: low none and high and there is NO differences between LOW and HIGH. Disappointed.

Overall I am very disappointed for my choice. I do not know if my product is defective or this is how it is.

author: Bob Gardner
title: Bose just can't be beat.
content: Bose Quiet Comfort 35 II is a superior product.  They are well worth the money and now can do more than ever before.  If you laptop PC doesn't have bluetooth installed you'll need to buy the little bluetooth adapter to use them wirelessly with your computer.  At least for now.  The  quality is outstanding as usual and in my opinion still top of the heap.

author: Dean Thorkelson
title: First time buyer
content: This is my first time using a noise cancelling headphone. I picked Bose because I own other Bose products. The price was what kept me from buying them sooner. Sound quality is fantastic and they're amazingly flexible. What impresses me the most is the noise cancelling, it works fantastic.

author: BILLB
title: Best NC Headphones in the world.
content:
I have now and have used in the past many  over the ear headphones.
These are the best sounding, with the most effective Noise Cancellation that I have ever owned.
The sound quality and accuracy is outstanding and the NC makes them great for airplanes or just having a completely quiet time listening to music.  They are not cheap but are definitly worth it !

author: Carrie Look
title: Not worth the money
content: The noise canceling was perfect, took you to a world of your own making noises like wind silent, but the sound quality was unacceptable, made some distorted popping noises when at full volume, something I would expect from cheap headphones, but not $300+ ones. Returned them and purchased a pair of beats solo 3 wireless, a pair of headphones I have heard many people critic the sound quality saying it’s not worth the money, I don’t see it that way and it is infinitely better than the Bose QC35 II I previously owned

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth it!!
content: Bought for my 14 tech savvy kid and he loves them, specially the noise cancellation while on trips.

author: james.a.bedford
title: 2nd pair bought! Still great!
content: 2nd one I've bought (for my partner) because they're just so good. Fully recommend. Being able to listen to the same thing on two noise-cancelling headphones is really good for couples or friends (podcasts or music on the train together). Not going to stay on your head very well at the gym, fair warning, but that's not the point I guess.

author: Greatjon Umber
title: Quality and comfort are extraordinary, but bluetooth connectivity, app, and firmware issues abound
content:
The sound quality, build quality, and features of this set of headphones are pretty much unmatched even considering its relatively steep price. While it might be a bit awkward putting these on if you've never used a pair of noise-cancelling cans before (it feels a little like your ears have to pop), you quickly get used to it. The sound quality is phenomenal; I use these mostly for playing video games in addition to music, and they're simply unmatched by any other set of headphones I have, including my pair of Audio Technica studio monitors, and a pair of Sennheiser "beater" phones that I use while traveling and such. Though this is to be expected considering the price of the Bose is far more than those other pairs. The bass rings low, highs are crisp, and midrange is full. Zero complaints, but I'm no audiophile, so if you're looking for an in-depth review you'll have to look elsewhere.

Being a gamer, I spend quite a few hours-long sessions with these on. My Audio Technicas had a nasty habit of really hurting my left ear, leaving soreness and a red mark if I tried to use them for more than just a couple of hours at a time. The Bose comfort, by comparison, is astronomically better. I've used these for a number of 8-9 hour sessions (don't judge me, I pay my taxes) and I've NEVER felt any discomfort -- Not once. They are supremely crafted for comfort.

I do have a few complaints, though. The added cost to ship this product with Google Assistant/Alexa functionality is completely lost on me because I don't use either service. In addition to this, having the headphones remain unusable while charging from the USB cable really hurts utility for me. They're usable with the power on and the auxiliary cable attached to your phone or PC and drawing power from there, but the battery still slowly drains in this mode. Having an nondetachable battery cell built into the body of the phones bodes unwell for future-proofing; this is basically the same shady built-in obsolescence that cell phone manufacturers are using to force people to upgrade sooner, and it stinks. At the moment, the battery lasts for quite a while (I can go for nearly 2 full days before requiring recharge), but if this battery loses its robustness over the next couple of years, then I'll never buy another because it's just not worth it at a $300-350 price range for the headphones to die every couple of years due to a battery that isn't built with the same longevity as the headphones themselves are. My cabled Audio Technicas come close to this sound quality, cost $200 cheaper, and have been kicking for 10 years. So if the Bose doesn't give me as long of a lifespan I'll happily go back to a set of cabled cans, sore left ear and all.

Jan 16 2019 Edit: In the previous few months of use I've experienced significant Bluetooth connectivity issues that have caused me to knock a star off my prior rating. I haven't been all that happy with the Bose Connect software which, while a stylish app to look at, feels like it sacrifices easy functionality in order to appear more stylish.

The headphones regularly have issues connecting to my work laptop, which is only a couple of years old, and also to my brand new phone, to which they regularly lose connection for no apparent reason (pictured). Another problem is that sometimes, in the middle of use, they will revert to an odd mode in which I can hear myself, as if I were recording from the microphone, with all other sound distorted. The only fix for this is a complete restart, after which they will no longer receive sound from my laptop without my restarting Windows. Since the headphones lack USB connectivity, and aux cable connection has noticeably poorer sound quality than Bluetooth connection does, this has become a significant issue, as you can imagine.

I can't help but feeling Bose pushed Bluetooth first and foremost, to the neglect of everything else. Maintaining the same sound quality of USB connection, or aux connection, should have been trivial, however the headphones lack it. And I warrant that a severe enough issue to knock a star off my initial rating.

At the risk of sounding like an old man yelling at a cloud: If you're going to force me to use Bluetooth connectivity to get the best sound quality, you better make Bluetooth damned reliable (and it hasn't been). Otherwise just give me a wired connection any day of the week. Bluetooth wireless is just a nice utility; I want good sound quality and comfort first and foremost. If you're similar to me in this aspect, then maybe these headphones are not for you.

Feb 6 2019 Edit: After several weeks of experiencing severe headaches, I finally narrowed it down to Bose's Active Noise Cancellation as the cause after some extensive googling and realizing that many others experience the same headaches as I do when using the ANC included in these headphones. I have no idea why it gives me such a terrible headache, but I was getting it almost every day until I began turning off noise cancellation each time I used the headphones. Normally I wouldn't hold such a subjective complaint against the product, but a significant problem is that these headphones don't save your setting when you turn them off. This means that each and every single time I turn on the headphones to use them, I have to log in to the app, wait for it to load and connect, then navigate the menu to turn off Active Noise Cancellation. This may not seem like a major issue, but trust me, when you're doing it several times every day, it becomes an annoyance extremely quickly. It's something that should be so simple to fix, too.

In addition to this, whenever you use the headphones with the cable, all of the buttons become non-functional. Since the headphones start up with noise cancellation active every single time and the buttons don't respond in cabled mode, you can never turn off noise cancellation. This basically means that I will never be able to use cabled mode without getting a severe headache. Thanks, Bose.

I have added photos, too, so you can see these headphones have held up very well with daily use. Build quality is indeed impressive.

3-Months Conclusion: These are still great headphones with supreme build and sound quality, but there are significant issues involved that I would not have expected when paying $350 for a pair of headphones. I would expect a higher level of polish when spending so much money. Buying these did in fact turn out to be a mistake, despite their positive aspects, and I do regret my purchase after a few months of use.

author: BbrambTX
title: My Black Friday Deal
content: Love these headphones. I’ve been wanting a pair for a long time. They’re great for talking on the phone or listening to music. I use them at the gym and the sweat doesn’t seem to effect them, mention this only because I was told you can’t use them at the gym.

author: richard
title: if you want durability go elsewhere
content: had the headphones for a little more than a year and the ear cushions split open. only used indoors to study with no exposure to rain or weather

author: Gary Murphy
title: Defective Firmware
content:
I am a fan of Bose headphones. They are expensive, but up until this purchase, I felt there was still a value there.  The pair I got has a noisy left ear.  I downloaded the firmware update.  That software is junk, but I finally got it to start up.  It states that I am at the current level of software.

This is a huge disappointment.

Update:  I called Bose Customer Support.  They asked if I had tried it on two devices.  I had.  That was the end of the diagnostics.  They were going to send me a replacement product.  There wasn't even a mention of trying a firmware update.  A person on the Bose Community board had this problem over a year ago and she received a second defective product.  Apparently Bose isn't the company they used to be, if they can't fix a manufacturing or QA issue in over a year.

author: Brent L. Bordelon
title: Bought 2
content: I loved my set so much I bought a set for my son.  The sound quality is excellent, though not the best.  Where these shine is the noise cancellation, which is second to none.  In fact, the noise cancellation is so good that it's dangerous to bike or walk with them, unless you turn down the noise cancellation level (which you can do via the app)

author: Connie Hill Smith
title: High Quality
content: Bose products are great - very high quality. These headphones really cancel the noise on an airplane and deliver a very high quality sound for music or movies.

author: Giraldus
title: As a cubicle dweller,  this is a sanity saver...
content:
As a cubicle dweller,  this is a sanity saver:  I was looking for something that I could use all day long (i.e.,  long battery life, confort - even while wearing spectacles - which is not a given for most over the hear headsets),  wireless to avoid the mess of yet another set of wires that gets in the way,  something that would cut off ambiant noise effectively (including next cubicle loud conversations,  off key singing colleagues,  noisy lab,  etc.) and with good excellent audio capabilities - and this is it.

There are a couple of competing products with similar specs and similar price range (e.g., Sennheiser,  Sony,  etc.) but the Bose came highly recommended by friends (and online reviewers).

Ah one handy feature is the ability to pair the headset with multiple devices,  it keeps track of two active ones,  e.g.,  the laptop and smartphone,  and will switch source seamlessly as needed.

author: mike
title: Well worth the money
content: Great battery life. Stays in place when I run and lift. Noise cancellation is out of this world. Well worth the money.

author: Rodney J. Carpenter
title: We'll see...
content:
Well, for the 1.5 hours that I got to enjoy these headphones, I really enjoyed them. Unfortunately, they quit working.  Everything was hunky-dory until they stopped working.  I am in the process of returning and getting a replacement set, so I'll try to remember to update this after I get the replacement.  For whatever reason, my original set decided to stop working.  They won't turn on at all.  I was enjoying them at PHX airport and when I boarded the plane they just stopped.  I couldn't turn them on.  The on/off slider switch had no effect.  I though that it might be because they needed to charge, although the charge level was at 90% according to the headphones themselves.  I brought them home and plugged them in...but to no avail.  Still won't turn on.  I tried the "reset" options that I discovered on the interwebs...nope.

Boxed up and ready to return for a replacement set.  If the replacement set works...great.  Otherwise I'm going to return and get the Sony alternative.

***Update November 6th - can I just say that Amazon's return policy/process is amazing.  Couldn't be easier.  I have receive the replacement set and they are working as advertised.  I'll update if I run into any further issues. ***

author: Mike R.
title: The ultimate in shutting out annoying children on a plane
content: I bought these because Bose has a good name in the speaker game. I had some high expectations and they were certainly met. I can have these on and don't even know there are crying kids in my vicinity. I'd have to say, I'll likely wear these during my first child's birth.

author: tt92618
title: Setup software and Bluetooth stability SUCKS.
content:
If I could give these a negative number I would.

First the backstory:  bought them, set them up, and enabled the Alexa helper.  All worked fine.  Charged them overnight.  Disabled Bluetooth on the phone,  then re-enabled.

And then:

- Alexa stopped working.
- Alexa app wouldn’t pair
- So after an hour of reading and trying everything online, still no Alexa.
- So I try to clear the Bluetooth list as Bose suggests.
- Headphones pair again, but still no Alexa.
- Clear Bluetooth devices again, and restart everything (phone etc).
- Alexa still won’t work.
- Clear everything again, delete Bose Connect, restart everything, reinstall Bose Connect, and re-pair.  Still no Alexa.
- Reoeat all previous steps but add in another device restart.
- Now the headphones won’t re-pair at all; all pairing attempts fail.

Total time wasted on something that should be dead simple: multiple hours.  Outcome: headphones won’t pair at all and are totally useless.

So where to begin?

- First, the Bluetooth pairing is terrible and unreliable.  It is utterly baffling how a user simply toggling Bluetooth on or off, nor doing ANYTHING with software settings, could break some core functionality of the device.  That’s just terrible engineering.  Bose needs to do better.

- No hardware reset.  So, if things go seriously sideways as they did here, there is no way to totally clear settings and set up from scratch.  Honestly, who does that?  Who builds a hardware device that can be set up only one time and can NEVER be reset to factory settings again?  That’s just crazy.  What if something goes wrong?  What if the settings get jacked up somehow and and nothing works to fix them?  Just replace the hardware?  Just seriously deficient.

None of this stuff should have happened.  It should not be possible for settings to get this munged.  So the fact that they can is a serious mark against these headphones.  A product this bad shouldn’t be sold.  I bought these for my son, but I have a pair of Sony MX1000/M3.  They are leaps and bounds better in every respect, starting with the fact that they just work without requiring a person to be a software engineer to figure them out or fix them when their software and firmware setting get jacked up,

Bose: if your product is this fragile, for crying out loud at least include a factory reset.  I’ve not been this disappointed in a product in a long, long time.

TL; DR: Do not buy these unless you are a masochist who enjoys pain.

author: Lauren Duncan
title: Work great!
content: I bought these because there is construction outside my office. I am happy to say that even without music, they block the vast majority of the construction noise. I am so relieved!

author: Joshua Benavides
title: All in the name!
content: Price is well worth the quality and sound. Wife loved her Mother’s Day gift.

author: M. Thomas
title: Noise cancelling is PHENOMENAL
content: I bought these for traveling and the noise cancelling is amazing. Now remember - these are not audiophile headphones. These are more for the function of noise cancelling. The sound quality is good but not as much bass as some people would like. Pairing is easy and calls are great too. I will note that I had to pair with my Samsung TV first before all my other devices. Battery life is superb and the headphones are so comfy! They cover your whole ear. Comes with a sturdy carrying case as well with pockets. Absolutely worth the money.

author: Amazon Customer
title: My 18 yr old son loves them
content: Seems to be the best product available for what it is.

author: Amanda Darling
title: Don’t bother if you’re getting them for flying.
content: Bought these for some long flights and was extremely disapponted to find out the headset jack is not compatible with JetBlue’s inflight system. The Bose cord does not work at all - says it’s the right size, but in actuality, it’s a tiny bit smaller and does not make proper contact. Since I fly JetBlue 95% of the time, these are useless. My old (dead) Bose QCs has no problems and my Sony headset works fine.

author: christopher mee
title: Love it!
content: We are loving it

author: vee99
title: Bose does not disappoint.
content:
I have always used Bose, been over two years so needed another headset for all around listening. I would give the
shipping six stars if they were available, it came, open my door, and right where I wanted it. This item was by itself
more expensive than $260 HH jacket I bought which took almost a week to get after paying extra $20 for shipping.
If you do not have honest neighbors, not recommended to have Amazon drop it off on your doorstep. Now, as far
as the headphone goes, it is wireless, plus has the mono cable for wired use, when you turn on the noise cancellation,
it greatly reduces the ambient noise, plus, it is so comfortable, the around the ear feel is natural, you can wear it all
day possibly.  I have never been a fan of Beats, just by looking at the two, Bose is the better choice, it is like that car
commercial where they are trying to sell a red pick up truck, it looks cool, the girls dig it but not practical and red pick
up trucks get pulled over more than any vehicle. Do not fall for the cheese!!!

author: Eugene Baroni
title: When they worked they are the best headphones ever
content: When they worked they are the best headphones ever. But they constantly cut on and off. And the battery drain over night was pretty rapid.

author: amaham
title: So beautiful!
content: I loved these headphones! I purchased the rose gold but unfortunately I had to send them back! My only reason for returning is I was worried that over time the underside of the top part would get dirty too easily as it is a suede type material. I’m not sure how well it would handle a cleaning. For a woman like myself it is easy to get makeup on it with the off and on movement of the headphones. They are so pretty though! And of course, the quality and nose cancellation is top notch! If only they could make the underside head band a leather material for cleaning ease.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It’s BOSE product
content: Bought for my wife for Xmas. But there is static in them. You have to cut volume way down to stop static.

author: Maureen Girard
title: Bose QC 35(Series ll)
content:
Absolutely love these headphones......all the pluses being wireless, cancels out the noise, sound quality superb!
I got the headphones with Alexa voice control......love this feature...worth the extra money!
Cannot go wrong with this purchase!

author: Scott Lemon
title: Will not work right with Windows!
content: I love the headphones. They are very light weight. The big drawback is that they are not compatible with windows. To use them with a windows computer you have to use the stereo plug and it kind of defeats the purpose of wireless. I wanted to use them on a gaming computer but to no avail on the Bluetooth front. I wonder if they will work with windows phones (we will never know as no one owns a windows phone:) ). Bose needs to make their devices compatible with all OS's. not just the most popular mobile platforms.

author: DaleC
title: Worth the price, excellent headphones.
content: Sound quality is great, easy to use and works very well with multiple phones. Very good battery life. Only complaint is the noise cancellation on a phone call removes all feedback when you speak so you are not sure it is picking up your voice, the other person has confirmed i sound great so i am very satisfied with this purchase.

author: JRB
title: Bose quality.
content: Comfortable, long battery life and perfect for travel.

author: john salyards
title: These probably do more than I know according to instructions
content: Very cool . I dont wear them constantly but very nice to relax with after work or late at night winding down . Definitely helps block out noise of any ( cough gf cough ) background noises .

author: Barry A. Thys
title: This product defines excellence
content: What can I say about this product that hasn't been said already. The sound quality is superior. The bass is breathtaking. I've heard sounds through these headphones that I haven't heard through my car stereo. I must have for the serious audiophile.

author: Chris Jordan
title: WOW!
content: WOW!  What a clear sound for the music that I play.  The noise cancelling is tremendous! It;s like no one else is around. I love it! Worth every penny.

author: Grimm
title: Fantastic, i expect nothing less from BOSE.
content: So good i cant hear my parents fighting anymore.

author: Blake S.
title: Super comfortable BUT terrible PC compatitibility and almost 1 second sound delay
content:
The fit of the headphones are light and comfortable. But there are MAJOR issues with the software. First, do NOT buy these if you have the intention of using with a PC, especially if you want to use the mic. There is little to no support and your PC will recognize multiple Bluetooth devices and get confused by switching to the wrong one at random times during use.
Second, the elephant in the room everyone is complaining about... The firmware has a serious issue with delay of the sound. Yea, yea, Bluetooth has a natural delay, but not 0.5 to 1.0 SECOND of a delay! The reason its obvious that its a firmware issue is that this delay is not prevalent when you first turn on the headphones. Give it around 5-10 minutes and you'll start experiencing worse and worse of a delay. Ruins the movie watching experience and video games are unbearable. I'd normally give the company the benefit of the doubt and wait for a firmware update, but the developers have shot down any criticism about a delay in the audio. These are not worth the price. Great hardware ruined by terrible software.

author: Jeremy Young
title: Sony WH-1000X M3 are (surprisingly) better, sorry.
content: Just ok, the latest Sony WH-1000X M3 NC are superior head to head. Sound quality was fair, NC is good, battery life is ok. They are like the Cracker Barrel of headphones, bland at best. If you just need $350 NC ear plugs and don't care about sound, you found these Bose, so buy them. If you like music, movies, games, audio etc. the Sony are vastly superior, and the NC is honestly on par. I bought a pair of both headphones for my wife and I, for an upcoming trip to Thailand. She doesn't care about audio, so the QC35II's are good for her. They aren't terrible or anything, they just aren't the best available for the same price.

author: Gerardo Medina
title: Very good I love at
content: You can hear the music and no noise

author: Daniil
title: Best headphones in the market for this price! ❤️
content: Best headphones in the market for this price! ❤️

author: Vicki C.
title: Great fitting!
content: Had purchased similar for my husband,but I wanted something with a little more "bling", so jumped on these rose gold headphones.  Fit is perfect, set up was easy, noise cancelling is good (my hearing is very sensitive).  Still learning button location for use without taking headphones off to look.  Have used Bose products for over 45 years and have NEVER been disappointed!

author: RLeo
title: My second pair, granny great headphones.
content: The noise canceling is fantastic.

author: Caleb Duman
title: Did I get used headphones?
content: Quality is great, but it came already connected to somebody else's phone. There was no evidence of tampering, but i don't want to pay full price for a used product.

author: Kristiano
title: More for your money with other brands.
content: Eh. I was more disappointed in the build quality than anything. Also for the price, the tech is kind of outdated. Traded these for the Sony equivalent.

author: WSV1975
title: Excellent value
content: I am having some trouble using the app to allow me to use it wirelessly with my computer.  I am sure it is my problem.

author: Nick Pekular
title: I love these headphones.
content: These are really great headphones, they sound awesome, the noise cancelling works great and hey have excellent battery life. Also, the construction feels pretty solid. My only gripe is that they always default to high noise cancellation instead of remembering your last setting. Other than that, solid.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent at blocking out the sounds of loud children
content: I'm a college student and need quiet to do all of my schoolwork- however, the place where I live has lots of loud, screaming toddlers that are constantly screeching or running down the halls. I put on these headphones and I can't hear them anymore. It's amazing, and probably the only reason why my sanity and my GPA haven't crashed and burned this semester. I bought these for the noise cancelling properties but the music quality is a great bonus!

author: Big guy
title: Good ear protection
content: Love them, I work in remote sites that have a lot of fan noise. The only think that I do not like is the volume when I am talking on the phone. It maybe a setting that I have not had the chance to check out yet

author: JMac
title: Love them!
content: Love love love these headphones! They keep out all the noise from my busy house. The only issue I have is that I got a headache at first wearing them for long periods of time. I think I have sensitive ears and maybe that’s why. My husband has the same pair and he never had that issue. I stretched them out and it seems to be better now. Definitely a good buy!

author: Don Elrod
title: Perfect for Airline Travel
content: Never knew how noisy airplanes were until I started using these headphones. Battery lasts a very long time. Great sound quality, nice travel bag. Headphone fit comfortably without feeling like they are binding. Ears will get hot after a few hours of wearing the headphones.

author: Tobie
title: It's all so quiet... Sshhh sshhh
content: What is there to say? The battery is awesome, they fit perfectly, they sound great, and the pairing is stupidly simple. It is nifty to have Google Assistant integrated into them as it comes in handy on my commutes to work on the train. And, the noise cancelling is awesome! The only criticism I have is the moments that I use the headphone jack to listen to music instead of bluetooth; it would be nice if it were a standard 3.5mm headphone jack instead of the 2.5mm one.

author: Joshua B.
title: They were not new!
content:
These were used! I bought these (thinking they were new for my wife for Christmas.

She opened them and was initially happy. When she tried to pair them she noticed scratches and had difficulty pairing them with her phone. The name of them was “kevin’s Ipad”.

I would ask that anyone buying these from this seller verify they are in fact new and not refurbished.

I paid a new price for a refurbished set of headphones.

author: jeffrey vincent
title: I like 'em a lot
content: Bought to replace an earlier, wired version. Just great. No wires, a big plus for me. Noise cancelling thing improved significantly, two levels, almost dangerously effective at high. Same Bose sound, which some find a little, what, smarmy? I like it, not an audiophile, admittedly, but I'm 70, the fine points lost to my hearing. One hint, if you don't want the "google assistant" stuff, buy the QC35-1 version for a few bucks less.

author: spot007
title: Very bad
content: Poor

author: Jose L Martin
title: It really blocks the noise
content: Great

author: sEhm
title: *SAFETY FIRST*  High Grade ear muffs #muffs
content: Welp!  These work brilliantly.  THey drown out loud phone lady with the best noise canceling I’ve ever heard.  Or not heard.  Either way I can’t hear the dumb stuff that comes out of her mouth.  I can also jam baby making music or holiday tunes as loud as I want without disturbing the judgey squares. It provides immediately on voice command meditation music so I don’t kill anyone.  That Alexa and Google Assistant that come with the headphones are my real beaches.  I’m over here telling them to make me coffee in the kitchen while I’m working in my office.  They do it.  They don’t fuss.  But really.  If you can afford them, buy them.  My sweet husband bought them for me for my birthday.  He knows I need safety ear muffs.

author: cz85b
title: Comfortable and definitely Quiet!
content:
I am really liking these for the connectivity, as in the bluetooth connection is always solid and dependable...  I am able to have them on my head for longer periods of time.  This being said, I ALSO own a set of Bang & Olufsen Beoplay H9i headphones.  I will say that compared with the Bose, the sound from the B&O is much better, to me.

In my mind it will depend on what people want.  IF you have your phone connected to many different competing sound systems (my car sometimes connects while I have my B&O headphones on and that just sucks!) Anyway, if you want your connection to be undisturbed, the Bose is superior.  If you are wearing them for long periods of time, the Bose is Superior.  However, if you want better sound?  B&O is the clear winner!

author: Jacob Hopkins
title: High quality comfortable wireless headphones
content: I’ve used these for a couple months at work now. They’re a bit expensive, but these are by far the best wireless noise cancelling headphones I’ve used. I had a pair of the original parrot Zik headphones before these, and they always hurt my head to wear for more than half an hour. I can wear the QC35s forever

author: Amazon Customer
title: The noise cancellation function works well. Works well as ...
content: The noise cancellation function works well.  Works well as a headset for cell phone.  The only downside to this is using it for headset replacement in computer.

author: Mauricio
title: Bose
content: Awesome sound quality

author: Valerie
title: Phone calls drop..otherwise love these headphones
content: I've tried repeatedly to accept phone calls and make phone calls and after a couple minutes talking on phone, the call drops.  My phone is next to me the entire time.  I also cannot get phone calls on my laptop although I can without the headphones, while sitting in front of the computer.  Noise canceling excellent - not complete blocking out of sound but 90% of sound, lightweight but after 4 hours the top of my ears feel a little discomfort from the ear pieces.

author: Mick James
title: I couldn't ask for more from these.
content: I've owned these headphones for almost a year now and have been nothing but happy with them. Been taken on multiple trips where the battery lasted well beyond what was needed. The noise cancellation is amazing and having no wires to get tangled up in is so freeing. If you got the money, you cant go wrong with these. And if you don't have the money, think about saving up for them.

author: Vlad
title: A disappointment. Constant bluetooth connectivity issues.
content:
I was excited to get this pair of headphones but after a couple of months of use I am compelled to come back here and write some feedback. I am very disappointed for the reasons listed below.

- constant, and I a mean constant issues with bluetooth connectivity when switching devices. Once you connect you're generally OK, but switching devices often requires multiple retries. For comparison I never have this issue with my Sony HDR. The most frequent issue is the bluetooth connecting to a device after turning the headphones on, only to immediately disconnect.
- intermittent interruptions in music playback (very brief, in the millisecond range). They seem to happen every 30-40minutes to 1-2 hrs. Frankly these interruptions are a minor annoyance, but for headphones from Bose they are unacceptable.
- Stuttering, continuously interrupted sound play when connected to two devices at the same time. This does not occur all the time, it seems to happen when I am connected to a chromebook AND my iMac at the same time. The only way I have found to address this is by disconnecting one of the devices and reconnecting the headphones to the other (turning one of the devices off is not enough, once the stuttering kicks in, you have to restart the headphones and reconnect).

UPDATE: 01/04/19 - bose pushed a few updates to their firmware, but it has not helped at all with regards to the bluetooth connectivity issues. Basically if you have multiple devices (say your phone and then switching between a work and home computer) expect constant issues, with the headphones connecting and disconnecting to the computers all the time. In addition recently (last couple of months) a new issue has come up, where the headphones would be connected the laptop, but would NOT play any sound (even though the laptop sees them as connected and the headphones themselves say they are connected).
