The solution seems to be turn up the volume to the max, and to press play/stop/play on the laptop to get the headphones to start playing sound. I don't quite get what the deal is with trying to make it possible for the headphones to connect to multiple devices, but in any case BOSE completely screwed up the work flow there.

The stuttering has been fixed by one of the firmwares as I no longer get any stuttering.
END UPDATE.

All in all this is massive disappointment.

So long story short, while I love the look and design of the headphones (very comfortable) and while I love the sound and the noise cancellation (after you get the bluetooth working), they are way too glitchy and require way too much fiddling. I regret that I am no longer able to return this as I've had them for a couple of months already.

I am simply very very disappointed. It seems to be that this pair of headphones is unnecessarily complicated, and Bose never worked out all the details in the many features they tried to cram into it.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great headphones but not Alexa-enabled as advertised
content: Great headphones but they’re set up to work with Google Assistant rather than Alexa (as advertised on Amazon). Clearly not the newest model. Not a deal breaker, though. But that’s why I give them 4 instead of 5 stars. Took them on a flight recently and they worked phenomenally. Battery life is solid. Priced higher than some competitors, but Bose has always charged a premium for their products. Overall great headphones, great noise-cancelling, great sound quality.

author: Steve
title: Connection distance is poor
content: The reson I give it 3 stars is because the bloothtooth connection distance is poor.

author: Marissa
title: These headphones are a lifesaver
content:
These headphones have been a lifesaver. As someone who works from home (and coffee shops), it's great to be able to drown out distractions that commonly occur. These headphones have two noise-canceling settings, which block out most anything or let some background noise in. The battery life is good, lasting a whole workday before needing a charge. They can get a little hot on your ears after prolonged use, but it's not terrible.

I didn't realize the power of these headphones until I traveled by airplane overseas. These are a game changer. I can now block out the crying babies, loud talkers, and engine noise. I used to not be able to sleep on planes. Not anymore.

author: Scottso
title: Best headphones on the market
content:
Bose does it again!  Without question, these are THE best headphones on the market.  The sound is balanced, battery life is long, build quality is excellent and the noise cancelling is best in class.  Dare I say they might even be underpriced.  If they're marked down, grab them.  This may be the last set of headphones you buy!

I was not compensated for this review and have no relationship with Bose.

author: Teresita Svalesen
title: Do not buy if you're even an occasional audiophile
content: Like others I did a head to head comparison between the Bose QC 35 and the Sony WH-1000XM2 AND headphones. First of all I do a lot of long haul plane trips. For the longest time I was jealous of all of these road warriors wearing their headphones with the Bose logo. I decided to do a decide between Bose and Sony. Yes the Sony headphones get warm and the Bose not so much. But the Sony sound is really beautiful compared to Bose. Bose sounds very flat and despite using and equalizer enhancement it offered no help. If you just want NC it might be cheaper to buy some Hearos but if you like good representive music with reasonable NC get the Sony. I plan on using the onboard aircraft fan while on flight to offset the heat from the ear cups. It can't hurt

author: Tim Rathman
title: Great but..
content: Right out of the box, the right eardrum rattled just enough to be snoozing every time you shake your head.

author: Ahmed
title: Awesome
content: This is a great buy. Absolutely in love with it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: extremely comfortable
content: the noise cancelling is good, and I just made a hands-free phone call from it!  I do like the option to Google or Alexa enable it.

author: Kindle Customer
title: For comfort it's Bose, for sound it's Sony.
content: I purchased the Sony headphones and the Bose QuietComfort 35 (Series II) set because the reviews were so close and I wasn't sure which ones I would like better.  While the Bose were definitely more comfortable and the case was large enough to fit the charging cord and headphone jack, the sound did not quite measure up.  I did like the on/off switch of the Bose headphones better and the Bose app, but I love the Sony headphones for the following reasons.  The sound is phenomenal...it's transforming.  I took them on a recent flight and it was like being in another world...no noisy discussions or engine noise, just a beautiful series of sounds that volleyed from one ear to the next.  It's easy to change tracks, adjust volume, or stop play by simply swiping or tapping the outside of the right earpiece.  The Sony app is fairly easy to use, too, including a way to adjust if your connection cuts in and out.  I didn't experience that with the Sony, but did with the Bose.  If I could have chosen the comfort of the Bose with the sound of the Sony (and the convenient swipe feature) I would never take them off!

author: Meg S
title: Battery Power Very Impressive
content: I purchased these for a 21hr trip 1 leg containing a 15hr direct flight.  Most of the time i used The Bluetooth function which take more battery power but i did plug in and watch an airline movie or two.  After my trip i still Had 60% battery life remaining.  I’m very impressed with the sound, noise canceling and battery life.  I should add that friends complained of the screaming baby which I never even heard.  Expensive but you do get what you pay for with this product.

author: Deadzone
title: Feels cheap for the price.
content: The product feels cheaply built. The sounds is not the best out there. The design and noise cancelation is fine.

author: Sam
title: comfortable, and immensely clear in sound
content: These headphones are superb, soft, comfortable, and immensely clear in sound.  The Bluetooth pairs easily with phones, tablets, and PC's.  The noise cancelling feature is great, with 3 settings:  low, high, and off.  Last but not least, is the customer service with World Wide Stereo.  Immediately upon ordering, they reach out showing their gratitude for becoming a customer, but they stay with you to make sure everything is working as it's suppose to. Highly recommend these headphones from this seller!!! Thank you for a great experience!!!!

author: Kyle
title: and I love them! They are very comfortable and the sound ...
content: My husband gave these to me for Christmas, and I love them! They are very comfortable and the sound is outstanding!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Comfortable noise cancellation
content: Quality noise cancellation that you expect from Bose in a very comfortable headphone

author: Pearce Melcher
title: Very convenient
content: Sound quality is definitely less than wired headphones around the same price point. However, if you're buying something like this, sound often comes second fiddle to convenience. It's great being able to get up from my desk and walk across the room without having to take my headphones off or use them when detailing the car. Used them on a red-eye cross country flight and was actually able to sleep with the noise cancelling. I'm a big fan of clean crisp sound, but the small sacrifice there for the convenience and noise cancelling are well worth it.

author: girl0227
title: After 1 year & 1 month, the left earphone stopped working...
content: ...and apparently it happens to a fair number of people.  there are tons of websites about this and a full troubleshooting guide on the website.  I've  been totally unable to get help from Bose on how to fix it because it's clearly a product defect.  It's too bad, because these genuinely do mnake working in an open office somewhat tolerable, just be prepared to replace them immidately after the 1 year warrantly ends.

author: Amazon CustomerRaymond
title: Fantastic !!
content: Because of price, I purchased a headset for $79 that had ANC and Bluetooth. I returned it as the ANC didn't work and the Bluetooth kept cutting out. I then decided to go to the other extreme and got the Bose headset. The difference was like night and day. ANC is almost perfect, sound quality is excellent. Bluetooth has not cut out and phone calls are crystal clear. Alexa works very well.  I highly recommend this headset.

author: AnielaS
title: Great quality, cord short
content: Nice quality as expected with Bose, the charger cord is very short.

author: pedro riera
title: Sound cuts off a couple of times per minute when ...
content: Sound cuts off a couple of times per minute when I walk with cellphone in my pocket. This is very anoying. No problem when I hold cellphone in my hand outside my pocket.

author: Fox
title: Why buy anything else
content: I dont know why I ever bothered to tey any other headphones.  The sound is great with the noise cancellation.  It really blocks out everything around. I use at work everyday. With using around 8 hours a day, I only have to charge every 3 to 4 days. Battery is good.

author: Jay
title: Good but still disappointed
content:
Will keep review simple: Bose will always be great with noise cancellation. I really like that you're able to change the level of noise cancellation and as always it cancels alot of background noise. I also like that you can use these without having the noise cancelling turned on. Upgraded these from the QC15's which require you to have them turned on. Battery life seems to be alright. Maybe I use mine quite a bit but it seems like they'll need to be charged around once a week. These are super comfortable. I definitely forget I have them on sometimes.

Set up for these was very difficult, both with pairing with my phone and laptop. I had to download the Bose app to connect to my phone which I felt was unnecessary. I've never had this much trouble, even when buying much cheaper brands. I deleted the app after pairing since I've read reviews about the app updating and messing up the headphones. My Biggest disappointment is that you can barely turn your head in any direction without disruptions. For comparison, I bought a generic bluetooth adapter for my QC15 pair and these barely had an issue with disruptions. You basically have to keep your head straight or the music will go in and out. Not sure if other people have experienced this as well.

author: Roy Echard
title: Best noise cancelling possiblw
content: I have had my QC15 on ear headphones for over ten years. Upgrading to an I-phone 7 requires getting Bluetooth ability. Bought the QC35s and wonder what took so long. Mass Be improvement over what I considered excellent in my QC15s

author: Phoebe
title: Wonderful for killing ambient noise
content: These headphones are PERFECT for drowning out ambient noise for those of us who travel often. Voices are still audible (though muffled mostly) when music is not on, but music on and, ontop of incredible sound quality, there is nothing else audible. Highly recommend! Comes with a sleek carrying case as well which is a perk.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Perfect for Quiet Time
content: Bought these as a gift for someone who finds it hard to enjoy a few minutes for quiet time with two small kids.  Works like a charm!

author: destornillador
title: Great noise cancellation
content: I use it mostly for the noise cancellation. I specially like it for airplane traveling and the office, and while commuting. It is also great for calls.

author: Thu Le
title: Good noise canceling, not so great sound
content: Great noise canceling and very comfortable. Sound quality is average at best.

author: TravelinT
title: Great headphones
content: As others have commented your spouse or SO may not appreciate how much noise they cancel but you will. Very comfortable and connects to all Bluetooth electronics  including my TV. Charge time is quick.

author: DR
title: Good headphones
content: Compared to the Beats we tried these are way better. The noise cancelling works so much better than the Beats. Their are comforting and sound nice.

author: Bobbie Digital
title: Bose is not what it used to be save your money there are just as good headphones for a lot less
content: I have always been a Bose girl, everything i have bought in terms of sound has been Bose for the last 25-30yrs for me so I bought this headset because of my loyalty. I am very pleased with the noise cancellation but the overall sound quality just sounded Tinny to me, no bass either and the volume does not go that high, so out of curiosity to compare, I purchased a different brand, ITeknic for less than $50 bucks and the noise cancellation is just as great as Bose but the sound quality is more superior and it has great bass and a loud volume. I am keeping the iTecknic and returning the Bose and saving myself $300 bucks. What happened Bose?

author: Justin True
title: Quickly turns on and automatic connects within 5 seconds or less
content: The audio quality is extremely clear, the noise cancellation actually blew my mind at how much it deafens the sound. I really like the fact that the battery hardly depletes, Everytime I turn on my head phone I typically will hear the same number and I use them quiet a bit. I put them on the charger for less than 15-20 when the battery was at 60% and fully charged in that time period. Very impressed with overall performance of these headphones and would highly recommend them.

author: Sarah Batzel
title: ... on my right ear when noise cancelling is engaged like I need to pop my
content: Puts an odd pressure on my right ear when noise cancelling is engaged like I need to pop my ear

author: rpcowan
title: Worth Every Cent
content:
I work remotely and travel often but still have to attend and be participative on conference calls. When onsite somewhere noisy, on aircraft attending calls, etc. I found it difficult to hear everything I needed to in these calls with all of the background noise.

I tried the Bose Soundlink II first and, while they worked for conf. calls, without the noise cancelling feature they weren’t materially different than using AirPods.

These QuietComforts exceeded my expectations.

*Sound Quality got 4 out of 5 stars because they leave me wanting more low end when listening to music

author: Eldar
title: Sound could be better
content: Sound quality could be better, bass is like in any other 100$ headphones, bt quality is poor. Good for traveling and watching movies, nothing more...

author: Quijote
title: The noise canceling worked FANTASTIC. I am not sure why but I felt ...
content: The noise canceling worked FANTASTIC. I am not sure why but I felt motion sick when I used them. I used them for 30 minutes and knew that even though I could not hear my SUV start or engine noise when I was driving, they are not for me.

author: RICHARD M HOLMES DMD PA
title: Save yourself time and buy 2!!
content: This is my second purchase of Bose headphones...my wife commandeered the last one.  The comfort is comparable to my flight headset. The sound is remarkable. Great product. I would highly recommend this headset  Yyou made need to buy 2 to save time. Someone in your house will like them too much to give them up!!

author: Kyiah
title: Fantastic Headphones!
content: I love these headphones! The ear padding is soft! Pure sound quality and I can listen to all my Bluetooth devices with it! Can’t wait to travel with it!

author: Dan Hahn
title: Traded Bose QC for these
content: I bought the latest Bose QCs and found them to be quiet and shockingly un-intuitive. I exchanged them for these and have been very pleased. The sound quality is way better, they are louder, and the app interface is dynamite. The noise-cancelling capability is so deep it borders on creepy. When you turn off the noise cancelling function, you get this wild rush of ambient noise that you completely forget exists when you are wired in. It is crazy how much sound these actually cut out. The interactive ear cups are also great as they give you the ability to work seamlessly almost forgetting your headphones are on. If you are making a choice between these and the comparable Bose product, go ahead and get these. Sony usually sounds like what you get if you need headphones and only have 30 bucks, but this product places them at the head of the table in the noise-cancelling realm.

author: Nancy W.
title: Great sound, comfortable...... wish it had replaceable batteries.... recharging requires it to be plugged in
content: Purchased these to replace a 10 year old Bose noise cancelling head set.  It still worked so I gave it to a family member.  What more can I say other than this is fantastic, like my other three Bose products.  I do miss having replaceable batteries.  If I am on a flight and the battery dies I have to recharge it with a micro-USB charger.  My older one had batteries I could replace but not this one.  That is the only complaint, otherwise it would have a 5 star rating.

author: Michael Lovett
title: Generally good all around, Bose got lazy on accommodating smaller heads.
content:
The overall comfort, sound, and battery life are good. I like the Google integration. An occasional crackle when using Bluetooth, but no major problems in that area.  (Could be my phone, too.. you know how pesky/tricky Bluetooth problems are)

I find the sound a bit muffled/soft in comparison to competitors, but that's sort of Bose's "sound" so you know what you are going to get. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad in any way, it's like a square edged table that's had it's corners sanded round so you can't hurt yourself, lol.

The reason I did not give this a 5 is because they are designed to fit a "standard" head. They are too big for my head and hang too low, causing jaw pain after an hour. I have to put a wad of material under the headband to keep them sitting high enough on my head. Yes, that's as lovely as you are imagining it is, lol.  Looking at the design, Bose could have opted to make these fit more heads quite easily. I think they were just lazy and didn't want to deviate from some 'standard' they've been using forever. Main competitor (Sony) actually fit worse and were less comfy.

Noise cancellation is good. As others have pointed out, don't expect it to block out *everything*, just certain kinds of white-noise sounds such as airplane. That aside, they are still quieter than headphones without noise cancellation. I can barely here myself typing this review on my desktop keyboard, for example, so that's good.

author: Wendell Lynch
title: Great!!
content: I bought these to replace my Beats (Studios) and pound for pound  these Bose are better.  The noise cancellation is great. Just to a trip and used these on a plane and I didn't hear the crying baby on the plane until I turned them off.

author: Caleb
title: Totally changes the air travel experience.
content: I decided to splurge on these since I was planning a few transatlantic trips in the coming months and it was definitely worth it! I got them for the noise cancelling which makes flying a totally different experience. And (as I should have expected from a Bose product) the sound quality is phenomenal. Best sound quality of any speakers or headphones I've ever personally owned.

author: Austin
title: Against the Sony MX1000 its a very close race - But QC35 comfort has no equal
content:
Having tested the Song MX1000x for a long while in Bestbuy and these at the next booth over, it was clear in that moment which I liked better - but i cant help but wonder if the MX1000x had just focused more on comfort what this review would look like instead.

Bose is all about comfort, as the name suggests it is built around the policy of supreme comfort, a factor that the MX1000x can't even come close too. Within 30 seconds of wearing the sonys in bestbuy, my ears began to burn and felt the nauseating sensation of a headache growing... and that was only after 30 seconds of listening. Bose on the other hand, even in those few seconds of testing at BestBuy - I could barely tell that I had a pair of headphones on my head.

So Bose wins comfort, and i think everyone can agree on this... but that's really about it. Sony has far better noise canceling, you should have seen my face when I pressed the calibration button in BestBuy (and as loud and busy at it was, and i didn't even have music playing) it was dead silent. And dead silent in a way, where even my own excited squeals of laughter were invisible. It was truly like being deaf, unable to hear a thing and nothing was even playing yet. Upon turning on the tunes though, aside form the neddle-like precision of notes, I felt something was missing from them. It was a strange feeling, and I think its the fact that the MX1000x are so good at separating sounds from one another, that music sounds sort of hollow when you really listen to something. It can turn a symphony into a bland practice session, because it's so good at separating notes.

QC35 on the other hand, left something to be desired on the noise canceling ability. The loud roar and chatter of bestbuy, became a dull to silent roar, with most sounds around me muffled out. With all music and sounds turned off I would rate the BOSE as more a "Sound Dampening" headphone, than a true noise cancelling headphone (at least when compared to the technology of Sony). Still when turning on the music the sound felt full. My face was shocked at the clarity of the notes produced by these headphones. music had feeling with these on, tension, emotion - something I felt the precision of the Sony's sort of took away. The music sounded more like a symphony, than a audiophile picking apart every single note and separating them so you could hear it individually (as the sony's did). This lead me to hear that the BOSE produced better sound to my ears with the test tracks provided. However using truely uncompressed audio, you will be able to hear much more notes and instruments with the MX1000x.

Reviewers constantly raved about how the Bass on the MX1000x was much better than the QC35, but to be completely honest I don't really hear that at all. I've ramped up my QC35 against a friends MX1000, and I prefer the Bass tones of my Bose over his, every time (even with uncompressed audio). Even the sound quality of the Bose I sort of prefer, even with the clarity that Sony produces.

In the end Bose wins in comfort hands down, there is absolutely no equal in this regard and really the QC35's shining quality. As far as bass and music quality go... its really a toss up on what you prefer. Sony hands down has the best noise cancelling possible, but are extremely uncomfortable and will give you a headache from how close they placed the speakers to your ears so they get squished!

If i were placed in the same position again of buying either, I don't think there's any change I would have changed my purchase. However if the MX1000x had been as comfortable, I would own a pair of sony's instead.

author: Delta Bravo 864
title: Best ANC Headphones Out There
content: Despite the negative Bluetooth reviews, my pair had no problems whatsoever. Bass is amazing and very thumping. It might not be the best on the market if you are buying the headphones for the bass, but it’s still amazing never the less. Sound quality is outstanding, and never gets old how amazing they are. The ANC is extremely impressive. For example, a Nike Factory Store is pretty loud on its own, but in Back To School week it was crazy. The Bose’s had no problem though. I put them on, turned on ANC, and cranked the volume halfway. Then... nothing! Absolutely nothing! Could not hear one outside noise. All in all, amazing product all around. Hefty price of $350, but if you are in the market for quality, ANC headphones, then the Bose QuietComfort 35 II are for you!

author: Mike Ransom
title: Works Great
content:
I absolutely love these. With no music playing I can barley hear things outside the headsets.  With music playing I can not hear anything other than the music.
Pros:
 - Comfortable
 - Long Battery Life, I have used them for several hours over several days without needing to recharge them
 - Great sound.  It is like having a stereo on my head.
 - Have not had any issues with them staying connected to my iPhone.

Cons:
 - I can not really thinking of any for this item.

I would recommend and would buy again.

author: Niko
title: Great headphones but hard to justify cost as a casual listener
content:
I got these headphones as a gift and in one word they are great. There are many detailed reviews from self-proclaimed audiophiles on here, so I won't waste time trying to write my own. I'll just make note that while these headphones are amazing, they didn't blow me away. Prior to owning these, I owned the Cowin E7 bluetooth noise canceling headphones for almost year. Make no mistake, these Bose headphones are a lot better than the budget friendly Cowin E7s, which cost roughly $70. But for me the QC 35 just didn't offer a big enough bump in my listening experience to justify the price difference.

That being said, I am a casual music listener. When I listen to music, I am usually doing something else and I don't often focus on the music itself. I just want my headphones to produce clear music that sound reasonably close to the original recording. I can live with minor distortions and I don't need feel as like I'm in a live studio.

Other things to note:
- I don't find these headphones to be super comfortable. I know I'm in the minority here, but the cups squeeze a bit too tight for my liking.
- As others have noted, the "noise canceling" aspect is more like "noise muffling" of certain frequencies. Not a bad thing per se, but just be aware that you'll still be able to hear a conversation happening next to you.
- While the bluetooth works well most of the time, I occasionally have connectivity issues. I sometimes have to disconnect/reconnect a few times to get things going.

Bottom line:
These headphones are amazing and are probably the best on the market. However, I think most people would be just as happy with cheaper alternatives. If you're a casual listener, who mostly plays music in the background, I would recommend saving your money and getting something cheaper.

author: Wayne
title: Awesome
content: Got these headphones for our trip to California on the plane. Works great

author: Vader
title: techno and electronic music sounds great. Heavy metal
content: Nobody in amazon owns more bluetooth headphones than me. This is my 12th pair and I think I've finally found what I'm looking for. I use this pair, strictly for my noisy office building. Although you still can hear the subtle, muffled murmurs here and there, it elimates 80% of the background noise when the music goes silent. It drowns out our servers almost completely. The sound quality is 9 out of 10. Soft music, pop and top 40 genre type, it handles really well. Dubstep, techno and electronic music sounds great. Heavy metal, death metal is fair. noise canceling at high setting deters the music quality from its better. Having it off will give the highest quality, but i have it set to high because of my noisy environment and im perfectly ok with it.

author: Spatzie
title: Love notes
content: Very comfortable to wear. Sound is great. Can not ask for anything more!!

author: gypsywillow
title: LOVE these!!!
content: I have gone back and forth about buying these headphones for years. I decided to buy them from Amazon because of their great return policy. Returning them has never crossed my mind. They're awesome!! The sound is great and I love the noise cancellation. I  was recently on a flight and ended up sitting next to a family with twin toddlers who screamed the entire flight and I barely noticed them! I think they paid for themselves on that flight. LOL

author: Flaqui
title: The best headphones I have owned
content: I used it mainly at the gym and airplanes. Highly recommend it if you want to block outside noise, and great sound quality

author: Scottvt
title: Unbelievable quality of sound and noise cancellation
content: I’ve owned many different types but these are awesome

author: Jill Oxford
title: Fantastic noise cancellation
content: Fantastic noise cancellation. Wireless feature WITH a plug-in capability as well for planes gives you the best of both worlds. Worth every penny!

author: Ann Hutson
title: Very Nice!
content: Could use just a tad more low end but overall a great product.  Would purchase again.

author: Mike Bankhead
title: Great headphones - the best
content: I tried many different headphones before buying these.  They are outstanding.  Good quality sound and cuts out background noise very well.

author: KenW
title: Often imitated, never duplicated. Love'em!
content: The Bose noise cancelling headsets are often imitated, but never duplicated.  I owned a pair of wired Bose noise cancelling headsets (which my son now owns) and wanted to go wireless.  They are easy to use, have a great battery life and are very comfortable.  I love'em, and never travel without them!

author: Noname Norelation
title: Expectations Exceeded
content: Dislike nothing. Great phone calls with audio monitoring feature (you don’t shout, you can hear your voice). Disabled voice prompts and switched the button to noise control. I turn noise control to low if I’m wearing a jacket hood made from nylon like a parka while moving around. Seems to confuse the mics. Might give you a sense of anxiousness the first few times, that’s how good the noise control is.

author: vikineo
title: Extremely poor audio quality in wired mode, good ANC
content: The audio quality is just ridiculous on certain songs when using wired mode. Bose, are you even looking into this? This is a serious problem and unacceptable for 300 dollar headphones. Just sounds utter garbage when using wired mode.

author: Sam B
title: Never knew what I was missing
content:
These are phenomenal headphones. I didn't realize the kinds of ambient noise I had around me until after I used this for a while. I bought other fancy headphones in the past, which usually had cables and ended up broken when I tripped across it. These are wireless, with a volume control built in. (You can still plug them in if you like, but I never do that.)

When I got them in the mail, they worked perfectly. Then, after an update, for a while, the software was a bit glitchy and would randomly beep. But at some point they must've fixed that in another update, after a year or so. Because they work perfectly again.

One downside is that the microphone isn't really worth having on it. In order to use the microphone, you have to put the headphones into "headset" "communications device" mode, which doesn't properly do sound cancelling. Worse, it sounds like someone is playing back the audio from outside the headphones. I never use that mode, because I can't stand it.

I also wish that I could stream (mix) two wireless sources at once. While speaking on the microphone. I often want to listen to a show on one device, and a video game on another, while possibly talking into a microphone. There isn't a solution for this. For my purpose, I connect to a small bluetooth adapter, and plug that into the line-in jack on my PC. Then I check the "listen to this" button for that line-in, so that I can hear the second audio source.

But despite any and all drawbacks, I am very happy with my headphones and would buy them again.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good in overall but sound quality can be improved.
content: This pair of headset is comfort to wear and battery lasts long enough before the end of the day when you start to charge it. The only deficiency of this product is that it only supports AAC and SBC codec which render the transfer rate  to be 320 kbps in maximum; while for its competitor, SONY wh-1000xm3, the transfer rate of its specific design(LDAC codec) makes it able to transfer up to 990kbps of music. So no wonder people are arguing the impressive sound quality of SONY wh-1000xm3. Yet SONY wh-1000xm3 is king of "notorious" for its discomfort of long-time wearing. So in the end it's a trade off between comfort and sound quality. I choose more comfortable QuietComfort 35 ii as I will be wearing my blue-tooth for hours.

author: Dale R.
title: Buy Sony instead.
content:
Not as good as the Sony.
Only about 50% actual noise cancellation, in my opinion.
No balance control as offered by Sony.

author: Franklin Peters
title: great product!
content: great performance!

author: Sev
title: Four Stars
content: Noise canceling is the best hands down...

author: a.roberts
title: Impressive
content: These aren't specifically for base sonthe base is good. But I've had base booster headphones that had better base. The house cancelation is very impressive and adds to the sound

author: Y. Y.
title: This is one of the best headset that money can by IMO
content: This is one of the best headset that money can by IMO. Eaay to carry and use especially for air travel. Now I bought total of 3!!

author: Kevin
title: $300 of fumes. Dizzy, sick stomach, and itchy.
content: Major chemical fumes. Couldn't wear. I have them outgassing outside. Maybe they will be usable.

author: CJMCK1065
title: Worth the $
content: One long flight with several unhappy toddlers & babies in the cabin: Noise cancelling works!

author: Don Q
title: This is a nice upgrade! I like the alcantara lining the head ...
content: I bought this to replace the prior version of this model.  This is a nice upgrade!  I like the alcantara lining the head band, and the foldable ear cups make storing the headphones easy.  The bluetooth functionality works well.  I paired it when my iMac, PC, and phone, and switching between them is easy.  The noise cancelling is really good.  I pair the headphones with some ear plugs, and I can barely hear the cars driving past my house even with the windows open.  I hope the ear cups hold up, the prior version had the material peeling off after a year of use.  The headphones are pretty comfy with a decent amount of pressure to stay on not too tight.  I've been able to wear these to sleep.

author: Justin Diffenderfer
title: Buy the warranty!
content:
This is the second Bose product I purchased, and both broke within a week of VERY light use. These headphones look and feel very nice, and the sound quality is absolutely amazing, but they just didn't hold up. I used them for five days and started getting what sounded like feedback from the right ear, but only while the active noise canceling is on.  I'm very disappointed that these extremely expensive headphones couldn't even hold up for a full week.

I'm aure Bose products are usually built pretty well (they certainly look like it), but there is definitely some kind of a quality control issue going on. I don't beat these up as much as the average person does. If you purchase these, you definitely want the warranty just in case. I'll update this after I've tried to get them repaired.

author: Vizar
title: Damn thing works great!
content: I bought this because my family was too noisy. Once I put it on, I forgot I had a family. It made me miss them so I had to take it off. But yeah, damn thing works great at cancelling out noise you don’t want to hear.

author: Rob
title: Would be 5 stars if they worked with computers too but only work with mobile devices
content: Sound quality is excellent. Noise canceling feature does not block ALL noise but these are WAY better than the Apple Studio Beats (those are garbage compared to these).  Overall I love these but with one exception:  in order to link to your device you must download the Bose app — which is, for some crazy reason, NOT AVAILABLE for an iMac or laptop computer so these are only useable with a phone or iPad or iPod.

author: Forever in school
title: Work as a transcriptionist
content: I use these with the fan on, air conditioner blowing and other background noises and you'd never know!

author: Crank
title: They are Bose, need I say more..
content: My husband is absolutely in love with these.. best thing I ever bought him!!

author: Tanusree Munshi
title: Great headphones
content: These are my favorite headphones. I just got these recently and I use them every day now.  The noise canceling is amazing, I use them on my morning commute on the train and a literally can’t hear anything around me other than my music so they are very effective.

author: gene dixon
title: Love these
content: I love everything about these except the price!

author: jane b.
title: Great for noise cancelling
content: My husband loves the sound quality and it blocks the tv noise

author: Amazon Customer
title: Music
content: The best headphones I ever owned

author: Joni Price
title: Bose is the Best
content: Bought for my husband, a professional pilot.  He knows quality headphones, and says these are amazing.  Highly recommend.  We have several Bose products.  All of them very good.  Every.  Single.  One.

author: RecoveringArtist
title: they are comfortable, they do cancel noise
content:
They are comfortable, they do cancel some noise, however you can still hear ambient  noise quite clearly.  I would say they muffle noise. These are not worth the price, however they appear to be good quality, well made.

Sound quality is good, not $300+ dollars good.

author: Will Gaston
title: The best
content: This is by far the best set of headphones I have owned. I use these mainly for air travel and business trips.

author: LATOYAYE
title: Fantastic!!!
content: I was so excited when I found these headphones. I did my research, and was intending to buy customized ones direct from Bose. Then came Black Friday and the excellent deals that day entails. Standard QC 35 II were $100 cheaper, and $159 cheaper than customized colors. Opted for the silver for me and the midnight blue for my Ska/Reggae-loving man for Christmas. He is a musician, saying he loved them is an understatement. Saying that I loved that he loved them is an understatement,  he can play his music as loud as he wants without disturbing me or the neighbors! last! Can not wait for her first flight with them to put them to the real test. Very easy to setup with android devices. Playing videos Youtube, Netflix, and Amazon  was fantastic. Excellent purchase!

author: Robbi I. Feela
title: Great and comfortable
content: Dont know about battry life but sound cancelling is fantastic

author: P. Rambau
title: Five Stars
content: Best bluetooth headphones, I love this.

author: Jeff M.
title: These Are Amazing. No More Putting Up with  Gym Music -- or Guys Grunting at the Gym
content:
I was getting sick of the gym. The music was starting to get to me, as were the sounds of guys banging the racks back down on the machines, and grunting. Maybe I'm getting old and cranky.

But I must say, I am so much happier now at the gym wearing these headphones. Bose, my physique and my girlfriend thank you.

author: Andrew D West
title: Excellent quality and sound
content: Excellent quality and sound.  However, when ordering there was no indication that it came with a case and Amazon suggested that a case was often purchased with it.  The headphones come with a case!  Don't buy one.  The case I bought was another $15 and it will now cost me $8 to send it back.  What a waste of my time too.

author: A. Butler
title: Great (but expensive) headphones
content: Sounds great, holds a charge well.

author: Daniel Hatfield
title: hear it all
content: noise reduction clarity, wireless connectivity, lightweight comfort--Bose has it all.  Ideal for sitting, walking and working.

author: Knowbody
title: Used and returned
content: Obviously a returned product sold as new.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Ok
content: They were everything I was lead to expect.

author: PickyNose
title: Wonderful except battery charging doesn't seem work...
content:
Update
not sire if mine is defective. sometimes there will be sharp noise bursting out in the middle when signal isn’t stable and you have to turn it off and on to stop the noise . Not a huge problem comparing its good sound quality but still annoying when it happens.

Update after continuous using of a couple weeks.
Still love it. The quality is good. Battery charging speed improves if you use high speed cable and plug.

The headphone somehow getting loose.. if I lay down or look down by tilting my head, it will fall. It also tangled hair easily, esp if you have long hair, when taking off.

---
Noise canceling is amazing.
Very comfortable.
Useful App and micro adjustable sound volume.

The only complaint would be the battery... I've charged for two days and it's never full.. not sure if it's broken.

author: M. Howard
title: Great sound!
content: Replaced my old set. The quality is worth the money.

author: Mike
title: Great noise canceling, best noisy open office solution, not great for audio enthusiasts
content: I bought these for my open office, which is rather noisy. It blocks most white noise entirely (HVAC, high pitch noise from lighting, etc). It probably cuts voices down by 60%. Bluetooth and dual pairing with my laptop and phone work seamlessly. Unfortunately, the audio quality is lacking - both highs and lows ("must be Bose?") are disappointing... but with music on at a low volume, these pretty much block out all voices entirely. The headphones themselves are lightweight and feel very sturdy and luxurious with the suede and leather; they certainly don't feel like cheap plastic. I tried wearing these outside on a windy day, and they just couldn't understand how to handle the "sound" of air blowing on them.

author: Margaret Drake
title: Best noise cancelling i've ever NOT heard!
content:
The audio quality blew me away. I had no idea music could sound so good. With the music on and noise cancellation on I couldn't hear a thing. Also these baby's feel like the world softest pillow on your ear, but also stay in place.

Would recommend

author: TacJunkie
title: Great headset
content: Most amazing headset I have ever owned. I forget I am wearing it and the battery seems to last forever.

author: TexMex
title: Bose beats Sony
content: Bought both Bose and Sony WH1000. I returned Sony in favor of the Bose as it's simplicity and ease of use is exceptional and intuitive without additional unneeded features that don't add much value.

author: Lis A
title: Worth the cost
content: These are good.  Not completely sound blocking but better than most. They do make flying quieter for sure.  They are comfortable.

author: Guillermo P.
title: ... the mail a couple days ago and couldn't be happier. Like most people
content:
I received these headphones in the mail a couple days ago and couldn't be happier. Like most people, i chose these over Sony's WH1000XM2 headphones -- as i simply wanted the best, and these headphones do not disappoint. i could only describe the noise cancellation feature as "magical" given the fact that a once noisy La Fitness during peak hours as well as a noisy workplace are now peaceful serenity. With my cheap ~9$ headphones i previously used, i would turn up the music constantly to try and block out noise, which as you know is counter-productive. You can keep the music really low or even switched off with these headphones and just turn on noise cancellation and ta da. The inverse wave cancellation blocks out a considerable amount of noise (not all).

There are a couple things however that i wish they improved upon for the price:
1. Wireless range is really low (less than 10 feet before you start noticing signal issue/loss)
2. You have to select Google Assistant OR Noise Cancellation via the app; You cannot have both available at the touch of a button simultaneously. I think everyone would have been OK with Bose adding another button for us to use both as needed.
3. Bluetooth pairing is limited to two device only. (So ipod, ipad, iphone trio cannot all be connected simultaneously)

Other than that, i purchased these for the noise cancellation and elegant audio quality and think they have far exceeded my expectations thus far.

author: Steve H.
title: Perfect for airplane trips!
content: If you want to enjoy a movie in your tablet of phone while traveling in a plane, this headphone is made for this. Pricey, yes, but well worth it.

author: Cali
title: Excellent
content: After upgrading fiware so that wired usage had noise cancellation features I am happy

author: seri
title: Can I give these more stars?
content:
I am in love with these headphones. I originally hesitated because of the cost but because I travel so much, and use 2 cell phones (one for business and one for personal), I decided to bite the bullet and hope for the best. These do not disappoint!

I have worn them on various flights and they have done a great job of canceling out the crying kids while I listen to music.

I work from home and these are also great for canceling out construction work going on outside.

I have successfully paired both my work phone and my personal phone at the same time to these headphones and it works perfectly. I can listen to music on my personal phone but still be connected for calls on my work phone.

And of course the sounds is incredible. BOSE really is the best for that.

I don't know why I waited so long to buy these. They're wonderful.

author: T. O.
title: Interesting to use. White-noise pressure. Little sweaty during long use.
content: It works excellently. I routinely work in data centers and server closets, and as anyone else who has done this can tell you, it is noisy. Not quite 'jet engine' noisy, but noisy. These headphones blocked out that noise and with noise cancellation on, it was reduced to "windy day". The active noise cancellation felt like it added a bit of pressure. Using them for a long period of time (4-10+ hours) led to frequently removing them to towel the sweat off from around the ears. Battery life is excellent. During phone calls, the person on the other end said they could hear me clearly.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great
content: Vary nice. Only down fall is can’t walk to far from were your connected.

author: Elroy
title: Audio quality is really good. A few brief drop outs
content: Audio quality is really good. A few brief drop outs, but nothing too much to worry about. I like that you can pair between two devices and switch back and forth easily. Also, i like the fact that if you are connected to both your computer and phone, and a phone call comes through, you can answer using headphones seamlessly. I did have a few wired connection issues while using the headphones on a plane - i was only getting audio from 1 ear cup. Issue resolved by purchasing a Bose airline adaptor (~$10) - they should really supply this out of box. The adapter also allows connection to aeroplane tv sets with either single or twin 3.5mm jacks, so that's handy.

author: Sean Gherardi
title: Firmware Improvements
content:
My original review of these headphones was 3 stars, mainly because the unpleasant active noise cancellation feature had to be manually disabled each time the headset was turned on via the buggy Bose Connect application.  The other reason was that these headphones were not able to decode audio for Skype on Android.

Since my original review, Bose has added the option to switch between noise cancellation settings using the press of the action button.  If you don't mind replacing the virtual assistant function on the action button with the noise cancellation setting function then it only takes a couple clicks of the button to turn the active noise cancellation off when you turn the headset on and put it over your ears.  I would have preferred if this setting could be remembered by the device when it was turned on, but this is close enough not to be too inconveniencing.

To be clear, some users may not be bothered by the active noise cancelling.  My ears are pretty sensitive (I think?) and well-trained as I do some music production as a hobby - so to me it feels like I am 20ft underwater when the active noise cancelling is enabled.  A few other people I know who are not audiophiles have also noticed this.  Some reviewers have not.  Try them and find out for yourself!

As for decoding/encoding Skype audio on android - I am not sure if this issue still remains as I have simply been using an iPad when I need to use this headset for Skype calls.

So I will give this headset 4 stars, because of the other great features which do work as advertised:

1) The headset is extremely light and comfortable.  You will forget you are wearing it.
2) The sound quality is great considering that these are wireless.
3) Battery life is outstanding.  I've used these for 4-6 hours a day about five days in a row without having to recharge.
4) They have not fallen apart on me - the carrying case does a great job of protecting the headset during transport.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great for flying
content: Some aircraft are very loud.  This works for most of them.

author: Squirley
title: Calls are interrupted - stops working
content:
I have been using the original Bose Noise suppressing headphones for years and absolutely loved them.  I thought that by now the wireless version would be excellent too.  I was wrong.  I installed the apps for my laptop and my iPhone 6 and paired the headphones to both.  I think I'll be returning them.
Good:
 • Comfortable
 • Light weight
 • Announces battery strength and paired devices when you turn them on
 • Microphone works very well for calls in both my home office and a very busy client site.
 • Extremely easy to pair to a device
Bad:
 • Garbled music!  Music from Laptop is very often garbled and the overall sound quality is bad.
 • They seem cheaper.  Not that they are, they are very well built, but I think in their striving for light weight they made them feel a bit cheaper.
 • While on a call on the laptop (Skype usually) other desktop alerts or any iPhone activity interrupts the call for at least 10 seconds or more.  I've had to ask people to repeat the couple minutes of a discussion because of this.  It should just mute the call by 20% and overlay the alert message so I don't miss anything.
 • Continuously announces that the iPhone is paired when it has a message like a text  that you have not dismissed yet.
 • The blue tooth connection just stops working.  While listening to music from YouTube on the laptop, it will just stop working.  I have to turn them off and wait several minutes for the paired devices to time out before they will reconnect.
 • The Google Assist isn't very useful.  Hopefully it will get better over time.

author: IC-DOC
title: Great update from QC2. Bluetooth and hardwired in one high quality headset.
content: What is not to like?

author: solomega
title: Excellent
content: Very comfortable! They are great for conference calls or for just listening to music. Excellent sound!

author: Vincent Burke
title: Absolutely the best
content: These are a must have for flying or trying to get peace in any noisy setting.

author: C. Duppenthaler
title: Noise canceling is like a superpower on airplanes.
content: The best. Very comfortable. Sound is flawless. Noise canceling is best in class. Controls are great. Range and battery life are admirable. Do you need the best? There are a lot of alternatives for half the price. This one is the best and priced like it. Worth it if you travel or plan to use them often.

author: Bradley J. Richman
title: Great sound and Bluetooth convenience. Typical Bose. I LOVE THEM!
content: Weird as it may sound, I use them when I drive to Mayo from Des Moines, Iowa. That is a 3/12 hour drive. I wear the headphones, when appropriate, and hear nothing but the music. No highway sound, wind, etc. with these. Great product and worth the money!

author: PY
title: a little pricey but good quality.
content: It's Bose, a little pricey but good quality.

author: Josh Persaud
title: How to get the most out of your Bose QuietComfory 35 II
content:
I’ve been using Bose for our sound equipment since I was a boy in middle school where my dad had a fancy basement movie theater setup. We used a custom Bose setup and I’ve been a fan since. Now it’s nearly 10 years later and here I am buying Bose for myself.

I bought these headphones because I live in NYC and the train is very annoying (MTA, I can’t complain enough about them). Using normal earphones or headphones on the train will force you to increase the volume, then everyone hears your music and you damage your hearing. I had also lost my Jaybirds so I needed something new.

These headphones are great, they are some of the most comforable headphones out right now. The noise canceling is as good as you can get right now at this price point.

One thing that bothered me when i first started listening to music on these is that the artist’s voice sounded distant compared to the instruments and beats. Some of the highs were also not playing how i liked. I played around with the equalizer in Spotify and got the sound perfected. If you aren’t satified with the sound your headphones are making, just match your equalizer to mine and I guarantee that you’ll love these.

author: Joffre Quintas
title: Excellent,  wonderful
content: Excellent quality,

author: Matthew Welch
title: Perfect for an open office
content: Put these on and instantly the office around me disappeared. Perfect for drowning out the coworkers in an open office so you can focus & get some work done. Only wish I hadn’t waited so long to buy them.

author: VCDG
title: Sound reduction, not noise cancelling.
content:
Bought these to help me concentrate at work and NOT hear any of the noise around me. However, I have tried them on with the TV on, with fairly low volume, and I can still hear it over the music. Only way NOT to hear the tv is to turn the volume up high on the headphones. I have hoped to replace my old Bose headphones (wired) which still work, but have lost most of the covering over the ear cups. Plus the limit mobility from them being wired. I'll have to try them out some more, before I decide to return them or not.
Sound quality thus far is best from my phone. My pc may need a better bluetooth transmitter. Looking to also get a transmitter for my tv.

author: TBR
title: It's 100% comfortable..
content: It's 100% comfortable... However ANC (for the particular item I had) wasn't the best. I could hear conversations around me, it does cut down low frequency continuous hums like a fridge. One out of 5 times, turning it one wouldn't do anything ?! no green / white LEDs. I had to keep trying on off every minute or so until it worked. Call quality was good, and in general the sound is good. But for a $350 item, every little aspect needs to be good, and so I returned mine.

author: NJ Contributor
title: Comfort, Feature Rich, Great Audio... Love It!
content:
I love the comfort this Bose headsets provide. The sound quality is above average, expected from a headset at this price range.
You can have up to 2 active simultaneous audio sources but you can add a lot more. The Bose App helps on making this process a lot simpler.
When the limit of 2 is reached, from the App, you simply deactivate one audio source to activate the desired one.
When having both active, the switch between sources is seamless. I currently have my MacBook, iPhone and Fire HD as audio sources while
having the MacBook and iPhone active all the time. When I need to use my Fire HD, I simply disable the MacBook. It's that simple.

The call quality from my iPhone is excellent. People can't tell I'm using a Bluetooth headset.

The price may deter many from looking at this product, but once you have it in your hands, you can't let go. It's that good!

author: Ravi Kiran Devarasetty
title: A great buy and worth the price and hype!
content:
I bought Cowin E7 wireless headphones a few months ago (when I was on a budget) and was not terribly impressed with it. My primary purpose back then was not high quality music, but just to be able to move around. It was not too bad.

When my budget freed up last month, I bought this product at a $50 discount during Christmas time. It was very easy to pair the headphones to two sources (my work PC and personal cell phone). I had to do some reading on forums to make sure it eventually worked with the Windows 7 PC. I even listened to some music on my cell phone and it was amazing. The battery life is also great. With my usage, it lasts me three days. The Bose app on the iPhone is very intuitive and simple as well. My iPhone also lets me check the battery percentage of the headphones on the phone itself.

For anyone who takes and makes a lot of calls and switches between PC and cell phones, this is a must buy. They also work well with my glasses that I wear all the time. I am glad I eventually bought these!

author: firefox09
title: They are gorgeous. So proud to wear them. Plus they are so soft
content: They are gorgeous. Stay charged for 15 hrs continuously at a time. The pair very easily.  These are so so soft. Like having clouds on your ears. Noise cancellation is phenomenal...love love love

author: Amazon Customer
title: Loud beeping sound
content:
I have had these headphones for about a month. I cannot listen to anything for more than 30 minutes before there is a long, loud, and irritating beeping sound. It is so loud that people who sit next to me can hear it. It does not go away when disconnecting the headphones or after uninstalling and reinstalling the Bose app.

Otherwise, the headphones are very comfortable and the sound quality is good.

author: David Couch
title: Great Quality and Sound
content:
Use it mostly when I fly.
Great sound quality  and keeps out the Airplane vibration.

author: Tawnya Dozier
title: Wife got these for me and ruined me forever
content:
My wife bought these for me as a gift. I'd never spend this kind of money on myself for headphones. I usually buy $10 ones and am pretty happy. Not any more. Once I used these for a few days, it's a pain going back to anything else. The kids didn't believe me when I said I couldn't hear what they were saying when I had the noise cancelling feature enabled. Heck, I didn't even know they were talking!

I bought another pair of noise canceling headphones for 1/7th the price during a Cyber Monday sale I found on slickdeals. But I returned that other pair after 2 days. What a piece of junk. My old $10 headphones are better than the wireless noise canceling headphones in the $50-$70 range. Now I want another pair of the Bose for home (I took them to work). Ugh, I guess I'll just have to shell out the cash or wait for my birthday. I'm tired of cords catching on things anyway, or forgetting I'm wearing headphones and stepping away from the desk with them on. With the wireless ones, that's not a problem.

Sound quality is excellent. Music and videos sound great. Even with nothing playing, you can use the noise canceling feature, combined with having something over your ears, to block out a good percentage of sound. I often put them on and forget to play music because I can focus really well without music when I wear these.

author: Hugo Reyes
title: These headphones are a total waste of money
content: A total waste of money, do not buy these!. I have had these for less than a month and i have noticed a clicking sound coming from the left headphone.

author: Stefan Hauge
title: High quality sound and cancellation overshot expectations
content: The noise cancellation alone is great, it's like being in a whole new world. Then comes sound, with both superb sound (great to listen to) and top tier cancellation, you definitely can't hear anything around you and it's a great experience. On top of that the headphones are very comfortable, so you won't get tired of wearing them (over ear, soft pads).

author: Jonathan
title: They're just very, very good
content:
I wanted some headphones that I could use for two main things: work (I work from and online so I wear headphones just about all day every day) and traveling. So other than how good they sounded, I wanted them to be comfortable to wear all the time, or even sleep in if I was on a plane. I also get bad headaches, so they needed to, you know, not give me a headache. They also needed to not hurt my ears after extended periods of wear. And, basically, these nail it. They sounds great, the noise canceling is top of the line, but they're also much lighter than many other pricey brands I've tried. I can wear them for hours and and be totally comfortable.

When I was researching various brands I noticed that the battery life on these was generally less than a lot of others, at about 20 hours. However, that's 20 hours with Bluetooth AND noise-canceling on. You can use the headphone jack on these and double the battery life with 40 hours of noise-canceling. But really even so, that's mostly a concern for when you're traveling, and 20 hours is is plenty log enough for most any trip.

I guess the only drawback is the price tag, but it is what it is. For me, they're worth it, because they ticked all the boxes.

author: Kimberly Coursen Antinone
title: Worth the money
content: Comfortable and great noice cancellation

author: JVD
title: Comfortable and quiet
content: These were a gift for my granddaughter starting college. They really reduced background sounds and she said they’re very comfortable.

author: rich584
title: Wow!
content: Expensive.  And worth every penny.  I have a very noisy utility room and I can't believe how well the noise cancelling works.  I tried a similar Sony headset and didn't like the controls on that.  The Bose set has easy to use controls and was more comfortable.  Sound and noise cancelling excellent on both.  Extremely happy with the Bose, I am.

author: Nifty
title: Quite good at eliminating noise, comfortable, good sound
content: I mostly use these on airplanes and they are quite good at eliminating noise. I also use them to help sleep when neighbors are using motorized yard tools. The ability to connect to multiple devices is nice, but sometimes I want to just use the noise cancellation and there seems to be no easy well to tell them not to search for bluetooth devices.

author: DayumWright
title: Amazing headphones!
content:
I previously had the corded headphones and I really loved the sound quality but the cord just gets really annoying.  I fly once a month, so it’s sooo nice to have that freedom when walking through the airport.  I really enjoy the fact that these headphones are rechargeable, I didn’t have a problem with the battery on my previous, but seeing that I can just plug in at the end of the night makes it very convenient.  The sound quality is obviously phenomenal, that’s why we pay the $$ for Bose products.  Noise cancellation I’d say is not as great as my previous corded ones, but still better than anything else i’ve tried.  When I found out there was an app, I was like WTF? But the app is pretty useful.  Being able to connect to two devices at once is really cool. I can connect to my phone and my computer while I work so I don’t miss any notifications.

Cons:
With all that good, there are a few things that would make these headphones perfect.  1. It would be nice to have play/pause, skip, and restart capabilities directly on the headphone.  2. When I take a call, I lose the noise cancellation capability and I can hear what’s going on in the background which gets a little distracting.  Even with this said, I’d highly recommend these for anyone looking.  Spend the extra $ and get the best quality, it's definitely worth it!

author: RandomEstablishedHuman
title: Painful, sound cuts out constantly
content: I have really good hearing and bought these to help me concentrate. Hardcore buyer's remorse. Don't get these. They're heavy, uncomfortable on my jaw and the top of my head. Worst of all the sound cuts out at anywhere from 3-minute to 30-second intervals. Troubleshooting forums suggest this happens when then Bluetooth signal encounters a wifi signal? The noise cancellation isn't bad (low works ok, high setting creates a painful pressure), but these particular headphones are not worth the hype at all. I wish there were a try-before-you-buy option -- noise-canceling headphones are great; just not this design.

author: Gordon
title: Excellent sound quality
content: Fantastic for watching Tv, and listening to music from my iTunes on my iPhone, and making and receiving phone calls from my iPhone.

author: J D'Auria
title: Life Saver on airplanes, in the office, on the train, etc
content: I know it can be expensive, but think of it as a small investment. I swear these pay for themselves over and over again every time I am in a noisey situation and need to either focus, relax, or sleep.

author: Shorty78666
title: Great!
content: Wonderful headphones! Can’t wait for my next flight!

author: kareldejong1
title: Bose is the best!!!!
content:
Love my Bose headset,  they are the best.
Unlike the Sony headset the Bose headset you can turn it on high volume and nobody can hear it.
Extremely satisfied.

author: Mi_Lo
title: Five Stars
content: Amazing! Crystal clear sound. Vaccumed the house with them on and couldn’t hear a thing.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Cord Input Faulty
content: Agree with others-- bluetooth is great but the connect when using the physical cord isn't. I bought a new cable from Amazon to see if it was the cable, but the port connection seems to be faulty-- I'm only getting sound from the left ear with this new cord.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: I bought these as a gift for my boyfriend. He absolutely loves them.

author: Lee D
title: Almost broke my own neck
content:
The sound detail with these is phenomenal. It picks up the smallest details...which I wasn't used to, which is how I almost snapped my own neck. I was listening to music and a subtle noise that directionally sounded like it came from behind me, scared the bejesus out of me to the point I snapped my head around so fast I nearly incapacitated myself.

The battery life is great on these, even when you don't use them for awhile they still retain their charge. They charge relatively fast too. You can use them with the aux cable without turning them on also which uses extremely minimal amounts of the battery.

They are very comfortable, coming from a guy that wears glasses and has big ears, I have worn these for hours without discomfort.

I don't have a lot of experience with noise cancellation but it seems to work good to me, I've actually put the headphones on and used the noise cancellation to take a nap.

I watch a lot of TV and movies with them and have them hooked to my amazon fire stick, the only down side is if you want to use them with bluetooth on another device while near the fire stick you either have to go onto the fire stick and disconnect the headphones or unplug it.

My only MILD gripe is having to install a Bose app on my phone to update the firmware and change what the left side button does (I use mine to adjust the noise cancellation but it can be used for Alexa or Google assistant too)

I can't 100% say it is or isn't worth the money because I have never had an equally expensive headset but I would recommend these to anyone as I have been very happy with the sound and build quality. They even come with a high quality case to store them in.

author: Aron
title: Awesome product and great quality
content: Great product!  Great quality

author: Gypsywoman
title: Great product and so as they advertise. Wonderful for plane travel !
content:
Have taken these now on 4 plane trips and used them on the plane, what a difference it makes in comfort level when flying.  Also in the room at night if others are sleeping I can watch a movie or listen to music knowing I’m not bothering anyone.  Great quality and very sturdy.  I’m rough on things when I travel and they show no wear and tear at all.
The quality of the music is so much better than just listening to music on my iPad or phone.  They are an investment but if you travel a good bit they are well worth the investment or if you just enjoy a great sound of your music enjoyment, buy them ! Yes

author: Violet Grace
title: Love mine
content: I love these headphones. I am 65 and I so enjoy listening to books on mine. They fit well and are very comfortable. I use them at the gym when I am on the treadmill. Makes time go by much faster! Easy to use and I'm so glad I got them!

author: Amber
title: Love the convenience of these headphones
content: Love the convenience of these headphones! Today I talked to my friends, listen to a book on my phone, and cleaned the house without needing to carry my cell phone around all day long. Love the sound and long distance. Microphone quality is superb - my friends were able to hear me very well. I haven't hooked up them to our TV yet, but it will serve very well when one person wants to watch TV while the other one cannot be disturbed because sleeping or working..

author: C. DeGhoul
title: Less-than-impressive noise cancelling and sound drops out.
content:
Update: 12/8/18 - I had a conversation with Amazon and we determined the headset was likely defective, so they kindly and quickly replaced them.  The replacement pair is MUCH better about the sound-dropping issue, but it still has happened a couple of times.  Noise-cancelling is still, in reality, merely noise-muffling.  For the price, they’re disappointing.  It’s nice not having a wire but I’m afraid that’s the best thing I can say about them.  My much less expensive - but wired - Street headset works as well for sound quality, if not better.  I guess sound quality is the sacrifice you have to make if you want to lose the wire.

Original review:  After having just picked up a Bose Soundwear, and being impressed with it, I splurged on the QC 35 II.  That was a mistake.  They are in no way noise-cancelling.  Noise dampening, yes.  Cancelling?  Not even close.  From the commercials, they make you think you'll be insulated from the outside world.  Nope.  The other issue I have is the moment I stepped out of my house, the music I was playing started to cut out.  This did this on all settings, including when the 'noise cancelling' was turned off.  It became so bad that when I was returning home I literally shut them off, which made them absurdly expensive ear muffs.  I turned them back on before entering the house and, while in the house, they worked fine.  So, apparently I can only use them while in a building.  That's not going to work for me.  Heck, my much less expensive, corded Star Wars Street headset muffles nearly as much extraneous sound and they're not even noise cancelling!  And they don't constantly drop the sound when I'm walking outside (because, of course, they're corded.)  At lunchtime, I turned them and music on and stepped outside.  About 5' outside the door, sure enough, the music started glitching again.  I'm torn between wanting to see if a replacement will have the same issues or just getting my money back after reading all the problems people have been having with them.  For the amount of money they're getting for these, they should be flawless.  So far, I'm 50/50 on satisfaction with the Bose products I've purchased, with this particular purchase being firmly in the "substandard" category.

author: Eric E.
title: awesome!
content: Bose always makes great products!

author: JMP
title: Big improvement over QC15/must have for frequent flyer
content:
I had a pair of QC15 for years and they quit working after a lot of use and replaced them with these.

A big improvement over the 15's.  The bluetooth is very nice over having to use them corded (I wish airlines would start enabling bluetooth on their IFE's so you didn't have to break out the cord.  It's nice having the rechargable battery, I love the auto shutoff feature and noise control level they added.  They fold up nicely to fit in the case.  Sound quality if good.  I lost the cord one time on my 15's and it was expensive to replace and this cord looks like it's a simple audio cord like you would use to connect an external MP3 player to a car so should be very cheap and easy to replace if it's loss.

A couple small things I don't like is there no plastic business card/ID holder to place a business card or contact info in case the headphones get lost and there is no airline adapter (fortunately my QC15 had one and I am just going to use that and sometimes airlines will give you one).  Most airlines have the regular plugs but a lot of airlines use the two prongs in business and first class when they furnish the headphones (probably to deter people from stealing theirs) so you will need the adapter in these cases (I prefer these over the crappy airline ones).

I'd recomend these for anyone that flies once a month and does a lot of redeyes.  For the occassional short-haul day time flyer there are cheaper headphones that work great.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I love it
content:
I am already using it for a month. There is only one subjectively minor bug. When I connect to my cellphone and laptop simultaneously, it sometimes gets confused and not playing sound from any device. Reconnecting both devices usually helps. But I still love those headphones. Battery is incredibly durable that surprised me. I was listening to them for about 5 hours for about 3 days to get them discharged to 10% and it is with noise cancellation turned on.
Noise cancellation is really good also. Pretty loud noises become so faint and distant.

author: Kevin
title: LOVE THEM
content: These headphones are absolutely amazing. The noise cancellation is excellent. The app works flawlessly. I am also a big fan of the sound sports as well!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Noise cancelling not as good as previous pair
content:
I upgraded from the Bose QC25 to QC35, mainly because i wanted to get rid of the cord.  The charge is okay, could be better.  I use the headphones at my desk, and charge them for 2 hours Monday morning, and they last me most of the work week.  However, I do then have 2 hours where I can't use them on Monday morning (they're too expensive to leave out to charge if i'm not at my desk).  When I used my wired headphones, I used a rechargeable battery for the noise cancellation, and it held a charge for longer than the amount i use the headphones during 1 week.

My main source of disappointment, however, is the noise cancelling.  I don't feel that these headphones have as good of quality of noise cancelling as my previous (wired) set.  I can choose "high", "low" or "off" for noise cancelling.  However, the noise cancelling doesn't improve at all when i move  from low to high, the only thing that changes is the amount of static I hear in my headset.  When i use my headset to join a call from my laptop, the audio quality is low (as reflected by the messages that skype returns to me even).

I do like that that this set has a microphone and i can take calls from my phone or my laptop using these headphones.  I like that i can switch back and forth from my phone to my laptop.

However, I paid an exorbitant amount of money for these, as they are considered great for noise cancelling, but I definitely feel that they are not as good as the earlier version.  If someone walks up behind me, I often don't notice them because i have my headphones, but it seems that is more that i'm zoned out than due to good noise cancelling.  As I am quite aware of the noises around me if i'm not 'zoned out'.

author: YODOG
title: Disappointing
content: Material quality while it appears to be high, the bluetooth disconnects repeatedly with head movement.  Sound quality near excellent.  Battery use unknown, item was returned

author: Serious Jazz Fan
title: Good until today .....
content: I bought them in July 2018....good until today. They developed a "tac" noise in one cup when connected to my Mac laptop with a cable. I couldn't find a wireless app to check them wireless.....Now the hassle of calling bose etc.

author: Mike B.
title: No more cords!!
content: Awesome! Awesome! Awesome! What more can I say? And what really pleased me is that when you turn them on, they connect to whatever device(s) they are paired with (in Bluetooth range) so whichever one you start using, it’s already connected!!  And of course, the sound quality and noise canceling are awesome!!  Note: for whatever reason the Feature Rating for Bass Quality of this review wouldn’t work.  Great bass, I give it 5 stars!

author: Seattle Jogger
title: Might be uncomfortable with noise cancellation. So try out first before buying.
content:
Ouch. This is what my ear was after first use. I was uncomfortable to the extend that i had to take it off in 40 minutes and see if the headache goes away. The pressure during noise cancellation is awkward and not confirting. The sound is NOT the quality u can expect from 350$ headphones. I have multiple other headphones and feel they provide much better experience when watching movies (via bluetooth)
Overall the quality is good and found a way to not use noise cancellation.

Update: After a month, i do feel comfortable with the noise cancellation.

author: Michael S.
title: Low Fidelity
content: well if you like mid-range only this is a great product for you I would buy it. but if you like high fidelity I would pass on this one. Also could use a little more volume. At this price point it's a total disappointment

author: Bad in Bahston
title: Great headphones. Bad fit for smaller people.
content: While the sound reduction is good, this model is significantly larger than the SoundLink II headphones (non-noise reduction) and they don't fit my wife's head correctly. They don't adjust small enough for them to stay on her head.

author: Steve W.
title: Great noise cancellation
content: Great noise cancellation, good volume and decent sound.  It's not super quality audio, but it's a good compromise to not have use wires!

author: jpc54
title: Just right
content: I shopped quite a bit and finally arrived on the Bose QC35 II.  Compared to Sony and others listening in the stores before I purchased. They are just right for my tastes.  Good purchase great service.

author: Wade Borth
title: Great value
content: I have a set of the original Bose noise cancelling headsets.  I use them almost everyday and finally after 6 yrs or so they stopped working so I went with the wireless headsets and wow love the quality, comfort, and convenience.  Worth the money especially if you use them for work and need quality

author: HeavyFeather
title: Great Sound! Not happy with Noise Cancellation! Not comfortable for people who wear glasses.
content:
I used this product for couple of days. I was happy with sound, but I'm having headaches with Noise cancellation. After wearing these headphones with noise cancellation ON for an hour, I'm having headache and I had to relax for a while. If you wear glasses and need headphones comfy enough to wear longer periods of time, then these are not the ones for you.

Headphones rating @5:

Sound: 5
Weight: 5
Battery: 5
Ease of connecting / use: 5
ear padding: 5
Comfort: 4
Noise Cancellation: 2

author: Arthur
title: Best headphones I’ve ever owned
content: Best headphones I’ve ever owned. They are comfortable, have great noise cancellation, and I can go over a week without having to charge it.
