One downside is you have to go into the app every time you turn on the headphones to change the level of noise cancellation. Low works best in my opinion.

author: LANMANTA
title: Buy anything else, you maybe disappointed
content:
I've had some noise cancelling headphones in the past, but not Bose.
I don't normally pay this much for a headset, but now that I have purchased the Bose QuietComfort 35, I wish I would have done it earlier.
Put it in simple terms:
"This Bose headset works so well, it pissed off my wife because I couldn't hear her."

author: Jackie Anderson
title: Great
content: Great headphones

author: Thomas Hackett
title: Great for music.... sucks for calls and bluetooth cuts out
content:
I don't know if NOW it is normal to have an echo while ON a call with these headphones.  Bought these for my wife so she can be free of wires and not have to constantly change out batteries.  Sound quality and noise cancellation is way beyond satisfactory.  Although, while making a call, it seems that you are using a web based platform, like Skype or Discord.  You can hear an echo if you have a tv in the background, or you can hear someone typing as if their phone was right at the keyboard.  Was told by a Bose agent via chat  "Karla at 14:18, Sep 18: The QC 35 has a side-tone feature. And it is perfectly normal for it to have an echo."  Wow.  Whatever this "side tone feature" is, its crap.

Another thing is that the bluetooth would cut out and disconnect at random times.  Just got these not too long ago and it worked fine until a few days ago.  The headset would say "disconnected from XXX" and then reconnect a few seconds later.. or having to reconnect manually.  Did an update to the Bose Connect app as well, which didn't fix the connection issue.  You can connect with the aux cord they provide, but what is the point of having it being hands free?  Anyway, if you like having your music drown out everything else around you, these are great.  Just don't use them for calls.  You're better off NOT using them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The sound is amazing and so is the noise cancelling
content: These are incredible! The sound is amazing and so is the noise cancelling. Pairing this with my iPhone took all of 5 seconds, super easy and great app on the app store. These will be primarily be used at the gym which I did today and they were very comfortable even with the ear pads getting wet.  One of the features I really like is how large they marked the left and right ear cups on the inside of each cup.

author: janet henry
title: Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones, Noise-Cancelling
content: Love, Love, Love them!!!  I've only had the oportunity to use them on a 3 hour flight twice... but the experience was fabulous!!  I had a screaming child sitting behind my seat; so,  I put on my new noise cancelling headphones, listened to my music a while and fell right to asleep!  The sound is crisp, clear and well balanced plus the noise cancellation is amazing!!!  Best headphones I have ever owned!!!  I highly recommend them.  Love the Rose Gold color too!

author: Cody Peterson
title: Wish I would have done it sooner.
content: These are amazing for big noise cancellation. Interestingly enough they don't cancel small noises very well which is perfect. On a plane though, wow! For 98% of the flight I don't hear the engine. I knew these would work some but man, they are way better than I thought was possible. That 2% of the flight where the engine is reverse thrusting and taking off, if next to the engine, the headphones struggle a bit like anything else. There is a little crackle but it is still way quieter than otherwise would be. I can see why some people don't even listen to music on these and just turn the noise cancelling on to study or do work. I have gone cheap before and was never happy. Pulling the trigger on purchasing these expensive headphones was worth every penny and I feel like I wasted so much money on other cheaper garbage that never really worked well. Bravo BOSE!

author: Cory Foster
title: Most comfortable headphones I’ve used
content: I couldn’t be more happy with these headphones. I am not an audio expert so I can’t get into the technical side of the sound of these headphones, but as a normal everyday listener I would have to say the audio quality is excellent. Call quality, noise cancellation, and battery life is also great. I can not speak to the effectiveness to the personal assistance features of these because I don’t use them. These clamp just enough to hold on to your head but not so tight that they become uncomfortable. The headband and earmuffs are very soft and comfortable. In a climate controlled environment these can be worn all day without any issues but could cause some sweating at ear pads in hotter environments as with most over the ear headphones. Overall, I highly recommend these headphones.

author: NJM1971
title: Worth the price!
content: They are lighter than beats. They fit better over my large ears. They connect and work fine with Iphone XS. They charge quickly. Only complaint is that the fake leather cups seal off air flow so my ears tend to get a little hot but thats the same with beats and others. Would be nice if foam cups were an option. One star off only for that. Has buttons for controlling audio and for controlling levels of noise cancelation. Recommend these!

author: Team Geofrog
title: These are the best headphones ever
content: These are the best headphones ever! I wear them a lot. Great sound, I don’t have to blast the music to hear it because of noise reduction, and it’s easy to switch between devices.

author: Luis Mejias
title: Ok
content: Good sound and excellent quality of materials. Connectivity with Mac is a real problem.

author: Stevenopolis
title: Great unit, afraid I may break them lol
content: Love it. No troubles yet but I’m afraid they may not be really sturdy? Again, great so far but I’m always afraid I’m going to break them. Maybe because I spent so much on them.

author: leonardo
title: functionality
content: excellent product, meets all its descriptions

author: Milissa Neilson
title: Item was clearly used even though description was new
content: Received the headphones and they were clearly used. The manufactures packaging was torn. The headphones has small scratches. The internal packaging was clearly opened before. These must have been returned by someone after they used them for a few weeks. Returning them.

author: Christina
title: Disappointed
content: I have had the ear bud version of the Bose noise cancelling headphones for years and I really love them and they work great. I was disappointed with the noise cancelling on this headset though ...I could still hear my coworker chewing her lunch on the highest setting...UGHHHHHH.

author: Randy H.
title: Great product
content: I bought this set of bows and one set of beats noise canceling headphones. I compared both of them and I ended up keeping the Bose.  I think that says everything

author: tolstoygirl
title: The noise cancellation is awesome and the quality of music is pretty good
content: Loving them!! The noise cancellation is awesome and the quality of music is pretty good.

author: Tempokitty
title: Highly recommend
content: I've been using Bose products since the 80's when I bought a set of the 601 Series II speakers. Bose has never let me down and these are no exception. They sound amazing and are without a doubt the most comfortable headphones I've ever worn.

author: Phillip Adams
title: Bose IS the best
content: This is my first Bose item and it’s defintely true the cliche “you get what you pay for”. I would recommend it to anyone that wants accurate sound AND it blocks out so much noise I’ve literally fallen asleep almost everywhere I was sitting down (not driving obviously- LOL)

author: nb98133
title: AMAZING!!!!
content: these are awesome. Love these for travelling, and just got a Bluetooth transmitter hooked up to my cable box. Now I can watch TV at night without disturbing the wife and kids while they are sleeping. I should have done this years ago.

author: Garth Vader
title: Well worth the money!
content: Great headphones works as advertised!

author: sgold
title: Comfortable and great sound
content: Most comfortable headphones I have used, I won't fly without them.

author: Drew
title: Great sound. Great noise cancellation. Surprisingly long battery life for rechargeable.
content: Bought this as a birthday present for my significant other. We like to travel. I’ve had the QC25 for years which is noise cancelling but wired (3.5mm jack). I really enjoy the mobility of wireless connection and these have a strong range without disruption. My biggest reserve was the rechargeable battery vs replacement AAAs, especially on international flights. I wish I could provide more insight on battery life but they’ve never gone dead between convenient charge times. They last more than 8 hours one way, as well as a round trip, both flights (4 hours each way) with a week in between without being charged. Bose has always had a reputation for quality sound. These sound better than any other Bose headphones I’ve own. Also she loves the color.

author: Wayne C Burkan
title: Super comfortable, great noise cancellation, no issue pairing and a great mike for making phone calls.
content:
I am a long-time Bose QC 25 user, so I'm used to good noise cancelling. Because I wear them while doing chores, however, the wire invariably catches and yanks. So after years' of my beloved QC 25, I took the plunge. The QC 35 II Wireless has topped even those high expectations!

I wear headphones to help me concentrate at work and to listen to music, so have been wearing this pair an average 6-8 hours a day, and they are by far the most comfortable pair I've ever owned. The noise cancelling is awesome, and being wireless is especially liberating. I was concerned, however, after reading reviews of pairing issues. Out of the box I paired my phones with my iPhone 8, my iPad Air 2 and my Lenova laptop, all without a hitch. I have not had ANY issues with connectivity.

I have not found any reviews on the phone's performance while making calls, so I wanted to highlight that I can receive, and to my relief, everyone reports they can hear me loud and clear: on a bus, in the wind, it makes no difference. I love my QC 25 II.

author: Thomas L Miles
title: Don’t fly without them
content: Read the description... enough said

author: Ken
title: I haven't found better.
content: For those long plane flights, this is the ticket. I own a gen I and bought this gen II for my daughter. They're both excellent and I haven't found any headsets that can come close in terms of comfort, active noise cancellation, and overall quality.

author: vie
title: Must for travel
content: Nice noise canceling and perfect for long flights

author: Tool enthusiast
title: Well worth it
content: I love these headphones. I was skeptical at first about the price but they are well worth it. I can put these headphones on and completely zone out my surroundings. Great for working on the dozer or any open cab machine.

author: LJohnson
title: Best Quality Noise-canceling Headphones
content: Top line noise canceling headphones. Sound quality is also top of the line. Easy to pair to your bluetooth device or you can use the included 3.5mm headphone cord. Has extremely long battery life. Great for long airline flights.Really comfortable over the ear coverage.

author: Flyboy
title: Bluetooth connection is a nightmare
content:
The sound on the unit is exceptional. One of the best I've heard -- when you can get it to work.  Bluetooth setup can be a nightmare, and differs from device to device.  Bose gives several excuses on their website as to why this might be - none of them valid (one of their suggestions was to make sure the unit is turned on).  The headphones stutter when played on PC, but work great through a smartphone -- until a firmware update happens.  Then you've got to drop all of the connections, clear out Bluetooth and try again...and again....and again....  I love the sound, but hate the headphones. For the cost, I should love both. You failed on this one, Bose.

Update: I'm standing behind this being a bluetooth nightmare, but I figured out what the problem was (with no help from Bose). I've got a metal desk, and I'm guessing this is a problem because when I moved the bt dongle from the back of the PC to the front, the issue cleared up immediately.  Now, they sound great and maintain their connection. I changed the review to 4 stars, but I'd happily give it 5 stars had I not had such a problem in the first place.

author: Molly
title: Uncomfortable
content: I like the sound quality but this headphones are not comfortable. I would think twice about investing in this headphones.

author: HiDeeBug
title: Great pair of work headphones!
content:
The pair I ordered on Amazon I returned because the box was opened and they had already been paired by someone else. I ended up going to Best Buy to purchase the same model bec I didn’t want to wait for a new pair or risk getting another opened box when I paid full price for a new pair.

I wear these headphones at work as I work in an open office cube farm. These headphones are comfortable fitting over my ears, which is important because I have a lot of ear piercings (industrial, daith, tragus, helix, lobe, and upper lobe) in each of my ears. My coworkers can be loud and these help me focus on my work. Sometimes I can still hear them if I don’t have my music up very high, but I’m actually ok with the amount of noise canceling.

They last for almost 2 weeks on a single charge and I use them at least 4-6 hours each day. I know they have a mic and could use them for conf calls, but I’ve never tried them as I worry that the mic would pic up all the background noise since it isn’t a direct mic in front of my mouth.

Overall, very satisfied with my purchase (from Best Buy). I love them!

author: Andrew Beres
title: Worth the money
content: These are 100% worth the money. They are comfortable, intuitive, and you can tell by handling them that they are well engineered and thought out. They are so comfortable to wear, and the sound quality is impeccable. The case included is also sturdy and the headphones fold nicely into it. I wish I had these through undergrad and grad school - they would be perfect for studying as ambient sound is almost completely cancelled out. You can chose three settings for noise cancellation, and on high, you are still “aware” of high frequency sounds (such as a siren or high bass sounds), but low level sounds are blocked out.

author: Sahana sarnad
title: I can't believe how much I love this!
content:
I can't believe how much I love this!!  I work in an open office and it can get noisy. I had bose headphones before too but with this I don't hear a thing. I am able to focus so much easier than before.  I also used this at the airport when it was too noisy and they work as a charm.

They are so much more comfortable to wear than my previous bose headphones.

author: NJ
title: Love them!
content: This is hands down one of my favorite electronic accessories.  It does it exactly what it says.  It blocks all outside noise beautifully and you can talk to Alexa or Siri.  I love that the button controls are easily located although it take some getting used to remembering where they are. Lol. They were definitely more expensive than I wanted however you get what you pay for and I believe these were a great investment.  I definitely recommend them.

title: I just wish on some old school songs a little bit louder
content: I love these headphones  trust me do not buy any other headphones  these tell you the battery  life they also tell you who is calling  you  and they also have Google  assistant

author: EBC
title: Awesome headphones
content: Awesome product however battery life is short

author: DeeJay
title: Good headphones with features I like
content: Overall, I like these headphones quite a bit. I've previously used Beats Solo Wireless 3 headphones and that is the device I'm comparing the Bose to. As far as comfort, the Bose are substantially more comfortable than the Beats. Although the Bose are heavier than the Beats, they actually feel lighter and don't squeeze as much as the Beats. As a result, I can wear the Bose for much longer periods of time than the Beats. As to sound quality, the Beats seem to sound somewhat better. I actually expected the Bose to have better sound quality than they do. The quality isn't bad, it's just not as good as I'd expect from Bose. However, I really wanted the Bose for the noise cancelling feature. They do a great job of noise cancelling and I like that they offer 3 levels of cancelling (high, medium, and off). Overall, while these are more expensive than other over-the-ear headphones, they're worth the money if you want noise cancelling wireless headphones.

author: Kent Knudsen
title: If You Travel or Mow Your Own Lawn....
content: I just used the headphones on a flight on a regional jet.  Outstanding noise cancellation. Keep your headphones on while on a flight (or mowing your lawn) and toggle the on/off switch to hear the difference. And comfy enough to wear around the house. Not inexpensive at $350 but I have NO buyer’s remorse.

author: Kevin Fernandez
title: Bluetooth skips/cuts out occasionally...
content:
Only thing that I've noticed is that the Bluetooth occasionally skips or cuts out while listening to music.  I am not sure if it's my phone or the headsets.  I am going to keep testing for a couple weeks and will try other devices.

Other than that, the headsets are great.  They're super comfortable and light.  Sound quality is very clear and the noise cancellation is on point.  If I could magically add more bass that would be fantastic, though I understand wireless headphones can only do so much.

author: Yash Parikh
title: Crisp & Clear Sound with Active Noise Cancellation  - Bose Way!
content:
I have had an eye on this headphones for almost 6 months since their launch and was waiting for the “Black Friday Discount” (that’s the only time Bose offers any discount on their products). Got it today and it’s absolutely gorgeous both in the look and feel. The “silver” is preferred color for these masterpiece.
As far as the sound is concerned, Bose knows the science behind the Acoustic Noise Cancellation (heard they have the best engineering team behind this invention) it totally separates and unwanted noise from your surroundings and gives you a clear and crisp sound.
It comes with three different Noise Cancellation modes/settings: High, Low, Off
You can choose/select/switch between these modes at a press of an action button situated on the left ear cup.
Right ear cup has three built in buttons, two for volume and one to pause or receive an incoming call.
The QC 2nd series comes with inbuilt Alexa and Google Assistance. So if you owe iPhone: you can actually have 3 services at your disposal: Alexa, Google Assistance, and of course Siri! You can use action button to switch between the selections. (have to download Bose app)
You’ll not go wrong with this choice. The closest to this is Sony WH1000. One time purchase and will last for years to come as it has Bose’s warranty and technical support.
I would highly recommended this product.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great sound and overall quality
content: I use these headphones for studying. And they are very comfortable, but most importantly they block out exterior sounds very well. Sound quality is excellent for me, but they don't provide a tremendous amount of bass, they are just perfect.

author: Reddog2316
title: Portable Studio
content: Wireless is always less hassle. Outside noise is canceled and sound is enhanced. Great benefits for any headphone.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Thank you
content: Thank you

author: Magali
title: Good, but fit is loose
content: I've had my headphones for about a month and a half now. The first time I put them on, they felt kind of loose but I had nothing to compare them to so I assumed it was normal. However, my friend has the same headphones, the only difference being that I have the silver and she has black ones. Hers are much sturdier, and don't move if you shake your head or lay down. Mine tend to fall off easily. I don't know if I received a faulty pair, or if maybe amazon is selling refurbished products and passing them off as new, but this is extremely disappointing. The sound is really good, and the noise cancellation is good. They would've been perfect had they fit better.

author: Victor M
title: Plane ride is most enjoyable now...
content: Takes most noise away... pricey tho.
